original: vuttasadisameva, kevalaṃ pana maggaṅgasaṅgahe “aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo hotī”ti padabhājanīye🔽sarūpeneva niddiṭṭhaṃ, indriyasaṅgahe paññindriyaṭṭhāne paṭhamamaggassa anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṃ
analyzed: vutta sadisam eva kevalam pana magga aṅga saṅgahe aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo hoti iti pada bhājanīye  sarūpena iva niddiṭṭham indriya saṅgahe paññindriya ṭṭhāne paṭhama maggassa anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam
translated: The same as the above, only in the section on the path factors, in the exposition of the terms, it is stated: “The path is eight-factored” .🔽In the section on the faculties, in the place of the faculty of understanding, the first path is taken as the faculty of “I am possessed of what has not been fully understood” ,

original: gahetvā itaramaggānaṃ aññindriyaṃ gahetvāva aṭṭhindriyanti aṭṭhindriyatā, sabbattha
analyzed: gahetvā itara maggānam aññindriyam gahetvā ava aṭṭhindriyan ti aṭṭhindriya tā sabbattha
translated: and the other paths are taken as the faculty of “I am possessed of understanding” . The difference is that the eight factors are eight faculties, and in all cases

original: lokuttaratā ca viseso, sesaṃ tādisameva. Paṭhamajjhānikā cattāro maggā.🔽Tathā dutiyajjhānikesupi kevalaṃ dhammuddese vitakkābhāvo, saṅgahavāre caturaṅgajjhānatā, sattaṅgamaggatā ca viseso, sesaṃ paṭhamajjhānikasadisameva. Dutiyajjhānikamaggā.
analyzed: lokuttara tā ca visesaḥ sesam tādisam eva paṭhama jhānikā cattāro maggā  tathā dutiya jhānikesu pi kevalam dhamma uddese vitakka abhāvo saṅgaha vāre catur aṅga jjhāna tā sattaṅga magga tā ca visesaḥ sesam paṭhama jhānika sadisam eva dutiya jhānika maggāḥ
translated: they are supramundane. The four paths of the first jhāna.🔽So too, in the case of the four paths of the second jhāna, the difference is that in the description of the terms there is the absence of applied thought, and in the section on the summary the jhāna is four- factored and the path is seven- factored. The rest is the same as in the case of the paths of the first jhāna. The four paths of the second jhāna.

original: Tathā tatiyajjhānikesupi kevalaṃ dhammuddese vicārābhāvo, saṅgahavāre tivaṅgikajjhānatā ca viseso, sesaṃ dutiyajjhānikasadisameva. Tatiyajjhānikamaggā.
analyzed: tathā tatiya jhānikesu pi kevalam dhamma uddese vicāra abhāvo saṅgaha vāre tivaṅgika jhāna tā ca viseso sesam dutiya jhānika sadisam eva tatiya jhānika maggāḥ
translated: So too, in the case of the four paths of the third jhāna, the difference is that in the description of the terms there is the absence of sustained thought, and in the section on the summary the jhāna is three- factored. The rest is the same as in the case of the paths of the second jhāna. The four paths of the third jhāna.

original: Tathā catutthajjhānikesupi kevalaṃ dhammuddese pītiyā abhāvo, koṭṭhāsavāre duvaṅgikajjhānatā,
analyzed: tathā catuttha jhānikesu pi kevalam dhamma uddese pītiyāḥ abhāvaḥ koṭṭhāsa vāre duvaṅgika jhāna tā
translated: Likewise, in the case of those of the fourth jhāna, there is only the absence of happiness in the description of the jhāna, and in the exposition of the jhāna it has two factors,

original: chaḷaṅgikabojjhaṅgatā ca viseso, sesaṃ tatiyajjhānikasadisameva. Catutthajjhānikamaggā.
analyzed: chaḷaṅgika bojjhaṅga tā ca visesaḥ sesam tatiya jhānika sadisam eva catuttha jhānika maggā
translated: and it has the six factors of the path. The rest is the same as in the case of those of the third jhāna.🔽Likewise, in the case of those of the fifth jhāna, there is only the substitution of the feeling in all the instances, the rest being the same as in the case of those of the fourth jhāna.

original: Tathā pañcamajjhānikesupi kevalaṃ sabbattha vedanāparivattanameva viseso, sesaṃ catutthajjhānikasadisameva. Pañcamajjhānikamaggā. Evaṃ dhammuddesādito vinicchayo.
analyzed: tathā pañcama jhānikesu pi kevalam sabbattha vedanā parivattanam eva visesaḥ sesam catuttha jjhānika sadisam eva pañcama jhānika maggāḥ evam dhamma uddesa āditaḥ vinicchayo
translated: This is how the exposition should be known here “as to the description of the ideas” and so on.

original: Visayādippabhedato pana sabbepi lokuttarakusalā ārammaṇato nibbānārammaṇāva, tasmā
analyzed: visaya ādi ppabhedato pana sabbe pi lokuttara kusalāḥ ārammaṇataḥ nibbāna ārammaṇāḥ ava tasmā
translated: As to object, etc.: all these supramundane kinds of profitable consciousness have Nibbāna as their object,

original: na tato nesaṃ bhedo, paṭipadādibhedato pana pubbe vuttanayena paccekaṃ bhedo veditabbo.🔽Ettha ca yo nāmarūpapariggahato paṭṭhāya kilamanto vipassanaṃ ārabhitvā dukkhena
analyzed: na tatas nesam bhedaḥ paṭipadā ādi bhedato pana pubbe vutta nayena paccekam bhedaḥ veditabbaḥ  ettha ca yaḥ nāma rūpa pariggahataḥ paṭṭhāya kilamantaḥ vipassanaṃ ārabhitvā dukkhena
translated: so there is no difference in their objects. But as to the way of entry, etc., their difference should be understood as already described in the case of the paths.🔽And here, when someone begins insight after discerning mentality-materiality and suppresses the defilements with difficulty and slowly,

original: kasirena kilese vikkhambheti, tassa dukkhā paṭipadā hoti. Yo pana vikkhambhitakileso,
analyzed: kasirena kilese vikkhambheti tassa dukkhā paṭipadā hoti yaḥ pana vikkhambhita kileso
translated: his is a painful way of practice. But when someone who has already suppressed the defilements

original: so vipassanāparivāsaṃ vāsento cirena maggapātubhāvaṃ pāpuṇāti, tassa dandhābhiññā🔽hoti. Iminā nayena itarā tissopi paṭipadābhiññāyo veditabbā. Yathā ca paṭipadādibhedato,
analyzed: so vipassanā parivāsam vāsentaḥ cirena magga pātubhāvam pāpuṇāti tassa dandhā abhiññā  hoti iminā nayena itarā tissaḥ api paṭipadābhiññāyaḥ veditabbā yathā ca paṭipadā ādi bhedato
translated: He reaches the state of appearance of the path only after a long time, and his direct-knowledge is sluggish.🔽The other two kinds of progress should be understood in this way too.🔽And as there are these three kinds of progress, so there are three kinds of direct-knowledge, that is to say:

original: evaṃ vimokkhabhedatopi paccekaṃ dvidhā honti – suññatavimokkho appaṇihitavimokkhoti.
analyzed: evam vimokkha bhedataḥ pi paccekam dvidhā honti suññata vimokkho appaṇihita vimokkho ti
translated: The three kinds of direct-knowledge are the direct-knowledge of the way, of the source, and of exhaustion.🔽Herein, the direct-knowledge of the way is the knowledge of the way that is the path.

original: Tattha suññatanti, appaṇihitanti ca lokuttaramaggassa nāmaṃ. So hi āgamanato saguṇato🔽ārammaṇatoti tīhi kāraṇehi nāmaṃ labhati. Kathaṃ? Idha bhikkhu vipassanākammaṭṭhāniko
analyzed: tattha suññatanti appaṇihitanti ca lokuttara maggassa nāmam saḥ hi āgamanataḥ saguṇataḥ  ārammaṇato ti tīhi kāraṇehi nāmam labhati katham idha bhikkhu vipassanā kammaṭṭhānikaḥ
translated: The direct-knowledge of the source is the knowledge of the source that is the cause.🔽The direct-knowledge of exhaustion is the knowledge of exhaustion that is the cessation.🔽The three kinds of direct-knowledge are the direct-knowledge of the way, of the source, and of exhaustion.

original: ādito paṭṭhāya “aniccaṃ dukkhamanattā”ti tividhaṃ anupassanaṃ āropetvā sammasanto🔽vicarati, sacassa vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanā tebhūmake saṅkhāre anattato vipassati,
analyzed: āditas paṭṭhāya aniccam dukkham anattā ti tividham anupassanam āropetvā sammasantaḥ  vicarati sacassa vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanā tebhūmake saṅkhāre anattataḥ vipassati
translated: Herein, the direct-knowledge of the way is the knowledge of the way that is the path.🔽The direct-knowledge of the source is the knowledge of the source that is the cause.

original: ayaṃ attasuññatādassanaṭṭhena suññatā nāma hoti. Sace dukkhato vipassati, ayaṃ taṇhāpaṇidhirahitaṭṭhena
analyzed: ayam atta suñña tā dassana ṭṭhena suñña tā nāma hoti sace dukkhataḥ vipassati ayam taṇhā paṇidhi rahita ṭṭhena
translated: The direct-knowledge of exhaustion is the knowledge of exhaustion that is the cessation.

original: appaṇihitā nāma hoti, tā ubhopi āgamanīyaṭṭhāne ṭhatvā attano attano maggassa yathākkamaṃ
analyzed: appaṇihitā nāma hoti tā ubho pi āgamanīya ṭhāne ṭhatvā attanaḥ attanaḥ maggassa yathākkamam
translated: The signless path is called the path of nothingness. Both of these paths stand in the place of arrival and give their own names to their respective paths in due course.

original: suññatamaggo appaṇihitamaggoti nāmaṃ denti. Evaṃ āgamanato nāmalābho veditabbo. Nanu🔽suttantesu sace vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanā aniccato passati, tassā vasena maggo animittavimokkho
analyzed: suññata maggo appaṇihita maggo ti nāmam denti evam āgamanataḥ nāma lābhaḥ veditabbaḥ nanu  suttantesu sace vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanāḥ aniccato passati tassāḥ vasena maggaḥ a nimitta vimokkho
translated: This is how the naming should be understood as to arrival.🔽But are not three kinds of path stated in the Suttas thus, “If the insight leading to emergence sees formations as impermanent, the path is the void liberation, and so on”?

original: hotīti katvā tayo vimokkhā kathitāti? Saccaṃ, api ca kho pariyāyato kathitā, nippariyāyato
analyzed: hoti iti katvā tayaḥ vimokkhā kathitā ati saccam api ca kho pariyāyataḥ kathitā nippariyāyataḥ
translated: They are stated in a figurative sense. But in the true sense there are only two kinds of path.

original: pana sayampi sanimittā attano maggassa animittanāmaṃ dātuṃ asakkuṇeyyatāya dve eva🔽vimokkhā hontīti. Tissopi hi vipassanā niccanimittaṃ, sukhanimittañca ugghāṭanena
analyzed: pana sayam pi sa nimittā attanaḥ maggassa animitta nāmam dātum a sakkuṇeyya tāya dve eva  vimokkhāḥ honti iti tissaḥ api hi vipassanā nicca nimittam sukha nimittam ca ugghāṭanena
translated: For although insight sees the signless in the sense of the signless, still it is not able to give its own name to the path, because it is itself accompanied by the sign of permanence, etc., in the sense of the appearance of permanence, etc., in formations.

original: animittavohāraṃ labhanti, tissopi nimittabhūtesu khandhesu caraṇato sanimittāva,
analyzed: a nimitta vohāram labhanti tissaḥ api nimitta bhūtesu khandhesu caraṇataḥ
translated: And although insight is called “signless” in the sense of the signless in the sense of the appearance of permanence, etc., in the aggregates that are the sign, still it is itself accompanied by the sign of the aggregates that are the sign.

original: tasmā sayaṃ āgamanīyaṭṭhāne ṭhatvā attano maggassa nippariyāyato animittanāmaṃ dātuṃ
analyzed: tasmai sayam āgamanīya ṭṭhāne ṭhatvā attanaḥ maggassa nippariyāyataḥ animitta nāmam dātum
translated: Therefore it is not able to give its own name to the path in the true sense, standing in the place of arrival.

original: na sakkonti. Yasmā pana maggo sayaṃ rāgādīhi suñño, rāgādinimittapaṇidhirahito ca,
analyzed: na sakkonti yasmā pana maggo sayam rāga ādīhi suññaḥ rāga ādi nimitta paṇidhi rahito ca
translated: But they cannot. Since the path is itself void of greed, etc., and is free from the sign of greed, etc., and from choice,

original: tasmā saguṇeneva suññatanāmaṃ, appaṇihitanāmañca labhati. Evamassa saguṇato nāmalābho
analyzed: tasmā saguṇena iva suññata nāmam appaṇihita nāmañca labhati evam assa saguṇataḥ nāma lābho
translated: it is called void, signless, and desireless in terms of its specific qualities. This is how the name should be understood as applicable in terms of specific qualities.

original: veditabbo. Yasmā pana nibbānaṃ rāgādīhi, saṅkhārehi ca suññattā, rāgādinimittapaṇidhirahitattā
analyzed: veditabbaḥ yasmā pana nibbānam rāga ādīhi saṅkhārehi ca suññattā rāga ādi nimitta paṇidhi rahita ttā
translated: But since Nibbāna is void of greed, etc., and of formations, and is free from the sign of greed, etc., and from choice,

original: ca “suññataṃ, animittaṃ, appaṇihita”nti ca vuccati, tasmā taṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā uppannamaggopi
analyzed: ca suññatam animittam appaṇihitanti ca vuccati tasmā tam ārammaṇam katvā uppanna maggaḥ api
translated: it is called void, signless, desireless. So the path that arises making that its object

original: “suññato, animitto, appaṇihito”ti ca nāmaṃ labhati. Evaṃ ārammaṇato nāmalābho veditabbo.
analyzed: suññataḥ animitto appaṇihitaḥ ti ca nāmam labhati evam ārammaṇataḥ nāma lābhaḥ veditabbo
translated: gets the names void, signless, desireless. This is how the name should be understood as applicable in terms of object.

original: Tesu idha āgamanatova maggo nāmaṃ labhati, na saguṇato, nāpi ārammaṇato, saguṇārammaṇato
analyzed: tesu idha āgamanataḥ va maggaḥ nāmam labhati na saguṇataḥ na api ārammaṇataḥ saguṇa ārammaṇataḥ
translated: Herein, the path gets its name by coming, but not by specific qualities or by object. The obtaining of the name in terms of specific qualities and object

original: nāmalābhassa suttantesu pariyāyadesitattā. Teneva hettha maggānaṃ saguṇārammaṇatopi
analyzed: nāma lābhassa suttantesu pariyāya desita ttā tena iva ha ittha maggānam sa guṇa ārammaṇataḥ pi
translated: is shown in the texts by the method of alternative treatment. That is why the path is called void, etc., in terms of specific qualities and object,

original: animittavimokkhataṃ aggahetvā suññataappaṇihitavimokkhatāva āgamanato vuttā, tañcāgamanaṃ🔽duvidhaṃ vipassanāgamanaṃ, maggāgamanañca. Tattha vipassanāgamanato maggo ca suññatādināmaṃ🔽labhati, maggāgamanato ca labhateva, idha pana maggassa adhippetattā vipassanāgamanatova
analyzed: animitta vimokkha tam aggahetvā āgamanataḥ vuttā tat ca āgamanam  duvidham vipassanā āgamanam magga āgamanañca tattha vipassanā āgamanataḥ maggo ca suññatā ādi nāmam  labhati magga āgamanataḥ ca labhatā iva idha pana maggassa adhippetattā vipassanā āgamanataḥ va
translated: and the two kinds of deliverance, namely, the emptiness deliverance and the desireless deliverance, are mentioned because they come about by the non-taking of the signless deliverance as the goal. And that coming about is

original: veditabbaṃ. Evaṃ vimokkhabhedato paccekaṃ dvidhā honti. Evaṃ visayādippabhedato vinicchayo.
analyzed: veditabbam evam vimokkha bhedato paccekam dvidhā honti evam visaya ādi ppabhedataḥ vinicchayo
translated: of two kinds: coming about by insight, and coming about by the path. Herein, the path gets the name “emptiness” and so on both because it comes about by insight and because it comes about by the path. But here it should be understood to come about by insight because it is the path that is intended. So they are twofold each according to the kinds of deliverance. This is how the exposition should be known here according to the object, etc.,

original: Lokuttarakusaladhammā niṭṭhitā.🔽Niṭṭhitā ca mohavicchedaniyā nāma
analyzed: lokuttara kusala dhammā niṭṭhitā  niṭṭhitā ca mohavicchedaniyā nāma
translated: The supermundane profitable ideas have now been completed.🔽And the section called “The Description of the Clearing of Confusion” is completed.

original: Abhidhammamātikatthasaṃvaṇṇanāya
analyzed: abhidhamma mātikattha saṃvaṇṇanāya
translated: In the commentary on the Abhidhamma-mātikā,

original: “Kusalā dhammā”ti padassa atthavaṇṇanā.🔽Akusalapadattho
analyzed: kusalāḥ dhammā ti padassa attha vaṇṇanā  akusala pada atthaḥ
translated: The commentary on the meaning of the words “Profitable ideas” is completed.🔽The meaning of the words “ unprofitable ideas”

original: Lobhamūlavaṇṇanā
analyzed: lobha mūla vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the unprofitable rooted in greed

original: Akusalā pana dhammā bhūmito ekavidhā kāmāvacarāva, sampayogato pana mūlavasena tividhā
analyzed: akusalā pana dhammā bhūmitaḥ ekavidhā sampayogato pana mūla vasena tividhā
translated: But unprofitable ideas are of one kind according to plane, being only of the sense sphere. But according to association they are of three kinds according to root:

original: honti lobhamūlā dosamūlā mohamūlāti. Tattha lobhamūlā aṭṭhavidhā somanassasahagataṃ
analyzed: honti lobha mūlā dosa mūlā moha mūlā ati tattha lobha mūlā aṭṭhavidhā somanassa sahagatam
translated: They are rooted in greed, rooted in hate, rooted in delusion. Herein, the eight rooted in greed are associated with joy,

original: diṭṭhigatasampayuttaṃ asaṅkhāraṃ, tathā sasaṅkhāraṃ, somanassasahagataṃ diṭṭhigatavippayuttaṃ🔽asaṅkhāraṃ, tathā sasaṅkhāraṃ, upekkhāsahagataṃ diṭṭhigatasampayuttaṃ asaṅkhāraṃ,
analyzed: diṭṭhi gata sampayuttam asaṅkhāram tathā sa saṅkhāram somanassa sahagatam diṭṭhi gata vippayuttam  asaṅkhāram tathā sa saṅkhāram upekkhā sahagatam diṭṭhi gata sampayuttam asaṅkhāram
translated: associated with wrong view, without root-cause, and with root-cause; associated with joy, dissociated from wrong view,🔽without root-cause, and with root-cause; associated with equanimity, associated with wrong view, without root-cause,

original: tathā sasaṅkhāraṃ, upekkhāsahagataṃ diṭṭhigatavippayuttaṃ asaṅkhāraṃ, tathā sasaṅkhāranti.🔽Tattha iṭṭhārammaṇe lobhabahulatādīhi kāraṇehi somanassasahagatatā, asaddhammasavanaakalyāṇamittatādīhi
analyzed: tathā sa saṅkhāram upekkhā sahagatam diṭṭhi gata vippayuttam asaṅkhāram tathā sa saṅkhāranti  tattha iṭṭha ārammaṇe lobha bahula tā ādīhi kāraṇehi somanassa sahagata tā asat dhamma savana akalyāṇa mitta tā ādīhi
translated: and with root-cause; associated with equanimity, dissociated from wrong view, without root-cause, and with root-cause.

original: diṭṭhisampayuttatā ca veditabbā. Yadā hi “natthi kāmesu ādīnavo”tiādinā nayena micchādiṭṭhiṃ
analyzed: diṭṭhi sampayutta tā ca veditabbā yadā hi na atthi kāmesu ādīnavaḥ ti ādinā nayena micchādiṭṭhim
translated: Herein, the presence of joy should be understood as due to the predominance of greed, etc., in regard to a desirable object, and the presence of wrong view as due to listening to false doctrines and to bad friends, etc. For when someone, by means of wrong view that “there is no danger in sense pleasures,”

original: purakkhatvā haṭṭhatuṭṭho kāme vā paribhuñjati, diṭṭhamaṅgalādīni vā sārato pacceti
analyzed: purakkhatvā haṭṭha tuṭṭhaḥ kāme vā paribhuñjati diṭṭha maṅgala ādīni vā sārataḥ pacceti
translated: is delighted and satisfied, and indulges in sense pleasures or believes in lucky days, etc., as being beneficial,

original: sabhāvatikkheneva anussāhitena cittena, tadā paṭhamaṃ akusalacittaṃ uppajjati. Yadā
analyzed: sabhāva tikkhena iva anussāhitena cittena tadā paṭhamam akusala cittam uppajjati yadā
translated: and then the first unprofitable consciousness arises with prompting by inherent tendency.

original: mandena samussāhitena, tadā dutiyaṃ. Yadā micchādiṭṭhiṃ apurakkhatvā kevalaṃ haṭṭhatuṭṭho🔽methunaṃ vā sevati, parasampattiṃ vā abhijjhāyati, parabhaṇḍaṃ vā harati sabhāvatikkhenānussāhitena,
analyzed: mandena samussāhitena tadā dutiyam yadā micchādiṭṭhim a purakkhatvā kevalam haṭṭha tuṭṭhaḥ  methunam vā sevati para sampattim vā abhijjhāyati para bhaṇḍam vā harati sabhāvatikkhena anussāhitena
translated: When it arises with prompting by prompting, then the second.🔽When he has intercourse or covets another’s excellence or steals another’s goods with prompting by inherent tendency without giving prior thought to wrong view, then the third.

original: tadā tatiyaṃ. Yadā samussāhitena, tadā catutthaṃ. Yadā pana kāmānaṃ vā asampattiṃ
analyzed: tadā tatiyam yadā samussāhitena tadā catuttham yadā pana kāmānam vā a sampattim
translated: When it arises with prompting by prompting, then the fourth.

original: āgamma, aññesaṃ vā somanassahetūnaṃ abhāvena catūsupi vikappesu somanassarahitatā
analyzed: āgamma aññesam vā somanassa hetūnam abhāvena catūsu pi vikappesu somanassa rahita tā
translated: But when there is no satisfaction in any of the four modes of thought because of the absence of any cause for joy, either through lack of success in getting sense desires or through lack of any other cause for joy,

original: hoti, tadā sesāni cattāri upekkhāsahagatāni uppajjantīti ayaṃ sampayogato vinicchayo.🔽Dhammuddesato pana paṭhamākusale tāva niyatā pāḷiyaṃ sarūpenāgatā soḷasa, yevāpanakavasena
analyzed: hoti tadā sesāni cattāri upekkhā sahagatāni uppajjanti iti ayam sampayogataḥ vinicchayo  dhamma uddesato pana paṭhama akusale tāva niyatā pāḷiyam sarūpena āgatā soḷasa yevāpanaka vasena
translated: then the remaining four, which are accompanied by equanimity, arise. This is the exposition of the unprofitable as to association.🔽As to description of mental states: there are twenty mental states in the first unprofitable consciousness, namely, the sixteen invariably given in the text, and four by implication.

original: cattāroti vīsati dhammā honti. Kathaṃ? Phasso vedanā saññā cetanā cittaṃ vitakko
analyzed: cattāro ti vīsati dhammāḥ honti katham phassaḥ vedanā saññā cetanā cittam vitakko
translated: How? Contact, feeling, perception, volition, consciousness, applied thought,

original: vicāro pīti vīriyaṃ ekaggatā jīvitaṃ ahirikaṃ anottappaṃ lobho moho micchādiṭṭhīti
analyzed: vicāraḥ pīti vīriyam ekagga tā jīvitam ahirikam anottappam lobho mohaḥ micchādiṭṭhi iti
translated: applied thought, sustained thought, happiness, energy, unification, life, conscience, shame, greed, delusion, and wrong view.

original: ime sarūpenāgatā soḷasa dhammā, chando adhimokkho manasikāro uddhaccanti ime yevāpanakā
analyzed: ime sarūpena āgatā soḷasa dhammā chandaḥ adhimokkhaḥ manasikāraḥ uddhaccanti ime yevāpanakā
translated: These sixteen dhammas come in the same way as the above. Zeal, resolution, attention, and agitation come in the same way as the above.

original: cattāroti. Padabhājanīye pana pubbe vuttanayeneva “phassapañcakaṃ jhānaṅgapañcakaṃ
analyzed: cattāro ti pada bhājanīye pana pubbe vutta nayena iva phassa pañcakam jhāna aṅga pañcakam
translated: There are four. But in the Padabhājaniya, the five beginning with contact, the five beginning with the jhāna factors,

original: vīriyasamādhimanosomanassajīvitavasena indriyāni pañca, micchādiṭṭhisaṅkappavāyāmasamādhivasena
analyzed: vīriya samādhi manaḥ somanassa jīvita vasena indriyāni pañca micchā diṭṭhi saṅkappa vāyāma samādhi vasena
translated: the five faculties beginning with energy, concentration, mind, joy, and life, the four path factors beginning with wrong view, thought, and endeavour,

original: maggaṅgāni cattāri, vīriyasamādhiahirikānottappavasena balāni cattāri, lobho mohoti
analyzed: maggaṅgāni cattāri vīriya samādhi ahirika anottappa vasena balāni cattāri lobho moho ti
translated: the four strengths beginning with energy, concentration, conscience, and shame, the two roots beginning with greed and delusion,

original: dve mūlāni, abhijjhā micchādiṭṭhīti dve kammapathāni, ahirikaṃ anottappanti lokanāsadukaṃ,
analyzed: dve mūlāni abhijjhā micchādiṭṭhī iti dve kamma pathāni ahirikam anottappanti lokanāsadukam
translated: the two courses of kamma beginning with covetousness and wrong view, the two beginning with lack of conscience and shame,

original: samatho paggāho avikkhepo cāti evaṃ sarūpenāgatānaṃ dvattiṃsadhammānaṃ soḷasasu eva🔽samavarodho, savibhattikāvibhattikabhedo ca kāmāvacarapaṭhamakusale vuttānusārato
analyzed: samathaḥ paggāhaḥ avikkhepaḥ ca ati evam sarūpena āgatānam dvattiṃsa dhammānam soḷasasu eva 🔽samavarodho sa vibhattika avibhattika bhedo ca kāmāvacara paṭhama kusale vutta anusārataḥ
translated: and serenity, insight, and non-distraction—these thirty-two dhammas come in the same way as the above.🔽They are included in the sixteen in the following way. The distinction between those that are stated with analysis and those that are stated without analysis should be understood according to the method stated in the first unprofitable consciousness of the sense sphere.

original: ñātabbo. Ayaṃ dhammuddesato vinicchayo.🔽Lakkhaṇādivibhāgato pana na hirīyatīti ahiriko, ahirikassa bhāvo ahirikkaṃ, na ottappaṃ🔽anottappaṃ. Tesu ahirikkaṃ kāyaduccaritādīhi ajigucchanalakkhaṇaṃ, alajjālakkhaṇaṃ🔽vā, anottappaṃ teheva asārajjanalakkhaṇaṃ, anuttāsalakkhaṇaṃ vā, sesaṃ hiriottappānaṃ
analyzed: ñātabbaḥ ayam dhamma uddesataḥ vinicchayaḥ  lakkhaṇa ādi vibhāgataḥ pana na hirīyati iti ahirikaḥ ahirikassa bhāvaḥ ahirikkam na ottappam  anottappam tesu ahirikkam kāya duccarita ādīhi a jigucchana lakkhaṇam a lajjā lakkhaṇam  vā anottappam a sārajjana lakkhaṇam an uttāsa lakkhaṇam vā sesam hiri uttappānam
translated: This is the exposition of the meaning of the terms.

original: vuttappaṭipakkhavasena veditabbaṃ.🔽Lubbhati tena, sayaṃ vā lubbhati, lubbhanamattameva vā tanti lobho. So ārammaṇagahaṇalakkhaṇo🔽makkaṭālepo viya, abhisaṅgaraso tattakapāle khittamaṃsapesi viya, apariccāgapaccupaṭṭhāno🔽telañjanarāgo viya, saññojanīyadhammesu assādadassanapadaṭṭhāno. Taṇhānadibhāvena
analyzed: vutta paṭipakkha vasena veditabbam  lubbhati tena sayam vā lubbhati lubbhana mattam eva vā lobho saḥ ārammaṇa gahaṇa lakkhaṇo  makkaṭa ālepaḥ viya abhisaṅga rasaḥ tatta kapāle khitta maṃsa pesi viya a pariccāga paccupaṭṭhāno  telañjana rāgaḥ viya saññojanīya dhammesu assāda dassana padaṭṭhāno taṇhā nadi bhāvena
translated: As to the analysis of their characteristics, etc., he is shameless, thus he is without shame ; the state of that is shamelessness . He is not afraid of anything, thus he is without dread ; the state of that is lack of dread . Herein, shamelessness has the characteristic of non- abhorrence of what is blameworthy, or the characteristic of shameless ness. Lack of dread has the characteristic of non-avoidance of what is blameworthy, or the characteristic of fearlessness. The rest can be understood by the method stated under the opposite states of shame and dread.

original: vaḍḍhamāno sīghasotā nadī viya mahāsamuddaṃ apāyameva gahetvā gacchatīti daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: vaḍḍhamānaḥ sīghasotā nadī viya mahā samuddam apāyam eva gahetvā gacchati iti daṭṭhabbo
translated: He is greedy, thus he is a greedy person ; the state of that is greed . It is the act of his being greedy that is meant, or the state of that act, or the act itself, thus it is greed . It has the characteristic of grasping an object, like the sticking of a leech. Its function is to delight, like a piece of meat thrown into a fire. It is manifested as non-renunciation, like the passion of one who is besmeared with oil. Its proximate cause is the seeing of gratification in things that breed craving. It should be regarded as increasing through the floods, etc., and as leading to the states of loss, like a river in the rainy season leading to the great ocean.

original: Muyhanti tena, sayaṃ vā muyhati, muyhanamattameva vā tanti moho. So cittassa andhakāralakkhaṇo,
analyzed: muyhanti tena sayam vā muyhati muyhana mattam eva vā tanti moho so cittassa andhakāra lakkhaṇo
translated: It is delusion because of that, or it is itself deluded, or it is just the state of being deluded, thus it is delusion . Its characteristic is the darkness of the mind,

original: aññāṇalakkhaṇo vā, asampaṭivedharaso, ārammaṇasabhāvacchādanaraso vā, asammāpaṭipattipaccupaṭṭhāno,
analyzed: aññāṇa lakkhaṇaḥ vā a sampaṭivedha rasaḥ ārammaṇa sabhā avacchādana rasaḥ vā asammāpaṭipatti paccupaṭṭhāno
translated: or its characteristic is unknowing. Its function is to obscure the real nature of an object. Its manifestation is wrong practice,

original: andhakārapaccupaṭṭhāno vā, ayonisomanasikārapadaṭṭhāno, sabbākusalānaṃ mūlanti daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: andhakāra paccupaṭṭhānaḥ vā ayonisomanasikāra padaṭṭhāno sabba akusalānam mūlan ti daṭṭhabbo
translated: or its manifestation is darkness. Its proximate cause is unwise attention. It should be regarded as the root of all unprofitable things.

original: Micchā passanti tāya, sayaṃ vā micchā passati, micchādassanamattameva vā esāti micchādiṭṭhi.🔽Sā ayoniso abhinivesalakkhaṇā, parāmāsarasā, micchābhinivesapaccupaṭṭhānā, ariyānaṃ🔽adassanakāmatādipadaṭṭhānā, paramaṃ vajjanti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: micchā passanti tāya sayam vā micchā passati micchā dassana mattam eva va esā ati micchādiṭṭhi  sā ayonisas abhinivesa lakkhaṇā parāmāsa rasā micchā abhinivesa paccupaṭṭhānā ariyānaṃ  a dassana kāma tā ādi pada ṭṭhānā paramam vajjanti daṭṭhabbā
translated: They see wrongly by it, or it itself sees wrongly, or it is just the state of wrong seeing, thus it is wrong view .🔽Its characteristic is unwise adherence. Its function is to overstep . It is manifested as wrong adherence. It has the wish not to see the noble ones, etc., as its proximate cause. It should be regarded as the worst kind of stain.

original: Uddhatabhāvo uddhaccaṃ. Taṃ avūpasamalakkhaṇaṃ, anavaṭṭhānarasaṃ, bhantatāpaccupaṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: uddhata bhāvaḥ uddhaccam tam a vūpasama lakkhaṇam an avaṭṭhāna rasam bhanta tā paccupaṭṭhānam
translated: Agitation is agitation of mind. Its characteristic is non-tranquillization. Its function is to be unstayed. It is manifested as trembling.

original: ayonisomanasikārapadaṭṭhānaṃ, cittavikkhepoti daṭṭhabbo. Seso panettha suññatavārapariyosāno
analyzed: ayoniso manasikāra padaṭṭhānam citta vikkhepo ti daṭṭhabbo sesaḥ pana ittha suññata vāra pariyosāno
translated: and the footing for it is wrong reflection. The rest here is as already stated in the section on the profitable .🔽All the exposition should be understood according to the method stated in the section on the profitable, only the difference being that in the heading of the unprofitable triad the words with greed, etc., are added.🔽In the case of the unprofitable triad with applied thought and sustained thought, the words “with greed, with hate, with delusion” are added to the heading.

original: sabbopi vinicchayo kusalādhikāre vuttānusārato veditabbo. Kevalaṃ saṅgahavāre pāḷiyaṃ🔽āgatavasena pañcindriyatā, caturaṅgamaggatā, catubbidhabalatā, dvehetutā, sabbattha🔽akusalabhāvo ca viseso, sesaṃ tādisameva. Paṭhamākusalaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: sabbaḥ api vinicchayaḥ kusala adhikāre vutta anusārataḥ veditabbaḥ kevalam saṅgaha vāre pāḷiyam  āgata vasena pañca indriya tā catur aṅga magga tā catubbidha bala tā dve hetu tā sabbattha  akusala bhāvo ca viseso sesam tādisam eva paṭhama akusalam niṭṭhitam
translated: In the case of the unprofitable triad without applied thought, the words “with greed, with hate, with delusion” are added to the heading.🔽In the case of the unprofitable triad without applied thought and with sustained thought only, the words “with greed, with hate, with delusion” are added to the heading.🔽In the case of the unprofitable triad without applied thought and without sustained thought, the words “with greed, with hate, with delusion” are added to the heading.🔽In the case of the unprofitable triad with happiness, the words “with greed, with hate, with delusion” are added to the heading.🔽In the case of the unprofitable triad with equanimity, the words “with greed, with hate, with delusion” are added to the heading.

original: Yathā ca paṭhame, evaṃ dutiyepi sasaṅkhāratā, yevāpanakesu thinamiddhānaṃ sambhavo,🔽niyatatā ca viseso. Tattha thinanatā thinaṃ, middhanatā middhaṃ, anussāhanasaṃsīdanatā,
analyzed: yathā ca paṭhame evam dutiye api sa saṅkhāra tā sambhavaḥ  niyata tā ca visesaḥ tattha thina natā thinam middha natā middham anussāhana saṃsīdana tā
translated: In the case of the unprofitable triad with greed, the words “with hate, with delusion” are added to the heading.🔽In the case of the unprofitable triad with hate, the words “with greed, with delusion” are added to the heading.🔽In the case of the unprofitable triad with delusion, the words “with greed, with hate” are added to the heading.🔽In the case of the unprofitable triad with greed and hate, the words “with delusion” are added to the heading.🔽In the case of the unprofitable triad with greed and delusion, the words “with hate” are added to the heading.

original: sattivighāto cāti attho. Tattha thinaṃ anussāhalakkhaṇaṃ, vīriyavinodanarasaṃ, saṃsīdanapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: satti vighāto ca ati attho tattha thinam anussāha lakkhaṇam vīriya vinodana rasam saṃsīdana paccupaṭṭhānam
translated: In the case of the unprofitable triad with hate and delusion, the words “with greed” are added to the heading.🔽In the case of the unprofitable triad with greed, hate, and delusion, no words are added to the heading.

original: Middhaṃ akammaññatālakkhaṇaṃ, onahanarasaṃ, līnatāpaccupaṭṭhānaṃ, pacalāyikāniddāpaccupaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: middham akammañña tā lakkhaṇam onahana rasam līna tā paccupaṭṭhānam pacalāyikā niddā paccupaṭṭhānam
translated: Drowsiness has the characteristic of unserviceability. Its function is to cause the body to sag. It is manifested as depression or as the depression of sleep.

original: vā, ubhayampi aratitandivijambhikādīsu ayonisomanasikārapadaṭṭhānaṃ. Dutiyaṃ.
analyzed: vā ubhayam pi arati tandi vijambhikā ādīsu a yoni soma nasikāra padaṭṭhānam dutiyam
translated: Drowsiness has the characteristic of unserviceability; its function is to lie down; it is manifested as depression or as the state of dozing off; its proximate cause is either discontent and languor, etc., or unwise attention. The second.

original: Tatiye sabbopi vinicchayo paṭhamākusale vuttanayova. Kevalaṃ diṭṭhiyā abhāvo, yevāpanakesu
analyzed: tatiye sabbaḥ api vinicchayo paṭhama akusale vutta nayaḥ uva kevalam diṭṭhiyāḥ abhāvaḥ yevāpanakesu
translated: In the third, all the exposition should be understood in the way already described under the first unprofitable consciousness. Only the absence of wrong view,

original: mānassa sambhavo, aniyatatā ca, saṅgahavāre tivaṅgikamaggatā ca viseso, sesaṃ tādisameva.
analyzed: mānassa sambhavaḥ aniyata tā ca saṅgaha vāre tivaṅgika magga tā ca viseso sesam tādisam eva
translated: the presence of conceit, the indetermination, and the inclusion of three factors in the path are different. The rest is the same.

original: Tattha maññatīti māno. So uṇṇatilakkhaṇo, sampaggaharaso, ketukamyatāpaccupaṭṭhāno,
analyzed: tattha maññati iti māno saḥ uṇṇa ti lakkhaṇo sampaggaha raso ketu kamya tā paccupaṭṭhāno
translated: Herein, he conceives , thus it is conceit . It has the characteristic of haughtiness. Its function is to exalt. It is manifested as the state of thinking “I am a master.”

original: diṭṭhivippayuttalobhapadaṭṭhāno, ummādo viya daṭṭhabbo. Tatiyaṃ.
analyzed: diṭṭhi vippayutta lobha padaṭṭhānaḥ ummādaḥ viya daṭṭhabbaḥ tatiyam
translated: It should be regarded as like madness, since it has attachment not associated with wrong view for its proximate cause. The third.

original: Yathā ca tatiye, evaṃ catutthepi. Thinamiddhañcettha sasaṅkhāratā ca adhikā, sesaṃ tādisameva. Catutthaṃ.
analyzed: yathā ca tatiye evam catutthe pi thinam iddham ca itthā sa saṅkhāra tā ca adhikā sesam tādisam eva catuttham
translated: And as in the third, so in the fourth too. But here the addition is the presence of applied thought and sustained thought. The rest is the same. The fourth.

original: Pañcamachaṭṭhasattamaṭṭhamesu somanassaṭṭhāne upekkhāsambhavo, pītiyā ca abhāvo,
analyzed: pañcama chaṭṭha sattama ṭṭhamesu somanassa ṭṭhāne upekkhā sambhavo pītiyā ca abhāvo
translated: In the fifth, sixth, seventh, and eighth, the presence of equanimity instead of joy, and the absence of happiness,

original: tato eva saṅgahavāre caturaṅgajjhānatā ca viseso, sesaṃ sabbaṃ paṭhamadutiyatatiyacatutthacittasadisameva.
analyzed: tatas eva saṅgaha vāre catur aṅga jjhāna tā ca visesaḥ sesam sabbam paṭhama dutiya tatiya catuttha citta sadisam eva
translated: So too in the Compendium section, the difference is that it has four factors. The rest is the same as in the first, second, third, and fourth consciousnesses.

original: Lobhamūlā niṭṭhitā.🔽Dosamūlavaṇṇanā
analyzed: lobha mūlā niṭṭhitā  dosa mūla vaṇṇanā
translated: The unprofitable rooted in greed is finished.

original: Dosamūlā pana dvidhā domanassasahagataṃ paṭighasampayuttaṃ asaṅkhāraṃ, tathā sasaṅkhāraṃ.
analyzed: dosa mūlā pana dvidhā domanassa sahagatam paṭigha sampayuttam asaṅkhāram tathā sa saṅkhāram
translated: The unprofitable rooted in hate is twofold, being accompanied by grief and associated with resentment, without root-cause, and with root-cause.

original: Evaṃ sampayogato. Dhammuddesādito pana paṭhame tāva paṭhamākusale vuttesu pītilobhadiṭṭhiyo🔽vajjetvā dosaṃ, yevāpanakesu aniyatāni issāmacchariyakukkuccāni, somanassaṭṭhāne
analyzed: evam sampayogataḥ dhamma uddesa ādito pana paṭhame tāva paṭhama akusale vuttesu pīti lobha diṭṭhiyo  vajjetvā dosam yevāpanakesu aniyatāni issā macchariya kukkuccāni somanassa ṭṭhāne
translated: So it is twofold by association. But in the first place, in the first unprofitable consciousness stated in the Description of the Mental Factors, the joy, greed, and false view should be omitted,

original: domanassañca pakkhipitvā ekavīsati dhammā honti. Yevāpanakā cettha satta. Tattha
analyzed: domanassañca pakkhipitvā ekavīsati dhammāḥ honti yevāpanakā ca ittha satta tattha
translated: and the anger, and the seven variable ones, namely, the lust, hate, delusion, stiffness, agitation, lack of faith, and idleness, should be omitted too, and the grief that is in the place of happiness should be included. So there are twenty-one mental factors. And here the seven variables are as follows:

original: dussanti tena, sayaṃ vā dussati, dussanamattameva vā tanti doso. So caṇḍikkalakkhaṇo
analyzed: dussanti tena sayam vā dussati dussana mattam eva vā doso so caṇḍikka lakkhaṇo
translated: It hates , or it hates itself, or it is mere hating , thus it is hate . Its characteristic is that of being hostile;

original: pahaṭāsīviso viya, visappanaraso visanipāto viya, attano nissayadahanaraso vā dāvaggi
analyzed: pahaṭa asīvisaḥ viya visappana rasaḥ visa nipātaḥ viya attanaḥ nissaya dahana rasaḥ vā
translated: like a snake uncoiled, its function is to spread out; its manifestation is that of biting; it should be regarded as like a poisonous thorn,🔽because it is the root-cause of suffering.

original: viya, dussanapaccupaṭṭhāno laddhokāso viya sapatto, āghātavatthupadaṭṭhāno, visasaṃsaṭṭhapūtimuttaṃ
analyzed: viya dussana paccupaṭṭhānaḥ laddha ukāsaḥ viya sa pattaḥ āghāta vatthu padaṭṭhānaḥ visa saṃsaṭṭha pūti muttam
translated: like a thief who has got his chance, like an enemy who has found an opportunity, like poisoned blood that has spread through the whole body.

original: viya daṭṭhabbo. Issāyanā issā. Sā parasampattīnaṃ usūyanalakkhaṇā, tattheva anabhiratirasā,
analyzed: viya daṭṭhabbaḥ issāyanā issā sā para sampattīnam usūyana lakkhaṇā tattha iva an abhirati rasā
translated: Envy is the state of being envious . It has the characteristic of resenting the success of others. Its function is dissatisfaction with that .

original: tato vimukhabhāvapaccupaṭṭhānā, parasampattipadaṭṭhānā, saññojananti daṭṭhabbā. Maccherabhāvo
analyzed: tatas vimukha bhāva paccupaṭṭhānā para sampatti padaṭṭhānā saññojana nti daṭṭhabbā macchera bhāvaḥ
translated: It is manifested as a desire to turn away from that . It is based upon the success of others. It should be regarded as a fetter.

original: macchariyaṃ. Taṃ laddhānaṃ vā labhitabbānaṃ vā attano sampattīnaṃ nigūhanalakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: macchariyam tam laddhānam vā labhitabbānam vā attanaḥ sampattīnam nigūhana lakkhaṇam
translated: Avarice is the state of being avaricious . It has the characteristic of concealing one’s own success.

original: tāsaññeva parehi sādhāraṇabhāvaakkhamanarasaṃ, saṅkocanapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ, kaṭukañcukatāpaccupaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: tāsam eva parehi sādhāraṇa bhāva akkhamana rasam saṅkocana paccupaṭṭhānam kaṭu kañcuka tā paccupaṭṭhānam
translated: Its function is not to tolerate others’ success. It is manifested as contraction or as a state of being wrapped up in something.

original: vā, attasampattipadaṭṭhānaṃ, cetaso virūpabhāvoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Kucchitaṃ kataṃ kukataṃ,
analyzed: vā atta sampatti padaṭṭhānam cetasaḥ virūpa bhāvaḥ ti daṭṭhabbam kucchitam katam ku katam
translated: It is based upon one’s own success. It should be regarded as the mind’s ugliness.🔽What is done badly is badly done . The state of that is worry . It has the characteristic of subsequent remorse.

original: tassa bhāvo kukkuccaṃ. Taṃ pacchānutāpalakkhaṇaṃ, katākatānusocanarasaṃ, vippaṭisārapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: tassa bhāvaḥ kukkuccam tam pacchā anutāpa lakkhaṇam kata akata anusocana rasam vippaṭisāra paccupaṭṭhānam
translated: Its function is to lament what is done and what is not done. It is manifested as regret.

original: katākatapadaṭṭhānaṃ, dāsabyamiva daṭṭhabbaṃ. Saṅgahavāre dukkhena saddhiṃ caturaṅgajjhānatā,
analyzed: kata akata padaṭṭhānam dāsabyam iva daṭṭhabbam saṅgaha vāre dukkhena saddhim catur aṅga jjhāna tā
translated: The footing for what is done and what is not done should be seen as slavery.

original: domanassena pañcindriyatā, tivaṅgikamaggatā, dosamohavasena dvihetukatā ca veditabbā.
analyzed: domanassena pañca indriya tā tivaṅgika magga tā dosa moha vasena dvi hetuka tā ca veditabbā
translated: In the “In brief” section, the four-factored jhāna should be understood as associated with pain, the five-factored as associated with grief, the three-factored as associated with the path, and the two-factored as associated with hate and delusion.

original: Seso pana sabbo vinicchayo paṭhamākusale vuttasadiso eva. Yathā ca paṭhame, evaṃ
analyzed: seso pana sabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ paṭhamā kusale vutta sadisaḥ eva yathā ca paṭhame evam
translated: But the whole of the rest of the exposition is the same as that already given under the unprofitable consciousness with delusion only.

original: dutiyepi, sasaṅkhāratā pana thinamiddhehi saddhiṃ navayevāpanakatā ca viseso, sesaṃ tādisameva.
analyzed: dutiye pi sa saṅkhāra tā pana thina middhehi saddhim ca visesaḥ sesam tādisam eva
translated: And as in the first, so too in the second unprofitable consciousness, except that there is the difference that there is the addition of applied thought and sustained thought to the five associated with stiffness and torpor. The rest is the same.

original: Dosamūlā niṭṭhitā.🔽Mohamūlavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dosa mūlā niṭṭhitā  moha mūla vaṇṇanā
translated: The unprofitable consciousness rooted in hate is finished.

original: Mohamūlāpi dvidhā upekkhāsahagataṃ vicikicchāsampayuttaṃ, tathā uddhaccasampayuttanti.🔽Tattha paṭhame dhammuddesato tāva phassapañcakaṃ vitakko vicāro vīriyaṃ ekaggatā
analyzed: moha mūlā api dvidhā upekkhā sahagatam vicikicchā sampayuttam tathā uddhacca sampayuttan ti  tattha paṭhame dhamma uddesato tāva phassa pañcakam vitakkaḥ vicāraḥ vīriyam ekagga tā
translated: The unprofitable consciousness rooted in delusion is twofold, namely, that associated with equanimity and accompanied by uncertainty, and that associated with agitation.

original: jīvitaṃ ahirikaṃ anottappaṃ moho vicikicchāti sarūpenāgatā cuddasa, uddhaccaṃ manasikāroti
analyzed: jīvitam ahirikam anottappam mohaḥ vicikicchā ati sarūpena āgatā uddhaccam manasikāroti
translated: Herein, in the first place, as regards the description of states, fourteen are given in their own form, that is to say, contact, feeling, perception, volition, contact, applied thought, sustained thought, energy, faculty of concentration, faculty of vitality, non- shame, non-embarrassment, delusion, uncertainty; and agitation and attention are given by their individual essences.

original: yevāpanakā dve cāti soḷasa dhammā honti, ekaggatā cettha cittaṭṭhitimattā, indriyamaggabalabhāvaṃ
analyzed: yevāpanakā dve ca ati soḷasa dhammāḥ honti ekagga tā ca ittha citta ṭṭhitimat tā indriya magga bala bhāvam
translated: and the two kinds of agitation make sixteen states. Herein, unification is mere steadiness of consciousness. It does not reach the state of a faculty, a path factor, or a power.

original: na sampāpuṇāti. Tato eva saṅgahavāre samādhiṃ vajjetvā upekkhāya saddhiṃ cattāri
analyzed: na sampāpuṇāti tatas eva saṅgaha vāre samādhim vajjetvā upekkhāya saddhim cattāri
translated: That is why, in the section on inclusion, concentration is omitted and equanimity is included with the four faculties,

original: indriyāni, dve maggaṅgāni, tīṇi balāni honti. Moho panettha ekova hetu. Seso panettha
analyzed: indriyāni dve maggaṅgāni tīṇi balāni honti mohaḥ pana ittha ekaḥ iva hetu sesaḥ pana ittha
translated: two path factors, and three powers. But delusion is the single cause here. The rest

original: sabbo vinicchayo vuttanayo eva.
analyzed: sabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ vutta nayaḥ eva
translated: here should be understood according to the method stated.

original: Tattha vigatā cikicchā etissāti vicikicchā. Sā saṃsayalakkhaṇā, kampanarasā, anicchayapaccupaṭṭhānā,
analyzed: tattha vigatā cikicchā etissa ati vicikicchā sā saṃsaya lakkhaṇā kampana rasā anicchaya paccupaṭṭhānā
translated: Herein, vicikicchā = vicikicchā . It has doubt as its characteristic. Its function is to waver. It is manifested as indecision,

original: anekaṃsabhāvapaccupaṭṭhānā vā, ayonisomanasikārapadaṭṭhānā, paṭipattiantarāyakarāti
analyzed: aneka sabhāva paccupaṭṭhānā vā a yoniso manasikāra padaṭṭhānā paṭipatti antarāya karāti
translated: or it is manifested as the state of having many aspects. Its proximate cause is unwise attention. It should be regarded as an obstruction to practice.

original: daṭṭhabbā. Yathā ca vicikicchāsampayutte, evaṃ uddhaccasampayuttepi. Kevalaṃ vicikicchāya
analyzed: daṭṭhabbā yathā ca vicikicchā sampayutte evam uddhacca sampayutte api kevalam vicikicchāya
translated: And as in the case of vicikicchā , so also in the case of uddhacca . Only the absence of doubt and the presence of resolution should be understood.

original: abhāvo, adhimokkhassa ca bhāvo, tato eva balavatarasamādhitā, teneva saṅgahavāre
analyzed: abhāvaḥ adhimokkhassa ca bhāvaḥ tatas eva balavatara samādhi tā tena iva saṅgaha vāre
translated: And because of that, the concentration is stronger. That is why, in the section on inclusion,

original: samādhinā saddhiṃ pañcindriyatā, tivaṅgikamaggatā, catubbalatā ca hoti. Uddhaccañcettha
analyzed: samādhinā saddhim pañca indriya tā tivaṅgika magga tā catur bala tā ca hoti uddhaccañca ittha
translated: It has the five faculties together with concentration, it has three factors of the path, and it has four powers. Excitement

original: sarūpeneva niddiṭṭhaṃ, adhimokkhamanasikārā dve yevāpanakavasenāti ayaṃ viseso, sesaṃ
analyzed: sarūpena iva niddiṭṭham adhimokkha manasikārāḥ dve yeva āpanaka vasena ati ayam visesaḥ sesam
translated: is shown in its individual essence. The difference is that there are only two, resolution and attention, and they are the opposite. The rest

original: tādisameva. Imāni pana dve cittāni nānāvisaye, ekavisaye ca asaṇṭhahanato pavaṭṭanakāni.🔽Uddhaccasahagataṃ hi laddhādhimokkhatāya laddhapatiṭṭhaṃ ekārammaṇeyeva patiṭṭhāya
analyzed: tādisam eva imāni pana dve cittāni nānā visaye eka visaye ca a saṇṭhahanataḥ pavaṭṭanakāni  uddhacca sahagatam hi laddha adhimokkha tāya laddha patiṭṭham eka ārammaṇe iva iva patiṭṭhāya
translated: is the same. But these two kinds of consciousness occur as turners because they do not persist in a single object or in different objects.

original: patiṭṭhāya pavaṭṭati caturassamaṇi viya, itaraṃ nānārammaṇesu vaṭṭamaṇi viyāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: patiṭṭhāya pavaṭṭati caturassa maṇi viya itaram nānā ārammaṇesu vaṭṭa maṇi viya ati daṭṭhabbam
translated: For that accompanied by excitement, having obtained resolution and having obtained steadiness, persists in a single object, like a four-faced die; the other occurs like a turning kaleidoscope in different objects.

original: Uddhaccasahagatañca ṭhapetvā sesā ekādasa paṭisandhiṃ janentīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: uddhacca sahagatam ca ṭhapetvā sesāḥ ekādasa paṭisandhim janenti iti veditabbam
translated: And it should be understood that all the eleven kinds except that accompanied by excitement produce rebirth-linking.

original: Visayādippabhedato panete dvādasapi vatthārammaṇavasena tāva chabbidhā honti. Tesu
analyzed: visaya ādi ppabhedato pana ete dvādasa api vattha ārammaṇa vasena tāva chabbidhāḥ honti tesu
translated: But as to the analysis of their objective fields, etc., these twelve are of six kinds according to the distinction of object, etc.,

original: lobhamohamūlā pana dasa pañcadvāre hadayavatthuṃ nissāyeva, manodvāre nissāya vā
analyzed: lobha moha mūlā pana dasa pañca dvāre hadaya vatthum nissāya iva manaḥ dvāre nissāya vā
translated: as follows. Of these, the ten accompanied by greed and delusion occur only in the five doors and in the heart-basis,🔽and in the mind door.

original: anissāya vā javanakiccaṃ sādhayamānā chabbidhā. Tathā dosamūlā nissāyeva pana pavattanti.🔽Lobhamūlā pana adinnādānakāmamicchācāramusāvādapesuññasamphappalāpābhijjhāsaṅkhātānaṃ
analyzed: a nissāya vā javana kiccam sādhayamānā chabbidhā tathā dosa mūlāḥ nissāya iva pana pavattanti  lobha mūlā pana adinnādāna kāma micchācāra musāvāda pesuñña samphappalāpa abhijjhā saṅkhātānam
translated: and when they do so by way of dependence, they are sixfold. So too, those rooted in hate occur only by way of dependence.

original: channaṃ kammapathānaṃ vasena chabbidhā. Diṭṭhisampayuttā panettha micchādiṭṭhivasenāpīti🔽sattavidhā honti. Dosamūlā pana pāṇābhipātādinnādānamusāvādapesuññapharusasamphappalāpabyāpādavasena🔽sattavidhā honti. Dasannampi panesaṃ dvārakammavasena ceva vīmaṃsāvajjitādhipatittayavasena
analyzed: channam kamma pathānam vasena chabbidhā diṭṭhi sampayuttā pana ittha micchādiṭṭhi vasena api iti  sattavidhāḥ honti dosa mūlā pana  sattavidhāḥ honti dasannam pi pana isam dvāra kamma vasena ca iva vīmaṃsā vajjita adhipati tittaya vasena
translated: But those rooted in greed are sixfold by way of the six courses of action called not giving what should be given, misconduct in sensual pleasures, false speech, malicious speech, harsh speech, and gossip, and covetousness.🔽But here, when associated with false view, they are sevenfold by way of the false view called “the view of holding to a doctrine of self.”🔽But those rooted in hate are sevenfold by way of the seven courses of action called killing living beings, taking what is not given, false speech, malicious speech, harsh speech, gossip, and ill will.

original: ca kusale vuttanayena vibhāgo veditabbo. Ekantahīnattā hīnattikabhedo natthi. Ārammaṇādhipati🔽panettha lobhamūlesu eva, na itaresu, mohamūlesu pana sahajātādhipatipi natthi, tathā
analyzed: ca kusale vutta nayena vibhāgaḥ veditabbaḥ ekanta hīna ttā hīna ttika bhedaḥ natthi ārammaṇa adhipati 🔽pana ittha lobha mūlesu eva na itaresu moha mūlesu pana sahajāta adhipati pi natthi tathā
translated: And the analysis of these ten should be understood in the way already given under the profitable by way of the two doors, the three roots, and the three controlling faculties beginning with investigation.

original: kammapathabhedopi. Na hi pavaṭṭamānaṃ kañci adhipatiṃ karoti. Doso vā savisayaṃ,
analyzed: kamma patha bhedaḥ api na hi pavaṭṭamānam kañci adhipatim karoti dosaḥ vā sa visayam
translated: And so too with the courses of kamma. For it does not make any other state its dominant condition as it occurs. Or else, like hate, it has a specific object.

original: vicikicchācittañca paṭipattimantarāyakarattena duccaritahetubhūtampi pāṇātipātādīnaṃ
analyzed: vicikicchā cittam ca paṭipattim antarāya karat tena duccarita hetu bhūtam pi pāṇātipāta ādīnam
translated: And the consciousness of doubt, though it is a cause of misconduct because it obstructs the undertaking of what is right,

original: dosalobhamūlacitteheva sanniṭṭhāpaniyato kammapathabhedaṃ na gacchati, pubbabhāge
analyzed: dosa lobha mūla cittehi iva sanniṭṭhāpaniyato kamma patha bhedam na gacchati pubba bhāge
translated: does not become a course of kamma because it is only concluded by the consciousnesses of hate and greed that have killing, etc., as their object.

original: eva pana hetu hoti. Tenevassa apāyahetutā paṭhamamaggavajjhatāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Atītādibhedato
analyzed: eva pana hetu hoti tena iva assa apāya hetu tā paṭhama magga vajjha tā ti daṭṭhabbam atīta ādi bhedato
translated: But in the earlier stage it is a cause. That is why it should be regarded as abandoned by the first path, since it is a cause of states of loss.

original: pana dvādasannaṃ paccekamanantatā, seso ca vinicchayo kusalādhikāre vuttanayeneva veditabboti.
analyzed: pana dvādasannam paccekam ananta tā seso ca vinicchayo kusala adhikāre vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ ti
translated: But as regards the classification according to past, etc., each one of the twelve has its own particular infinity, and the rest of the exposition should be understood in the way already given under the profitable .

original: Akusalā dhammā niṭṭhitā.🔽Abyākatapadattho
analyzed: akusalāḥ dhammāḥ niṭṭhitā  a byākata pada tthaḥ
translated: The unprofitable have now been dealt with.🔽The meaning of the terms “indeterminate” , etc.,

original: Ahetukakusalavipākavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ahetuka kusala vipāka vaṇṇanā
translated: The profitable resultant without root-cause has been dealt with.

original: Abyākatā pana dhammā jātito catubbidhā vipākakiriyarūpanibbānavasena. Tattha vipākābyākatā
analyzed: abyākatā pana dhammā jātito catubbidhā vipāka kiriya rūpa nibbāna vasena tattha vipāka abyākatā
translated: As regards the indeterminate states, they are of four kinds as resultants, in the sense- sphere, in the fine-material sphere, and in the immaterial sphere. Herein, the indeterminate states as resultants

original: dhammā jātito ca dvidhā honti kusalākusalavipākavasena. Tattha kusalavipākā bhūmito
analyzed: dhammā jātitaḥ ca dvidhā honti kusala akusala vipāka vasena tattha kusala vipākāḥ bhūmitaḥ
translated: are of two kinds as the result of profitable kamma and as the result of unprofitable kamma. Herein, the resultants of profitable kamma are of three kinds according to the plane, as of the sense sphere, the fine-material sphere, and the immaterial sphere.

original: catubbidhā kāmarūpārūpāvacaralokuttaravipākavasena. Tattha kāmāvacaravipākā ahetukā
analyzed: catubbidhā kāmarūpa arūpāvacara lokuttara vipāka vasena tattha kāmāvacara vipākā ahetukā
translated: They are fourfold as the result of the sense-desire, fine-material, immaterial, and supramundane planes. Herein, those of the sense-desire plane that are without root-cause are the five consciousnesses, namely, eye-, ear-, nose-, tongue-, and body-consciousness.

original: sahetukāti duvidhā. Tattha alobhādisahajātahetuvirahitā ahetukā. Te sampayogavatthārammaṇādibhedato
analyzed: sa hetukā ati duvidhā tattha alobha ādi sahajāta hetu virahitā ahetukā te sampayoga vattha ārammaṇa ādi bhedato
translated: They are of four kinds as resultants of the sense sphere, of the fine-material sphere, of the immaterial sphere, and of the supramundane. Herein, those of the sense sphere are twofold as without root-cause and with root-cause. Herein, those without root-cause are devoid of the root-cause conascent with non-greed, etc.,🔽They are of eight kinds as associated with non-hate, etc., and as having different objects, bases, etc.

original: aṭṭhavidhā. Seyyathidaṃ – upekkhāsahagataṃ cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, tathā sotaghānajivhāviññāṇaṃ,
analyzed: aṭṭhavidhā sā iyyathidam upekkhā sahagatam cakkhu viññāṇam tathā sota ghāna jivhā viññāṇam
translated: They are: eye-consciousness associated with equanimity, and similarly ear-, nose-, and tongue-consciousness;

original: sukhasahagataṃ kāyaviññāṇaṃ, upekkhāsahagatā manodhātu, somanassasahagatā manoviññāṇadhātu,🔽tathā upekkhāsahagatā cāti. Cakkhuviññāṇādīni hi cattāri cakkhupasādādīsu catūsu
analyzed: sukha sahagatam kāya viññāṇam upekkhā sahagatā manaḥ dhātu somanassa sahagatā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu  tathā upekkhā sahagatā ca ati cakkhu viññāṇa ādīni hi cattāri cakkhu pasāda ādīsu catūsu
translated: body-consciousness associated with pleasure, mind element associated with equanimity, mind-consciousness element associated with joy,🔽and similarly mind-consciousness element associated with equanimity. For the four beginning with eye-consciousness are associated only with the feeling of equanimity because the impact of the impingement of the objects, visible data, etc., on the four physical bases, eye, etc., is very slight,

original: upādāyarūpesu upādāyarūpānaṃ ghaṭṭanānighaṃsassa picupiṇḍe picupiṇḍassevātidubbalatāya
analyzed: upādāya rūpesu upādāya rūpānam ghaṭṭanā nighaṃsassa picu piṇḍe picu piṇḍassa iva ati dubbala tāya
translated: like the impact of a mass of cotton on a heap of cotton.

original: upekkhāvedanāsampayuttāneva honti. Kāyaviññāṇaṃ pana kāyindriye phoṭṭhabbabhūtattayaghaṭṭanānighaṃsassa
analyzed: upekkhā vedanā sampayuttāna eva honti kāya viññāṇam pana kāya indriye
translated: But the impact of the impingement of the three kinds of physical object on the body faculty is very slight, like the impact of a puff of wind on the body.

original: adhikaraṇimatthake ṭhapitapicupiṇḍe kūṭapahārasseva balavatāya pasādanissayesupi🔽bhūtesu paṭighātasambhavato sukhasahagataṃ hoti, manodhātu attano gahaṇadubbalatāya
analyzed: adhikaraṇi matthake ṭhapita picu piṇḍe kūṭa pahārassa iva balava tāya pasāda nissayesu pi  bhūtesu paṭighāta sambhavataḥ sukha sahagatam hoti manaḥ dhātu attanaḥ gahaṇa dubbala tāya
translated: And even in the case of the lump of boiled rice placed on the top of a legal question, it is accompanied by pleasure because of the strength of the faith and confidence in the case of those who remove the trick.🔽The mind element is accompanied by equanimity because of the weakness of its own apprehension.

original: atiiṭṭhepi upekkhāsahagatāva, manoviññāṇadhātu pana atiiṭṭhe somanassasahagatā, iṭṭhamajjhatte
analyzed: ati iṭṭhe pi upekkhā sahagatā ava manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu pana ati iṭṭhe somanassa sahagatā iṭṭha majjhatte
translated: The mind-consciousness element is accompanied by joy when there is excessive pleasure, and by equanimity when there is pleasure that is neither excessive nor deficient.

original: upekkhāsahagatāti ayaṃ sampayogato vinicchayo.
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatā ati ayam sampayogataḥ vinicchayo
translated: This is the exposition of the associated.

original: Dhammuddesādito pana cakkhuviññāṇe tāva phassapañcakaṃ, ekaggatā, jīvitanti sarūpenāgatā
analyzed: dhamma uddesa āditas pana cakkhu viññāṇe tāva phassa pañcakam ekagga tā jīvitan ti sarūpena āgatā
translated: As regards eye-consciousness, however, there are eight states: the five beginning with contact, unification, and life, which are given in their own individual names,

original: satta, yevāpanakavasena manasikāro eko cāti aṭṭha dhammā honti. Saṅgahato panettha
analyzed: satta yevāpanaka vasena manasikāro eko ca ati aṭṭha dhammāḥ honti saṅgahato pana ittha
translated: and attention, which is included under “and so on,” making seven, and the state itself, making eight. But in the aggregate method,🔽in the base method,🔽in the element method,🔽in the nutriment method,🔽in the faculty method,

original: khandhāyatanadhātuāhārindriyavasena pañcevasaṅgahā. Tattha cakkhuviññāṇadhātudhammadhātuvasena
analyzed: khandha āyatana dhātu āhāra indriya vasena pañca iva saṅgahā tattha cakkhu viññāṇa dhātu dhammadhātu vasena
translated: there is only a single inclusion, namely, in the case of the eye-consciousness element, in the states of the aggregate of consciousness, in the eye-base and mind-base, in the eye-consciousness element and the mind element,

original: dhātusaṅgaho, mano upekkhājīvitindriyavasena indriyasaṅgaho ca veditabbo. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: dhātu saṅgahaḥ manaḥ upekkhā jīvitindriya vasena indriya saṅgaho ca veditabbo sesam vutta nayam eva
translated: in the life faculty, in the faculties of pleasure, joy, and equanimity, and in the faculty of mind. The rest is as already stated.

original: Ettha ca vijjamānāpi vedanā jhānaṅgataṃ na gacchati, indriyaṃ pana hoti. Ekaggatā🔽indriyamaggaṅgabalabhāvampi na gacchati atidubbalattā. Vitakkapacchimakaṃ hi jhānaṃ,
analyzed: ettha ca vijjamānā api vedanā jhānaṅgatam na gacchati indriyam pana hoti ekagga tā  na gacchati ati dubbala ttā vitakka pacchimakam hi jhānam

translated: And in the section on the faculties, the faculty of vitality is included in the life faculty base and the mental-data base.🔽And in the section on the faculties, the faculty of

original: Yathā cettha, evaṃ manoviññāṇadhātudvayepi. Somanassasahagatatāya panettha pīti adhikā,
analyzed: yathā ca ittha evam manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu dvaye pi somanassa sahagata tāya pana ittha pi iti adhikā
translated: And as here, so also in the case of the two mind-consciousness elements. But in this case happiness is predominant by its being associated with joy.

original: saṅgahavāre ca pañcaṅgajjhānatā, vedanāparivattanaṃ, ubhayatthāpi manoviññāṇadhātudhammadhātuvasena
analyzed: saṅgaha vāre ca pañcaṅga jjhāna tā vedanā parivattanam ubhayattha api manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu dhammadhātu vasena
translated: And in the inclusion by aggregates, etc., the difference is that there is the fivefold aggregate, the change of feeling, and the inclusion by the element of mind-consciousness element and the element of mental data.

original: dhātusaṅgaho ca viseso, sesaṃ tādisameva.
analyzed: dhātu saṅgahaḥ ca visesaḥ sesam tādisam eva
translated: The rest is the same.

original: Visayādippabhedato pana cakkhuviññāṇādīni pañca yathākkamaṃ cakkhādiekekameva vatthuṃ
analyzed: visaya ādi ppabhedato pana cakkhu viññāṇa ādīni pañca yathākkamam cakkha ādi ekekam eva vatthum
translated: As regards the five beginning with eye-consciousness, they have respectively only one base in the eye, etc.,

original: nissāya paccuppanne, iṭṭhe ca rūpādiekekārammaṇe eva kiriyamanodhātuanantaraṃ ālokākāsavāyujalapathavīsahakārīni
analyzed: nissāya paccuppanne iṭṭhe ca rūpa ādi eka eka ārammaṇe eva kiriya manaḥ dhātu anantaram āloka ākāsa vāyu jala pathavī sahakārīni
translated: and they have only one object, visible data, etc., that are present. They are next to the functional mind element. They are assisted by light, space, air, water, and earth,

original: pasādakādīni dassanasavanaghāyanasāyanaphusanakiccāni sādhayamānāni cakkhudvārādīsu
analyzed: pasādaka ādīni dassana savana ghāyana sāyana phusana kiccāni sādhayamānāni cakkhu dvāra ādīsu
translated: and they perform the functions of seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, and touching respectively in the eye door, etc.,

original: ekekasmiṃ eva vipaccanti. Evametesaṃ vatthudvārārammaṇakiccāni visuṃ niyatāni. Ṭhānaṃ
analyzed: eka ekasmin eva vipaccanti evam etesam vatthu dvāra ārammaṇa kiccāni visum niyatāni ṭhānam
translated: and they occur only in the eye, etc., respectively. So their base, door, object, and function are each definitely separate.

original: pana tesaṃ pañcannampi ekameva, tena nesaṃ na bhedo. Manodhātu pana hadayavatthuṃ
analyzed: pana tesam ekam eva tena na isam na bhedaḥ manodhātu pana hadaya vatthum
translated: But their location is the same for all five, and so they are not separate in that. The mind element has the heart-basis as its location.

original: nissāyeva paccuppannesu rūpādīsu pañcasupi ārammaṇesu pañcaviññāṇānantaraṃ sampaṭicchanakiccaṃ🔽sādhayamānā pañcasupi dvāresu pavattati, somanassasahagatā manoviññāṇadhātu pana
analyzed: nissāya iva paccuppannesu rūpa ādīsu pañcasu pi ārammaṇesu pañca viññāṇa anantaram sampaṭicchana kiccam  sādhayamānā pañcasu pi dvāresu pavattati somanassa sahagatā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu pana
translated: It occurs in the five doors, accomplishing the function of receiving in the five doors after the five consciousnesses, having as its support the five physical sense bases that are present.🔽But the mind element associated with joy

original: hadayavatthuṃ nissāyeva atiiṭṭhe paccuppanne pañcārammaṇe vipākamanodhātuanantaraṃ🔽santīraṇakiccaṃ, chasupi dvāresu chasu balavakāmāvacarārammaṇesu atītādīsu javanānantaraṃ
analyzed: hadaya vatthum nissāya iva ati iṭṭhe paccuppanne pañca ārammaṇe vipāka manaḥ dhātu anantaram  santīraṇa kiccam dvāresu chasu balava kāmāvacara ārammaṇesu atīta ādīsu javana anantaram
translated: accomplishes the function of determining in the heart-basis, having as its support the heart-basis, after the resultant mind element in the five doors, in regard to the five presently arisen objects that are very striking.🔽It occurs accomplishing the function of adverting to the six objects that are very striking in the six doors, and the function of registration in regard to the six objects that are past, etc., after impulsion in the six doors.

original: tadārammaṇakiccañca sādhayamānā vipaccati. Evametissā dvārārammaṇakiccaṭṭhānāni anibaddhāni,
analyzed: tad ārammaṇa kiccam ca sādhayamānā vipaccati evam etissā dvāra ārammaṇa kicca ṭṭhānāni anibaddhāni
translated: Thus its doors, objects, functions, and locations are unfixed.

original: tato tehi bhedo hoti, vatthu pana tattheva nibaddhaṃ, tato na bhedo, evamupekkhāsahagatāyapi.
analyzed: tatas tehi bhedaḥ hoti vatthu pana tattha iva nibaddham tatas na bhedaḥ evam upekkhā sahagatāya api
translated: It differs from the other two in these four ways. But its physical basis is fixed there, so it does not differ from them in that. So too with the equanimous mind element.

original: Kevalaṃ panesā dvāravinimuttāpi hutvā sugatiyaṃ jaccandhabadhirajaccummattakādīnaṃ
analyzed: kevalam pana īsā dvāra vinimuttā api hutvā
translated: But this occurs in the heart-basis, having become free from the doors, accomplishing the function of registration in the happy destinies in regard to the objects that are very striking, such as the beauty of a newly born deva’s or Brahmā’s body, or the sound of the first thunder in the rainy season, or the smell of the first paddy or wheat shoots, or the taste of the first fruits, etc., after the impulsion consciousnesses that arise in the six doors in the course of an existence.

original: paṭisandhikāle purimacuticittānantaraṃ kammabalenopaṭṭhitaṃ kammakammanimittagatinimittesu🔽aññataraṃ atītādibhedaṃ chabbidhampi kāmāvacarārammaṇamārabbha paṭisandhikiccaṃ,
analyzed: paṭisandhi kāle purima cuti citta anantaram kamma balena upaṭṭhitam kamma kamma nimitta gati nimittesu  aññataram atīta ādi bhedam chabbidham pi kāmāvacara ārammaṇam ārabbha paṭisandhi kiccam
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking, next to the death consciousness in the previous becoming, it is generated by kamma-formation, and it has as its object any one of the six kinds of object, namely, visible data, etc., that are past, etc., and belong to the sense sphere. It performs the function of rebirth-linking,

original: tadanantarato paṭṭhāya yāvatāyukaṃ bhavaṅgakiccaṃ, ante cutikiccañca, vuttanayena
analyzed: tad anantarataḥ paṭṭhāya yāvatāyukam bhavaṅga kiccam ante cuti kiccam ca vutta nayena
translated: and next to that it performs the function of life-continuum as long as there is no other kind of consciousness, and finally it performs the function of death. And in the way already stated

original: santīraṇatadārammaṇakiccāni ca sādhayamānā imesu pañcasu ṭhānesu vipaccatīti ayaṃ
analyzed: ca sādhayamānā imesu pañcasu ṭhānesu vipaccati iti ayaṃ
translated: it performs the functions of adverting, determining, and receiving. So it occurs in these five ways.

original: viseso, sesaṃ tādisameva.🔽Ettha ca vadhabandhādivasappavatte aniṭṭhārammaṇe khantipaṭisaṅkhānādivasena kusaluppattito🔽tannibbattānaṃ paṭisandhiādiviññāṇānaṃ kammanimittañce ārammaṇaṃ hoti, aniṭṭheneva
analyzed: visesaḥ sesam tādisam eva  ettha ca vadha bandha ādi vasa ppavatte aniṭṭha ārammaṇe khanti paṭisaṅkhāna ādi vasena kusala uppattito  tad nibbattānam paṭisandhi ādi viññāṇānam kamma nimittam ce ārammaṇam hoti aniṭṭhena iva
translated: This is the difference. The rest is the same.🔽And here, when an undesirable object such as killing, binding, etc., occurs, then, since profitable consciousness arises in the way beginning “with patience and with reflection” ,🔽the rebirth-linking consciousness, etc., that arise owing to that have as their object the sign of kamma. But it must be undesirable.

original: tena bhavitabbaṃ. Evaṃ iṭṭhavisaye uppannānaṃ kusalavipākānaṃ aniṭṭhārammaṇesu anuppattito
analyzed: tena bhavitabbam evam iṭṭha visaye uppannānam kusala vipākānam aniṭṭha ārammaṇesu anuppattitaḥ
translated: And so, since profitable resultant consciousness that has arisen owing to a desirable object does not occur with an undesirable object,

original: kammagatinimittameva tesaṃ ārammaṇaṃ hotīti viññāyati. Vicāretvā yathā avirodho hoti,🔽tathā gahetabbaṃ. Evaṃ iṭṭhavisaye uppannakusalato nibbattānampi paṭisandhiādiviññāṇānaṃ🔽kammanimittārammaṇatāya avirodho ñātabbo. Atītādibhedato pana aṭṭhannampi paccekamanantaratā
analyzed: kamma gati nimittam eva tesam ārammaṇam hoti iti viññāyati vicāretvā yathā avirodhaḥ hoti  tathā gahetabbam evam iṭṭha visaye uppanna kusalataḥ nibbattānam pi paṭisandhi ādi viññāṇānam  kamma nimitta ārammaṇa tāya avirodhaḥ ñātabbaḥ atīta ādi bhedato pana aṭṭhannam pi paccekam anantara tā
translated: It is evident that the object of these is only the sign of the kamma.🔽It should be taken in such a way that there is no contradiction.🔽So too, in the case of the kinds of rebirth-linking consciousness that arise in the happy destinies, their object should be understood to be the sign of kamma in the same way.

original: heṭṭhā vuttanayena gahetabbā.
analyzed: heṭṭhā vutta nayena gahetabbā
translated: But as regards the eight kinds of consciousness classed according to the past, etc., each should be taken separately in the way already described.

original: Ahetukakusalavipākā niṭṭhitā.🔽Sahetukakusalavipākavaṇṇanā🔽Alobhādivipākahetusampayuttā pana sahetukā, te sampayogato kāmāvacarakusalā viya
analyzed: ahetuka kusala vipākā niṭṭhitā  sa hetuka kusala vipāka vaṇṇanā  alobha ādi vipāka hetu sampayuttā pana sa hetukā te sampayogato kāmāvacara kusalāḥ viya
translated: The profitable resultant without root-cause has now been dealt with.🔽The profitable resultant with root-cause is associated with non- greed, etc., as root-cause. It is of eight kinds according to association, like the profitable of the sense sphere.

original: aṭṭhavidhā. Somanassañāṇādisampayogo panettha āgamanādito veditabbo. Tihetukaṃ hi🔽kāmāvacarakusalaṃ tihetukadvihetukapaṭisandhiyo datvā pavatte chasu dvāresu soḷasa
analyzed: aṭṭhavidhā somanassa ñāṇa ādi sampayogaḥ pana ittha āgamana āditaḥ veditabbo ti hetukam hi  kāmāvacara kusalam ti hetuka dvi hetuka paṭisandhiyaḥ da tvā pavatte chasu dvāresu soḷasa
translated: But the association with joy, knowledge, etc., should be understood according to the way in which they occur.🔽For profitable consciousness of the sense sphere with three roots gives rebirth-linking of the two kinds with three roots and with two roots, and in the course of an existence it gives sixteen kinds of resultant in the six doors.

original: vipākāni deti, duhetukaṃ pana kusalaṃ duhetukāhetukapaṭisandhiyo datvā pavatte chasu
analyzed: vipākāni deti du hetukam pana kusalam du hetuka ahetuka paṭisandhiyaḥ da tvā pavatte chasu
translated: But that with two roots gives rebirth-linking of the two kinds with two roots and without root-cause, and in the course of an existence it gives eight kinds of resultant in the six doors.

original: dvāresu tihetukarahitāni dvādasa vipākāni deti. Asaṅkhārikasasaṅkhārikabhāvo panettha🔽paccayavisesatopi hoti. Balavapaccayenāpi hi uppannaṃ asaṅkhārikaṃ hoti, dubbalenāpi
analyzed: dvāresu ti hetuka rahitāni dvādasa vipākāni deti asaṅkhārika sasaṅkhārika bhāvaḥ pana ittha  paccaya visesataḥ pi hoti balava paccayena api hi uppannam asaṅkhārikam hoti dubbalena api
translated: At the doors of the eye, etc., it gives twelve resultants devoid of three roots. But here the state of being with or without prompting is due🔽to a difference in conditions. For what is produced by a strong condition is without prompting;

original: itaraṃ. Keci pana asaṅkhārikena sasaṅkhāravipākānaṃ, sasaṅkhārikena ca asaṅkhārikānaṃ🔽uppattiṃ na icchanti. Yasmā panetāni paṭisandhidāyakato aññenāpi kammena pavatte
analyzed: itaram pana asaṅkhārikena sa saṅkhāra vipākānam sa saṅkhārikena ca  uppattim na icchanti yasmā pana itāni paṭisandhi dāyakataḥ aññena api kammena pavatte
translated: what is produced by a weak one is with prompting. But some do not want it to be so, saying that what is without prompting is produced by what is with prompting and what is with prompting is produced by what is without prompting.

original: akusalavipākāni pavattanti, paṭṭhāne ca “sahetukaṃ bhavaṅgaṃ ahetukassa bhavaṅgassa
analyzed: akusala vipākāni pavattanti paṭṭhāne ca sa hetukam bhavaṅgam ahetukassa bhavaṅgassa
translated: But since these are found occurring by other kamma too, apart from that which gives rebirth-linking, and since it is said in the Paṭṭhāna: “The hetu- accompanied bhavanga is a condition, as conascence condition, etc., for the hetu-unaccompanied bhavanga,”

original: anantarapaccayena paccayo”ti vuttaṃ, tasmā ahetukapaṭisandhikassa puggalassa sugatiyaṃ🔽pavatte sahetukānipi vipākāni pavattanti. Duggatiyaṃ, pana rūpāvacarabhūmiyañca ahetukāneva
analyzed: anantara paccayena paccayaḥ ti vuttam tasmai ahetuka paṭisandhikassa puggalassa sugatiyam  pavatte sa hetukāni api vipākāni pavattanti duggatiyam pana rūpāvacara bhūmiyam ca ahetukān eva
translated: therefore in the case of a person with a hetu-unaccompanied rebirth-linking, resultant consciousnesses accompanied by root-cause occur in the happy destiny,

original: pavattanti. Tesupi atiiṭṭhe ārammaṇe somanassasahagatāni, iṭṭhamajjhatte upekkhāsahagatānīti
analyzed: pavattanti tesu pi ati iṭṭhe ārammaṇe somanassa sahagatāni iṭṭha majjhatte upekkhā sahagatāni iti
translated: but in the unhappy destiny and in the fine-material sphere only those unaccompanied by root-cause occur. And of these, too, those accompanied by joy occur when the object is a very desirable one, and those accompanied by equanimity occur when the object is a desirable one in a moderate degree.

original: evaṃ āgamanādito sampayogabhedo veditabbo.
analyzed: evam āgamana āditaḥ sampayoga bhedaḥ veditabbo
translated: So the analysis of the associated should be understood as beginning with the coming.

original: Dhammuddesādito pana yāva suññatavārapariyosānā kāmāvacarakusalasadisova sabbo vinicchayo,
analyzed: dhamma uddesa āditaḥ pana yāva suññata vāra pariyosānā kāmāvacara kusala sadisaḥ iva sabbaḥ vinicchayo
translated: But the exposition should be understood as like that of the profitable of the sense sphere, beginning with the description of the mental factors and ending with the section on the void,

original: kevalañcettha yevāpanakesu karuṇāmuditā na santi sattārammaṇattā. Ekantaparittārammaṇā🔽hi kāmāvacaravipākā. Viratiyopettha lokiyesu ekantakusalasabhāvattā na santi. “Pañcasikkhāpadā
analyzed: kevalam ca ittha yevāpanakesu karuṇā muditāḥ na santi satta ārammaṇa ttāḥ ekanta paritta ārammaṇā  hi kāmāvacara vipākāḥ viratiyā upettha lokiyesu ekanta kusala sabhāvattāḥ na santi pañca sikkhāpadā
translated: except that in the case of the four divine abodes of the compassion and gladness kinds there is no equanimity of the abandoning kind, because they have living beings as their object.🔽For the fruition consciousness of the sense sphere has only a limited object.🔽And there is no virtue here because the mundane kinds are entirely of the profitable type.🔽For it is said, “The five training precepts are profitable only” .

original: kusalā evā”ti hi vuttaṃ. Phassādayo cettha vipākattā ādāse mukhanimittaṃ viya nirussāhasantā,
analyzed: kusalāḥ evā ti hi vuttam phassa ādayaḥ ca ittha vipāka attā ādāse mukha nimittam viya
translated: And here the contact, etc., are without root-cause because they are fruition, like the reflection of the face in a looking-glass;🔽but the profitable ones have root-cause, like the face.

original: kusalā pana mukhaṃ viya saussāhā. Saṅgahavāre ca pañcaṅgiko maggo hoti, ayaṃ viseso. Sesaṃ tādisameva.
analyzed: kusalā pana mukham viya saussāhā saṅgaha vāre ca pañcaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ hoti ayam viseso sesam tādisam eva
translated: And in the section on the inclusive triad the path is of five aggregates, which is the difference here. The rest is the same.

original: Visayādippabhedato pana yvāyaṃ kusalesu kammadvārapuññakiriyādhipatīhi bhedo vutto,
analyzed: visaya ādi ppabhedato pana yvā ayam kusalesu kamma dvāra puñña kiriyā adhipatīhi bhedaḥ vutto
translated: But the analysis given under the profitable under the headings of “object,” etc.,

original: so idha natthi aviññattijanakato, avipākadhammato, tathā appavattito ca. Hīnattikabhedo
analyzed: so idha natthi a viññatti janakataḥ avipāka dhammato tathā appavattito ca hīna ttika bhedaḥ
translated: is not applicable here, because these are not productive of intimation, because they are not states of kammic result, and because they do not occur in such a way.🔽The analysis into inferior, medium, and superior is applicable.

original: pana atthi hīnamajjhimappaṇītānaṃ kusalānaṃ vipākattā, tathā dvārārammaṇādibhedo.🔽Ete hi hadayavatthuṃ nissāya dvāravinimuttā hutvā devamanussesu dvihetukatihetukānaṃ🔽heṭṭhā vuttanayena paṭisandhibhavaṅgacutikiccāni, chadvāre chasu ārammaṇesu tadārammaṇakiccañca
analyzed: pana atthi hīna majjhima ppaṇītānam kusalānam vipāka ttā tathā dvāra ārammaṇa ādi bhedaḥ  ete hi hadaya vatthum nissāya dvāra vinimuttāḥ hutvā deva manussesu dvi hetuka ti hetukānam  heṭṭhā vutta nayena paṭisandhi bhavaṅga cuti kiccāni cha dvāre chasu ārammaṇesu tad ārammaṇa kiccam ca
translated: but there is a difference in the kinds of kamma that produce them, in that they are the result of profitable kamma of the fine-material sphere only.🔽For these are not classed according to door, object, etc., like the others.

original: sādhayamānā evaṃ catūsu ṭhānesu vipaccanti. Evametesaṃ dvārārammaṇakiccaṭṭhānāni
analyzed: sādhayamānāḥ evam catūsu ṭhānesu vipaccanti evam etesam dvāra ārammaṇa kicca ṭṭhānāni
translated: For they are produced in two or three of the four instances, namely, rebirth-linking, life-continuum, death, and adverting, in the happy destinies of the fine-material sphere, and they perform the function of adverting in the six doors in the case of the two-rooted consciousnesses, and in the five doors in the case of the three-rooted consciousnesses.

original: anibaddhāni, tato tehi bhedo hoti. Vatthu pana tattheva nibaddhaṃ, tato na bhedo.
analyzed: a nibaddhāni tatas tehi bhedaḥ hoti vatthu pana tattha iva nibaddham tatas na bhedaḥ
translated: So their door, object, and function are not fixed, and that is why they are not classed according to them. But their physical basis is fixed, and that is why they are not classed according to that.

original: Atītādibhedato panetthāpi anantatā vuttanayā evāti.🔽Kāmāvacarasahetukakusalavipākā niṭṭhitā.🔽Rūpāvacaravipākavaṇṇanā
analyzed: atīta ādi bhedato pana itthā api ananta tā vutta nayā eva ati  kāmāvacara sa hetuka kusala vipākā niṭṭhitā  rūpāvacara vipāka vaṇṇanā
translated: And here too the endlessness is to be understood as already stated according to the past, etc., distinction.🔽The profitable resultant of the fine-material sphere is classed according to association, etc., as is the profitable of the fine-material sphere.

original: Rūpāvacaravipākāpi sampayogabhedato attano kusalā viya pañcavidhā honti. Sabbo cettha
analyzed: rūpāvacara vipākā api sampayoga bhedataḥ kusalāḥ viya pañcavidhāḥ honti ca ittha
translated: The profitable resultant of the immaterial sphere is classed according to association, etc., as is the profitable of the immaterial sphere.

original: vinicchayabhedo kusale vuttanayo eva. Vipākabhāvato panettha yathā hatthiādīnaṃ chāyā
analyzed: vinicchaya bhedo kusale eva vipāka bhāvataḥ pana ittha yathā hatthi ādīnam chāyā
translated: The analysis of the results is the same as that given for the profitable.

original: taṃsadisā, evaṃ kusalāgamanato ca jhānaṅgādisampayuttadhammasamāyogo, paṭipadādibhedo
analyzed: taṃsadisā evam kusala āgamanato ca jhāna aṅga ādi sampayutta dhamma samāyogo paṭipadā ādi bhedo
translated: The analysis is the same as that given for the profitable.
