original: Gandhādīnaṃ avinibbhogattā, phoṭṭhabbattā, dhātusabhāvattā ca ghānādittayabhāvadvayasukhadukkhadomanassindriyāni,
analyzed: gandha ādīnam avinibbhoga ttā phoṭṭhabba ttā dhātu sabhāva ttā ca ghāna ādi ttaya bhāva dvaya sukha dukkha domanassa indriyāni
translated: The nose, tongue, and body faculties, the pleasure, pain, and grief faculties,

original: pana domanassahetukabaḷīkārāhāraghānādittayasamphassādīni ca vajjetvā cuddasindriyādibhāvo veditabbo.
analyzed: pana domanassa hetuka baḷīkāra āhāra ghāna ādi ttaya samphassa ādīni ca vajjetvā cuddas indriya ādi bhāvaḥ veditabbo
translated: and the nose, tongue, and body contacts, etc., are excluded, but the remaining fourteen faculties, etc., should be understood as present.

original: Tatiyakoṭṭhāse pana –
analyzed: tatiya koṭṭhāse pana
translated: In the third section

original: “Arūpadhātuyā cattāro khandhā, dve āyatanāni, dve dhātuyo, tīṇi saccāni, ekādasindriyāni, aṭṭha hetū, tayo āhārā, eko phasso…pe… ekaṃ citta”nti –
analyzed: arūpa dhātuyā cattāro khandhāḥ dve āyatanāni dve dhātuyo tīṇi saccāni ekādasa indriyāni aṭṭha hetū tayo āhārāḥ ekaḥ ekam cittam
translated: the exposition is given after stating the Schedule thus: “In the immaterial-sphere element there are four aggregates, two bases, two elements, three truths, eleven faculties, eight causes, three kinds of nutriment, one kind of contact … one kind of consciousness” .

original: Mātikaṃ nikkhipitvā vibhattā. Ettha ca cakkhusotaanaññātaññassāmītindriyānampi abhāvā ekādasindriyāni veditabbāni.
analyzed: mātikam nikkhipitvā vibhattā ettha ca abhāvā ekādasa indriyāni veditabbāni
translated: And here the eleven faculties should be understood as follows: the eye, ear, and mental-data faculties, and the femininity, masculinity, bodily- pleasure, bodily-pain, and grief faculties are absent.

original: Catutthakoṭṭhāse pana –
analyzed: catuttha koṭṭhāse pana
translated: In the fourth section

original: “Apariyāpanne cattāro khandhā, dve āyatanāni, dve dhātuyo, dve saccāni, dvādasindriyāni, cha hetū, tayo āhārā, eko phasso…pe… ekaṃ citta”nti –🔽Mātikaṃ nikkhipitvā vibhattā. Yasmā ca okāsavasena vā sattuppattivasena vā apariyāpannadhātu
analyzed: apariyāpanne cattāro khandhāḥ dve āyatanāni dve dhātuyaḥ dve saccāni dvādasa indriyāni cha hetū tayo āhārā ekaḥ phassa upe ekam cittam  mātikam nikkhipitvā vibhattā yasmai ca okāsa vasena vā sattu patti vasena vā apariyāpanna dhātu
translated: “In the unincluded four aggregates, two bases, two elements, two truths, twelve faculties, six causes, three kinds of nutriment, one kind of contact … one kind of consciousness” .🔽After the matrix had been laid down, the exposition was given.

original: nāma natthi, tasmā “apariyāpannadhātuyā”ti avatvā nibbattitalokuttarameva dassetuṃ
analyzed: nāma na atthi tasmai a pariyāpanna dhātuyā ti avatvā nibbattita lokuttaram eva dassetum
translated: And since there is no element called unincluded either by way of plane or by way of arising of the faculties, therefore, instead of saying “in the unincluded element,”

original: “apariyāpanne cattāro khandhā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Evaṃ catūhi koṭṭhāsehi dutiyo vāro veditabbo.
analyzed: apariyāpanne cattāro khandhā ti ādi vuttam evam catūhi koṭṭhāsehi dutiyaḥ vāraḥ veditabbo
translated: the exposition was given beginning with “in the unincluded four aggregates” in order to show only the supramundane that arises at the moment of rebirth. Thus the second round should be understood as consisting of four sections.

original: Tatiyo pana vāro –
analyzed: tatiyaḥ pana vāraḥ
translated: But the third round is as follows:

original: “Rūpakkhandho kāmadhātupariyāpanno, cattāro khandhā siyā kāmadhātupariyāpannā, siyā na kāmadhātupariyāpannā”tiādinā –
analyzed: rūpa khandho kāmadhātu pariyāpanno cattāro khandhā siyā kāmadhātu pariyāpannā siyā na kāmadhātu pariyāpannā ati ādinā
translated: “The form aggregate is included in the sense-desire element. Four aggregates may be included in the sense-desire element or they may not be included in the sense-desire element” .

original: Catūsu bhūmīsu catūhi koṭṭhāsehi taṃtaṃbhūmipariyāpannadhammadassanavasena pavatto,
analyzed: catūsu bhūmīsu catūhi koṭṭhāsehi taṃ taṃ bhūmi pariyāpanna dhamma dassana vasena pavatto
translated: It is the round that occurs by way of showing the states included in the four planes, in four sections.

original: so ca heṭṭhā vuttānusārena sakkā ñātunti na vitthārito. Tattha ca kāmadhātupariyāpannoti
analyzed: so ca heṭṭhā vutta anusārena sakkā ñātunti na vitthārito tattha ca kāmadhātu pariyāpannaḥ ti
translated: and since it can be known by the method stated above, it is not elaborated here.

original: kāmāvacarabhāvena tattha antogadho kāmāvacaroti attho. Sesesupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: kāmāvacara bhāvena tattha antogadhaḥ kāmāvacaraḥ ti attho sesesu pi esa eva nayo
translated: Herein, included in the sense-desire element means included there as belonging to the sense-desire element. The meaning is, of the sense-desire realm. The same method applies in the other cases.🔽But the fourth section occurs by way of the four terms in the three planes as the seeing of the states that arise and do not arise at the moment of rebirth-linking.

original: Catuttho pana vāro tīsu bhūmīsu catūhi koṭṭhāsehi paṭisandhikkhaṇe uppajjanakānuppajjanakadhammadassanavasena pavatto. Tattha paṭhamakoṭṭhāse tāva –
analyzed: catuttho pana vāro tīsu bhūmīsu catūhi koṭṭhāsehi paṭisandhi kkhaṇe uppajjanaka anuppajjanaka dhamma dassana vasena pavatto tattha paṭhama koṭṭhāse tāva
translated: Herein, firstly, in the first term:

original: “Kāmadhātuyā upapattikkhaṇe sabbesaṃ pañcakkhandhā pātubhavanti, kassaci ekādasāyatanāni
analyzed: kāmadhātuyāḥ upapatti khaṇe sabbesam pañca kkhandhāḥ pātubhavanti kassaci ekādasa āyatanāni
translated: At the moment of reappearing in the sense-desire element, all have the five aggregates that have reappeared. Some have eleven bases that have reappeared,

original: pātubhavanti, kassaci dasāyatanāni pātubhavanti, kassaci aparāni dasa, kassaci nava,
analyzed: pātubhavanti kassaci dasa āyatanāni pātubhavanti kassaci aparāni dasa kassaci nava
translated: some have ten bases that have reappeared, some have another eleven, some have nine,

original: kassaci satta, kassaci ekādasa dhātuyo…pe… satta dhātuyo. Sabbesaṃ ekaṃ saccaṃ pātubhavati.
analyzed: kassaci satta kassaci ekādasa satta dhātuyo sabbesam ekam saccam pātubhavati
translated: some have seven, some have another eleven, some have seven elements that have reappeared. All have one truth that has reappeared.

original: Kassaci cuddasindriyāni, kassaci terasa, kassaci aparāni terasa, kassaci dvādasa,
analyzed: kassaci cuddas indriyāni kassaci terasa kassaci aparāni terasa kassaci dvādasa
translated: Some have fourteen faculties that have reappeared, some have thirteen, some have another thirteen, some have twelve,

original: kassaci dasa, kassaci nava, kassaci aparāni nava, kassaci aṭṭha, kassaci aparāni
analyzed: kassaci dasa kassaci nava kassaci aparāni nava kassaci aṭṭha kassaci aparāni
translated: some ten, some nine, some eight, some seven, some six, some five, some four, some three, some two,🔽

original: aṭṭha, kassaci satta, kassaci pañca, kassaci cattārindriyāni pātubhavanti, kassaci
analyzed: aṭṭha kassaci satta kassaci pañca kassaci cattāri indriyāni pātubhavanti kassaci
translated: some ten, some nine, some eight, some seven, some five, some four.

original: tayo hetū pātubhavanti, kassaci dve, kassaci ahetukā pātubhavanti. Sabbesaṃ cattāro
analyzed: tayaḥ hetū pātubhavanti kassaci dve kassaci ahetukā pātubhavanti sabbesam cattāro
translated: Some have three roots, some two, some are without roots.

original: āhārā, eko phasso…pe… ekaṃ cittaṃ pātubhavatī”ti –
analyzed: ekaḥ ekam cittam pātubhavati iti
translated: All have four nutriments, one contact … one kind of consciousness.”

original: Mātikaṃ nikkhipitvā vibhattā. Tattha paṭisandhikkhaṇe kāmāvacarānaṃ opapātikānaṃ,
analyzed: mātikam nikkhipitvā vibhattā tattha paṭisandhi khaṇe kāmāvacarānam opapātikānam
translated: After laying down the matrix, he explained the rest. Herein, at the rebirth-linking of sense-sphere beings who are apparitional,

original: āpāyikānaṃ, devamanussānaṃ paripuṇṇāyatanānaṃ saddāyatanavajjitāni ekādasāyatanāni
analyzed: āpāyikānam deva manussānam paripuṇṇa āyatanānam saddhāyatana vajjitāni ekādasa āyatanāni
translated: and of those in states of loss, and of gods and human beings with complete sense bases, eleven sense bases

original: pātubhavanti, tāneva ekādasa dhātuyo honti. Saddo hi ekantena paṭisandhiyaṃ na uppajjati,
analyzed: pātubhavanti tān eva ekādasa dhātuyaḥ honti saddo hi ekantena paṭisandhiyam na uppajjati
translated: come into existence, omitting the sound base. There are eleven kinds of materiality,🔽for sound arises only in a continuity that has already reached existence.

original: tesaññeva pana jaccandhānaṃ dasa, jaccabadhirānaṃ aparāni dasa, jaccandhabadhirānaṃ
analyzed: tesam eva pana jat candhānam dasa aparāni dasa jat candha badhirānam
translated: But in the blind the sound base is absent, and in the deaf the other eleven are absent,

original: nava, gabbhaseyyakānaṃ rūpagandharasakāyaphoṭṭhabbamanodhammavasena satta āyatanadhātuyo🔽pātubhavanti. Opapātikānaṃ tihetukānaṃ manacchaṭṭhāni indriyāni, bhāvadvaye ekaṃ,🔽jīvitindriyaṃ, somanassupekkhindriyesu ekaṃ, saddhādīni pañcāti cuddasindriyāni,
analyzed: nava gabbhaseyyakānam rūpa gandha rasa kāya phoṭṭhabba manaḥ dhamma vasena satta āyatana dhātuyo  pātubhavanti opapātikānam ti hetukānam mana chaṭṭhāni indriyāni bhāva dvaye ekam  jīvitindriyam somanassupekkhindriyesu ekam saddhā ādīni pañca ati cuddasindriyāni
translated: Nine, for those who are born from wombs, seven bases and elements are manifest, namely, visible-data, odour, flavour, body, tangible-data, mind, and mental-data.🔽For those of double-rooted rebirth, the six faculties beginning with mind, the two states of being, the life faculty, and one of the faculties of joy or equanimity, and the five beginning with faith, make fourteen faculties.

original: tesaṃ dvihetukānaṃ paññindriyaṃ vajjetvā terasa, paṭhamakappikānaṃ manussānaṃ tihetukānaṃ
analyzed: tesam dvi hetukānam paññindriyam vajjetvā terasa paṭhama kappikānam manussānam ti hetukānam
translated: For those of single-rooted rebirth, the faculty of understanding is omitted, making thirteen. For those of the first stage of life who are of double-rooted rebirth,🔽the faculty of womanhood is omitted, making thirteen. For those of the same stage who are of single-rooted rebirth,

original: bhāvindriyaṃ vajjetvā aparānipi terasa, tesaññeva duhetukānaṃ dvādasa, gabbhaseyyakānaṃ
analyzed: bhāvindriyam terasa tesaññeva du hetukānam dvādasa gabbhaseyyakānam
translated: twelve are reckoned. But for those of double-rooted rebirth who are born from wombs,

original: pana tihetukānaṃ purimesu cuddasasu cakkhādīni cattāri vajjetvā dasa, tesaṃ duhetukānaṃ
analyzed: pana ti hetukānam purimesu cuddasasu cakkha ādīni cattāri vajjetvā dasa tesam du hetukānam
translated: four, namely, eye, ear, nose, and tongue, are omitted from the first fourteen, making ten. For those of single-rooted rebirth

original: nava, opapātikānaṃ ahetukānaṃ paripuṇṇāyatanānaṃ purimesu cuddasasu saddādīni vajjetvā
analyzed: nava opapātikānam ahetukānam paripuṇṇa āyatanānam purimesu cuddasasu sadda ādīni vajjetvā
translated: nine are reckoned. For those of double-rooted rebirth who are apparitional beings and have complete bases, the five beginning with faith are omitted from the first fourteen, making nine. For those of the same kind who are born blind

original: aparāni nava, tesaññeva jaccandhānaṃ aṭṭha, tathā badhirānaṃ, andhabadhirānaṃ pana
analyzed: aparāni nava tesaññeva aṭṭha tathā badhirānam andhabadhirānam pana
translated: eight are reckoned. So too for those who are born deaf. But for those who are born blind and deaf

original: satta, gabbhaseyyakānaṃ pana ahetukānaṃ kāyamanobhāvajīvitaupekkhindriyāni pañca,
analyzed: satta gabbhaseyyakānam pana ahetukānam kāya manaḥ bhāva jīvita aupekkhindriyāni pañca
translated: But in the case of those of no-cause nature who lie in the womb, five faculties, namely, the body faculty, the mind faculty, and the three faculties of pleasure, pain, and life,

original: tesaññeva napuṃsakānaṃ cattāri pātubhavanti. Ahetukacittesu hi vijjamānāpi ekaggatā
analyzed: tesam eva napuṃsakānam cattāri pātubhavanti ahetuka cittesu hi vijjamānā api ekagga tā
translated: and in the case of those of no-cause nature who are sexless, four faculties, namely, the body faculty, the life faculty, and the two faculties of equanimity and pain,

original: samādhindriyataṃ na gacchati, manoviññāṇadhātuvasena pana “eko phasso”tiādayo veditabbā.
analyzed: na gacchati manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu vasena pana ekaḥ phassaḥ ti ādayaḥ veditabbā
translated: for in the consciousnesses of no-cause nature the singleness that exists does not reach the state of the concentration faculty. But the “one contact” and the rest should be understood as in the case of the mind-consciousness element.

original: Dutiyakoṭṭhāse pana –
analyzed: dutiya koṭṭhāse pana
translated: In the second section

original: “Rūpadhātuyā upapattikkhaṇe ṭhapetvā asaññasattānaṃ devānaṃ pañcakkhandhā pātubhavanti.
analyzed: rūpadhātuyāḥ upapatti kkhaṇe ṭhapetvā asaññasattānam devānam pañca khandhāḥ pātubhavanti
translated: “At the moment of reappearing in the fine-material sphere, except for the non-percipient beings, the five aggregates become manifest.

original: Pañcāyatanāni, pañca dhātuyo, ekaṃ saccaṃ, dasindriyāni, tayo hetū, tayo āhārā, eko
analyzed: pañca āyatanāni pañca dhātuyaḥ ekam saccam dasa indriyāni tayaḥ hetū tayaḥ āhārāḥ ekaḥ
translated: There are five bases, five elements, one truth, ten faculties, three causes, three kinds of nutriment,

original: phasso…pe… ekaṃ citta”nti –🔽Mātikaṃ nikkhipitvā vibhattā. Tattha cakkhurūpasotamanodhammānaṃ vasena pañcāyatanadhātuyo
analyzed: phassa upe ekam cittam ti  mātikam nikkhipitvā vibhattā tattha cakkhu rūpa sota manaḥ dhammānam vasena pañca āyatana dhātuyo
translated: one kind of contact … one kind of … consciousness” .🔽After setting out the mātikā in this way, he expounded it. Herein, the five bases and the five elements should be understood as the eye, the visible-data base, the ear, the sound base, the nose, the odour base, the tongue, the flavour base, and the body, the tangible-data base.

original: veditabbā. Etthāpi gandharasaphoṭṭhabbānaṃ aggahaṇe kāraṇaṃ pubbe vuttameva. Cakkhusotamanojīvitindriyāni,
analyzed: veditabbā ettha api gandha rasa phoṭṭhabbānam aggahaṇe kāraṇam pubbe vuttam eva cakkhu sota manaḥ jīvita indriyāni
translated: Herein, the reason for not including the odour, flavour, and tongue faculties is the same as before . The eye, ear, mind, and life faculties,

original: somanassupekkhānaṃ aññataraṃ, saddhādīni pañcāti dasindriyāni veditabbāni.
analyzed: somanassa upekkhānam aññataram saddhā ādīni dasa indriyāni veditabbāni
translated: and either joy or equanimity. The five beginning with faith should be understood as the five faculties.

original: Tatiyakoṭṭhāse pana –
analyzed: tatiya koṭṭhāse pana
translated: In the third section:

original: “Asaññasattānaṃ devānaṃ upapattikkhaṇe eko khandho pātubhavati rūpakkhandho, dve
analyzed: asaññasattānam devānam upapatti khaṇe ekaḥ khandho pātubhavati rūpa kkhandho dve
translated: “At the moment of rebirth-linking in the non-percipient beings’ realm, one aggregate appears, that is, the materiality aggregate;

original: āyatanāni rūpāyatanaṃ dhammāyatanaṃ, dve dhātuyo rūpadhātu dhammadhātu, ekaṃ dukkhasaccaṃ,
analyzed: āyatanāni rūpāyatanam dhammāyatanam dve dhātuyaḥ rūpadhātu dhammadhātu ekam dukkhasaccam
translated: two bases, that is, the form base and the mental-data base; two elements, that is, the form element and the mental-data element; one truth, that is, suffering;

original: ekaṃ rūpajīvitindriyaṃ, asaññasattā devā ahetukā, anāhārā, aphassakā…pe… acittakā”ti –
analyzed: ekam rūpa jīvitindriyam asaññasattāḥ devāḥ ahetukāḥ anāhārāḥ aphassakā ape acittakā ati
translated: one faculty, that is, the material life faculty; the non-percipient beings are without root cause, without nutriment, without contact, … without consciousness” .

original: Saniddesamātikā nikkhittā. Ettha ca rūpampi kiñcāpi tesaṃ āyatanādikiccaṃ na karoti,
analyzed: nikkhittā ettha ca rūpam pi kiñca api tesam āyatana ādi kiccam na karoti
translated: This is given in the Description of the Dependent Origination. And here, although materiality does not perform the function of a base, etc.,

original: saviññāṇakarūpīsu pana gahitattā idhāpi gahitaṃ. Gandhādayo pana tattha na gahitattā
analyzed: sa viññāṇaka rūpīsu pana gahita ttā idha api gahitam gandha ādayaḥ pana tattha na gahita ttā
translated: it is included here because it is included in the consciousness with which it is associated. But odour, etc., are not included here because they are not included there.

original: idhāpi na gahitā, no avijjamānatāya. Ekatalavāsikānaṃ vā sesabrahmānaṃ cakkhuvisayattā
analyzed: idha api na gahitā no a vijjamāna tāya eka tala vāsikānam vā sesa brahmānam cakkhu visaya ttā
translated: They are not included there because they are not found there, not because they are not. Or alternatively, they are not included here because they are the domain of the eye, etc.,

original: idhāpi rūpāyatanaṃ uddhaṭaṃ, asaññīnaṃ pana pañcāyatanāni, eko āhāro uppajjatīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: idha api rūpa āyatanam uddhaṭam asaññīnam pana pañca āyatanāni ekaḥ āhāraḥ uppajjati iti veditabbam
translated: Here too the visible-form base is excluded, but it should be understood that the five bases and one nutriment arise in the case of the non-percipient.

original: Catutthakoṭṭhāse –
analyzed: catuttha koṭṭhāse
translated: In the fourth section

original: “Arūpadhātuyā upapattikkhaṇe cattāro khandhā, dve āyatanāni, dve dhātuyo, ekaṃ saccaṃ, aṭṭhindriyāni, tayo hetū, tayo āhārā, eko phasso…pe… ekaṃ citta”nti –🔽Mātikāpadāni nikkhipitvā vibhattā. Ettha ca manojīvitaupekkhindriyāni, saddhādīni
analyzed: arūpadhātuyāḥ upapatti kkhaṇe cattāro khandhāḥ dve āyatanāni dve dhātuyo ekam saccam aṭṭha indriyāni tayaḥ hetū tayaḥ āhārāḥ ekaḥ ekam cittam  mātikā padāni nikkhipitvā vibhattā ettha ca manaḥ jīvita aupekkhindriyāni saddhā ādīni
translated: “At the moment of rebirth-linking in the immaterial world there are four aggregates, two bases, two elements, one truth, eight faculties, three causes, three kinds of nutriment, one kind of contact … and one kind of consciousness” .

original: pañcāti aṭṭhindriyāni veditabbāni. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva. Evaṃ catūhi koṭṭhāsehi catuttho vāro veditabbo.🔽Pañcamo pana vāro tesaṃ dhammānaṃ bhūmantaravasena “kāmāvacaradhammā, na kāmāvacarā…pe…
analyzed: pañca ati aṭṭhindriyāni veditabbāni sesam su viññeyyam eva evam catūhi koṭṭhāsehi catutthaḥ vāraḥ veditabbo  pañcamaḥ pana vāro tesam dhammānam bhūma antara vasena kāmāvacara dhammā na kāmāvacara āpe
translated: After the terms of the mātikā have been stated, the exposition follows. And here the eight faculties should be understood as the mind faculty, the life faculty, and equanimity, and the five beginning with faith. The rest is quite clear. This is how the fourth section should be understood.🔽The fifth section

original: pariyāpannā”ti cattāro duke mātikāvasena nikkhipitvā vibhajanavasena pavatto, so heṭṭhā vuttatthova.
analyzed: pariyāpannā ti cattāro duke mātikā vasena nikkhipitvā vibhajana vasena pavatto so heṭṭhā vutta tthaḥ eva
translated: is set out in the mātikā by way of the plane of existence, with the four permutations beginning thus: “States subject to cankers, not subject to cankers … ” . The exposition is given by way of the analysis. But the meaning is the same as that already given above.

original: Chaṭṭho pana vāro sammutidevaupapattidevavisuddhideve niddisitvā manussadevagatīsu🔽uppādakakammaāyuppamāṇadassanavasena vutto. Tatthāyaṃ saṅkhepattho – sattā hi dānasīlādikāmāvacarakusalaṃ🔽katvā manussaloke khattiyamahāsālādikulesu ceva cātumahārājikatāvatiṃsayāmatusitanimmānaratiparanimmitavasavattisaṅkhātesu
analyzed: chaṭṭhaḥ pana vāraḥ sammuti deva aupapatti deva visuddhi deve niddisitvā manussa deva gatīsu  uppādaka kamma āyu ppamāṇa dassana vasena vuttaḥ tattha ayam saṅkhepa atthaḥ sattā hi dāna sīla ādi kāmāvacara kusalam  katvā manussa loke khattiya mahāsāla ādi kulesu ca iva cātumahārājika tā avatiṃsa yāma tusita nimmāna rati para nimmita vasavatti saṅkhātesu
translated: The sixth section, however, is stated by way of showing the kamma that causes rebirth and the measure of life span in the human and divine worlds, after pointing out the gods of the worldly deities, the gods of the gods of the form realm, and the gods of the gods of the formless realm. Herein, the meaning in brief is this: Beings, having performed the wholesome of the sense sphere such as generosity, virtue, etc.,

original: chasu devalokesu ca uppajjanti, tattha sinerupabbatavemajjhaparibhaṇḍapabbatato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: chasu deva lokesu ca uppajjanti tattha sineru pabbata vemajjha paribhaṇḍa pabbatataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: are reborn in the human world in such clans as the aristocratic, the wealthy, etc., and in the six divine worlds called the Four Great Kings, the Thirty-three, Yāma, Tusita, Nimmānarati, and Paranimmitavasavatti.

original: heṭṭhā yāva bhūmi tiriyaṃ cakkavāḷapabbataṃ āhacca etthantare pabbataākāsarukkhapathavinissitā🔽cātumahārājacandasūriyā sabbe cātumahārājikā. Tato uddhaṃ cakkavāḷapariyantaṃ tāvatiṃsādayo
analyzed: heṭṭhā yāva bhūmi tiriyam cakkavāḷa pabbatam āhacca etthantare pabbata ākāsa rukkha patha vinissitā  sabbe cātumahārājikā tatas uddham cakkavāḷa pariyantam tāvatiṃsa ādayo
translated: Herein, from the central mountain Sineru down to the surrounding mountains,🔽and from the ground up to the edge of the world system, all the Four Great Kings, the moon, and the sun, are situated in the world of the Four Great Kings. Above that, the Thirty-three, etc., should be understood as situated one above the other up to the edge of the world system.

original: yathākkamaṃ uparūpari ṭhitāti veditabbā. Devalokopi paramparacakkavāḷapabbataṃ appatto nāma natthi.
analyzed: yathākkamam uparu upari ṭhitā ati veditabbā deva lokaḥ api parampara cakkavāḷa pabbatam appattaḥ nāma natthi
translated: There is no divine world that does not reach the surrounding mountains.

original: Paṭhamajjhānaṃ pana parittaṃ bhāvetvā brahmapārisajjesu uppajjanti, majjhimaṃ bhāvetvā
analyzed: paṭhama jhānam pana parittam bhāvetvā brahmapārisajjesu uppajjanti majjhimam bhāvetvā
translated: But those who develop the first jhāna to a limited extent are reborn as a minor deity in the Brahmā-world,🔽those who develop it to a middling extent are reborn as a Brahmā’s Retinue deity,

original: brahmapurohitesu, paṇītaṃ bhāvetvā mahābrahmesu, ime tayopi janā paṭhamajjhānabhūmiyaṃ
analyzed: brahma purohitesu paṇītam bhāvetvā mahābrahmesu ime janā
translated: those who develop it to a superior extent are reborn as a Great Brahmā. All these three kinds are on the plane of the first jhāna.

original: ekatale vasanti. Āyuābhādibhedena panesaṃ bhedo, evaṃ uparipi.
analyzed: eka tale vasanti bhedaḥ
translated: But there is a difference between them in respect of life span, and so on. So too with the other jhānas.

original: Catukkanaye pana dutiyajjhānaṃ, pañcakanaye dutiyatatiyajjhānañca parittaṃ, majjhimaṃ,
analyzed: catukka naye pana dutiya jhānam pañcaka naye dutiya tatiya jhānam ca parittam majjhimam
translated: But in the fourfold reckoning those who develop the second jhāna to a limited extent, to a middling extent,

original: paṇītañca bhāvetvā parittābhāappamāṇābhāābhassaresu uppajjanti. Tatiyajjhānaṃ parittādivasena
analyzed: paṇītam ca bhāvetvā paritta ābhā appamāṇa ābhā ābhassaresu uppajjanti tatiya jhānam paritta ādi vasena
translated: to a superior extent are reborn as a minor deity, as a deity of Limited Radiance, as a deity of Immeasurable Radiance, respectively. Those who develop the third jhāna to a limited extent, to a middling extent,

original: bhāvetvā parittasubhaappamāṇasubhasubhakiṇhesu. Catutthajjhānaṃ pana bhāvetvā ārammaṇamanasikārachandādhimuttiādinānattato
analyzed: bhāvetvā paritta subha appamāṇa subha subha kiṇhesu catuttha jhānam pana bhāvetvā ārammaṇa manasikāra chanda adhimutti ādi nānattato
translated: to a superior extent are reborn as a minor deity, as a deity of Limited Beauty, as a deity of Immeasurable Beauty, respectively. Those who develop the fourth jhāna to a limited extent, to a middling extent,

original: keci asaññīsu, keci vehapphalesu, keci avihesu, atappesu, sudassesu, sudassīsu, keci
analyzed: keci asaññīsu keci vehapphalesu keci avihesu atappesu sudassesu sudassīsu keci
translated: to a superior extent, to a very superior extent, to a supreme extent, are reborn as a minor deity, as a deity of Streaming Radiance, as a deity of Refulgent Glory, as a deity of Great Fruit, as a Non-Percipient, as a deity of the Base of Neither-Perception-nor-Non-Perception, respectively.

original: akaniṭṭhesu, ākāsānañcāyatanādīsu catūsu ca yathākkamaṃ uppajjanti. Tattha hi ekacce🔽titthiyā “cittaṃ nissāya rajjanadussanādayo, tannidānāni ca dukkhāni samuppajjantī”ti
analyzed: akaniṭṭhesu ākāsānañcāyatana ādīsu catūsu ca yathākkamam uppajjanti tattha hi ekacce  titthiyāḥ cittam nissāya rajjana dussana ādayaḥ tad nidānāni ca dukkhāni samuppajjanti iti
translated: and in the four immaterial states beginning with the base consisting of boundless space. For some sectarians there,🔽seeing the danger in the mind because of lust, hate, etc., and because of the suffering that originates from that as a basis,

original: citte dosaṃ disvā “diṭṭhadhammanibbānameta”nti saññāvirāgaṃ janetvā tatrūpapattiyā
analyzed: citte dosam disvā diṭṭhadhamma nibbānam etat ti saññā virāgam janetvā tatra upapattiyā
translated: they generate the perception of the fading away of lust in order to attain nibbāna here and now.

original: jhānaṃ bhāvetvā rūpakāyamattā ṭhitā vā nisinnā vā nipannā vā hutvā nibbattitvā tattheva
analyzed: jhānam bhāvetvā rūpa kāya mattā ṭhitā vā nisinnā vā nipannā vā hutvā nibbattitvā tattha eva
translated: Having developed jhāna for the purpose of rebirth there, they are reborn there, standing or sitting or lying down in the mere material body.

original: pañcakappasatāni tiṭṭhantīti veditabbā.
analyzed: pañca kappa satāni tiṭṭhanti iti veditabbā
translated: They should be understood as remaining there for five hundred eons.

original: Aṭṭhasamāpattilābhīnaṃ kataraṃ jhānaṃ vipaccatīti? Paguṇaṃ, sabbesu paguṇesu yassa
analyzed: aṭṭha samāpatti lābhīnam kataram jhānam vipaccati iti paguṇam sabbesu paguṇesu yassa
translated: Which jhāna ripens for those who have attained the eight attainments? The ordinary jhāna. If all are familiar, then whichever

original: vipākabhūmiṃ pattheti, taṃpatthanāya ca asati yaṃ maraṇasamaye samāpajjati, taṃ,
analyzed: vipāka bhūmim pattheti tad patthanāya ca asati yam maraṇa samaye samāpajjati tam
translated: he wishes to be the plane of his rebirth. If he has no wish, then whichever he enters at the time of death.

original: tasmimpi asati uttamavasena nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ vipaccati. Suddhāvāsesu ca avihādīsu
analyzed: tasmim pi asati uttama vasena nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam vipaccati suddhāvāsesu ca a vihādīsu
translated: If he has not entered any, then the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception ripens as the highest. And in the Pure Abodes beginning with Aviha,

original: anāgāmivajjitā sattā na uppajjanti, anāgāmino pana asaññīvajjitabrahmalokesu sabbattha
analyzed: anāgāmi vajjitāḥ sattāḥ na uppajjanti anāgāminaḥ pana asaññī vajjita brahma lokesu sabbattha
translated: Beings who are non-returners do not reappear there, but non-returners who are bound for the immaterial world reappear everywhere there.

original: uppajjituṃ labhanti. Sabbesampi ca ariyānaṃ tatrūpapattito uparūpapattipi, na heṭṭhūpapatti.
analyzed: uppajjitum labhanti sabbesam pi ca ariyānam tatrūpapattitaḥ uparu upapatti pi na heṭṭhu upapatti
translated: And for all Noble Ones, too, there is no reappearance below, only reappearance above, after reappearance there.

original: Te hi paṭhamajjhānabhūmiyaṃ nibbattā anāgāmino nava brahmaloke sodhetvā matthake
analyzed: te hi paṭhama jhāna bhūmiyam nibbattāḥ anāgāminaḥ nava brahmaloke sodhetvā matthake
translated: For non-returners who have been reborn in the plane of the first jhāna purify the nine levels of that plane and then,

original: vehapphalesu ṭhitā parinibbanti, na nivattanti ariyānaṃ heṭṭhūpapattiabhāvā. Vehapphalaakaniṭṭhanevasaññānāsaññāyatanabhavā
analyzed: vehapphalesu ṭhitā parinibbanti na nivattanti ariyānam heṭṭhu upapatti abhāvā vehapphala akaniṭṭha nevasaññā nāsañña āyatana bhavā
translated: standing in the fruition of non-returning, they attain Nibbāna without ever returning from that plane. They do not return, because there is no reappearance below for Noble Ones.

original: tayopi seṭṭhabhavā nāma. Imesu tīsu ṭhānesu nibbattā anāgāmino neva uddhaṃ gacchanti,
analyzed: tayaḥ api seṭṭhabhavāḥ nāma imesu tīsu ṭhānesu nibbattāḥ anāgāminaḥ na iva uddham gacchanti
translated: The three planes of existence beginning with the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception are called the “best planes of existence.” Non-returners reborn in these three places go neither upwards nor downwards;

original: na adho. Tattheva parinibbāyanti. Manussaloke ca sekhā gihibhāve yāvajīvaṃ tiṭṭhanti,
analyzed: na adhas tattha iva parinibbāyanti manussa loke ca sekhāḥ gihi bhāve yāvajīvam tiṭṭhanti
translated: they attain Nibbāna there itself. And in the human world the trainees remain as householders as long as they live,

original: na asekhā. Te hi arahattaṃ pattadivase pabbajanti vā, parinibbanti vā. Bhummadevesu
analyzed: na asekhā te hi arahattam patta divase pabbajanti vā parinibbanti vā bhummadevesu
translated: but not the adepts. For the adepts go forth on the very day they attain Arahantship or they attain Nibbāna.

original: pana khīṇāsavāpi yāvajīvaṃ tiṭṭhanti. Chasu kāmāvacaradevesu sotāpannasakadāgāminova
analyzed: pana khīṇa āsavā api yāvajīvam tiṭṭhanti chasu kāmāvacara devesu sotāpanna sakadāgāminā uva
translated: In the six sense-sphere divine worlds there are stream-enterers and once-returners,

original: tiṭṭhanti, anāgāmino pana tadaheva rūpabhavaṃ gantuṃ vaṭṭati khīṇāsavena parinibbātunti
analyzed: tiṭṭhanti anāgāminaḥ pana tadahā iva rūpa bhavam gantum vaṭṭati khīṇāsavena parinibbātum
translated: but non-returners are obliged to go to the fine-material-sphere existence on that very day, and those whose cankers are destroyed to attain Nibbāna.

original: gahetabbaṃ. Evaṃ imāsu sattavīsatiyā bhūmīsu pariyāpannamanussadevabrahmalokesu nibbattasattesu
analyzed: gahetabbam evam imāsu sattavīsatiyā bhūmīsu pariyāpanna manussa deva brahma lokesu nibbatta sattesu
translated: So it should be understood that among the beings reborn in the human, divine and Brahmā worlds included in these twenty-seven stations,🔽the human life span is a hundred years or less in this present Buddha era.

original: manussānaṃ tāva imasmiṃ buddhuppādeva vassasataṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ, appaṃ vā bhiyyo. Āpāyikānaṃ,🔽bhummadevānañca kadāci āyuparicchedo natthi, kammameva pamāṇaṃ. Te hi sattāhenapi
analyzed: manussānam tāva imasmin buddhuppāde iva vassa satam āyu ppamāṇam appam vā bhiyyas āpāyikānam  kadāci āyu paricchedaḥ natthi kammam eva pamāṇam te hi satta ahena pi
translated: As to the beings in the states of loss,🔽they die after seven days,

original: maranti, kappampi tiṭṭhantīti.🔽Cātumahārājikānaṃ pana mānusakāni paññāsa vassāni ekaṃ rattindivaṃ, tāya rattiyā
analyzed: maranti kappam pi tiṭṭhanti iti  cātumahārājikānam pana mānusakāni paññāsa vassāni ekam rattindivam tāya rattiyā
translated: and they live for a whole aeon.

original: tiṃsa rattiyo māso, tena māsena dvādasamāsiyo saṃvaccharo, tena saṃvaccharena dibbāni
analyzed: tiṃsa rattiyaḥ māso tena māsena dvādasa māsiyaḥ saṃvaccharo tena saṃvaccharena dibbāni
translated: As regards the gods of the Four Kings’ retinue, fifty human years is one day and night for them. Thirty of their days make a month. Twelve of their months make a year. A thousand of their years is a day and night for the gods of the Tāvatimsa heaven.

original: pañcavassasatāni āyuppamāṇaṃ. Tāni manussagaṇanāya navutivassasatasahassāni honti.
analyzed: pañca vassa satāni āyu ppamāṇam tāni manussa gaṇanāya navuti vassa sata sahassāni honti
translated: The life-span of the gods of the Four Kings is five hundred years of the gods, which is equivalent to ten thousand years of men.

original: Tāvatiṃsānaṃ mānusakaṃ vassasataṃ ekaṃ rattindivaṃ katvā evamāgataṃ dibbaṃ vassasahassaṃ.🔽Evaṃ yāmādīnaṃ vassagaṇanañca diguṇaṃ katvā heṭṭhimato diguṇacatugguṇaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: tāvatiṃsānam mānusakam vassa satam ekam rattindivam katvā evam āgatam dibbam vassa sahassam  evam yāma ādīnam vassa gaṇanam ca diguṇam katvā heṭṭhimataḥ diguṇa catugguṇam āyu ppamāṇam veditabbam
translated: One day and night of the Thirty-Three gods is equivalent to a hundred years of men. Their life-span is a thousand years of the gods, which is equivalent to two hundred thousand years of men.🔽The life-span of the Yāma gods is two thousand years of the gods, which is equivalent to four hundred thousand years of men.🔽The life-span of the gods of the Retinue of the Great King Brahmā is a third of an aeon.

original: Brahmesu pana brahmapārisajjānaṃ kappassa tatiyo bhāgo āyuppamāṇaṃ, brahmapurohitānaṃ
analyzed: brahmesu pana brahmapārisajjānam kappassa tatiyaḥ bhāgaḥ āyu ppamāṇam brahmapurohitānam
translated: The life-span of the gods of the Brahmā’s Ministers is half an aeon.🔽The life-span of the gods of the Great Brahmā is one aeon.

original: upaḍḍhakappo, mahābrahmānaṃ eko kappo, parittābhānaṃ dve kappāti evaṃ uparūpari diguṇaṃ
analyzed: upaḍḍha kappaḥ mahābrahmānam ekaḥ kappo parittābhānam dve evam upari upari diguṇam
translated: The life-span of the gods of Limited Radiance is two aeons.🔽The life-span of the gods of Immeasurable Radiance is four aeons.🔽The life-span of the gods of Streaming Radiance is eight aeons.

original: katvā yāva subhakiṇhā yojetabbaṃ. Subhakiṇhānaṃ hi catusaṭṭhikappaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ,🔽asaññīnaṃ, vehapphalānañca pañcakappasatāni, avihānaṃ kappasahassanti uparūpari diguṇavasena
analyzed: katvā yāva subha kiṇhāḥ yojetabbam subha kiṇhānam hi catusaṭṭhi kappam āyu ppamāṇam  asaññīnam vehapphalānam ca pañca kappa satāni a vihānam upari upari diguṇa vasena
translated: The life-span of the gods of Glory is sixteen aeons.🔽The life-span of the gods of Limited Beauty is thirty-two aeons.🔽The life-span of the gods of Immeasurable Beauty is sixty-four aeons.

original: yāva akaniṭṭhā yojetabbaṃ. Akaniṭṭhānaṃ hi soḷasakappasahassāni, arūpānaṃ catunnaṃ
analyzed: yāva akaniṭṭhāḥ yojetabbam akaniṭṭhānam hi soḷasa kappa sahassāni arūpānam catunnam
translated: The life-span of the gods of Streaming Beauty is one hundred and twenty-eight aeons.🔽The life-span of the gods of the Great Fruit is five hundred aeons.🔽The life-span of the Aviha gods is one thousand aeons.🔽The life-span of the gods of the Highest Peak is two thousand aeons.🔽The life-span of the Aviha gods is one thousand aeons.🔽The life-span of the gods of the Highest Peak is two thousand aeons.

original: yathākkamaṃ vīsati, cattāri, saṭṭhi, caturāsīti kappasahassāni āyuppamāṇanti.
analyzed: yathākkamam vīsati cattāri saṭṭhi caturāsīti kappa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇanti
translated: twenty, four, sixty, and eighty-four thousand eons, respectively.

original: Ukkhittā puññatejena, kāmarūpagatiṃ gatā;
analyzed: ukkhittā puñña tejena kāmarūpa gatim gatā
translated: “Having risen by the radiance of merit, they have gone to the heavenly and human worlds,

original: Bhavaggatampi sampattā, punāgacchanti duggatiṃ.
analyzed: sampattā punar āgacchanti duggatim
translated: And having reached the end of existence, they come back again to the evil destinations.

original: Tāva dīghāyukā sattā, cavanti āyusaṅkhayā;
analyzed: tāva dīgha āyukā sattā cavanti āyu saṅkhayā
translated: Those beings who have such a long life span pass away at the end of their life span;

original: Natthi koci bhavo nicco, iti vuttaṃ mahesinā.
analyzed: natthi koci bhavaḥ nicco iti vuttam mahesinā
translated: There is no permanent existence, so it was said by the Great Sage.

original: Tasmā hi dhīrā nipakā, nipuṇā atthacintakā;
analyzed: tasmā hi dhīrā nipakā nipuṇā attha cintakā
translated: Therefore, the wise, the prudent, the skillful, the thinkers of the meaning,

original: Jarāmaraṇamokkhāya, bhāventi maggamuttamaṃ.
analyzed: jarā maraṇa mokkhāya bhāventi maggam uttamaṃ
translated: Meditate on the supreme path for the sake of liberation from old age and death.

original: Bhāvayitvā suciṃ maggaṃ, nibbānogadhagāminaṃ;
analyzed: bhāvayitvā sucim maggam nibbāna ogadha gāminam
translated: Having developed the pure path that ends in nibbāna,

original: Sabbāsave pariññāya, parinibbanti anāsavāti. ;
analyzed: sabba āsave pariññāya parinibbanti anāsavā
translated: They attain final nibbāna, free from taints, having fully understood all the taints.”

original: Ayaṃ chaṭṭhavāre nayo.
analyzed: ayam chaṭṭha vāre nayo
translated: This is the method in the sixth section.

original: Sattamo pana vāro tesaṃ khandhādīnaṃ abhiññeyyādibhāvavibhāvanavasena pavatto. Tattha hi –🔽“Rūpakkhandho abhiññeyyo, pariññeyyo, na pahātabbo, na bhāvetabbo, na sacchikātabbo.
analyzed: sattamaḥ pana vāro tesam khandha ādīnam abhiññeyya ādi bhāva vibhāvana vasena pavatto tattha hi 🔽rūpakkhandho abhiññeyyaḥ pariññeyyaḥ na pahātabbaḥ na bhāvetabbaḥ na sacchikātabbaḥ
translated: But the seventh section occurs with the analysis of the dhammas beginning with the aggregates as to be directly known, etc. Herein:

original: Cattāro khandhā abhiññeyyā pariññeyyā, siyā pahātabbā, siyā bhāvetabbā, siyā sacchikātabbā,
analyzed: cattāro khandhāḥ abhiññeyyā pariññeyyā siyā pahātabbā siyā bhāvetabbā siyā sacchikātabbā
translated: The four aggregates are to be directly known and fully understood. They may be abandoned, they may be developed, they may be realized.

original: siyā na pahātabbā na bhāvetabbā na sacchikātabbā”tiādinā –
analyzed: siyā na pahātabbā na bhāvetabbā na sacchikātabbā ati ādinā
translated: They may not be abandoned, they may not be developed, they may not be realized.

original: Dvādasapi koṭṭhāsā vitthārato vibhattā. Tattha lakkhaṇapariggāhikāya paññāya khandhādayo🔽sabbe dhammā abhiññeyyā. Ñātatīraṇapahānapariññāsu yathāyogaṃ yāya kāyaci pariññāya
analyzed: dvādasa api koṭṭhāsāḥ vitthārataḥ vibhattā tattha lakkhaṇa pariggāhikāya paññāya khandha ādayo  sabbe dhammā abhiññeyyāḥ ñāta tīraṇa pahāna pariññāsu yathāyogam yāya kāyaci pariññāya
translated: In this way the twelve sections are analyzed in detail. Herein, all states are to be directly known by the understanding that discerns their characteristics.🔽All states are to be fully understood by one or other of the three kinds of full understanding, according to the kind of state.

original: vasena sabbepi dhammā pariññeyyā. Lokuttaradhammāpi ñātapariññeyyāva. Akusalā pana
analyzed: vasena sabbe pi dhammā pariññeyyā lokuttara dhammā api ñāta pariññeyyā va akusalā pana
translated: And supramundane states are to be fully understood by the full understanding of what is to be known. But the unprofitable is to be abandoned.

original: pahātabbā. Maggo bhāvetabbo, phalaṃ, nibbānañca sacchikātabbaṃ. Tattha rūpakkhandho🔽ñātatīraṇavasena pariññeyyo. Vipassanāvisaye hi sabbaṃ tīraṇapariññāya pariññeyyanti.
analyzed: pahātabbāḥ maggaḥ bhāvetabbaḥ phalam nibbānam ca sacchikātabbam tattha rūpa kkhandho  ñāta tīraṇa vasena pariññeyyaḥ vipassanā visaye hi sabbam tīraṇa pariññāya pariññeyyanti
translated: The path is to be developed. The fruition and Nibbāna are to be realized.🔽Herein, the materiality aggregate is to be fully understood by means of full understanding as the known and as investigation. analyzed: iminā eka mūla naya anusārena sabbattha su viññeyyaḥ ti na vitthārayimhā ayam khandha pada niddesa nayo  āyatana dhātu padānam pi khandha pade vutta anusārena iva tīhi saṅgaho tīhi asaṅgaho ca
translated: So we have not elaborated further, as it can be understood in all instances by the method of the single root. This is the method of the exposition of the aggregates.

original: yathāyogaṃ yojetvā ñātabbo. Kevalaṃ panettha dhammāyatanadhammadhātūsu asaṅkhatassa
analyzed: yathāyogam yojetvā ñātabbo kevalam pana ittha dhamma āyatana dhammadhātūsu asaṅkhatassa
translated: The method of exposition of the bases and elements should be understood by applying the threefold inclusion and threefold non-inclusion stated under the aggregates, according to the appropriate cases. But here, in the case of the mental-data base and the mental-data element, the unformed element should be excepted,

original: khandhasaṅgahābhāvā taṃ ṭhapetvā sesānaṃ khandhesu saṅgaho veditabbo.
analyzed: khandha saṅgaha abhāvā tam ṭhapetvā sesānam khandhesu saṅgahaḥ veditabbo
translated: since it is not included in the aggregates. The rest are included in the aggregates.

original: Saccesu dukkhasaccaṃ sabbehi khandhāyatanadhātūhi. Samudayamaggasaccāni saṅkhārakkhandhena,
analyzed: saccesu dukkha saccam sabbehi khandha āyatana dhātūhi samudaya magga saccāni saṅkhāra kkhandhena
translated: In the case of the truths, the truth of suffering is included in all the aggregates, bases, and elements. The truth of origin and the truth of the path are included in the formation aggregate,

original: dhammāyatanadhammadhātūhi ca saṅgahitāni. Nirodhasaccaṃ khandhena asaṅgahitaṃ, dhammāyatanadhammadhātūhi eva saṅgahitaṃ.
analyzed: dhamma āyatana dhammadhātūhi ca saṅgahitāni nirodha saccam khandhena asaṅgahitam dhamma āyatana dhammadhātūhi eva saṅgahitam
translated: and in the mental-data base and element. The truth of cessation is not included in any aggregate, but it is included in the mental-data base and element.

original: Indriyesu jīvitindriyaṃ dvīhi rūpakkhandhasaṅkhārakkhandhehi. Sukhindriyādīni pañca
analyzed: indriyesu jīvitindriyam dvīhi rūpa kkhandha saṅkhāra kkhandhehi sukha indriya ādīni pañca
translated: In the case of the faculties, the life faculty is included in two aggregates, namely, the form aggregate and the formations aggregate. The five beginning with the pleasure faculty

original: vedanākkhandhena, saddhādīni saṅkhārakkhandhena, sabbāni cetāni jīvitindriyādīni,
analyzed: vedanā kkhandhena saddhā ādīni saṅkhāra kkhandhena sabbāni cetāni jīvitindriya ādīni
translated: The feeling aggregate, the faith aggregate, etc., the life faculty, etc.,

original: itthindriyapurisindriyādīnipi dhammāyatanadhammadhātūhi saṅgahitāni. Sesindriyāni suviññeyyāni.
analyzed: itthi indriya purisa indriya ādīni pi dhamma āyatana dhammadhātūhi saṅgahitāni sesindriyāni su viññeyyāni
translated: and the femininity faculty, etc., are included in the mental-data base and the mental-data element. The remaining faculties are easy to understand.

original: Paṭiccasamuppādesu nāmarūpaṃ viññāṇavajjitehi catūhi khandhehi, ekādasahi āyatanadhātūhi🔽ca saṅgahitaṃ. Ettha hi pavattiyaṃ nāmarūpassāpi gahitattā saddāyatanampi gahitanti
analyzed: paṭiccasamuppādesu nāma rūpam viññāṇa vajjitehi catūhi khandhehi ekādasahi āyatana dhātūhi  ca saṅgahitam ettha hi pavattiyam nāma rūpassa api gahita ttā sadda āyatanam pi gahitan ti
translated: In the case of the dependent origination, the mentality-materiality, excluding consciousness, is included in the four aggregates, in eleven bases and elements,

original: veditabbaṃ. Saḷāyatanaṃ dvīhi khandhehi, pasādaviññāṇabhūtehi chahi āyatanehi, dvādasahi🔽dhātūhi saṅgahitaṃ. Upapattibhavo pana kāmabhavabhūto pañcahi khandhehi, saddāyatanavajjitehi
analyzed: veditabbam saḷāyatanam dvīhi khandhehi pasāda viññāṇa bhūtehi chahi āyatanehi dvādasahi  dhātūhi saṅgahitam upapatti bhavaḥ pana kāma bhava bhūtaḥ pañcahi khandhehi sadda āyatana vajjitehi
translated: for the sound base is also included here since mentality-materiality includes the process of becoming. The sixfold base is included in two aggregates, in the six bases consisting of the sensitive materiality of the eye, etc., and in twelve elements.

original: ekādasahi āyatanehi, sattarasahi dhātūhi. Rūpabhavo pañcahi khandhehi, saddādicatukkaghānādittayatabbiññāṇavajjehi
analyzed: ekādasahi āyatanehi sattarasahi dhātūhi rūpa bhavaḥ pañcahi khandhehi
translated: The rebirth-process becoming is included in the five aggregates, in eleven bases and in seventeen elements, excluding the sound base. The fine-material becoming is included in the five aggregates, in eleven bases and in seventeen elements, excluding the four beginning with sound and the three beginning with the eye-sensitivity element.

original: pañcahāyatanehi, aṭṭhahi dhātūhi saṅgahito. Asaññībhavo ekena rūpakkhandhena, rūpadhammavasena🔽dvīhi āyatanadhātūhi saṅgahito. Ghānādittayaṃ panettha āyatanādikiccākaraṇato āyatanadhātūhi
analyzed: pañcahi āyatanehi aṭṭhahi dhātūhi saṅgahitaḥ asaññībhavaḥ ekena rūpa kkhandhena rūpa dhamma vasena  dvīhi āyatana dhātūhi saṅgahitaḥ āyatana ādi kicca akaraṇataḥ āyatana dhātūhi
translated: and by five bases and by eight elements. The non-percipient kind is included by one, namely, the form-group, and by two, namely, the form base and the form element,

original: asaṅgahitampi rūpakkhandhena saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Bhavassa ca ekantamupādinnattā🔽pavattivipākānaṃ cakkhuviññāṇādīnaṃ gahaṇepi anupādinnasaddāyatanassa idha aggahaṇaṃ🔽daṭṭhabbaṃ. Arūpabhavo catūhi khandhehi dvīhi āyatanadhātūhi. Jātijarāmaraṇāni nāmarūpadhammānaṃ
analyzed: asaṅgahitam pi rūpakkhandhena saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbam bhavassa ca ekantam upādinna ttā  pavatti vipākānam cakkhu viññāṇa ādīnam gahaṇe pi anupādinna sadda āyatanassa idha a gahaṇam  daṭṭhabbam arūpa bhavaḥ catūhi khandhehi dvīhi āyatana dhātūhi jāti jarā maraṇāni nāma rūpa dhammānam
translated: because it is a form state. The three beginning with the nose are included by the form-group, though they are not included by the bases and elements, because they do not perform the function of a base or of an element. But the existence-group is wholly clung to,

original: lakkhaṇattā dvīhi rūpakkhandhasaṅkhārakkhandhehi. Sokadukkhadomanassāni vedanākkhandhena.
analyzed: lakkhaṇa ttā dvīhi rūpa kkhandha saṅkhāra kkhandhehi soka dukkha domanassāni vedanā kkhandhena
translated: and so it is included by the form-group, though the five beginning with eye- consciousness are included by the consciousness-group, and though the in-breath and out-breath are included by the body-group. The unclung-to sound base should be understood as not included here, though the in-breath and out-breath are included, because it is not included by the form-group. The formless-world kind is included by four, namely, the feeling-group, perception-group, formations-group, and consciousness-group, and by two, namely, the mind base and the mind element, and by two, namely, the states of being formed and being clung to. Birth, ageing, and death are included by two, namely, the form-group and the formations-group, because they are the characteristics of states that are both form and name. Sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair are included by the feeling-group.

original: Upāyāso saṅkhārakkhandhena, dhammāyatanadhammadhātūhi ca saṅgahito. Paridevo rūpakkhandhasaddāyatanasaddadhātūhi.
analyzed: upāyāsaḥ saṅkhāra kkhandhena dhamma āyatana dhamma dhātūhi ca saṅgahitaḥ paridevaḥ rūpa kkhandha sadda āyatana sadda dhātūhi
translated: Weariness is included by the formations-group and by the states of being formed and being clung to, and by the mental-data base and the mental-data element. Wailing is included by the form-group, the sound base, and the sound element.

original: Sesāni panettha paṭiccasamuppādaṅgāni, satipaṭṭhānasammappadhānā ca suviññeyyāva.
analyzed: sesāni pana ittha paṭiccasamuppāda aṅgāni sati paṭṭhāna sammappadhānā ca su viññeyyā ava
translated: The rest of the factors of dependent origination and the foundations of mindfulness and right efforts are easy to understand.

original: Iddhipādā dvīhi khandhehi, āyatanehi, dhātūhi saṅgahitā. Ettha ca cittiddhipādassa
analyzed: iddhipādāḥ dvīhi khandhehi āyatanehi dhātūhi saṅgahitāḥ ettha ca citta iddhipādassa
translated: The bases of success are included in two aggregates, in two bases, and in two elements. Herein, the mental base of success

analyzed: dhammadhātu manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu niyamato soḷasahi dhātūhi asaṅgahaḥ veditabbaḥ jhānāni

translated: are included in two aggregates, in one base, and in one element, namely, in the feeling aggregate, in the mental-data base, and in the mental-data element. The divine abidings

original: ekena khandhena, ekena āyatanena, ekāya dhātuyā saṅgahitā. Evaṃ pañcindriyādīnipi.
analyzed: ekena khandhena ekena āyatanena ekāya saṅgahitā evam
translated: are included in one aggregate, in one base, and in one element, namely, in the mental-data aggregate, in the mental-data base, and in the mental-data element. The same applies to the immaterial states,

original: Kevalaṃ pana cittaṃ sattahi viññāṇadhātūhi saṅgahitanti ettakameva viseso. Sabbesampi🔽cesa vuttāvasesehi khandhāyatanadhātūhi asaṅgahitabhāvo veditabbo.
analyzed: kevalam pana cittam sattahi viññāṇa dhātūhi saṅgahitanti ettakam eva visesaḥ sabbesam pi  vutta avasesehi khandha āyatana dhātūhi asaṅgahita bhāvaḥ veditabbo
translated: the kinds of direct knowledge, and the paths. But only consciousness is included in seven elements, namely, the mind element and the six classes of consciousness. This is the only difference.🔽The rest, however, that is to say, the remaining aggregates, bases, and elements, should be understood as not included in the profitable, etc.

original: Iminā nayena bāhiramātikāyapi “kusalā dhammā, akusalā dhammā catūhi khandhehi, dvīhi
analyzed: iminā nayena kusalāḥ dhammāḥ akusalāḥ dhammā catūhi khandhehi dvīhi

original: āyatanehi, dhātūhi saṅgahitā. Abyākatā pana asaṅkhataṃ khandhato ṭhapetvā pañcahi
analyzed: āyatanehi dhātūhi saṅgahitā a byākatā pana asaṅkhatam khandhato ṭhapetvā pañcahi
translated: and by the bases and elements. But the unformed element, which is indeterminate, is included by the five aggregates,

original: khandhehi dvādasahi āyatanehi aṭṭhārasahi dhātūhi saṅgahitā”tiādinā yojetvā saṅgahāsaṅgaho
analyzed: khandhehi dvādasahi āyatanehi aṭṭhārasahi dhātūhi saṅgahitā ati ādinā yojetvā saṅgaha asaṅgahaḥ

analyzed: niṭṭhitaḥ saṅgahaḥ asaṅgaho ti padassa

translated: is ended.🔽The exposition of the words

analyzed: saṅgahitena asaṅgahita pada attha vaṇṇanā

original: “katihi khandhehī”tiādinā khandhādīhi asaṅgahassa vuccamānattā ca arūpakkhandhehi
analyzed: katihi khandhehi itiādinā khandha ādīhi asaṅgahassa vuccamāna ttā ca arūpa kkhandhehi
translated: and not included in the element method. And since it is said that it is not included in the aggregates, etc.,🔽by the aggregate, etc., methods, it should be understood that it is outside the immaterial aggregates.

original: saha bahibhūtatā veditabbā. Yathā cettha cakkhāyatanena upalakkhitānaṃ rūpadhammānaṃyeva
analyzed: saha bahibhūta tā veditabbā yathā ca ittha cakkha āyatanena upalakkhitānam rūpa dhammānam yeva
translated: But the visible-form phenomena that are indicated by the eye-base are included in the aggregate, base, and element methods.

original: saṅgahitena asaṅgahitatā, na cakkhāyatanassa, evaṃ upari rūpāyatanādīhi upalakkhitavārepi yathārahaṃ ñātabbā.
analyzed: saṅgahitena asaṅgahita tā na cakkhāyatanassa evam upari rūpāyatana ādīhi upalakkhita vāre pi yathāraham ñātabbā
translated: and the unincluded by the included. So too in the case of the visible-data base, etc., in the remaining sections of the exposition.

original: Sesesu pana cakkhuviññāṇadhātuyā ye dhammā khandhasaṅgahena saṅgahitā, āyatanasaṅgahena
analyzed: sesesu pana cakkhu viññāṇa dhātuyā ye dhammā khandha saṅgahena saṅgahitāḥ āyatana saṅgahena
translated: But in the case of the eye-consciousness element, the states that are included by the aggregates are

original: saṅgahitā, dhātusaṅgahena asaṅgahitā, te dhammā catūhi khandhehi ekādasahi āyatanehi
analyzed: saṅgahitāḥ dhātu saṅgahena asaṅgahitā te dhammā catūhi khandhehi ekādasahi āyatanehi
translated: included by three aggregates, by eleven bases,🔽and by eighteen elements.

original: dvādasahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitā. Evaṃ sesaviññāṇadhātūsupi. Paṭiccasamuppādaṅgesu asaññībhavena
analyzed: dvādasahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitāḥ evam sesa viññāṇa dhātūsu pi paṭiccasamuppāda aṅgesu asaññībhavena

original: ye dhammā…pe… te dhammā catūhi khandhehi dasahāyatanehi soḷasahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitā.
analyzed: ye te dhammā catūhi khandhehi dasahi āyatanehi soḷasahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitā
translated: In the case of the factors of dependent origination, the states that are included by the aggregates are included by four aggregates, by ten bases,🔽and by sixteen elements.

original: Upādādhammehi ye dhammā…pe… te dhammā catūhi khandhehi ekādasahāyatanehi sattarasahi
analyzed: upādā dhammehi ye te dhammā catūhi khandhehi ekādasahi āyatanehi sattarasahi
translated: In the case of the states that are subject to cankers, the states that are included by the aggregates are included by four aggregates, by eleven bases,🔽and by seventeen elements.🔽These four sections are the same as the previous ones, with no difference.

original: dhātūhi asaṅgahitāti ime cattāro vārā apubbavisesā samāyeva. Tattha cakkhuviññāṇavāre
analyzed: dhātūhi asaṅgahitā ti ime cattāro vārāḥ apubba visesā samāyā iva tattha cakkhu viññāṇa vāre
translated: Herein, in the case of the eye-consciousness element,

original: dvādasahīti cha viññāṇadhātuyo vajjetvā avasesāhi dhātūhi sesā cha viññāṇadhātuyova
analyzed: dvādasahi iti cha viññāṇa dhātuyaḥ vajjetvā avasesāhi dhātūhi sesā cha viññāṇa dhātuyaḥ va
translated: Twelve means that the remaining six consciousness elements are included by the remaining twelve elements, excluding the six consciousness elements.🔽They are included by the aggregates and bases, but not by the elements.

original: khandhāyatanasaṅgahehi saṅgahitā, dhātusaṅgaheneva asaṅgahitā. Avasesāhi dvādasahi
analyzed: khandha āyatana saṅgahehi saṅgahitāḥ dhātu saṅgahena iva a saṅgahitāḥ avasesāhi dvādasahi
translated: Not included by the remaining twelve elements means that they are not included by the twelve elements excluding the six consciousness elements.

original: dhātūhi asaṅgahitāti. Esa nayo sesaviññāṇadhātūsupi.
analyzed: dhātūhi a saṅgahitā ati e sa nayo sesa viññāṇa dhātūsu pi
translated: The same method applies to the remaining consciousness elements.🔽In the second triad, by the two bases means by the visible-form base and the mental-data base.

original: Dutiye tīhāyatanehīti rūpāyatanadhammāyatanamanāyatanehi. Asaññibrahmaloke hi rūpāyatanadhammāyatanavasena
analyzed: dutiye tīhi āyatanehi iti rūpāyatana dhammāyatana manāyatanehi asaññi brahma loke hi rūpāyatana dhammāyatana vasena
translated: For in the immaterial world-sphere, the two bases, namely, the visible-form base and the mental-data base,

original: dve āyatanāni upapattibhavabhāvena pāḷiyaṃ āgatāni, te pana khandhehi saṅgahitāni,🔽āyatanadhātūsu asaṅgahitāni. Tadavasesāni nava rūpāyatanāni, tāni teheva ca dvīhi🔽manāyatanadhammāyatanehi ca asaṅgahitāni nāma honti. Navahi dhātūhīti rūpadhātudhammadhātūhi
analyzed: dve āyatanāni upapatti bhava bhāvena pāḷiyam āgatāni te pana khandhehi saṅgahitāni  āyatana dhātūsu asaṅgahitāni tad avasesāni nava rūpāyatanāni tāni ca  manāyatana dhammāyatanehi ca asaṅgahitāni nāma honti navahi dhātūhi iti rūpadhātu dhammadhātūhi
translated: are mentioned in the texts as the rebirth-linking existence by way of the aggregates. But they are not included by the aggregates,🔽and they are not included by the bases and elements. The remaining nine visible-form bases are not included by those two,🔽and they are not included by the mind base and the mental-data base.

original: saddhiṃ sattahi viññāṇadhātūhi.
analyzed: saddhim sattahi viññāṇa dhātūhi
translated: By the seven elements means by the seven consciousness elements together with the visible-form element and the mental-data element.

original: Tatiye dasahīti rūpāyatanadhammāyatanavajjehi. Soḷasahīti rūpadhātudhammadhātuvajjāhi.
analyzed: tatiye dasahi iti rūpa āyatana dhamma āyatana vajjehi soḷasahi iti rūpa dhātu dhammadhātu vajjāhi
translated: In the third, with ten, that is to say, with the exception of the visible-data base and the mental-data base. In the sixteenth, with sixteen, that is to say, with the exception of the form element and the mental-data element.

original: Anidassanasappaṭighāni nāma nava oḷārikāyatanāni, tāni tehi khandhasaṅgahena saṅgahitāni,
analyzed: anidassana sappaṭighāni nāma nava oḷārika āyatanāni tāni tehi khandha saṅgahena saṅgahitāni
translated: The nine gross bases that are not-so-classifiable-as-supramundane are the nine bases beginning with the eye. They are included among the aggregates by the aggregate-as-a-heading,

original: āyatanadhātusaṅgahehi ca asaṅgahitāni, rūpāyatanadhammāyatanāni dvepi sesehi āyatanadhātūhi
analyzed: āyatana dhātu saṅgahehi ca asaṅgahitāni rūpa āyatana dhamma āyatanāni dve pi sesehi āyatana dhātūhi
translated: but they are not included among the bases and elements by the bases-and-elements-as-a-heading. The two, that is, the visible-data base and the mental-data base, are not included among the remaining bases and elements.

original: asaṅgahitāni nāma honti.🔽Catutthe ekādasahīti phoṭṭhabbāyatanavajjehi phoṭṭhabbāyatanassa upādādhammehi āyatanādīsu asaṅgahitattā. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva. Ayaṃ saṅgahitenaasaṅgahitapade nayo.
analyzed: asaṅgahitāni nāma honti  catutthe ekādasahi iti phoṭṭhabba āyatana vajjehi phoṭṭhabba āyatanassa upādā dhammehi āyatana ādīsu asaṅgahita ttā sesam su viññeyyam eva ayam saṅgahitena asaṅgahita pade nayo
translated: They are called “not-so-classifiable.”🔽In the fourth, with eleven, that is to say, with the exception of the tangible-data base. For the tangible-data base is not included among the aggregates by the aggregate-as-a-heading,

original: Asaṅgahitenasaṅgahitapadatthavaṇṇanā
analyzed: asaṅgahitena saṅgahita padattha vaṇṇanā
translated: but it is included among the bases and elements by the bases-and-elements-as-a-heading. The rest is quite clear. This is the method in the case of the “classifiable-as-so-and-so” and “not-so-classifiable” terms.🔽As to the “not-so-classifiable-as-so-and-so” and “not-so-classifiable” terms,

original: Asaṅgahitenasaṅgahitapade pana yāni padāni viññāṇena vā oḷārikarūpena vā asammissaṃ
analyzed: asaṅgahitena saṅgahita pade pana yāni padāni viññāṇena vā oḷārika rūpena vā a sammissam
translated: the terms that refer to a part of the mental-data base unmixed with consciousness or gross materiality

original: dhammāyatanekadesaṃ dīpenti, tāneva niddisīyanti, tāni pana vedanādīnaṃ tiṇṇaṃ khandhānaṃ,
analyzed: dhammāyatana eka desam dīpenti tān eva niddisīyanti tāni pana vedanā ādīnam tiṇṇam khandhānam
translated: are shown in the following way. For the three aggregates beginning with feeling

original: dukkhasaccavajjitānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ saccānaṃ, pasādamanovajjitānaṃ soḷasannaṃ indriyānaṃ,
analyzed: dukkha sacca vajjitānam tiṇṇam saccānam pasāda manaḥ vajjitānam soḷasannam indriyānam
translated: The three truths excluding the truth of suffering, the sixteen faculties excluding the faith faculty,

original: avijjāsaṅkhāraphassavedanātaṇhupādānakammabhavajātijarāmaraṇasokadukkhadomanassupāyāsavasena
analyzed: avijjā saṅkhāra phassa vedanā taṇhu pādāna kamma bhava jāti jarā maraṇa soka dukkha domanassa upāyāsa vasena
translated: and the fourteen modes of the conditions, namely, ignorance, determinations, craving, attachment, becoming, birth, ageing, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, despair, and defilement,

original: cuddasapaccayākārapadānañca vasena veditabbāni, na rūpakkhandhādīnaṃ. Teneva aṭṭhakathāyaṃ –

original: “Tayo khandhā tathā saccā, indriyāni ca soḷasa;
analyzed: tayo khandhā tathā saccā indriyāni ca soḷasa
translated: And the sixteen faculties,🔽And the fourteen modes of the conditions,

original: Padāni paccayākāre, cuddasūpari cuddasa.
analyzed: padāni paccaya ākāre cuddasu upari cuddasa
translated: And the fourteen above them.🔽Thirty altogether are the modes,

original: “Samatiṃsa padā honti, gocchakesu dasasvatha;
analyzed: samatiṃsa padāḥ honti gocchakesu dasasu atha
translated: And then ten in the groups,🔽And two in the short section,

original: Duve cūḷantaradukā, aṭṭha honti mahantarā”ti. –
analyzed: duve aṭṭha honti
translated: And eight in the long section.

original: Evaṃ uddānagāthā vuttā. Idaṃ hettha lakkhaṇaṃ – yaṃ khandhapadena asaṅgahitaṃ, āyatanadhātupadehi
analyzed: evam uddāna gāthā vuttā idam ha ittha lakkhaṇam yam khandha padena asaṅgahitam āyatana dhātu padehi
translated: This is the characteristic here: what is not included by the aggregate term is included by the base and element terms.

original: saṅgahitaṃ, tasseva tīhi visesanehi visiṭṭhassa khandhādīhi saṅgaho vuccati. Kathaṃ?
analyzed: saṅgahitam tassa iva tīhi visesanehi visiṭṭhassa khandha ādīhi saṅgahaḥ vuccati katham
translated: The inclusion of that which is distinguished by the three distinctions is called inclusion by the aggregates, etc. How?

analyzed: vedanā kkhandhena ye dhammā khandha saṅgahena asaṅgahitāḥ āyatana dhātu saṅgahehi saṅgahitā  te dhammā katihi khandhehi āyatanehi dhātūhi saṅgahitā te dhammā asaṅkhatam khandhato

analyzed: tatra ayam nayaḥ vedanā khandhena hi nibbānam sukhuma rūpam saññā saṅkhārā ca khandha saṅgahena  asaṅgahitā hutvā dhammāyatana dhammadhātu saṅgahena saṅgahitā tesu nibbānam khandha saṅgaham
translated: Here is the method: for Nibbāna, subtle materiality, and perception and determinations are not included in the aggregate of feeling,🔽but they are included in the base and element of mental data. Of these, Nibbāna does not go to inclusion in the aggregates,

original: na gacchati, sesā tīhi rūpasaññāsaṅkhārakkhandhehi saṅgahaṃ gacchanti, āyatanadhātuyo
analyzed: na gacchati sesā tīhi rūpa saññā saṅkhāra kkhandhehi saṅgaham gacchanti āyatana dhātuyo

analyzed: pana ittha dhamma āyatana dhammadhātūnam vasena iva sabbattha veditabbāḥ itarāsam asambhavā

analyzed: evam saññā khandha ādīsu pi yojanā veditabbā ayam pana viseso jīvitindriyena ye  te dhammā dvīhi vedanā saññā kkhandhehi saṅgahitāḥ rūpa arūpa jīvita indriyehi nibbāna vedanā saññā viññāṇa kkhandhāḥ  khandha saṅgahena asaṅgahitā tesu ca nibbāna vedanā saññā u āyatana dhātu saṅgahena saṅgahitā ati  sesam su viññeyyam eva ayam asaṅgahitena saṅgahita pade nayo

original: ekampi koṭṭhāsaṃ sakalena gahetvā ṭhitapadāni na yujjanti. Tāni pana dvinnaṃ samudayamaggasaccānaṃ,
analyzed: ekam pi koṭṭhāsam sakalena gahetvā ṭhita padāni na yujjanti tāni pana dvinnam
translated: and it is not possible to take any one part and stand on it. But they should be understood according to the two truths of the origin and the path,

analyzed: uddhaṭa padassa puna khandha ādīhi saṅgahaḥ vuccati
translated: That which is included by aggregates, etc., under a heading such as “aggregate” is said to be included again under that same heading,

analyzed: tatra ayam ādi pade nayaḥ samudaya saccena ye dhammā khandha ādīhi tīhi saṅgahehi pi saṅgahitā  tehi dhammehi ye dhammā khandha ādīhi tīhi pi saṅgahitā te dhammā ekena khandhena ekena āyatanena  ekāya dhātuyā saṅgahitā ati samudaya saccena hi taṇhā vajjā sesā saṅkhārā khandha ādīhi

original: saṅgahehi saṅgahitā, puna tehi ca taṇhāva saṅgahitā, sā ca puna saṅkhārakkhandhadhammāyatanadhammadhātūhi

original: sattahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitā. Rūpakkhandhena hi cattāro khandhā, nibbānañca khandhasaṅgahena
analyzed: sattahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitā rūpa kkhandhena hi cattāro khandhāḥ nibbānam ca khandha saṅgahena
translated: They are not included in the seven elements. For the four aggregates and Nibbāna are not included in the aggregate-heading,

original: asaṅgahitā, āyatanādīhi pana viññāṇameva ṭhapetvā vedanādayo dhammāyatanena rūpakkhandhekadesena
analyzed: asaṅgahitāḥ āyatana ādīhi pana viññāṇam eva ṭhapetvā vedanā ādayaḥ dhammāyatanena rūpa kkhandha ekadesena
translated: but feeling, etc., are included in the aggregate of mental data, in the mental-data base, and in the seven elements, leaving out consciousness.

original: saṅgahitāti viññāṇameva tīhipi khandhasaṅgahādīhi rūpakkhandhena asaṅgahitaṃ nāma.
analyzed: saṅgahitā ti viññāṇam eva tīhi pi khandha saṅgaha ādīhi rūpa kkhandhena asaṅgahitam nāma
translated: So only consciousness is not included in the three headings beginning with aggregates and in the aggregate of material form.

original: Tena puna viññāṇena saddhiṃ sanibbānā cattāro khandhā khandhādīhi asaṅgahitā, te
analyzed: tena puna viññāṇena saddhim sa nibbānā cattāro khandhāḥ khandha ādīhi asaṅgahitā te
translated: Again, the four aggregates together with Nibbāna are not included in the headings beginning with aggregates, etc.,

original: sabbepi puna viññāṇabhūtena ekena khandhena ekenāyatanena sattahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitāti.
analyzed: sabbe api puna viññāṇa bhūtena ekena khandhena ekena āyatanena sattahi dhātūhi asaṅgahitā ati
translated: and all of them are not included in one aggregate, one base, and seven elements, leaving out the element of consciousness.

original: Ayaṃ asaṅgahitenaasaṅgahitapade nayo.
analyzed: ayam asaṅgahitena asaṅgahita pade na yo
translated: This is the method of explaining “not included in the not-included.”

original: Sampayogavippayogapadatthavaṇṇanā🔽Sampayogavippayogapade pana yāni padāni nibbānena, rūpena vā missesu sattasu viññāṇadhātūsu
analyzed: sampayoga vippayoga pada attha vaṇṇanā  sampayoga vippayoga pade pana yāni padāni nibbānena rūpena vā missesu sattasu viññāṇa dhātūsu
translated: As to the words “associated with” and “dissociated from”:🔽The mental data of the mental-data base, the truth of suffering, etc., which are not dissociated from any one of the seven elements of consciousness among the eighteen elements,

original: ekāyapi avippayutte arūpadhamme pakāsenti, tesaṃ dhammāyatanadukkhasaccādīnaṃ niddeso
analyzed: a vippayutte arūpa dhamme pakāsenti tesam dhamma āyatana dukkha sacca ādīnam niddesaḥ
translated: are shown by the words “associated with Nibbāna” or “associated with materiality.”

original: na sambhavati. Kāhici pana viññāṇadhātūhi vippayuttānaṃ rūpamissārūpadhammānaṃ, kevalānārammaṇānaṃ🔽vā sakalarūpakkhandhānaṃ vā pakāsakānaṃ rūpabhavarūpakkhandhakusalādipadānaṃ sampayogapade
analyzed: na sambhavati kāhici pana viññāṇa dhātūhi vippayuttānam rūpa missā rūpa dhammānam kevala anārammaṇānam  vā sakala rūpa kkhandhānam vā pakāsakānam rūpa bhava rūpa kkhandha kusala ādi padānam sampayoga pade
translated: It is not possible. But in the case of the immaterial states that are dissociated from the consciousness elements, or of the material states that are mixed with matter, or of the mere objects,🔽or of the entire material aggregate, or of the illuminating material states, or of the material aggregates, or of the terms “wholesome” and so on, the term “association” is used in the sense of “conascence” in the expression “associated with materiality.”🔽

original: eva niddeso na sambhavati, vippayogapade pana sambhavati. Arūpakkhandhānaṃ pana paccekaṃ,
analyzed: eva niddesaḥ na sambhavati vippayoga pade pana sambhavati arūpa kkhandhānam pana paccekam
translated: But it is not possible in the case of the material dhammas dissociated from the consciousness-originated materiality, or in the case of the objective fields that are not mixed with materiality, or in the case of the whole material aggregate, or in the case of the material dhammas that are illuminating, or in the case of the words “materiality” and “materiality aggregate” in the sense of the wholesome, etc., because their definition is not possible in the associated clause but is possible in the dissociated clause. But in the case of the immaterial aggregates, it is possible in the case of each of them,

original: dvinnaṃ, tiṇṇaṃ, tadekadesānaṃ vā tadubhayepi sambhavati. “Catūhi sampayogo, catūhi🔽vippayogo, sabhāgo visabhāgo”ti hi vacanato catūhi arūpakkhandheheva sabhāgānaṃ ekasantāne🔽ekakkhaṇeva uppannānaṃ arūpakkhandhānaṃ eva aññamaññaṃ sampayogo labbhati. Rūpadhammānaṃ
analyzed: dvinnam tiṇṇam vā tad ubhaye pi sambhavati sampayogo  vippayogaḥ sabhāgaḥ visabhāgaḥ ti hi vacanato catūhi arūpa kkhandhehi iva sabhāgānam eka santāne  eka khaṇā iva uppannānam arūpa kkhandhānam eva aññamaññam sampayogaḥ labbhati rūpa dhammānam
translated: or in the case of two or three or a part of them in either clause. For it is said: “Association is with four; dissociation is with four; homogeneous; heterogeneous” .

original: pana rūpena, nibbānena vā, nibbānassa ca rūpena saddhiṃ sampayogo nāma natthi, tathā
analyzed: pana rūpena nibbānena vā nibbānassa ca rūpena saddhim sampayogaḥ nāma natthi tathā
translated: Thus association is possible only between the immaterial aggregates, which are homogeneous, and which arise in one life-continuum and in one moment, and only between the immaterial aggregates themselves. But there is no association of material dhammas with materiality, or of Nibbāna with materiality,🔽or of Nibbāna with Nibbāna.

original: rūpanibbānānaṃ arūpakkhandhehi. Visabhāgā hi te tesaṃ yathā arūpakkhandhānaṃ rūpanibbānehi,
analyzed: rūpa nibbānānam arūpa kkhandhehi visabhāgāḥ hi te tesam yathā arūpa kkhandhānam rūpa nibbānehi
translated: And matter and Nibbāna are dissimilar to the immaterial aggregates. For they are dissimilar to them as matter and Nibbāna are to the material groups.

original: evaṃ bhinnasantānikehi nānakkhaṇikehi arūpadhammehipi saddhiṃ natthiyeva. Tepi hi
analyzed: evam bhinna santānikehi nānakkhaṇikehi arūpa dhammehi pi saddhim te pi hi
translated: And so too they are dissimilar to the immaterial states belonging to different continua and different moments.

original: tesaṃ santānakkhaṇavisabhāgatāya visabhāgā eva. Ayaṃ pana visabhāgatā idha sāmaññato
analyzed: tesam santāna kkhaṇa visabhāga tāya visabhāgāḥ eva ayam pana visabhāga tā idha sāmaññato
translated: For they are dissimilar to them because of difference of continuity and difference of moment.🔽But this kind of dissimilarity is not intended here.

original: na gahitā tesaṃ avisesena sampayogassāpi sambhavā. Yattha pana visesetvā cakkhuviññāṇataṃsampayuttādayo
analyzed: na gahitā tesam avisesena sampayogassa api sambhavā yattha pana visesetvā cakkhu viññāṇa tad sampayutta ādayo
translated: But where they are stated as eye-consciousness, etc., associated with feeling, etc., then too the dissimilarity is intended.

original: nikkhittā, tatthāyampi visabhāgatā gahitā. Yattha pana ye aniddhāritavisesanā, tatthāpi
analyzed: nikkhittā tattha ayam pi visabhāga tā gahitā yattha pana ye a niddhārita visesanā tattha api
translated: But where they are stated without any distinction, then

original: sabbathā sampayogalakkhaṇaṃ na sambhavati. So ca tassa ekantena visabhāgoti idha gayhati.
analyzed: sabbathā sampayoga lakkhaṇam na sambhavati saḥ ca tassa ekantena visabhāgaḥ ti idha gayhati
translated: the characteristic of association is not possible in any way. And that is why the word “dissimilar” is used here.

original: Tatrāyaṃ nayo – rūpakkhandho kenaci sampayuttoti? Natthi. Katihi vippayutto? Catūhi
analyzed: tatra ayam nayaḥ rūpakkhandho kenaci sampayuttaḥ ti natthi katihi vippayuttaḥ catūhi
translated: Here is the method. Is the materiality aggregate associated with anything? No. With how many is it dissociated? With four.

original: khandhehi ekenāyatanena sattahi dhātūhi vippayutto, ekenāyatanena ekāya dhātuyā kehici
analyzed: khandhehi ekena āyatanena sattahi dhātūhi vippayuttaḥ ekena āyatanena ekāya dhātuyā kehici
translated: He is dissociated from one aggregate, from one base, and from seven elements. He is dissociated from one base and from one element in part.

original: vippayutto. Esa nayo cakkhāyatanādianārammaṇesupi. Sārammaṇesu pana vedanākkhandho
analyzed: vippayuttaḥ esa nayo cakkhā āyatana ādi anārammaṇesu pi sārammaṇesu pana vedanā khandho
translated: The same method applies in the case of the eye-base, etc., which are not objects. But as regards the objects, the feeling aggregate

original: tīhi khandhehi ekenāyatanena sattahi dhātūhi sampayutto, ekenāyatanena ekāya dhātuyā
analyzed: tīhi khandhehi ekena āyatanena sattahi dhātūhi sampayuttaḥ ekena āyatanena ekāya dhātuyā
translated: is associated with three aggregates, with one base, and with seven elements. He is associated with one base and with one element in part.

original: kehici sampayutto. Ekena khandhena dasahi āyatanehi dasahi dhātūhi vippayutto, ekenāyatanena
analyzed: kehici sampayuttaḥ ekena khandhena dasahi āyatanehi dasahi dhātūhi vippayuttaḥ ekena āyatanena
translated: He is dissociated from one aggregate, from ten bases, and from ten elements. He is dissociated from one base and from one element in part.

original: ekāya dhātuyā kehici vippayutto. Esa nayo saññākkhandhādīsupi.
analyzed: ekāya dhātuyā kehici vippayuttaḥ esa nayo saññā khandha ādīsu pi
translated: The same method applies in the case of the perception aggregate, etc.

original: Tattha ekenāti manāyatanena. Sattahīti viññāṇadhātūhi. Kehicīti dhammāyatanadhammadhātupariyāpannehi
analyzed: tattha ekena ati mana āyatanena sattahi iti viññāṇa dhātūhi kehici iti dhamma āyatana dhammadhātu pariyāpannehi
translated: Herein, “from one” means from the mind base. “From seven” means from the seven elements of consciousness. “In part” means from the perception, formations, and consciousness elements included in the mental-data base and mental-data element.

original: vedanāsaññāsaṅkhārehi. Dutiyanaye tīhīti attānaṃ ṭhapetvā sesehi arūpakkhandhehi.
analyzed: vedanā saññā saṅkhārehi dutiya naye tīhi iti attānam ṭhapetvā sesehi arūpa kkhandhehi
translated: In the second method, “from three” means from the three immaterial aggregates, excluding the self.

original: Kehici vippayuttoti dhammāyatanadhammadhātūsu saññāsaṅkhārehi. Kehici vippayuttoti
analyzed: kehici vippayuttoti dhamma āyatana dhammadhātūsu saññā saṅkhārehi kehici vippayuttoti
translated: He is dissociated from one base and from one element in part.

original: rūpanibbānehi. Evaṃ uparipi sabbattha yathānurūpaṃ ñātabbaṃ. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: rūpa nibbānehi evam upari pi sabbattha yathā anurūpam ñātabbam sesam vutta nayam eva
translated: and with the cessation of materiality. So too above, in all cases, it should be understood according to the way in which it is appropriate. The rest is as already stated.

original: Ayaṃ pana viseso “samudayamaggasaccādayo ekāya manoviññāṇadhātuyā sampayuttā, adhimokkho🔽pana manodhātumanoviññāṇadhātūhi dvīhevā”ti. Ayaṃ sampayogavippayogapade nayo.🔽Sampayuttenavippayuttapadatthavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ayam pana viseso samudaya magga sacca ādayo ekāya manaḥ viññāṇa dhātuyā sampayuttāḥ adhimokkhaḥ  pana manaḥ dhātu manaḥ viññāṇa dhātūhi dvīhā iva ati ayam sampayoga vippayoga pade nayo
translated: But there is this difference: the origin, path, and cessation truths, etc., are associated with one mind-consciousness element only, while resolution is associated with the mind element and the mind-consciousness element, that is to say, with two. This is the method in the case of the words associated and not associated.

original: Sampayuttenavippayuttapade pana sampayogārahapadesu yāni padāni dhammadhātuyā sampayutte🔽dhamme, viññāṇañca aññena asammissaṃ dīpenti, tesameva niddeso. Tāni pana catunnaṃ🔽arūpakkhandhapadānaṃ, manāyatanassa, sattannaṃ viññāṇadhātūnaṃ, manopekkhāvasena
analyzed: sampayuttena vippayutta pade pana sampayoga araha padesu yāni padāni dhammadhātuyā sampayutte  dhamme viññāṇam ca aññena asammissam dīpenti tesam eva niddeso tāni pana catunnam  arūpa kkhandha padānam manāyatanassa sattannam viññāṇa dhātūnam manā upekkhā vasena
translated: In the case of the words associated and dissociated, the definition is only of those terms that are associated with the mental-data element and dissociated from the other terms that are the remaining terms in the clause beginning “With the mental-data element as the fourth” .

original: dvinnaṃ indriyānaṃ, viññāṇaphassavedanānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ paṭiccasamuppādapadānaṃ, phassasattakassa,
analyzed: dvinnam indriyānam viññāṇa phassa vedanānam tiṇṇam paṭiccasamuppāda padānam phassa sattakassa

original: adukkhamasukhasavitakkasavicāraupekkhāsahagatānaṃ vasena tiṇṇaṃ tikapadānaṃ, sattamahantaradukapadādīnañca
analyzed: adukkham asukha sa vitakka sa vicāra aupekkhā sahagatānam vasena tiṇṇam tika padānam
translated: and the three triads with the third triad, namely, those associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, and the seven remaining dyads beginning with the seventh, namely, the neither-painful-nor-pleasant dyad,

original: vasena veditabbāni, na itaresaṃ asambhavā. Teneva aṭṭhakathāyaṃ –
analyzed: vasena veditabbāni na itaresam asambhavā tena iva aṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: should be understood in the same way, not the others, because they are impossible. That is why in the commentary it is said:

original: “Cattāro khandhāyatanañca ekaṃ,
analyzed: cattāro khandha āyatanam ca ekam
translated: Four aggregates and one base,

original: Dve indriyā dhātupadāni satta;
analyzed: dve indriyāḥ dhātu padāni satta
translated: Two faculties, seven elements,

original: Tayo paṭiccā atha phassasattakaṃ,
analyzed: tayo paṭiccāḥ atha phassa sattakam
translated: Three conditions, then contact, feeling,

original: Tike tayo satta mahantare ca;🔽Ekaṃ savitakkaṃ savicāramekaṃ,
analyzed: tike tayo satta mahantare ca  ekam sa vitakkam sa vicāram ekam
translated: Three triads, seven dyads,🔽One associated with applied thought, one with sustained thought,

original: Yuttaṃ upekkhāya ca ekamevā”ti. –
analyzed: yuttam upekkhāya ca ekam eva ati
translated: One associated with equanimity.

original: Uddānagāthā vuttā. Idaṃ hettha lakkhaṇaṃ – ye dhammā paṭhamaṃ uddhaṭapadena sampayuttā, tehi ye dhammā vippayuttā, tesaṃ khandhādīhi vippayogo vuccati.
analyzed: uddāna gāthā vuttā idam ha ittha lakkhaṇam ye dhammā paṭhamam uddhaṭa padena sampayuttā tehi ye dhammā vippayuttā tesam khandha ādīhi vippayogaḥ vuccati
translated: This is the verse of the summary. This is the characteristic here: the dissociation of those things associated with the first dyad stated from those things associated with the remaining dyads is called dissociation from aggregates, etc.

original: Tatrāyaṃ nayo – vedanākkhandhena ye dhammā sampayuttā, tehi dhammehi ye dhammā vippayuttā,
analyzed: tatra ayam nayaḥ vedanā kkhandhena ye dhammā sampayuttā tehi dhammehi ye dhammā vippayuttā
translated: Here is the method. The things associated with the feeling aggregate are dissociated from those things associated with the remaining aggregates.

original: te dhammā catūhi khandhehi ekenāyatanena sattahi dhātūhi vippayuttā, ekenāyatanena
analyzed: te dhammā catūhi khandhehi ekena āyatanena sattahi dhātūhi vippayuttāḥ ekena āyatanena
translated: They are dissociated from four aggregates, from one base, from seven elements,

original: ekāya dhātuyā kehici vippayuttā. Cakkhuviññāṇadhātuyā ye dhammā sampayuttā, tehi
analyzed: ekāya dhātuyā kehici vippayuttā cakkhu viññāṇa dhātuyā ye dhammā sampayuttā tehi
translated: They are not dissociated from any of the aggregates, elements, and bases.🔽The states that are associated with eye-consciousness element are not dissociated from any of the aggregates, elements, and bases.

original: dhammehi ye dhammā vippayuttā, te dhammā na kehici khandhāyatanehi vippayuttā, ekāya
analyzed: dhammehi ye dhammā vippayuttā te dhammā na kehici khandha āyatanehi vippayuttāḥ ekāya
translated: But they are dissociated from one element.

original: pana dhātuyā vippayuttāti evaṃ sabbattha yojanā veditabbā.
