translated: The meaning is this: the classification of states beginning with material form that was given above is not in terms of conventional truth.

original: nāpi anussavādivasena gahetabbo, attano pana bhūtatāya eva saccikaṭṭho, attapaccakkhatāya
analyzed: na api anussava ādi vasena gahetabbaḥ attanaḥ pana bhūta tāya eva saccikaṭṭhaḥ atta paccakkha tāya
translated: Nor can it be apprehended by hearsay, etc., but only as the truth in its own actuality, and as the ultimate reality in its own immediacy.

original: ca paramattho, so tathāpaṭiññāto puggalo tato tena saccikaṭṭhaparamatthena ākārena🔽upalabbhati, yathā ruppanānubhavanādinā sakiyenākārena puna saccikaṭṭhaparamattho🔽upalabbhati, kiṃ tava puggalopi evaṃ upalabbhatīti vuttaṃ hoti. Na hevaṃ vattabbeti🔽avajānanā paravādissa. So hi tathārūpaṃ puggalaṃ anicchanto avajānāti. Na hi attā
analyzed: ca paramattho so tathā paṭiññāto puggalo tatas tena saccikaṭṭha paramatthena ākārena  upalabbhati yathā ruppana anubhavana ādinā sa kiyena ākārena puna  upalabbhati kim tava puggalaḥ api evam upalabbhati iti vuttam hoti na ha ivam vattabbā iti  avajānanā para vādissa saḥ hi tathārūpam puggalam an icchantaḥ avajānāti na hi attā
translated: That person who is admitted to be such is apprehended in that way, in the aspect of the truth in its own actuality and the ultimate reality in its own immediacy,🔽just as the truth in its own actuality and the ultimate reality are apprehended in their own respective aspects. So why do you say that the person is apprehended in the same way?

original: nāma khandhādivimutto koci dissati aññatra byāmohamattā. Tatrāyaṃ padacchedo – na
analyzed: nāma khandha ādi vimuttaḥ koci dissati aññatra byāmoha mattā tatra ayam padacchedaḥ na
translated: “You should not say so”: this is the rejection of the opponent’s view. For the opponent, not wanting to admit the existence of such a person, rejects it. For no one is seen to be liberated from the aggregates, etc., as a self, except by mere delusion. Here is the word-commentary:

original: hi evaṃ vattabbeti. “Na ha eva”ntipi paṭhanti, dvinnampi evaṃ na vattabboti attho.🔽Ājānāhi niggahanti sakavādivacanaṃ. Yasmā te purimāya vattabbapaṭiññāya pacchimā
analyzed: hi evam vattabbā iti na ha evam ti pi paṭhanti dvinnam pi evam na vattabbaḥ iti attho 🔽ājānāhi niggahanti sakavādi vacanam yasmai te purimāya vattabba paṭiññāya pacchimā
translated: “You should not say so”: some read “na ha eva” . The meaning of both is: “You should not say so.”🔽“You should admit”: the opponent’s statement. Because of the opponent’s admission of the statement in the first place,

original: navattabbapaṭiññā, pacchimāya ca purimā na sandhīyati, tasmā niggahaṃ patto, taṃ
analyzed: navattabba paṭiññā pacchimāya ca purimā na sandhīyati tasmā niggaham tam
translated: He has admitted that he has not made nine statements. And the latter does not join on to the former. Therefore he has fallen into defeat.🔽You should admit that defeat, that offence, that transgression. The meaning is that you should agree to it.

original: niggahaṃ dosaṃ aparādhaṃ ājānāhi, sampaṭicchāhīti attho. Evaṃ niggahaṃ ājānāpetvā
analyzed: niggaham dosam aparādham ājānāhi sampaṭicchāhi iti evam niggaham ājānāpetvā
translated: Having thus made him admit the defeat,

original: idāni taṃ ṭhapanāya ceva anulomapaṭilomato pāpanāropanānañca vasena pākaṭaṃ karonto
analyzed: idāni tam ca iva vasena pākaṭam karontaḥ
translated: now, in order to make it clear to him by way of the laying down, of the forward and reverse order, of the accusation and the refutation,

original: “hañci puggalo”tiādimāha. Tattha hañcīti yadi, sace puggalo upalabbhatīti attho.
analyzed: hañci puggalaḥ ti ādim āha tattha hañci iti yadi sace puggalo upalabbhati iti attho
translated: he said, “If a person is found” , etc. Herein, hañci means if, if a person is found, is the meaning.

original: Ayaṃ tāva paravādīpakkhassa anuvadanena ṭhapanato niggahapatiṭṭhāpanato niggahapāpanāropanānaṃ🔽lakkhaṇabhūtā anulomaṭṭhapanā nāma. Tena vata retiādi anulomapakkhe niggahassa pāpikattā
analyzed: ayam tāva paravādī pakkhassa anuvadanena ṭhapanataḥ niggaha patiṭṭhāpanataḥ niggaha pāpanā āropanānam  lakkhaṇa bhūtā anulomaṭṭhapanā nāma tena vata ra iti ādi anuloma pakkhe niggahassa pāpika ttā
translated: This is the forward laying down, which is a characteristic of the laying down of the defeat by admission and the laying down of the defeat by evasive and prevaricating answers.🔽The accusation of the forward order is called the accusation of the forward order because the defeat in the forward order is sinful.

original: anulomapāpanā nāma. Tattha tenāti kāraṇavacanaṃ. Vatāti okappanavacanaṃ niyamavacanaṃ.
analyzed: anulomapāpanā nāma tattha tena ati kāraṇa vacanam vatā ati okappana vacanam niyama vacanam
translated: Herein, tena vata re is a reason, vatā is an expression of censure, a restriction.

original: Reti āmantanavacanaṃ. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – tena vata re vattabbe vata re hambho bhadramukha
analyzed: re ti āmantana vacanam idam vuttam hoti tena vata re vattabbe vata re hambho bhadra mukha
translated: Re is an expression of address. This is what is said: “You, sir, should say this, you should say this, you good sir,

original: tena kāraṇena vattabbo evāti attho. Yaṃ tattha vadesītiādi anulomapakkhe niggahassa
analyzed: tena kāraṇena vattabbaḥ evā ti atthaḥ yam tattha vadesi itiādi anuloma pakkhe niggahassa
translated: “What you say there” , etc., is called “the setting up of the affirmative” because the respondent’s denial is set up in the affirmative part.

original: āropitattā anulomaropanā nāma. Yañcassa pariyosāne “micchā”ti padaṃ, tassa purato
analyzed: āropita ttā anulomaropanā nāma yat ca assa pariyosāne padam tassa puratas
translated: And the word “wrong” at the end of the respondent’s statement should be brought forward to the beginning.🔽The meaning is “This is wrong for you.” The same method applies above.

original: “idaṃ te”ti āharitabbaṃ. Idaṃ te micchāti ayañhettha attho. Evaṃ uparipi. Parato
analyzed: idam te iti āharitabbam idam te micchā ati ayam ha ittha atthaḥ evam upari pi paratas
translated: This is also stated in the text itself.

original: pāḷiyampi etaṃ āgatameva. No ce pana vattabbetiādi “na hevaṃ vattabbe”ti paṭikkhittapakkhassa🔽anuvadanena ṭhapitattā paṭilomato niggahapāpanāropanānaṃ lakkhaṇabhūtā paṭilomaṭṭhapanā🔽nāma. No ca vata retiādi paṭilomapakkhe niggahassa pāpitattā paṭilomapāpanā nāma.
analyzed: pāḷiyam pi etam āgatam eva no ce pana vattabbā itiādi na ha ivam vattabbā iti paṭikkhitta pakkhassa  anuvadanena ṭhapita ttā paṭilomataḥ niggaha pāpanā āropanānam lakkhaṇa bhūtā paṭilomaṭṭhapanā  nāma no ca vata rai iti ādi paṭiloma pakkhe niggahassa pāpita ttā paṭilomapāpanā nāma
translated: “But if it should not be stated” , etc., is called “the setting up of the negative” because the respondent’s denial is set up by the proponent’s repeating what has been denied in the negative part.🔽“But it is not so stated” , etc., is called “the bringing up of the negative” because the respondent’s denial is brought up in the negative part.

original: Puna yaṃ tattha vadesītiādi paṭilomapakkhe niggahassa āropitattā paṭilomaropanā nāma.
analyzed: puna yam tattha vadesi itiādi paṭiloma pakkhe niggahassa āropita ttā paṭilomaropanā nāma
translated: “What you say there” , etc., is called “the setting up of the negative” because the respondent’s denial is set up in the negative part.

original: Tatrāyaṃ ādito paṭṭhāya saṅkhepattho – yadi puggalo upalabbhati saccikaṭṭhaparamatthena,
analyzed: tatra ayam āditaḥ paṭṭhāya saṅkhepa atthaḥ yadi puggalaḥ upalabbhati saccikaṭṭha paramatthena
translated: Here is the meaning in brief, starting from the beginning: If a person is found in the absolute sense of reality,

original: tena vata bho so upalabbhatīti vattabbo. Yaṃ pana tattha vadesi “vattabbo kho purimapañhe
analyzed: tena vata bho so upalabbhati iti vattabbaḥ yam pana tattha vadesi vattabbaḥ kho purima pañhe
translated: “But it should be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real.”🔽“But what you said was: ‘In the first question it should be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real, and in the second question it should not be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real.’ This is wrong.”🔽“In the second question it should not be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real. In the first question it should not be said either.”

original: ‘saccikaṭṭhaparamatthena upalabbhatī’ti no ca vattabbo dutiyapañhe ‘tato so puggalo🔽upalabbhatī”’ti, idaṃ te micchāti evaṃ tāva anulomato ṭhapanāpāpanāropanā honti.
analyzed: saccikaṭṭha paramatthena upalabbhati iti no ca vattabbaḥ dutiya pañhe tatas so puggalo  upalabbhati iti idam te evam tāva anulomataḥ ṭhapana āpāpana āropanāḥ honti
translated: “But what you said was: ‘In the first question it should be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real, and in the second question it should not be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real.’ This is wrong.”

original: Atha na vattabbo dutiyapañhe “tato so puggalo upalabbhatī”ti, purimapañhepi na vattabbova.
analyzed: atha na vattabbaḥ dutiya pañhe tatas saḥ puggalaḥ upalabbhati iti purima pañhe pi na vattabbaḥ uva
translated: “In the second question it should not be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real. In the first question it should not be said either.”

original: Yaṃ pana tattha vadesi “vattabbo kho purimapañhe ‘saccikaṭṭhaparamatthena upalabbhatī’ti,
analyzed: yam pana tattha vadesi vattabbaḥ kho purima pañhe saccikaṭṭha paramatthena upalabbhati iti
translated: “But what you said was: ‘In the first question it should be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real, and in the second question it should not be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real.’ This is wrong.”🔽Thus the laying down of the tetrad of the first question is wrong.🔽“In the second question it should not be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real. In the first question it should not be said either.”

original: no ca vattabbo dutiyapañhe ‘tato so puggalo upalabbhatī”’ti, idaṃ te micchāti evaṃ
analyzed: no ca vattabbaḥ dutiya pañhe tatas saḥ puggalaḥ upalabbhati iti idam te micchā ati evam
translated: “But what you said was: ‘In the first question it should be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real, and in the second question it should not be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real.’ This is wrong.”🔽Thus the laying down of the tetrad of the second question is wrong.

original: paṭilomato ṭhapanāpāpanāropanā honti. Evametaṃ niggahassa ca anulomato dvinnaṃ, paṭilomato
analyzed: paṭilomataḥ ṭhapana apāpana āropanāḥ honti evam etam niggahassa ca anulomataḥ dvinnam paṭilomataḥ
translated: Thus the laying down of the tetrad of the first question is wrong.🔽“In the second question it should not be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real. In the first question it should not be said either.”🔽“But what you said was: ‘In the first question it should be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real, and in the second question it should not be said that it is found in the ultimate sense of the real.’ This is wrong.”🔽Thus the laying down of the tetrad of the second question is wrong.

original: dvinnanti catunnaṃ pāpanāropanānañca vuttattā upalabbhatītiādikaṃ anulomapañcakaṃ
analyzed: catunnam vutta ttā upalabbhati iti ādikam anuloma pañcakam
translated: Thus the laying down of the tetrad of the first question is wrong.🔽“In

original: nāma. Ettha ca kiñcāpi anulomato pāpanāropanāhi eko, paṭilomato pāpanāropanāhi ekoti🔽dve niggahā katā, ājānāhi niggahanti etasseva pana paṭhamassa niggahassa dvīhākārehi
analyzed: nāma ettha ca kiñca api anulomataḥ pāpanāropanāhi ekaḥ paṭilomataḥ pāpanāropanāhi ekaḥ iti  dve niggahā katā ājānāhi niggahanti etassa iva pana paṭhamassa niggahassa dvīhākārehi
translated: And here, although the two questions are made by the two methods of forward and reverse order respectively,

original: āropitattā ekovāyaṃ niggahoti gahetabbo. Paṭhamo niggaho.
analyzed: āropita ttā ekaḥ uva ayam niggaho ti gahetabbaḥ paṭhamaḥ niggaho
translated: still the first question is to be taken as one only because it is asked in two ways.

original: Idāni paccanīkanayo hoti. Tattha puggalo nupalabbhatīti pucchā paravādissa. Sakavādī
analyzed: idāni paccanīka nayaḥ hoti tattha puggalo na upalabbhati iti pucchā paravādissa sakavādī
translated: Now there is the method of the opposite. Herein, the question “A person is not found” is that of the other theorist. The proponent of the doctrine of non-existence

original: yathā rūpavedanādayo dhammā upalabbhanti, evaṃ anupalabbhanīyato “āmantā”ti paṭijānāti.
analyzed: yathā rūpa vedanā ādayaḥ dhammāḥ upalabbhanti evam anupalabbhanīyataḥ āmantā ati paṭijānāti
translated: answers “Yes, sir” because a person is not found in the way that such ideas as material form, feeling, etc., are found.

original: Puna itaro attanā adhippetaṃ saccikaṭṭhaṃyeva sandhāya “yo saccikaṭṭho”tiādimāha.🔽Sammutisaccaparamatthasaccāni vā ekato katvāpi paravādī evamāha. Sakavādī puggalo
analyzed: punar itaraḥ attanā adhippetam saccikaṭṭham yā iva sandhāya yaḥ saccikaṭṭhā uti ādim āha  sammuti sacca paramattha saccāni vā ekatas katvā api paravādī evam āha sakavādī puggalo
translated: Then the other theorist, referring to the real state of facts intended by himself, says “That which is the real state of facts,”

original: hi upādāyapaññattisabbhāvatopi dvinnaṃ saccānaṃ ekato katvā pucchitattāpi “na heva”nti
analyzed: hi upādāya paññatti sabbhāvataḥ pi dvinnam ekatas katvā pucchita ttā api na
translated: or else the other theorist says this referring to the two truths taken together, that is, conventional truth and ultimate truth. The proponent of the doctrine of non-existence answers “No, sir”🔽because a person is not found in the ultimate sense.

original: paṭikkhipati. Idāni kiñcāpi tena paṭhamaṃ paramatthasaccavasena nupalabbhanīyatā
analyzed: paṭikkhipati idāni kiñcā api tena paṭhamam paramattha sacca vasena n upalabbhanīya tā
translated: He rejects it. Although he has previously admitted that it cannot be found as the ultimate truth,

original: sampaṭicchitā, pacchā pana sammutisaccavasena vā vomissakavasena vā paṭikkhittā.
analyzed: sampaṭicchitā pacchā pana sammuti sacca vasena vā vomissaka vasena vā paṭikkhittā
translated: now he rejects it as the conventional truth or as a mere designation.

original: Paravādī pana “nupalabbhatī”ti vacanasāmaññamattaṃ chalavādaṃ nissāya “yaṃ tayā paṭhamaṃ🔽paṭiññātaṃ, taṃ pacchā paṭikkhitta”nti bhaṇḍanassa paṭibhaṇḍanaṃ viya attano katassa🔽niggahakammassa paṭikammaṃ karonto “ājānāhi paṭikamma”nti āha. Idāni yathāssa anulomapañcake
analyzed: paravādī pana nupalabbhati iti vacana sāmañña mattam chala vādam nissāya yam tayā paṭhamam  paṭiññātam tam pacchā paṭikkhittanti bhaṇḍanassa paṭibhaṇḍanam viya attanaḥ katassa  niggaha kammassa paṭikammam karontaḥ ājānāhi paṭikamman ti āha idāni yathā assa anuloma pañcake
translated: But the opponent, taking the mere similarity of the words “cannot be found” as a pretext for a quibble, says, “You have rejected what you affirmed first.”🔽As if he were countering a charge by saying, “You have done the same thing yourself,” he says, “Understand the counter-question.”

original: sakavādinā vādaṭṭhapanaṃ katvā anulomapaṭilomato pāpanāropanāhi paravādiniggaho pākaṭo🔽kato, evaṃ paṭikammaṃ pākaṭaṃ karonto “hañci puggalo”tiādimāha. Taṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva
analyzed: sakavādinā vādaṭṭhapanam katvā anuloma paṭilomataḥ paravādi niggahaḥ pākaṭaḥ  kataḥ evam paṭikammam pākaṭam karontaḥ hañci puggalaḥ ti ādim āha tam heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva
translated: Now, just as the opponent’s refutation by the respondent in the five-part sequence was made clear by the respondent’s statement of his own position and by the opponent’s refutation by the respondent in the forward and reverse order,🔽so the respondent now makes his counter-question clear by saying, “Well then, is a person … ?” The meaning should be understood in the way already stated.

original: atthato veditabbaṃ. Yasmā panettha ṭhapanā nāma paravādipakkhassa ṭhapanato “ayaṃ
analyzed: atthataḥ veditabbam yasmā pana ittha ṭhapanā nāma paravādi pakkhassa ṭhapanataḥ ayaṃ
translated: But here “positing” is the positing of the opponent’s view.

original: tava doso”ti dassetuṃ ṭhapanamattameva hoti, na niggahassa vā paṭikammassa vā pākaṭībhāvakaraṇaṃ,🔽pāpanāropanāhi panassa pākaṭīkaraṇaṃ hoti, tasmā idaṃ anulomapaṭilomato pāpanāropanānaṃ
analyzed: tava doso ti dassetum ṭhapanam attam eva hoti na niggahassa vā paṭikammassa vā pākaṭībhāva karaṇam  pāpanā āropanā hi panassa pākaṭīkaraṇam hoti tasmai idam anuloma paṭilomato
translated: It is only a mere suspension, not a making clear of the refutation or the counter-objection.

original: vasena catūhākārehi paṭikammassa katattā paṭikammacatukkaṃ nāmāti ekaṃ catukkaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: vasena catūhākārehi paṭikammassa kata ttā paṭikammacatukkam nāma ati ekam catukkam veditabbam
translated: But the making clear of the counter-charge is done by the accusation of the fault. So this is called the tetrad of counter-objection because the counter-objection is made in four ways by way of the accusation of the fault in the order and in the reverse order.🔽This is how there is one tetrad.

original: Evaṃ paṭikammaṃ katvā idāni yvāssa anulomapañcake sakavādinā niggaho kato, tassa
analyzed: evam paṭikammam katvā idāni yvā assa anuloma pañcake sakavādinā niggaho kato tassa
translated: Having thus made the counter-objection, now, since the opponent’s objection in the fivefold series is made by way of a fallacious statement,

original: tameva chalavādaṃ nissāya dukkaṭabhāvaṃ dassento “tvaṃ ce pana maññasī”tiādimāha.🔽Tattha tvaṃ ce pana maññasīti yadi tvaṃ maññasi. “Vattabbe kho”ti idaṃ paccanīke
analyzed: tam eva chala vādam nissāya dukkaṭa bhāvam dassento tvam ce pana maññasi iti ādim āha  tattha tvam ce pana maññasi iti yadi tvam maññasi vattabbe kho ti idam paccanīke
translated: showing that it is faulty, he says, “But if you think” and so on.

original: “āmantā”ti paṭijānanaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, “no ca vattabbe”ti idaṃ pana “na hevā”ti
analyzed: āmantā iti paṭijānanam sandhāya vuttam no ca vattabbā iti idam pana na ha eva ati
translated: Herein, if you think means if you imagine. “You should say” is said with reference to the opponent’s admission of the challenge. “But you should not say” is said with reference to his rejection of the challenge.

original: avajānanaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tena tava tatthāti tena kāraṇena tvaṃyeva tasmiṃ “yo
analyzed: avajānanam sandhāya vuttam tena tava tattha ati tena kāraṇena tvaṃyā iva tasmin yaḥ
translated: Therefore, because of that means for that reason. You alone are at fault there means you alone are at fault in that.

original: nupalabbhatī”ti pakkhe hevaṃ paṭijānanti “āmantā”ti evaṃ paṭijānanto. Hevaṃ niggahetabbeti
analyzed: nupalabbhati iti pakkhe ha ivam paṭijānanti āmantā ati evam paṭijānantaḥ ha ivam niggahetabbā iti
translated: “No, friend.”🔽If he admits it thus, he should be charged thus:

original: puna “na hevā”ti avajānanto evaṃ niggahetabbo. Atha taṃ niggaṇhāmāti athevaṃ niggaṇhanārahaṃ
analyzed: puna na ha iva ati avajānantaḥ evam niggahetabbaḥ atha tam niggaṇhāma ati atha ivam niggaṇhana araham
translated: “If he denies it thus, he should be charged thus:🔽“If he deserves to be charged, then we will charge him.”

original: taṃ niggaṇhāma, suniggahito ca hosīti sakena matena niggahitattā suniggahito ca bhavasi.
analyzed: tam niggaṇhāma su niggahitaḥ ca hosi iti sakena matena niggahita ttā su niggahitaḥ ca bhavasi
translated: If he deserves to be charged in this way, then we will charge him. And he will be well charged.

original: Evamassa niggahetabbabhāvaṃ dassetvā idāni taṃ niggaṇhanto “hañcī”tiādimāha. Tattha
analyzed: evam assa niggahetabba bhāvam dassetvā idāni tam niggaṇhantaḥ hañci iti ādim āha tattha
translated: Having thus shown how he should be charged, he now says “Hañci” in order to charge him. Herein🔽the placing, the bringing up, and the superimposition should be understood in the way already described .

original: ṭhapanāpāpanāropanā heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva veditabbā. Pariyosāne pana idaṃ te micchāti🔽idaṃ tava vacanaṃ micchā hotīti attho. Idaṃ chalavādena catūhi ākārehi niggahassa
analyzed: ṭhapana apāpana āropanā heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva veditabbā pariyosāne pana idam te micchā ti  idam tava vacanam micchā hoti iti attho idam chala vādena catūhi ākārehi niggahassa
translated: At the end, however, “This is your downfall” means “This is your downfall, friend.”🔽This is your wrong view, friend, this is your wrong grasp, this is your wrong adherence, this is your wrong all-around clinging, this is your wrong stubbornness in saying ‘Only this is the truth, the rest is false’—this is how the meaning should be understood.

original: katattā niggahacatukkaṃ nāma.
analyzed: kata ttā niggahacatukkam nāma
translated: Since the refutation is made in four ways by means of the terms of the rebuke, it is called the “tetralemma of refutation.”

original: Evaṃ niggahaṃ katvāpi idāni “yadi ayaṃ mayā tava matena kato niggaho dunniggaho,
analyzed: evam niggaham katvā api idāni yadi ayam mayā tava matena kataḥ niggahaḥ dunniggahaḥ
translated: Having thus made the refutation, he now says “If this refutation made by me according to your view is a bad refutation,”

original: yopi mama tayā heṭṭhā anulomapañcake kato niggaho, sopi dunniggaho”ti dassento “ese
analyzed: yaḥ api mama tayā heṭṭhā anuloma pañcake kataḥ niggaho saḥ api dunniggahaḥ ti dassento ese
translated: and the refutation you made of my fivefold right-way series below is a bad refutation.” Showing this, he said:

original: ce dunniggahite”tiādimāha. Tattha ese ce dunniggahiteti eso ce tava vādo mayā dunniggahito,
analyzed: ce dunniggahitā iti ādim āha tattha ese ce dunniggahitā iti esaḥ ce tava vādaḥ mayā dunniggahitaḥ
translated: “If that’s a bad refutation,” etc. Herein, if that’s a bad refutation is if that statement of yours is a bad refutation by me;🔽or else, if that refutation of yours by me is a bad refutation.

original: atha vā eso ce tava mayā kato niggaho dunniggaho. Hevamevaṃ tattha dakkhāti tatthāpi
analyzed: atha vai esaḥ ce tava mayā kataḥ niggahaḥ dunniggahaḥ ha ivam evam tattha dakkhāti tattha api
translated: So too, you should see it there is so too you should see it in the same way there

original: tayā mama heṭṭhā kate niggahe evamevaṃ passa. Idāni yvāssa heṭṭhā sakavādinā niggaho
analyzed: tayā mama heṭṭhā kate niggahe evam evam passe idāni yvā assa heṭṭhā sakavādinā niggaho
translated: in the fivefold right-way series below that you made.

original: kato, taṃ “vattabbe kho”tiādivacanena dassetvā puna taṃ niggahaṃ aniggahabhāvaṃ upanento
analyzed: kataḥ tam vattabbe kho ti ādi vacanena dassetvā puna tam niggaham a niggaha bhāvam upanentaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation made by the other party below, which he showed by the words “What is to be stated,” etc., he now brings back to the state of being a non-refutation by saying:

original: “no ca mayaṃ tayā”tiādimāha. Tattha no ca mayaṃ tayā tattha hetāya paṭiññāyātiādīsu
analyzed: no ca mayam tayā iti ādim āha tattha no ca mayam tayā tattha ha itāya paṭiññāya ati ādīsu
translated: “But we do not admit that,” etc. Herein, in the passage beginning with “But we do not admit that you have a reason for that assertion” the meaning is as follows:

original: ayamattho – yasmā so tayā mama kato niggaho dunniggaho, tasmā mayaṃ tayā tattha anulomapañcake
analyzed: ayam attho yasmā saḥ tayā mama kataḥ niggahaḥ dunniggaho tasmā mayam tayā anuloma pañcake
translated: Since that refutation of yours of mine is a bad refutation, therefore we do not admit that you have a reason for that assertion in the fivefold right-way series below that you made.

original: “āmantā”ti etāya paṭiññāya evaṃ paṭijānantā puna “na hevā”ti paṭikkhepe katepi “ājānāhi
analyzed: āmantā ati etāya paṭiññāya evam paṭijānantā puna na ha iva ati paṭikkhepe kate pi ājānāhi
translated: “I admit”: by this admission, when they are admitting thus, then, when the denial “I do not” is made, they are to be pressed further thus:🔽“Do you understand?🔽“You press me, though I am not to be pressed.🔽“I am not to be pressed in this way.

original: niggaha”nti evaṃ niggahetabbāyeva, evaṃ aniggahetabbampi maṃ niggaṇhāsi, īdisena🔽pana niggahena dunniggahitā mayaṃ homa. Idāni yaṃ niggahaṃ sandhāya dunniggahitā
analyzed: niggahanti evam niggahetabbāya iva evam a niggahetabbam pi mamam niggaṇhāsi īdisena  pana niggahena dunniggahitā mayam home idāni yam niggaham sandhāya dunniggahitā
translated: “But you press me, though I am not to be pressed.”🔽“You say that I am not to be pressed.🔽“I will show you the pressing I am not to be pressed.”🔽“Well, then, a person is not to be pressed in this way: ‘You are not to be pressed in this way.

original: ca homāti avoca, taṃ dassetuṃ “hañci puggalo…pe… idaṃ te micchā”ti āha. Evamidaṃ🔽anulomapaṭilomato catūhi pāpanāropanāhi niggahassa upanītattā upanayanacatukkaṃ nāma hoti.
analyzed: ca homa ati avoca tam dassetum hañci puggala ope idam te micchā ati āha evam idam  anuloma paṭilomataḥ catūhi pāpanā āropanāhi niggahassa upanīta ttā upanayanacatukkam nāma hoti
translated: “This is your wrongness’—🔽“Thus this is called the tetrad of pressing because the pressing is brought up in four ways by the four kinds of wrongness, in forward and reverse order.

original: Idāni na hevaṃ niggahetabbetiādikaṃ niggamanacatukkaṃ nāma hoti. Tattha na hevaṃ🔽niggahetabbeti yathāhaṃ tayā niggahito, na hi evaṃ niggahetabbo, etassa hi niggahassa
analyzed: idāni na ha ivam niggahetabbā iti ādikam niggamana catukkam nāma hoti tattha na ha ivam  niggahetabbā iti yathā aham tayā niggahitaḥ na hi evam niggahetabbaḥ etassa hi niggahassa
translated: “You are not to be pressed in this way” is called the tetrad of unpressing.🔽Herein, you are not to be pressed in this way: you are not to be pressed as I have pressed you, for the wrongness of this pressing has been demonstrated by me.🔽Therefore: for this reason.

original: dunniggahabhāvo mayā sādhito. Tena hīti tena kāraṇena. Yasmā esa niggaho dunniggaho,
analyzed: dunniggaha bhāvaḥ mayā sādhitaḥ tena hi iti tena kāraṇena yasmai esa niggahaḥ dunniggahaḥ
translated: Because this pressing is wrong pressing,

original: tasmā yaṃ maṃ niggaṇhāsi. Hañci puggalo…pe… idaṃ te micchāti idaṃ niggaṇhanaṃ tava
analyzed: tasmai yam mam niggaṇhāsi hañci puggala ope idam te idam niggaṇhanam tava
translated: “This is not right for you” means “This is not right in you.”🔽“Then what is wrong with it?” means “Then what is wrong with the reason you are refuting?”

original: micchāti attho. Tena hi ye kate niggaheti yena kāraṇena idaṃ micchā, tena kāraṇena
analyzed: micchā ati attho tena hi ye kate niggahe iti yena kāraṇena idam micchā tena kāraṇena
translated: “The refutation you make is wrong,” means “The refutation you make is faulty.”🔽“What I have done in reply is right,” means “What I have done in reply is good.”

original: yo tayā niggaho kato, so dukkaṭo. Yaṃ mayā paṭikammaṃ kataṃ, tadeva sukataṃ. Yāpi🔽cesā paṭikammacatukkādivasena kathāmaggasampaṭipādanā katā, sāpi sukatāti. Tadeva🔽puggalo upalabbhatītiādikassa anulomapañcakassa nupalabbhatītiādikānaṃ paṭikammaniggahopanayananiggamanacatukkānañca🔽vasena anulomapaccanīkaṃ nāma niddiṭṭhanti veditabbaṃ. Ettāvatā sakavādino pubbapakkhe🔽sati paravādino vacanasāmaññamattena chalavādena jayo hoti.
analyzed: yaḥ tayā niggahaḥ kato saḥ dukkaṭaḥ yam mayā paṭikammam katam tat eva su katam yā api  ca isā paṭikamma catukka ādi vasena kathā magga sampaṭipādanā katā sā api su katā ati tat eva  puggalaḥ upalabbhati iti ādikassa anuloma pañcakassa na upalabbhati iti ādikānam paṭikamma niggaha upanayana niggamana catukkānam ca  vasena anulomapaccanīkam nāma niddiṭṭhanti veditabbam ettāvatā sakavādino pubbapakkhe  sati paravādinaḥ vacana sāmañña mattena chala vādena jayaḥ
translated: “The method of discussion I have used is right,” means “The method of discussion I have used is good.”

original: Idāni yathā paravādino pubbapakkhe sati sakavādino dhammeneva tathena jayo hoti,
analyzed: idāni yathā paravādinaḥ pubbapakkhe sati sakavādinaḥ dhammena iva tathena jayaḥ hoti
translated: “The five-point application of the counter-question and the four-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the five-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the four-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the three-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the two-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the one-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the non-application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the non-application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the four-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the three-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the two-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the one-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the non-application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the non-application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the four-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the three-point application of the counter-question, the four-point application of the counter-question by way of the two

original: tathā vāduppattiṃ dassetuṃ “puggalo nupalabbhatī”ti paccanīkānulomapañcakaṃ āraddhaṃ.
analyzed: tathā vāda uppattim dassetum puggalaḥ na upalabbhati iti paccanīka anuloma pañcakam āraddham
translated: The five questions in direct and reverse order are stated in order to show the origin of the dispute.🔽Herein, the question in the reverse order is the other party’s,

original: Tattha paccanīke pucchā paravādissa, rūpādibhedaṃ saccikaṭṭhaparamatthaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: tattha paccanīke pucchā paravādissa rūpa ādi bhedam saccikaṭṭha paramattham sandhāya
translated: the answer is the proponent’s, and it is given in terms of the ultimate truth consisting in the real particular instances of material form, etc.,

original: paṭiññā sakavādissa, suddhasammutisaccaṃ vā paramatthamissakaṃ vā sammutisaccaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: paṭiññā sakavādissa suddha sammuti saccam vā paramattha missakam vā sammuti saccam sandhāya
translated: or in terms of the mere conventional truth or the conventional truth mixed with the ultimate truth.🔽The further question in the direct order is the other party’s,

original: “yo saccikaṭṭho”ti puna anuyogo paravādissa, sammutivasena “puggalo nupalabbhatī”ti🔽navattabbattā missakavasena vā anuyogassa saṃkiṇṇattā “na heva”nti paṭikkhepo sakavādissa,
analyzed: yaḥ saccikaṭṭhaḥ ti puna anuyogo paravādissa sammuti vasena puggalo na upalabbhati iti  navattabba ttā missaka vasena vā anuyogassa saṃkiṇṇa ttā na paṭikkhepaḥ saka vādissa
translated: and the denial is the proponent’s.

original: paṭiññātaṃ paṭikkhipatīti vacanasāmaññamattena “ājānāhi niggaha”ntiādivacanaṃ paravādissa.
analyzed: paṭiññātam paṭikkhipati iti vacana sāmañña mattena ājānāhi niggahan ti ādi vacanam paravādissa
translated: The statement “You have lost, admit your defeat” is the other party’s, because it is similar to the statement “You have lost, admit your defeat” in the mere words.

original: Evamayaṃ puggalo nupalabbhatīti dutiyavādaṃ nissāya dutiyo niggaho hotīti veditabbo.
analyzed: evam ayam puggalaḥ nupalabbhati iti dutiya vādam nissāya dutiyaḥ niggahaḥ hoti iti veditabbaḥ
translated: So this second refutation should be understood to be stated with the second proposition, “A person is not found.”

original: Evaṃ tena chalena niggaho āropito.
analyzed: evam tena chalena niggahaḥ āropito
translated: Thus the refutation is imposed by that reductio ad absurdum.

original: Idāni dhammena samena paravādipaṭiññāya attano vāde jayaṃ dassetuṃ anulomanaye pucchā
analyzed: idāni dhammena samena paravādi paṭiññāya attanaḥ vāde jayam dassetum anuloma naye pucchā
translated: Now, in order to show his own victory in the debate by means of the right method, the questioner, in the method of agreement,

original: sakavādissa, attano laddhiṃ nissāya paṭiññā paravādissa, laddhiyā okāsaṃ adatvā paramatthavasena
analyzed: sakavādissa attanaḥ laddhim nissāya paṭiññā paravādissa laddhiyā okāsam a datvā paramattha vasena
translated: asks the respondent, who is on his own side, to admit his own proposition, and he does not give the respondent an opportunity to establish his own proposition.

original: puna anuyogo sakavādissa, paramatthavasena puggalassa anupalabbhanato paṭikkhepo
analyzed: puna anuyogaḥ saka vādissa paramattha vasena puggalassa an upalabbhanataḥ paṭikkhepaḥ
translated: The respondent, in the method of difference, rejects the questioner’s proposition by means of the ultimate truth, since the individual is not found.

original: paravādissa, tato paraṃ dhammena samena attano jayadassanatthaṃ “ājānāhi paṭikamma”ntiādi
analyzed: paravādissa tatas param dhammena samena attanaḥ jaya dassana attham ājānāhi paṭikamma ntiādi
translated: Then, in order to show his own victory by means of the right method, the questioner says, “Acknowledge the counter-question,” etc.

original: sabbaṃ sakavādivacanameva hoti. Tattha sabbesaṃ paṭikammaniggahopanayananiggamanacatukkānaṃ🔽heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva attho veditabbo. Evamidaṃ “puggalo nupalabbhatī”tiādikassa paccanīkapañcakassa
analyzed: sabbam sakavādi vacanam eva hoti tattha sabbesam paṭikamma niggaha upanayana niggamana catukkānam  heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva atthaḥ veditabbaḥ evam idam puggalaḥ na upalabbhati iti ādikassa paccanīka pañcakassa
translated: All this is the questioner’s speech. Herein, the meaning of the four propositions, “counter-question,” “admit,” “consequence,” and “rejection,”🔽should be understood in the way stated above. Thus, the five counter-questions and the five methods of agreement

original: “upalabbhatī”tiādīnaṃ paṭikammaniggahopanayananiggamanacatukkānañca vasena paccanīkānulomapañcakaṃ
analyzed: upalabbhati iti ādīnam paṭikamma niggaha upanayana niggamana catukkānam ca vasena paccanīka anuloma pañcakam
translated: are stated in the way beginning, “The individual is not found,” etc., and “The individual is found,” etc., respectively.

original: nāma niddiṭṭhaṃ hoti. Evametāni paṭhamasaccikaṭṭhe dve pañcakāni niddiṭṭhāni, tatthetaṃ vuccati –
analyzed: nāma niddiṭṭham hoti evam etāni paṭhama saccikaṭṭhe dve pañcakāni niddiṭṭhāni tattha etam vuccati
translated: The name is stated. So these two sets of five in the first fact of conformity are stated. This is said:

original: “Niggaho paravādissa, suddho paṭhamapañcake;
analyzed: niggahaḥ para vādissa suddhaḥ paṭhama pañcake
translated: The opponent’s statement, pure, In the first set of five;

original: Asuddho pana tasseva, paṭikammajayo tahiṃ.
analyzed: asuddhaḥ pana tassa iva paṭikamma jayaḥ tahim
translated: But impure, and there, the opponent’s Reversal of his statement.

original: “Niggaho sakavādissa, asuddho dutiyapañcake;
analyzed: niggahaḥ saka vādissa asuddhaḥ dutiya pañcake
translated: The proponent’s statement, impure, In the second set of five;

original: Visuddho pana tasseva, paṭikammajayo tahiṃ.
analyzed: visuddhaḥ pana tassa iva paṭikamma jayaḥ tahim
translated: But pure, and there, the proponent’s Reversal of his statement.

original: “Tasmā dvīsupi ṭhānesu, jayova sakavādino;
analyzed: tasmā dvīsupi ṭhānesu saka vādinaḥ
translated: Therefore in both cases, the proponent’s Victory alone;

original: Dhammena hi jayo nāma, adhammena kuto jayo.
analyzed: dhammena hi jayaḥ nāma adhammena kutas jayo
translated: For victory is by Dhamma, how can there be victory by what is not Dhamma?

original: “Saccikaṭṭhe yathā cettha, pañcakadvayamaṇḍite;
analyzed: saccikaṭṭhe yathā ca itthā pañcaka dvaya maṇḍite
translated: As here in the first fact of conformity, Adorned with two sets of five,

original: Dhammādhammavaseneva, vutto jayaparājayo.
analyzed: dhamma adhamma vasena iva vuttaḥ jaya parājayaḥ
translated: Victory and defeat are stated According to what is Dhamma and what is not Dhamma.

original: “Ito paresu sabbesu, saccikaṭṭhesu paṇḍito;
analyzed: itas paresu sabbesu saccikaṭṭhesu paṇḍitaḥ
translated: From here on in all the rest Of the facts of conformity, the wise man

original: Evameva vibhāveyya, ubho jayaparājaye”ti. ;
analyzed: evam eva vibhāveyyaḥ ubhaḥ jaya parājaya iti
translated: Should analyze in the same way Both victory and defeat.

original: Paṭhamo suddhikasaccikaṭṭho niṭṭhito.
analyzed: paṭhamaḥ suddhika saccikaṭṭhaḥ niṭṭhito
translated: The first fact of conformity, pure, is finished.

original: Evaṃ suddhikasaccikaṭṭhaṃ vitthāretvā idāni tameva aparehipi okāsādīhi nayehi vitthāretuṃ
analyzed: evam suddhika saccikaṭṭham vitthāretvā idāni tam eva aparehi pi okāsa ādīhi nayehi vitthāretum
translated: Having thus analyzed the first fact of conformity, pure, he now analyzes it by other methods, beginning with the occasion.

original: puna “puggalo upalabbhatī”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Tattha pucchā sakavādissa, paṭiññā paravādissa.🔽Puna sabbatthāti sarīraṃ sandhāya anuyogo sakavādissa, rūpasmiṃ attānaṃ samanupassanādosañca
analyzed: puna puggalaḥ upalabbhati itiādi āraddham tattha pucchā sakavādissa paṭiññā paravādissa  puna sabbattha ati sarīram sandhāya anuyogaḥ sakavādissa rūpasmim attānam samanupassanā dosam ca
translated: and again “a person is found” , etc., was introduced. Herein, the question is on the proponent’s side, and the respondent’s reply is on the opponent’s side.

original: “aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīra”nti āpajjanadosañca disvā paṭikkhepo paravādissa. Sesamettha
analyzed: aññam jīvam aññam sarīran ti āpajjana dosam ca disvā paṭikkhepaḥ paravādissa sesam ettha
translated: Again, “in every way” is on the proponent’s side in the sense of the body, and the respondent’s reply is on the opponent’s side in the sense of the visible-form aggregate, and in the sense of the fault of misrepresenting a self that is visible form, and in the sense of the fault of misrepresenting a self that is a person separate from the body. The rest of this tetrad

original: anulomapaccanīkapañcake heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ. Pāṭho pana saṃkhitto. Tattha
analyzed: anuloma paccanīka pañcake heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva veditabbam pāṭhaḥ pana saṃkhittaḥ tattha
translated: should be understood in the way already stated in the case of the fivefold forward and reverse order. But the text is abbreviated. Herein,

original: yasmā sarīraṃ sandhāya “sabbattha nupalabbhatī”ti vutte sarīrato bahi upalabbhatīti🔽āpajjati, tasmā paccanīke paṭikkhepo sakavādissa, paṭhamaṃ anujānitvā pacchā avajānātīti
analyzed: yasmā sarīram sandhāya sabbattha nu upalabbhati iti vutte sarīrataḥ bahi upalabbhati iti  āpajjati tasmā paccanīke paṭikkhepaḥ sakavādissa paṭhamam anujānitvā pacchā avajānāti iti
translated: since it is misrepresented that “a person is found outside the body” when it is said that “in every way he is not found in the body,”

original: chalavādassa vasena paṭikammaṃ paravādissa, sesaṃ pākaṭameva.
analyzed: chala vādassa vasena paṭikammam paravādissa sesam pākaṭam eva
translated: the respondent’s reply is on the proponent’s side in the sense of the rejection of the reverse order, and the opponent’s rejoinder is on the opponent’s side in the sense of the rejection of the counter-question, since it is a misrepresentation to admit first and then deny. The rest is clear.

original: Dutiyanaye sabbadāti purimapacchimajātikālañca dharamānaparinibbutakālañca sandhāya
analyzed: dutiya naye sabbadāti purima pacchima jāti kālañca dharamāna parinibbuta kālañca sandhāya
translated: In the second method, “in every way” refers to the time of the past and future births and to the time of the present life and death.

original: anuyogo sakavādissa, sveva khattiyo so brāhmaṇotiādīnaṃ āpattidosañca dharamānaparinibbutānaṃ
analyzed: anuyogaḥ saka vādissa su eva khattiyaḥ saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ti ādīnam āpatti dosaṃ ca dharamāna parinibbutānam
translated: and the adherence to one’s own view, and the fault of the proposition that “Only this is true” , and the proposition that “The khattiya is the best of these people” , and so on, and the proposition that “One who has attained the cessation-trance is parinibbuta” ,

original: visesābhāvadosañca disvā paṭikkhepo paravādissa. Sesaṃ paṭhamanaye vuttasadisameva.
analyzed: visesa abhāva dosam ca disvā paṭikkhepaḥ paravādissa sesam paṭhama naye vutta sadisam eva
translated: and the rejection is on the part of the other disputant. The rest is as already stated.

original: Tatiyanaye sabbesūti khandhāyatanādīni sandhāya pucchā sakavādissa, rūpasmiṃ attā, cakkhusmiṃ attātiādidosabhayena paṭikkhepo paravādissa. Sesaṃ tādisamevāti.
analyzed: tatiya naye sabbesu iti khandha āyatana ādīni sandhāya pucchā sakavādissa rūpasmim attā cakkhusmim attā ati ādi dosa bhayena paṭikkhepaḥ paravādissa sesam tādisam eva ati
translated: In the third method the question is on the part of the one who asserts his own doctrine, referring to the aggregates, bases, etc., and the rejection is on the part of the other disputant, out of fear of the faults of the view that the self is form, the self is the eye, and so on. The rest is the same.

original: Evamimāni tīṇi mukhāni anulomapaccanīkapañcake anulomamattavaseneva tāva paṭipāṭiyā🔽bhājetvā puna paccanīkānulomapañcake paccanīkamattavaseneva bhājetuṃ “puggalo nupalabbhatī”tiādi

analyzed: tattha  saṅketa vacanam saccam loka sammuti kāraṇam
translated: Herein,

original: Paramatthavacanaṃ saccaṃ, dhammānaṃ tathalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: paramattha vacanam saccam dhammānam tatha lakkhaṇam
translated: The truth of the relative is the speech of convention, The truth of the ultimate is the specific nature of things.

original: Tasmā viññū akatvāna, byañjanebhinivesanaṃ;🔽Paramatthe patiṭṭhāya, puggalādiṃ vivajjaye.
analyzed: tasmai a katvāna byañjana ibhinivesanam  paramatthe patiṭṭhāya puggala ādim vivajjaye
translated: Therefore, the wise, not insisting on the letter, Should, by the ultimate, the individual and so on, avoid.

original: Paññattiṃ anatikkamma, paramattho pakāsito;🔽Vināyakena so yasmā, tasmā aññopi paṇḍito;

translated: The ultimate is revealed without transgressing the designation, Therefore, the wise, not insisting on the letter, Should, by the ultimate, the individual and so on, avoid.

original: Paramatthaṃ pakāsento, samaññaṃ nātidhāvayeti. ;
analyzed: paramattham pakāsento samaññam na atidhāvaya iti
translated: The ultimate is revealed without transgressing the designation, Therefore, the wise, not insisting on the letter, Should, by the ultimate, the individual and so on, avoid.

original: Ayaṃ puggalakathānayo.
analyzed: ayam puggala kathā nayaḥ

original: Parihānikathādivaṇṇanā

The knowledge of the divine eye and the divine ear,

analyzed: yathā kammu upagata ñāṇam eva dibba cakkhu iti pavattā yathā kammu upagata ñāṇa kathā devabrahmānam

The talk went on about the divine eye.

original: pāṇātipātādiasaṃvarābhāvamattena sampattaviratiyā abhāvepi saṃvaro atthīti pavattā
analyzed: pāṇa atipāta ādi asaṃvara abhāva mattena sampattaviratiyāḥ abhāve pi saṃvaro atthi iti pavattā
translated: The discussion that occurs thus: “Though there is no restraint in the mere absence of the undertaking of the restraint of refraining from killing living beings, etc., there is restraint”🔽is the discussion of restraint. The discussion that occurs thus: “At the moment of death and the moment of rebirth-linking there is perception in the case of those without perception”

original: saṃvarakathā. Asaññīnampi cutipaṭisandhikkhaṇe saññā atthīti pavattā asaññakathā.
analyzed: saṃvara kathā asaññīnam pi cuti paṭisandhi kkhaṇe saññā atthi iti pavattā asañña kathā
translated: is the discussion of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.🔽The discussion that occurs thus: “A noble disciple is a layman”

original: Nevasaññānāsaññāyatanabhūmiyaṃ saññā nappavattatīti pavattā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanakathā.🔽Arahā gihī assāti pavattā gihissa arahātikathā. Anāgāmino suddhāvāsesu paṭisandhicittena
analyzed: neva saññā nāsañña āyatana bhūmiyam saññā nappavattati iti pavattā neva saññā nāsañña āyatana kathā  arahā gihī assa ati pavattā gihissa arahā atikathā anāgāmino suddhāvāsesu paṭisandhi cittena
translated: is the discussion of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception. The discussion that occurs thus: “Non-returners become arahants by the rebirth-linking consciousness in the pure abodes”

original: upapattikkhaṇe arahanto hontīti pavattā upapattikathā. Arahato lokiyadhammāpi anāsavāti🔽pavattā anāsavakathā. Paccuppannakkhaṇe samaṅgibhāvasamannāgamo ca rūpāvacarādibhūmantarapaṭilābhasamannāgamo
analyzed: upapatti kkhaṇe arahantaḥ honti iti pavattā upapatti kathā arahataḥ lokiya dhammā api anāsavā ti  pavattā anāsava kathā paccuppanna kkhaṇe samaṅgi bhāva samannāgamo ca rūpāvacara ādi bhūma antara paṭilābha samannāgamo
translated: is the discussion of rebirth. The discussion that occurs thus: “The worldlings’ states are without cankers in the case of an arahant”🔽is the discussion of the cankers. The discussion that occurs thus: “There are two kinds of endowment: endowment with the presence of the thirty-seven states partaking of enlightenment in the present moment, and endowment with the presence of the states partaking of enlightenment in the future by the attainment of the various higher states of the fine-material and immaterial spheres”

original: cāti dve samannāgamā, yesaṃ pana ime dve samannāgame ṭhapetvā aññopi hettha upapattidhammavasena
analyzed: ca ati dve samannāgamā yesam pana ime dve samannāgame ṭhapetvā aññaḥ api ha ittha upapatti dhamma vasena
translated: is the discussion of endowment. But there is also another kind of endowment here, which is the state of being destined for rebirth.

original: eko samannāgamo nāma atthi, tena arahā catūhi phalehi samannāgatoti pavattā samannāgatakathā.
analyzed: ekaḥ samannāgamaḥ nāma atthi tena arahā catūhi phalehi samannāgato ti pavattā samannāgata kathā
translated: There is a kind of possession called “possession in the sense of accompaniment” . The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “A perfected one is possessed of four fruits” is a discussion of possession in the sense of accompaniment.

original: Imināva nayena arahā chahi upekkhāhi samannāgatoti pavattā upekkhāsamannāgatakathā.
analyzed: iminā ava nayena arahā chahi upekkhāhi samannāgato ti pavattā upekkhā samannāgata kathā
translated: In the same way, the discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “A perfected one is possessed of six equanimities” is a discussion of possession of equanimity.

original: Maggañāṇasabbaññutaññāṇasaṅkhātabodhiyā sadā sannihitabhāvena buddhoti pavattā bodhiyā
analyzed: magga ñāṇa sabbaññu taññāṇa saṅkhāta bodhiyā sadā sannihita bhāvena buddhaḥ iti pavattā bodhiyā
translated: The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “He is enlightened because of his possession of enlightenment consisting of the knowledge of paths and the knowledge of all things” is a discussion of enlightenment.

original: buddhotikathā. Mahāpurisalakkhaṇayuttāva bodhisattāti pavattā lakkhaṇakathā. Bodhisattānampi
analyzed: buddha uti kathā mahā purisa lakkhaṇa yuttā ava bodhisattā ti pavattā lakkhaṇa kathā bodhisattānam pi
translated: The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “Only those who possess the characteristics of a Great Man are Bodhisattas” is a discussion of the characteristics.🔽The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “There is a regular succession of Bodhisattas” is a discussion of the succession of Bodhisattas.

original: magganiyāmo atthīti pavattā niyāmokkantikathā. Catutthamaggaṭṭho tīhi phalehi samannāgatotiādinā🔽pavattā aparāpi samannāgatakathā. Paṭhamamaggādīhi pahīnehi saddhiṃ nippariyāyato
analyzed: magga niyāmo atthi iti pavattā niyāma ukkanti kathā catuttha magga ṭṭho tīhi phalehi samannāgataḥ ti ādinā  pavattā aparā api samannāgata kathā paṭhama magga ādīhi pahīnehi saddhim nippariyāyato
translated: The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “One who possesses the third fruit possesses three fruits” is another discussion of possession.

original: arahattaṃ sabbasaṃyojanappahānanti pavattā sabbasaṃyojanapahānakathā.
analyzed: arahattam sabba saṃyojana ppahānanti pavattā sabba saṃyojana pahāna kathā
translated: The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “Arahantship is the complete destruction of the cankers together with the cankers abandoned by the first path, and so on” is a discussion of the complete destruction of the cankers.

original: Nippariyāyato phalaṃ vimutti nāma, vipassanāmaggapaccavekkhaṇañāṇāni pana pariyāyato.
analyzed: nippariyāyataḥ phalam vimutti nāma vipassanā magga paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇāni pana pariyāyataḥ
translated: The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “The fruit is called deliverance in the absolute sense” is a discussion of deliverance.

original: Evaṃ pana aggahetvā yaṃ kiñci kilesavippayuttaṃ ñāṇaṃ vimuttīti pavattā vimuttikathā.🔽Buddhādiasekhārammaṇaṃ asekhañāṇanti pavattā asekhañāṇakathā. Pathavīkasiṇādisamāpattiyo
analyzed: evam pana aggahetvā yam kiñci kilesa vippayuttam ñāṇam vimutti iti pavattā vimutti kathā  buddha ādi asekha ārammaṇam asekha ñāṇan ti pavattā asekha ñāṇa kathā pathavī kasiṇa ādi samāpattiyaḥ
translated: But without taking it thus, any knowledge that is dissociated from defilement is called “deliverance” in the discussion that occurs under the heading “Deliverance.”🔽“The knowledge of the Arahant has the Arahant, etc., as its object” in the discussion that occurs under the heading “Knowledge of the Arahant.”

original: paramatthato avijjamāne paññattārammaṇe pavattattā viparītañāṇanti pavattā viparītakathā.
analyzed: paramatthataḥ a vijjamāne paññatta ārammaṇe pavatta ttā viparīta ñāṇan ti pavattā viparīta kathā
translated: “The attainment of the earth kasiṇa, etc., is wrong knowledge because it occurs with respect to an object that is conceptually existent and does not exist in the ultimate sense” in the discussion that occurs under the heading “Wrong knowledge.”

original: Tattha anicce niccantiādinā catubbidho vipallāso veditabbo. Sabbesaṃ puthujjanānaṃ
analyzed: tattha anicce nicca nti ādinā catubbidhaḥ vipallāsaḥ veditabbo sabbesam puthujjanānam
translated: Herein, the four perversions should be understood as follows: “In what is impermanent there is permanence” , etc.🔽“All ordinary people have knowledge of the way leading to the passing away of suffering” in the discussion that occurs under the heading “Way leading to passing away.”

original: niyāmagamanāya ñāṇaṃ atthīti pavattā niyāmakathā. Sabbaṃ ñāṇaṃ paṭisambhidāti pavattā🔽paṭisambhidākathā. Sammutivisayampi ñāṇaṃ bhūtārammaṇamevāti pavattā sammutiñāṇakathā.
analyzed: niyāma gamanāya ñāṇam atthi iti pavattā niyāma kathā sabbam ñāṇam paṭisambhidā ati pavattā  paṭisambhidā kathā sammuti visayam pi ñāṇam bhūta ārammaṇam eva ati pavattā sammuti ñāṇa kathā
translated: “All knowledge is a discrimination” in the discussion that occurs under the heading “Discrimination.”🔽“Knowledge of the conventional has only the four primary elements as its object” in the discussion that occurs under the heading “Knowledge of the conventional.”

original: Cetopariyañāṇaṃ cittārammaṇameva, na taṃsampayuttarāgādicetasikārammaṇanti pavattā
analyzed: cetaḥ pariya ñāṇam citta ārammaṇam eva na tad sampayutta rāga ādi cetasika ārammaṇam ti pavattā
translated: “Knowledge of penetration of minds has only consciousness as its object, not the associated greed, etc.,” in the discussion that occurs under the heading “Consciousness as object.”

original: cittārammaṇakathā. Sabbasmiṃ anāgatadhamme sabbesaṃ ñāṇaṃ atthīti pavattā anāgatañāṇakathā.
analyzed: citta ārammaṇa kathā sabbasmim anāgata dhamme sabbesam ñāṇam atthi iti pavattā anāgata ñāṇa kathā
translated: “There is knowledge of all future states” in the discussion that occurs under the heading “Knowledge of the future.”

original: Paccuppanne attano ñāṇepi ñāṇaṃ pavattatīti pavattā paṭuppannañāṇakathā. Buddhā viya🔽sāvakāpi tena tena veneyyajanena pattabbaphalaṃ ñatvāva tadatthāya dhammaṃ desentīti
analyzed: paccuppanne attanaḥ ñāṇe pi ñāṇam pavattati iti pavattā paṭuppanna ñāṇa kathā buddhāḥ viya  sāvakā api tena tena veneyya janena pattabba phalam ñatvā ava tad atthāya dhammaṃ desenti iti
translated: “Knowledge occurs in the present regarding one’s own knowledge” — thus has been set forth the discussion on knowledge of the present.

original: pavattā phalañāṇakathā.🔽Sammattaniyāmo niyamato niccaṭṭhena asaṅkhatoti pavattā niyāmakathā. “Dhammaṭṭhitatā
analyzed: pavattā phala ñāṇa kathā  sammatta niyāmaḥ niyamataḥ nicca ṭṭhena asaṅkhataḥ ti pavattā niyāma kathā dhamma ṭṭhita tā
translated: “Just as the Buddhas, so also the disciples, having known the fruit to be attained by a certain person to be taught, teach the Dhamma for that purpose” — thus has been set forth the discussion on knowledge of the fruit.🔽“The regularity of the right path is unformed in the sense of being permanent” — thus has been set forth the discussion on regularity. “The stability of the Dhamma,

original: dhammaniyāmatā”tiādivacanato paṭiccasamuppādo asaṅkhatoti pavattā paṭiccasamuppādakathā.🔽“Saccāni tathāni avitathānī”tiādivacanato catusaccāni asaṅkhatānīti pavattā saccakathā.🔽“Cattāro āruppā āneñjā”ti vacanato asaṅkhatāti pavattā āruppakathā. Nirodhasamāpatti
analyzed: dhamma niyāma tā ati ādi vacanato paṭiccasamuppādaḥ asaṅkhataḥ ti pavattā paṭiccasamuppāda kathā  saccāni tathāni avitathāni iti ādi vacanato catu saccāni asaṅkhatāni iti pavattā sacca kathā  cattāro āruppā āneñja ati vacanataḥ asaṅkhatā ati pavattā āruppa kathā nirodha samāpatti
translated: the regularity of the Dhamma” — thus has been set forth the discussion on dependent origination, which is unformed.🔽“The truths are such, not otherwise” — thus has been set forth the discussion on the four truths, which are unformed.

original: asaṅkhatāti pavattā nirodhasamāpattikathā. Asaṅkhato ākāsoti ākāsakathā. Ākāso sanidassanotikathā.
analyzed: asaṅkhatā ati pavattā nirodha samāpatti kathā asaṅkhataḥ ākāso ti ākāsa kathā ākāsaḥ sa nidassanaḥ ti kathā
translated: “The four immaterial states are imperturbable” — thus has been set forth the discussion on the immaterial states, which are unformed. “The attainment of cessation is unformed” — thus has been set forth the discussion on the attainment of cessation. “Space is unformed” — thus has been set forth the discussion on space. “Space is visible” — thus has been set forth the discussion on space.

original: Pathavīdhātu sanidassanātiādiṃ katvā kāyakammaṃ sanidassananti pariyosānakathā.
analyzed: pathavī dhātu sa nidassanā ati ādim katvā kāya kammam sa nidassanan ti pariyosāna kathā
translated: The discussion beginning with the question, “Is the earth-element visible?” and ending with the question, “Is bodily action visible?” is the discussion of the visible.

original: Natthi keci dhammā kehici dhammehi saṅgahitā, tena ekavidhena rūpasaṅgahotiādi niratthakanti🔽pavattā saṅgahitakathā. Vedanādayo arūpadhammā aññamaññaṃ na sampayuttāti pavattā
analyzed: natthi keci dhammā kehici dhammehi saṅgahitā tena ekavidhena rūpa saṅgahaḥ uti ādi niratthakan ti  pavattā saṅgahita kathā vedanā ādayaḥ arūpa dhammāḥ aññam aññam na sampayuttā ati pavattā
translated: The discussion beginning with the statement, “There are no dhammas included in any other way than by the single method of inclusion as material form,” is the discussion of inclusion.

original: sampayuttakathā. Cetasikaṃ natthīti pavattā cetasikakathā. Cetanādhammova dānaṃ,🔽na deyyadhammoti pavattā dānakathā. Paṭiggāhakānaṃ paribhogamayaṃ puññaṃ atthīti
analyzed: sampayutta kathā cetasikam natthi iti pavattā cetasika kathā cetanā dhammaḥ uva dānam  na deyya dhammaḥ ti pavattā dāna kathā paṭiggāhakānam paribhoga mayam puññam atthi iti
translated: The discussion beginning with the statement, “Feeling, etc., are not conjoined with one another” is the discussion of conjoined dhammas. The discussion beginning with the statement, “There is no cetasika” is the discussion of cetasikas. The discussion beginning with the statement, “Only the dhamma of volition is giving, not the object given” is the discussion of giving.

original: pavattā paribhogakathā. Petā ito dinnacīvarādīheva yāpentīti pavattā itodinnakathā.🔽Pathavīkammavipākotikathā. Jarāmaraṇaṃ vipākotikathā. Kilesappahānamattameva sāmaññaphalaṃ,
analyzed: pavattā paribhoga kathā petāḥ itas dinna cīvara ādi iha iva yāpenti iti pavattā itodinna kathā  pathavī kamma vipāka uti kathā jarā maraṇam vipāka uti kathā kilesa ppahāna mattam eva sāmañña phalam
translated: The discussion beginning with the statement, “There is merit for the recipients through the use of the robe, etc., given” is the discussion of use. The discussion beginning with the statement, “The departed enjoy the robe, etc., given from here” is the discussion of the departed.

original: na cittacetasikā dhammāti pavattā ariyadhammavipākakathā. Aññamaññādipaccayatāya
analyzed: na citta cetasikāḥ dhammā ti pavattā ariya dhamma vipāka kathā aññamañña ādi paccaya tāya
translated: The discussion beginning with the statement, “The earth is the result of kamma” is the discussion of the result of kamma. The discussion beginning with the statement, “Ageing and death are the result of kamma” is the discussion of the result of kamma. The discussion beginning with the statement, “The fruit of recluseship is the mere abandoning of defilements, not the dhammas of consciousness and its concomitants” is the discussion of the fruit of the noble dhamma. The discussion beginning with the statement, “The condition by mutual dependence” is the discussion of mutual dependence.

original: vipāko vipākadhammadhammotikathā.
analyzed: vipākaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ iti kathā
translated: The discussion of “resultant and resultant-producing states” is concluded.🔽The discussion of “six realms of existence together with the asura world” is concluded.

original: Asurakāyena saddhiṃ cha gatiyoti pavattā gatikathā. Matasatto mātuutusamayañca mātāpitusaṃyogañca🔽olokayamāno sattāhaṃ, atirekasattāhaṃ vā yasmiṃ bhave tiṭṭhati, so antarābhavo nāma🔽atthīti pavattā antarābhavakathā. Rūpādipañcakāmaguṇāva kāmadhātu nāma, na tu vatthukāmakilesakāmāti
analyzed: asura kāyena saddhim pavattā gati kathā mata sattaḥ mātā pitu saṃyogam ca  olokayamāno satta aham atireka satta aham vā yasmin bhave tiṭṭhati saḥ antarābhavaḥ nāma  atthi iti pavattā antarābhava kathā rūpa ādi pañca kāmaguṇā va kāmadhātu nāma na tu vatthu kāma kilesa kāmā ati
translated: The discussion of “the intermediate existence” is concluded.🔽The discussion of “the five strands of sense pleasure as the sense-desire element, not the defilement of sense desire” is concluded.🔽The discussion of “the five sense bases as sense desire” is concluded.

original: pavattā kāmaguṇakathā. Pañcevāyatanāni kāmātikathā. Rūpadhammāva rūpadhātūtikathā.
analyzed: pavattā kāma guṇa kathā pañca iva āyatanāni kāma atikathā rūpa dhammā ava rūpa dhātu utikathā
translated: The discussion of “the form element as the form element consisting of the form dhammas” is concluded.

original: Arūpadhammāva arūpadhātūtikathā. Rūpadhātuyā sattā ghānādīhi saddhiṃ saḷāyatanikāti🔽pavattā rūpadhātuyāāyatanakathā. Āruppepi atthi sukhumarūpantikathā. Kāyavacīviññattivasena
analyzed: arūpa dhammā ava arūpa dhātu utikathā rūpa dhātuyā sattā ghāna ādīhi saddhim saḷāyatanikā ati  pavattā rūpa dhātuyā āyatana kathā āruppe pi atthi sukhuma rūpa nti kathā kāya vacī viññatti vasena
translated: The discussion of “the formless element as the formless element consisting of the formless dhammas” is concluded.🔽The discussion of “the six sense bases in the form element together with the nose, etc.” is concluded.🔽The discussion of “subtle form in the formless element” is concluded.🔽The discussion of “form as action by way of bodily and verbal intimation” is concluded.

original: rūpaṃ kammantikathā. Cittavippayutto arūpadhammova jīvitindriyaṃ, rūpajīvitindriyaṃ
analyzed: rūpam kammanti kathā citta vippayuttaḥ arūpa dhammaḥ uva jīvita indriyam rūpa jīvita indriyam
translated: The discussion of “the life faculty as a formless state dissociated from awareness, not a form-sphere life faculty” is concluded.

original: natthīti pavattā jīvitindriyakathā. Ariyupavādakammena arahattā parihāyatīti pavattā kammahetukathā.🔽Aniccādivasena saṅkhāre ādīnavato apassitvā nibbānaṃ ānisaṃsato passantassa saṃyojanappahānaṃ🔽hotīti pavattā ānisaṃsadassāvikathā. Nibbānārammaṇampi saṃyojanaṃ atthīti pavattā
analyzed: natthi iti pavattā jīvita indriya kathā ariya upavāda kammena arahattā parihāyati iti pavattā kamma hetu kathā  anicca ādi vasena saṅkhāre ādīnavataḥ a passitvā nibbānam ānisaṃsataḥ passantassa saṃyojana ppahānam  hoti iti pavattā nibbāna ārammaṇam pi saṃyojanam atthi iti pavattā
translated: The discussion going on as to whether or not there is a life faculty is the discussion of the life faculty. The discussion going on as to whether or not there is falling away from arahatship by the action of defaming an ariya is the discussion of the action of defaming an ariya.

original: amatārammaṇakathā. Rūpaṃ sārammaṇantikathā. Anusayā anārammaṇātikathā. Ñāṇaṃ anārammaṇantikathā.🔽Atītārammaṇañca anāgatārammaṇañca cittaṃ anārammaṇantikathādvayaṃ. Sabbaṃ cittaṃ🔽vitakkānupatitantikathā. Vitakkavipphārova saddo, so ca na sotaviññeyyoti pavattā
analyzed: amata ārammaṇa kathā rūpam sa ārammaṇa anti kathā anusayāḥ anārammaṇa ati kathāḥ ñāṇam anārammaṇa anti kathā  atīta ārammaṇañca anāgata ārammaṇañca cittam anārammaṇa nti kathā dvayam sabbam cittam  vitakka anupati tanti kathā vitakka vipphāraḥ va saddo so ca na sota viññeyyaḥ ti pavattā
translated: The discussion going on as to whether or not there is abandoning of fetters for one who sees danger in formations by way of impermanence, etc., and sees the benefit in nibbana is the discussion of seeing the benefit. The discussion going on as to whether or not there is a fetter with nibbana as its object is the discussion of nibbana as object. The discussion going on as to whether or not there is form as object is the discussion of form as object. The discussion going on as to whether or not there are latent tendencies without an object is the discussion of latent tendencies without an object. The discussion going on as to whether or not there is knowledge without an object is the discussion of knowledge without an object.

original: vitakkavipphārasaddakathā. Vināpi cittena vācā pavattatīti pavattā nayathācittassavācātikathā.
analyzed: vitakka vipphāra sadda kathā vinā api cittena vācā pavattati iti pavattā
translated: The two discussions going on as to whether or not there is consciousness with the past as its object and with the future as its object are the discussions of the past and future as objects. The discussion going on as to whether or not all consciousness is accompanied by applied thought is the discussion of all consciousness as accompanied by applied thought. The discussion going on as to whether or not sound is the outcome of applied thought, and whether or not it is cognizable by the ear is the discussion of sound as the outcome of applied thought. The discussion going on as to whether or not speech occurs without consciousness is the discussion of speech without consciousness.

original: Vināpi cittena kāyakammaṃ pavattatīti pavattā nayathācittassakāyakammantikathā. Atītehipi
analyzed: vinā api cittena kāya kammam pavattati iti pavattā atītehi pi
translated: “Bodily action occurs without consciousness” is the method of exposition. “Bodily action of one not in jhāna” is the method of exposition. “Bodily action of one in jhāna” is the method of exposition. “Bodily action of one in the immaterial sphere” is the method of exposition.

original: jhānehi, anāgatehipi yogino samannāgatāti pavattā atītānāgatasamannāgatakathā.🔽Bhavaṅgacitte aniruddhe eva kusalākusalacittāni uppajjanti, tadabhāve ca santatinirodho🔽siyāti pavattā nirodhakathā. Saha vācāhi viññattirūpaṃ maggotikathā. Pañcaviññāṇasamaṅgissāpi🔽maggabhāvanā atthīti pavattā pañcaviññāṇasamaṅgissamaggakathā. Pañcaviññāṇā kusalāpi🔽akusalāpītikathā. Pañcaviññāṇā sābhogātikathā. Maggakkhaṇe lokiyena, lokuttarena
analyzed: jhānehi anāgatehi pi yogino samannāgatā ati pavattā atīta anāgata samannāgata kathā  bhavaṅga citte aniruddhe eva kusala akusala cittāni uppajjanti tad abhāve ca santati nirodhaḥ  siyā ati pavattā nirodha kathā saha vācāhi viññatti rūpam magga uti kathā pañca viññāṇa samaṅgissa api  magga bhāvanā atthi iti pavattā pañca viññāṇa samaṅgiḥ sa magga kathā pañca viññāṇā kusalā api  akusalā api iti kathā pañca viññāṇā sa ābhoga atikathā magga kkhaṇe lokiyena lokuttarena
translated: “Bodily action occurs without consciousness” — this is the discussion of bodily action in one whose mind is not in conformity with his bodily action. “The meditator is endowed with the jhānas of the past and the future” — this is the discussion of the past and the future.

original: cāti dvīhi sīlehi yuttātikathā. Sīlaṃ acetasikantikathā. Sīlaṃ na cittānuparivattītikathā.
analyzed: ca ati dvīhi sīlehi yutta atikathā sīlam sīlam na citta anuparivatti itikathā
translated: “When the life-continuum is not interrupted, wholesome and unwholesome consciousnesses arise, and when it is interrupted, there is cessation” — this is the discussion of cessation. “The path is accompanied by speech” — this is the discussion of the path. “One who is accompanied by the five consciousnesses also develops the path” — this is the discussion of the path in one who is accompanied by the five consciousnesses. “The five consciousnesses are wholesome and unwholesome” — this is the discussion of the five consciousnesses. “The five consciousnesses are accompanied by greed” — this is the discussion of the five consciousnesses. “At the moment of the path, one is endowed with two kinds of virtue, mundane and supramundane” — this is the discussion of the two kinds of virtue. “Virtue is not mental” — this is the discussion of virtue. “Virtue does not follow consciousness” — this is the discussion of virtue.

original: Samādānahetucittavippayutto puññopacayo hotīti pavattā samādānahetukakathā. Viññatti
analyzed: samādāna hetu citta vippayutto puñña upacayaḥ hoti iti pavattā samādāna hetuka kathā viññatti
translated: “Merit is accumulated by one who is dissociated from the consciousness that is the cause of undertaking” — this is the discussion of the cause of undertaking. “Intimation is a bodily formation” — this is the discussion of intimation.

original: sīlantikathā. Pāṇātipātādayo vināpi viññattiṃ hontīti pavattā aviññattidussīlyakathā.🔽Anusayā abyākatā, ahetukā, cittavippayuttāti tissopi anusayakathā. Asekhassa ñāṇavippayuttappavattiyā🔽so ñāṇīti navattabboti pavattā ñāṇakathā. Ñāṇaṃ cittavippayuttantikathā. Maggakkhaṇe
analyzed: sīlanti kathā pāṇātipāta ādayaḥ vinā api viññattim honti iti pavattā aviññatti dussīlya kathā  anusayāḥ abyākatāḥ ahetukā citta vippayuttā ati tissaḥ pi anusaya kathāḥ asekhassa ñāṇa vippayutta ppavattiyā  so ñāṇī iti pavattā ñāṇa kathā ñāṇam citta vippayutta anti kathā magga kkhaṇe
translated: The discussion of virtue. The discussion of unvirtuousness not by intimation. Killing-breathing-things, etc., occur even without intimation.🔽The discussion of inherent tendencies. The inherent tendencies are indeterminate, without root cause, dissociated from awareness.🔽The discussion of knowledge. The discussion of knowledge dissociated from awareness. At the moment of the path🔽

original: idaṃ dukkhanti ñāṇaṃ pavattanti pavattā idaṃ dukkhantikathā. Buddhā iddhibalena āyukappaṃ🔽vināpi mahākappaṃ tiṭṭhantīti pavattā iddhibalakathā. Cittasantati samādhi, na ekacittakkhaṇikoti🔽pavattā samādhikathā. Avijjādipaṭiccasamuppādaṅgehi aññā dhammaṭṭhitatāti pavattā🔽dhammaṭṭhitatākathā. Rūpādīhi aññā aniccatāti pavattā aniccatākathā.
analyzed: idam dukkham ti ñāṇam pavattanti pavattā idam dukkham ti kathā buddhāḥ iddhi balena āyu kappam 🔽vinā api mahākappam tiṭṭhanti iti pavattā iddhi bala kathā citta santati samādhi na eka citta kkhaṇikaḥ ti 🔽pavattā samādhi kathā avijjā ādi paṭiccasamuppāda aṅgehi aññā dhamma ṭṭhita tā ti pavattā 🔽dhamma ṭṭhita tā kathā rūpa ādīhi aññā anicca tā ti pavattā anicca tā kathā
translated: The discussion of virtue. The discussion of non-virtue by way of the unprompted. The discussion of the latent tendencies. The discussion of knowledge. The discussion of the idea of the aggregates. The discussion of the idea of the elements. The discussion of the idea of the sense bases. The discussion of the idea of suffering. The discussion of the idea of the origin. The discussion of the idea of the cessation. The discussion of the idea of the path. The discussion of the idea of the fruit. The discussion of the idea of nibbāna.

original: Viññattiyo vināpi indriyasaṃvaro kāyavacīkammanti pavattā kathā. Sabbaṃ kammaṃ vipākajanakanti
analyzed: viññattiyaḥ vinā api indriya saṃvaro kāya vacī kamman ti pavattā kathā sabbam kammam vipāka janakanti
translated: The discussion that goes on about the bodily and verbal actions of one who has no restraint of faculties but only intimation is the discussion of action.

original: pavattā kammakathā. Saddo vipākoti pavattā kathā. Saḷāyatanaṃ vipākoti pavattā kathā.🔽Maggaṃ vināpi sattakkhattuparamotikathā. Tathā kolaṃkolaekabījikathāsupi. Diṭṭhisampanno
analyzed: pavattā kamma kathā saddo vipāko ti pavattā kathā saḷāyatanam vipāko ti pavattā kathā  maggam vinā api satta kkhattu paramaḥ ti kathā tathā kolaṃkola ekabīji kathāsu pi diṭṭhi sampanno
translated: The discussion that goes on about all action as producing ripening is the discussion of kamma. The discussion that goes on about sound as ripening is the discussion of ripening. The discussion that goes on about the sixfold base as ripening is the discussion of ripening.

original: jīvitā voropetītikathā. Diṭṭhisampannassa apāyaduggatiyā saddhiṃ rūpāditaṇhāsaṅkhātaduggatipahīnāti🔽pavattā duggatikathā. Sattamabhavikassa taṇhāsambhavato duggati appahīnāti pavattā
analyzed: jīvitā voropeti iti kathā diṭṭhi sampannassa apāya duggatiyā saddhim rūpa ādi taṇhā saṅkhāta duggati pahīnā ati  pavattā duggati kathā sattama bhavikassa taṇhā sambhavataḥ duggati appahīnā ati pavattā
translated: The discussion that goes on about the one who is limited to seven existences without taking the path is the discussion of the one limited to seven existences. Likewise the discussion of the one who is a stump-born and the discussion of the one who is a seed-of-one- shoot. The discussion that goes on about the one perfected in view as one who cannot deprive a living being of life is the discussion of the one perfected in view.

original: sattamabhavikakathā.
analyzed: sattama bhavika kathā
translated: The discussion that goes on about the one perfected in view as one who has abandoned evil destinations consisting of craving for materiality, etc., is the discussion of evil destinations. The discussion that goes on about the one who is limited to seven existences as one who has not abandoned evil destinations because of the possibility of craving is the discussion of the one limited to seven existences.

original: Saṅghabhedādikappaṭṭhaṃ kammaṃ katvā tena mahākappaṃ asītibhāgaṃ katvā tato ekabhāgamattaṃ🔽kālaṃ āyukappaṃ niraye paccantīti aggahetvā sakalaṃ mahākappaṃ paccanti, vinassamānepi
analyzed: saṅgha bheda ādi kappaṭṭham kammam katvā tena mahā kappam asīti bhāgam katvā tatas eka bhāga mattam 🔽kālam āyu kappam niraye paccanti iti aggahetvā sakalam mahā kappam paccanti vinassamāne pi
translated: The discussion that goes on about the action that lasts for an aeon, such as schism in the Community, as lasting for a hundred and forty-four thousand great aeons, taking a great aeon as eighty of these aeons, and then as one of these aeons is the discussion of the action that lasts for an aeon.🔽The discussion that goes on about the action that lasts for an aeon as lasting for a hundred and forty-four thousand great aeons, taking a great aeon as eighty of these aeons, and then as one of these aeons, and about the one who is limited to seven existences as one who has not abandoned evil destinations because of the possibility of craving, and about the one perfected in view as one who cannot deprive a living being of life, and about the one perfected in view as one who has abandoned evil destinations consisting of craving for materiality, etc., as lasting for a hundred and forty-four thousand great aeons, taking a great aeon as eighty of these aeons, and then as one of these aeons, and about the one who is limited to seven existences as one who has not abandoned evil destinations because of the possibility of craving, and about the one perfected in view as one who cannot deprive a living

original: kappe cakkavāḷantaresu paccantīti pavattā kappaṭṭhakathā. Saṅghabhedako appanākusalāni🔽viya kāmāvacarakusalampi na paṭilabhatīti pavattā kusalapaṭilābhakathā. Aṅgasampannāya🔽āṇattiyā abhāvepi mātughātādiānantariyakammapayojako micchattaniyato evāti pavattā🔽anantarāpayuttakathā. Aniyatadhammesupi keci kusalasampayuttāniyatā atthīti pavattā🔽niyatassa niyāmakathā. Nīvaraṇehi nivutena paṭicchanneneva cittena nīvaraṇaṃ pajahantīti🔽pavattā nivutakathā. Sammukhībhūtaṃ saṃyojanameva jahatīti pavattā sammukhībhūtakathā.🔽Samāpanno ca jhānārammaṇanikantiyā jhānaṃ assādetīti pavattā samāpanno assādetītikathā.
analyzed: kappe cakkavāḷa antaresu paccanti iti pavattā kappaṭṭhakathā saṅgha bhedakaḥ appanā kusalāni  kāmāvacara kusalam pi na paṭilabhati iti pavattā kusala paṭilābha kathā aṅga sampannāya  āṇattiyāḥ abhāve pi mātughāta ādi ānantariya kamma payojakaḥ eva ati pavattā  anantara apayutta kathā aniyata dhammesu pi keci kusala sampayutta aniyatā atthi iti pavattā  niyatassa niyāmakathā nīvaraṇehi nivutena paṭicchannena iva cittena nīvaraṇam pajahanti iti  pavattā nivuta kathā sammukhībhūtam saṃyojanam eva jahati iti pavattā sammukhībhūta kathā  samāpannaḥ ca jhāna ārammaṇa nikantiyā jhānam assādeti iti pavattā samāpannaḥ assādeti iti kathā
translated: The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “They occur in the interval between the world’s becoming and its non-becoming” is the discussion of the duration of an aeon.🔽The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “One who has committed a schism in the Community does not obtain profitable ideas as well as the unprofitable” is the discussion of the obtaining of profitable ideas.🔽The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “Even though there is no such thing as a command complete with factors” is the discussion of the immediate-proximity-condition.🔽The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “And in the case of indeterminate ideas too there is an indeterminate that is associated with profitable ideas” is the discussion of the determining of the indeterminate.🔽The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “One abandons the hindrances with a cognizance that is covered and concealed by the hindrances” is the discussion of the covered.🔽The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “One abandons only the fetter that is manifest” is the discussion of the manifest.🔽The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “And one who has entered upon jhana delights in the jhana’s object by relishing” is the discussion of the one who has entered upon delighting.

original: Dukkhavedanāyapi rāgassādavedanā hotīti pavattā assātarāgakathā. Dhammataṇhā abyākatātikathā.
analyzed: rāga ssāda vedanā hoti iti pavattā a ssāta rāga kathā dhamma taṇhā abyākata atikathā
translated: The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “They occur in the interval between the world’s creation and destruction” is the discussion of the duration of an aeon. The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “One who has committed schism in the Community does not obtain profitable ideas as well as the formless jhanas” is the discussion of the obtaining of profitable ideas. The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “Even though there is no such thing as a command complete with factors” is the discussion of the next rebirth of one who has committed the heinous crimes of immediate retribution. The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “Among indeterminate ideas too there are some that are indeterminate as associated with profitable ideas” is the discussion of the determining of the indeterminate. The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “One abandons the hindrances with a mind that is covered and concealed by the hindrances” is the discussion of the covered. The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “One abandons only the fetter that is manifest” is the discussion of the manifest. The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “One who has attained jhana delights in jhana by relishing the jhana’s object” is the discussion of one who has attained delighting. The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “There is relishing of lust even in painful feeling” is the discussion of relishing lust. The discussion that goes on in the way beginning, “The craving for ideas is indeterminate” is the discussion of the indeterminate.

original: Dhammataṇhā na dukkhasamudayotikathā.
analyzed: dhamma taṇhā na dukkha samudayā iti kathā
translated: Discussion as to whether craving for ideas is the origin of suffering.

original: Kusalaṃ vā akusalassa, akusalaṃ vā kusalassa anantarā uppajjantīti pavattā kusalākusalapaṭisandahanakathā.
analyzed: kusalam vā akusalassa akusalam vā kusalassa anantarā uppajjanti iti pavattā kusala akusala paṭisandahana kathā
translated: Discussion as to whether a profitable or unprofitable idea arises next to a profitable or unprofitable idea.

original: Gabbhaseyyakānampi bījamattaṃ saḷāyatanaṃ paṭisandhikkhaṇe uppajjatīti pavattā saḷāyatanuppattikathā.🔽Pañcaviññāṇāni aññamaññassa anantarā uppajjantīti pavattā anantarapaccayakathā. Sammāvācākammantaviññattiyo
analyzed: gabbhaseyyakānam pi bīja mattam saḷāyatanam paṭisandhi kkhaṇe uppajjati iti pavattā saḷāyatana uppatti kathā  pañca viññāṇāni aññamaññassa anantarā uppajjanti iti pavattā anantara paccaya kathā sammā vācā kammanta viññattiyo
translated: Discussion as to whether the mere seed of the sixfold base arises in the rebirth-linking of those who are to be reborn in a womb.🔽Discussion as to whether the five consciousnesses arise next to one another. Discussion as to whether right speech, right action, and right livelihood are materiality.

original: ariyarūpantikathā. Kāmarāgādito añño anusayotikathā. Kilesapariyuṭṭhānaṃ cittavippayuttantikathā.🔽Yathā kāmarāgo kāmadhātuyaṃ pariyāpanno, evaṃ rūparāgaarūparāgā rūpārūpabhūmiyaṃ

translated: Discussion as to whether the taints are associated with consciousness. Discussion as to whether there is any underlying tendency other than lust, etc. Discussion as to whether the perversions are dissociated from consciousness.
