original: Balappattā buddhādayo iddhibalena sattānaṃ cittaṃ rāgādianuppattiyā niggaṇhantīti🔽pavattā niggahakathā. Evaṃ kusaluppattiyā paracittapaggahanakathā. Buddhā iddhiyā🔽paresaṃ sukhaṃ dentīti pavattā sukhānuppadānakathā. “Saṅkhārā aniccā”ti manasikaroto

translated: Discussion of the “arising” of the profitable in others by the arousing of the knowledge of penetration of minds in others. Discussion of the “giving” of happiness by Buddhas by means of their supernormal power. Discussion of the “realization” of all formations classed according to past, future, and present, as objects, in a single act of adverting by one who is giving attention to “Impermanent are formations” in the way beginning “On the dissolution of the body after death …” .🔽Discussion of the “root-cause” of materiality. Discussion of the “root-cause and fruit” of materiality. Discussion of the “profitable and unprofitable” of materiality. Discussion of the “resultant” of materiality. Discussion of the “sense sphere, fine-material sphere, and immaterial sphere” of materiality arisen respectively through sense-sphere, fine-material-sphere, and immaterial-sphere kamma.

original: jātaṃ rūpaṃ rūpāvacarārūpāvacarantikathā. Rūparāgo rūpadhātuyā, arūparāgo ca arūpadhātuyā pariyāpannotikathā.
analyzed: jātam rūpam rūpāvacara a rūpa avacaranti kathā rūpa rāgaḥ rūpa dhātuyā a rūpa rāgaḥ ca a rūpa dhātuyā pariyāpannaḥ iti kathā
translated: Discussion of the “lust for materiality” and “lust for immateriality” as included in the fine-material and immaterial elements respectively.

original: Atthi arahato puññūpacayotikathā. Natthi arahato akālamaccūtikathā. Yaṃ kiñci uppajjati,🔽sabbamidaṃ kammatotikathā. Indriyabaddhameva dukkhaṃ, na sabbe saṅkhārāti pavattā🔽indriyabaddhakathā. Sabbe saṅkhārā dukkhā ṭhapetvā ariyamaggantikathā. Maggaphalāneva
analyzed: atthi arahato puññūpacayā iti kathā natthi arahataḥ akāla maccu iti kathā yat kiñci uppajjati  sabbam idam kamma toti kathā indriya baddham eva dukkham na sabbe saṅkhārā ati pavattā  indriya baddha kathā sabbe saṅkhārā dukkhā ṭhapetvā ariya magga nti kathā magga phalāni eva
translated: Discussion: “There is no untimely death for an Arahant.”🔽Discussion: “Whatever arises, all that arises only through kamma.”🔽Discussion: “Only what is bound up with the faculties is suffering, not all formations.”

original: saṅgho nāma, na ca tāni dakkhiṇaṃ paṭiggaṇhanti, tasmā na vattabbaṃ saṅgho dakkhiṇaṃ
analyzed: saṅghaḥ nāma na ca tāni dakkhiṇam paṭiggaṇhanti tasmā na vattabbam saṅghaḥ dakkhiṇam
translated: Discussion: “All formations are suffering.” Discussion: “Only the path and the fruition are the Sangha, and they do not receive an offering. Therefore it should not be said that the Sangha receives an offering.”🔽Discussion: “It should not be said that the Sangha purifies an offering.”

original: paṭiggaṇhātītikathā. Tathā na vattabbaṃ saṅgho dakkhiṇaṃ visodhetītikathā. Na vattabbaṃ
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhāti iti kathā tathā na vattabbam saṅghaḥ dakkhiṇam visodheti iti kathā na vattabbam
translated: Discussion: “It should not be said that the Sangha eats.”

original: saṅgho bhuñjatītikathā. Na vattabbaṃ saṅghassa dinnaṃ mahapphalantikathā. Buddhā
analyzed: saṅghaḥ bhuñjati iti kathā na vattabbam saṅghassa dinnam mahapphalanti kathā buddhā
translated: Discussion: “What is given to the Sangha has great fruit.”

original: na kiñci bhuñjanti, tasmā na vattabbaṃ buddhassa dinnaṃ mahapphalantikathā. Dāyakato
analyzed: na kiñci bhuñjanti tasmā na vattabbam buddhassa dinnam mahapphalantikathā dāyakato
translated: Discussion: “The Buddhas do not eat anything. Therefore it should not be said that what is given to the Buddha has great fruit.”

original: dānaṃ visujjhati, na paṭiggāhakatoti pavattā dakkhiṇāvisuddhikathā.
analyzed: dānam visujjhati na paṭiggāhakato ti pavattā dakkhiṇā visuddhi kathā
translated: Discussion: “The gift is purified by the giver, not by the receiver.”

original: Buddhā tusitaloke eva nibbattanti, na manussaloke. Ettha hi nimmitarūpamattaṃ dassentīti🔽pavattā manussalokakathā. Nimmitarūpaṃ dhammaṃ deseti, na buddhoti pavattā dhammadesanākathā.
analyzed: buddhā tusita loke eva nibbattanti na manussa loke ettha hi nimmita rūpa mattam dassenti iti  pavattā manussa loka kathā nimmita rūpam dhammam deseti na buddhaḥ ti pavattā dhamma desanā kathā
translated: Buddhas are reborn only in the Tusita heaven, not in the human world. The discussion that proceeds thus: “For here they show only created materiality”🔽is the discussion of the human world. The discussion that proceeds thus: “Created materiality teaches the Dhamma, not the Buddha”

original: Rāgova karuṇā nāma, tato natthi buddhānaṃ karuṇātikathā. Buddhānaṃ uccārapassāvo
analyzed: rāgaḥ uva karuṇā nāma tatas na atthi buddhānam karuṇā atikathā buddhānam uccāra passāvaḥ
translated: is the discussion of the teaching of the Dhamma. The discussion that proceeds thus: “Craving itself is called compassion; there is no compassion apart from that of the Buddhas”

original: aññe gandhajāte ativiya adhigaṇhātīti pavattā gandhajātakathā. Buddhā ekena maggena
analyzed: aññe gandha jāte ativiya adhigaṇhāti iti pavattā gandha jāta kathā buddhā ekena maggena
translated: is the discussion of compassion. The discussion that proceeds thus: “The Buddhas’ urine and excrement are superior to other people’s perfumes”

original: cattāri sāmaññaphalāni sacchikarontīti pavattā ekamaggakathā. Parikammādiṃ vināva🔽paṭhamādijjhānā dutiyādijjhānaṃ saṅkamatīti pavattā jhānasaṅkantikathā. Pañcakanaye
analyzed: cattāri sāmañña phalāni sacchikaronti iti pavattā eka magga kathā parikamma ādim vinā ava  paṭhama ādi jhānā dutiya ādi jhānam saṅkamati iti pavattā jhāna saṅkanti kathā pañcaka naye
translated: is the discussion of perfumes. The discussion that proceeds thus: “The Buddhas realize the four fruits of asceticism by a single path”🔽is the discussion of the single path. The discussion that proceeds thus: “Without preliminary work, etc., the first jhāna enters upon the second jhāna, etc.”

original: avitakkavicāramattaṃ jhānaṃ visuṃ jhānaṃ nāma na hoti, jhānantarikaṃ nāma hotīti
analyzed: avitakka vicāra mattam jhānam visum jhānam nāma na hoti jhā ānantarikam nāma hoti iti
translated: is the discussion of the linking of jhānas. The discussion that proceeds thus: “In the fivefold reckoning, the jhāna without thinking and with only the second jhāna is not called a jhāna, it is called the threshold of the second jhāna”🔽is the discussion of the threshold of the jhānas. The discussion that proceeds thus: “One who is possessed of jhāna hears sounds”

original: pavattā jhānantarikakathā. Samāpanno saddaṃ suṇātītikathā. Viññāṇaṃ vinā pasādacakkhunā
analyzed: pavattā jhāna āntarika kathā samāpannaḥ saddam suṇāti iti kathā viññāṇam vinā pasāda cakkhunā
translated: is the discussion of hearing sounds. The discussion that proceeds thus: “Without consciousness, the purified-material-existence eye”

original: rūpaṃ passatītikathā.
analyzed: rūpam passati iti kathā
translated: Discussion of “he sees materiality.”🔽Discussion of “he abandons defilements that are momentary.”

original: Tekālike kilese pajahatīti pavattā kilesappajahanakathā. Nibbānasaṅkhātāpi suññatā
analyzed: tekālike kilese pajahati iti pavattā kilesa ppajahana kathā nibbāna saṅkhātā api suñña tā
translated: Discussion of “voidness” as Nibbāna,🔽Discussion of “voidness” as the aggregate of mental formations.

original: saṅkhārakkhandhapariyāpannāti pavattā suññatakathā. Asaṅkhatameva sāmaññaphalantikathā.🔽Yesaṃ kesañci dhammānaṃ paṭilābhā asaṅkhatāti pavattā pattikathā. Sabbadhammānaṃ🔽sabhāvasaṅkhātā tathatā asaṅkhatāti pavattā tathatākathā. Anavajjaṭṭhena nibbānampi
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā ati pavattā suññata kathā asaṅkhatam eva sāmañña phalanti kathā  yesam kesañci dhammānam paṭilābhāḥ asaṅkhatā ati pavattā patti kathā sabba dhammānam  sa bhāva saṅkhātā tathatā asaṅkhatā ati pavattā tathatā kathā anavajja ṭṭhena nibbānam pi
translated: Discussion of “the fruit of recluseship” as the unformed element.🔽Discussion of “the path” as the acquisition of any of the states beginning with the first jhāna.🔽Discussion of “suchness” as the individual essences of all states.🔽Discussion of “the profitable” as Nibbāna in the sense of blameless.

original: kusalantikathā. Ānantariyādiṃ vināpi atthi puthujjanassa accantaniyāmatātikathā.
analyzed: kusala antikathā ānantariya ādim vinā api atthi puthujjanassa accanta niyāma tā atikathā
translated: Discussion of the fact that there is no absolute certainty for the ordinary man even without the immediate conditions for the states of punishment.

original: Lokiyasaddhādayo na indriyānīti pavattā indriyakathā.
analyzed: lokiya saddhā ādayaḥ na indriyāni iti pavattā indriya kathā
translated: Discussion of the faculties, which is that “Worldly faith, etc., are not faculties.”🔽Discussion of “unintentional” as the immediate cause.

original: Asañciccāpi ānantariko hotīti pavattā asañciccakathā. Natthi puthujjanassa ñāṇanti
analyzed: a sañcicca api ānantariko hoti iti pavattā asañcicca kathā natthi puthujjanassa ñāṇan ti
translated: Discussion of “knowledge,” which is that “The ordinary man has no knowledge.”

original: pavattā ñāṇakathā. Nerayikānaṃ kammāneva nirayapālarūpena vadhenti, na nirayapālāti
analyzed: pavattā ñāṇa kathā nerayikānam kammān eva niraya pāla rūpena vadhenti na
translated: Discussion of “hell,” which is that “The beings in hell say that it is only their own kamma that appears to them in the form of the warders of hell, not that there are warders of hell.”

original: pavattā nirayapālakathā. Atthi devesu tiracchānātikathā. Viratittayaṃ cittavippayuttaṃ,
analyzed: pavattā niraya pāla kathā atthi devesu virati ttayam citta vippayuttam
translated: and the discussion of the hell-guardians. “There is talk of gods and of animals,” and the discussion of the three planes of existence as being dissociated from consciousness.

original: pañcaṅgikova maggoti pavattā maggakathā. Paṭiccasamuppādesu ñāṇaṃ lokuttaranti pavattā ñāṇakathā.🔽Tisso saṅgītiyo ārabbha sāsanaṃ navaṃ katanti pavattā sāsanakathā. Puthujjano ekakkhaṇe🔽tedhātukehi dhammehi avivittoti pavattā avivittakathā. Ñeyyāvaraṇahetukaṃ kiñci saṃyojanaṃ
analyzed: pañcaṅgikaḥ iva maggaḥ ti pavattā magga kathā paṭiccasamuppādesu ñāṇam lokuttaranti pavattā ñāṇa kathā  tissaḥ saṅgītiyaḥ ārabbha sāsanam navam katanti pavattā sāsana kathā puthujjanaḥ eka khaṇe  te dhātukehi dhammehi avivittā ti pavattā avivitta kathā ñeyya āvaraṇa hetukam kiñci saṃyojanam
translated: “The path consists of five factors only,” and the discussion of the path. “The knowledge of dependent origination is supramundane,” and the discussion of knowledge.

original: appahāyapi arahā hotīti pavattā saṃyojanakathā. “Saṅkhārā niccā hontu, rukkhā niccapupphaphalādiyuttā🔽khemino hontū”tiādinā yathādhippāyaṃ iddhi pavattatīti pavattā iddhikathā. Buddhānaṃ
analyzed: arahā hoti iti pavattā saṃyojana kathā saṅkhārāḥ niccāḥ hontu rukkhāḥ nicca puppha phala ādi yuttā  kheminaḥ hontu utiādinā yathā adhippāyam iddhi pavattati iti pavattā iddhi kathā buddhānam
translated: “The Dispensation is renewed with the three councils as its starting point,” and the discussion of the Dispensation. “The worldling is not devoid of any of the dhammas in the three planes,” and the discussion of non-devoidness. “Some fetter may not be abandoned even though one becomes an arahat,” and the discussion of the fetters. “May formations be permanent! May trees be laden with permanent flowers and fruits!🔽May all beings be happy!” and so on, and the discussion of the supernormal powers. “There is a difference among the Buddhas

original: sarīraāyupabhāvemattato aññāpi vemattatā atthīti pavattā buddhakathā. Ekasmiṃ khaṇe
analyzed: sarīra āyu pabhā vemattato aññā api vematta tā atthi iti pavattā buddha kathā ekasmim khaṇe
translated: apart from the difference in their life-span, physical appearance, and enjoyment,” and the discussion of the Buddhas. “In a single moment

original: sabbalokadhātūsu aneke buddhā santīti pavattā sabbadisākathā. Sabbe dhammā niyatāti
analyzed: sabba lokadhātūsu aneke buddhāḥ santi iti pavattā sabba disā kathā sabbe dhammāḥ niyatā ati
translated: The talk that there are many Buddhas in all the world-spheres is the talk about all directions. The talk that all ideas are fixed is

original: pavattā dhammakathā. Sabbakammāni phaladāne niyatānīti pavattā kammakathā.
analyzed: pavattā dhamma kathā sabba kammāni phala dāne niyatāni iti pavattā kamma kathā
translated: the talk about ideas. The talk that all actions are fixed in giving results is the talk about action.

original: Arahā asabbaññubhāvena sabbaññuvisaye kiñci saṃyojanaṃ appahāya parinibbātīti pavattā🔽parinibbānakathā. Arahā kusalacitto parinibbāyatīti pavattā kusalacittakathā. Arahā🔽āneñje saṇṭhito parinibbāyatīti pavattā āneñjakathā. Atthi gabbhaseyyāya dhammābhisamayo,
analyzed: arahā a sabbaññu bhāvena sabbaññu visaye kiñci saṃyojanam a pahāya parinibbāti iti pavattā  parinibbāna kathā arahā kusala citto parinibbāyati iti pavattā kusala citta kathā arahā  āneñje saṇṭhitaḥ parinibbāyati iti pavattā āneñja kathā atthi gabbhaseyyāya dhamma abhisamayaḥ
translated: The talk that an Arahant attains extinction without having abandoned any fetter by virtue of not being omniscient is the talk about

original: atthi gabbhaseyyāya arahattappatti, supinante dhammābhisamayo, arahattappatti cāti🔽pavattā tissopi kathā. Sabbaṃ supinacittaṃ abyākatantikathā. Khaṇikatāya cittānaṃ
analyzed: atthi gabbhaseyyāya arahatta patti supina ante dhamma abhisamayaḥ arahatta patti ca ati  pavattā tissaḥ api kathā sabbam supina cittam abyākata anti kathā khaṇika tāya cittānam
translated: attaining extinction. The talk that an Arahant attains extinction with a profitable cognizance is the talk about a profitable cognizance. The talk that an Arahant attains extinction in the imperturbable is the talk about the imperturbable. The talk that there is penetration of ideas and there is the attainment of Arahantship while lying in the womb,

original: natthi āsevanapaccayatātikathā. Sabbe saṅkhatā ekacittakkhaṇikāti pavattā khaṇikakathā.
analyzed: natthi āsevana paccaya tā atikathā sabbe saṅkhatāḥ eka citta khaṇikā ti pavattā khaṇika kathā
translated: and that there is penetration of ideas and the attainment of Arahantship in a dream is the talk about the three. The talk that all cognizance in a dream is indeterminate is the talk about the indeterminate. The talk that cognizances have no conditionality as repetition because of their momentary nature is the talk about conditionality. The talk that all determinations are momentary is the talk about the momentary.

original: Itthiyā saddhiṃ ekato sampattiṃ anubhavissāmāti pūjādiṃ katvā ekādhippāyappattassa🔽bhikkhuno methuno dhammo paṭisevitabboti pavattā ekādhippāyakathā. Pāpabhikkhūsu
analyzed: itthiyā saddhim ekatas sampattim anubhavissāma iti pūjā ādim katvā eka adhippāya ppattassa  bhikkhunaḥ methunaḥ dhammo paṭisevitabbaḥ ti pavattā eka adhippāya kathā pāpa bhikkhūsu
translated: he has sexual intercourse with her, this is called a conversation about a single purpose.

original: methunaṃ paṭisevantesu arahantānaṃ vaṇṇena amanussā methunaṃ paṭisevantīti pavattā🔽arahantavaṇṇakathā. Keci sattā attano issariyena kāmakārikāvasena vinipātaṃ gacchanti,
analyzed: methunam paṭisevantesu arahantānam vaṇṇena amanussāḥ methunam paṭisevanti iti pavattā  arahanta vaṇṇa kathā keci sattāḥ attanaḥ issariyena kāmakārikā vasena vinipātam gacchanti
translated: When wicked bhikkhus have sexual intercourse, non-human beings have intercourse because of the praise of the arahants. This is called a conversation about the praise of the arahants.🔽Some beings go to the states of loss because of their own sovereignty and because of their indulgence in sensual pleasures, not because of kamma. This is called a conversation about sovereignty and indulgence in sensual pleasures.

original: na kammavasenāti pavattā issariyakāmakārikākathā. Na rāgo rāgapatirūpakotiādi patirūpakathā.
analyzed: na kamma vasena ati pavattā issariya kāma kārikā kathā na rāgaḥ rāga patirūpakā uti ādi patirūpa kathā
translated: “Lust is not lust, a lust-like state is a lust-like state,” etc., is called a conversation about a like state.

original: Khandhāyatanādayo aparinipphannāti pavattā aparinipphannakathāti sādhikadvisatakathā.🔽Pāḷiyaṃ aṭṭhamukhavādayuttivaseneva sammitiyādīnaṃ bhinnaladdhikānaṃ laddhibhedavasena
analyzed: khandha āyatana ādayaḥ a parinipphannā ati pavattā a parinipphanna kathā ati sa adhika dvisata kathā  pāḷiyam aṭṭhamukha vāda yutti vasena iva sammitiya ādīnam bhinna laddhikānam laddhi bheda vasena
translated: The aggregates, sense bases, etc., are not fully developed. This is called a conversation about what is not fully developed. Thus there are two hundred conversations with a basis.

original: nānāpakārato vibhattā, tā pana sabbakathā puggalakathāva. Tā taṃtaṃladdhibhedavasena
analyzed: nānā apakārataḥ vibhattā tā pana sabba kathā puggala kathā va tā taṃ taṃ laddhi bheda vasena
translated: In the texts, the various kinds of conversations are distinguished according to the different opinions of the various schools, such as the Sammitiyas, etc., by means of the eight kinds of verbal expression. But all these conversations are really about persons.

original: saṅkhepatopi vuccamānā atibhāriyaṃ ganthaṃ karonti, tasmā na vitthāritā. Taṃ pana
analyzed: saṅkhepataḥ pi vuccamānāḥ atibhāriyam gantham karonti tasmā na vitthāritā tam pana
translated: and when it is told in brief, they make the text too condensed, so it is not expanded. But it is

original: nayaṃ icchantehi pāḷiaṭṭhakathāsu eva vitthārato gahetabboti ayamettha pāḷinayena🔽saddhiṃ atthavinicchayo.🔽Mohavicchedaniyā abhidhammamātikatthavaṇṇanāya🔽Kathāvatthumātikatthavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nayam icchantehi pāḷi aṭṭhakathāsu eva vitthārataḥ gahetabbaḥ iti ayam ettha pāḷi nayena  saddhim attha vinicchayo
translated: If they were told in brief, they would make the text too heavy, so they are not given in detail here. But those who want them can be learned in detail from the texts and commentaries. This is the exposition of the meaning together with the text.

original: 6. Yamakamātikā
translated: The exposition of the Abhidhamma and the Kathāvatthu in the Dhammasanganī, which is the first of the nine Piṭaka-texts, is finished.🔽The Book of the Twos

original: Mūlayamakamātikatthavaṇṇanā🔽Idāni yamakamātikāya saṃvaṇṇanānayo hoti. Sā panesā mūlayamakamātikā khandhaāyatanadhātusaccasaṅkhāraanusayacittadhammaindriyayamakamātikāti🔽dasavidhā hoti. Kenaṭṭhena cettha yamakanti? Yugaḷaṭṭhena. Yugaḷaṃ hi “yamakapāṭihāriyaṃ”,
analyzed: idāni yamaka mātikāya saṃvaṇṇanā anayaḥ hoti sā pana isā mūla yamaka mātikā khandha āyatana dhātu sacca saṅkhāra anusaya citta dhamma indriya yamaka mātikā ati  dasavidhā hoti kena ṭṭhena ca ittha yamakan ti yugaḷa ṭṭhena yugaḷam hi yamaka pāṭihāriyam
translated: The Book of the Twos: The Root Twos🔽Now there follows the method of exposition of the Twos. This Root Twos is of ten kinds as the Twos of the Categories, Bases, Elements, Truths, Formations, Taints, Canals, Cognitions, Faculties, and Ideas.🔽In what sense are they a “twofold” ? In the sense of a pair. For a pair is called a “twofold” in such passages as “The twofold miracle of Dhamma and of psychic power” , “The twofold hall” ,

original: “yamakasālā”tiādīsu “yamaka”nti vuccati, iti yugaḷasaṅkhātānaṃ yamakānaṃ vasena desitattā
translated: and so on. So they are taught under the heading of “twofold” in the sense of a pair.

original: imesu dasasu ekekampi, etesaṃ vibhajanattā niddesopi, sabbesaṃ samūhattā pakaraṇampi
analyzed: imesu dasasu ekekam pi etesam vibhajana ttā niddesaḥ api sabbesam samūha ttā pakaraṇam pi
translated: and each of these ten is a definition because it defines them, and a chapter because it is a collection of all of them.

original: yamakaṃ nāma. Idha panetā niddesayamakaṃ upādāya “yamakamātikā”tveva vuttā, tāsaṃ
analyzed: yamakam nāma idha pana itā niddesa yamakam upādāya vuttā tāsam
translated: This is called a “twin.” But here the “twin schedule” is mentioned only in the sense of the definition twin.

original: pana dasannaṃ yamakamātikānaṃ mūlayamakamātikā ādi. Tatthāpi “ye keci kusalā dhammā,
analyzed: pana dasannam yamaka mātikānam mūlayamaka mātikā ādi tattha api ye keci kusalāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: And of these ten twin schedules, the root twin schedule is the first. And in that schedule the twin is this:🔽“Whatever are wholesome states, are they all wholesome roots?

original: sabbe te kusalamūlā. Ye vā pana kusalamūlā, sabbe te dhammā kusalā”ti idaṃ yamakaṃ
analyzed: sabbe te kusala mūlāḥ ye vā pana kusala mūlā sabbe te dhammā kusalā ti idam yamakam
translated: Or are those that are wholesome roots all wholesome states?”

original: ādi. Tassa kusalamūlasaṅkhātānaṃ dvinnaṃ atthānaṃ vasena atthayamakanti vā, tesaññeva
analyzed: ādi tassa kusala mūla saṅkhātānam dvinnam atthānam vasena attha yamakanti vā tesañca eva
translated: This twin is a meaning twin because it is about two meanings called “wholesome roots,”

original: atthānaṃ anulomato paṭilomato pavattapāḷidhammavasena dhammayamakanti vā, anulomapaṭilomato
analyzed: atthānam anulomataḥ paṭilomataḥ pavatta pāḷi dhamma vasena dhammayamakanti vā anuloma paṭilomato
translated: or it is a law twin because it is about the text of the True Idea occurring in forward and reverse order,

original: pavattapucchāvasena pucchāyamakanti vā tidhā yamakabhāvo veditabbo. Sesesupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: pavatta pucchā vasena pucchāyamakanti vā tidhā yamaka bhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ sesesu pi esā iva nayo
translated: or it is a question twin because the question occurs in forward and reverse order. The twinness should be understood as threefold thus. The same method applies in the other cases.

original: Idāni imesaṃ yamakānaṃ vasena desitāya imissā mūlayamakamātikāya tāva nayayamakapucchāatthavārappabhedavasena🔽pāḷivavatthānaṃ evaṃ veditabbaṃ – kusalattikamātikāya hi “kusalā dhammā”ti idaṃ ādipadaṃ
analyzed: idāni imesam yamakānam vasena desitāya imissā mūlayamaka mātikāya tāva naya yamaka pucchā attha vāra ppabheda vasena  pāḷi vavatthānam evam veditabbam kusala ttika mātikāya hi kusalāḥ dhammāḥ ti idam ādi padam
translated: Now, in this Root-Couplet-Matrix taught by means of these couplets, the exposition of the text should be understood as follows:

original: nissāya mūlanayo mūlamūlanayo mūlakanayo mūlamūlakanayoti ime cattāro nayā honti.
analyzed: nissāya mūla nayaḥ mūla mūla nayaḥ mūlaka nayaḥ mūlaka nayaḥ iti ime cattāro nayāḥ honti
translated: In the case of the “wholesome triad” matrix, there are four methods, namely, the root method, the root-of-the-root method, the branch method, and the branch-of-the-branch method, based on the first term “wholesome states” .

original: Tesu ekekasmiṃ naye mūlayamakaṃ ekamūlayamakaṃ aññamaññamūlayamakanti tīṇi tīṇi yamakānīti
analyzed: tesu eka ekasmin naye mūla yamakam eka mūla yamakam aññam añña mūla yamakam ti tīṇi tīṇi yamakāni iti
translated: In each of these methods there are three couplets, namely, root couplet, single root couplet, and mutual root couplet.

original: dvādasa yamakāni. Ekekasmiṃ yamake anulomapaṭilomavasena dve dve pucchāti catuvīsati
analyzed: dvādasa yamakāni eka ekasmin yamake anuloma paṭiloma vasena dve dve catuvīsati
translated: So there are twelve couplets. In each couplet there are two questions, one in forward order and one in reverse order, making twenty-four questions.

original: pucchā, ekekapucchāya sanniṭṭhānasaṃsayavasena dve dve atthāti aṭṭhacattālīsa atthā.
analyzed: pucchā ekeka pucchāya sanniṭṭhāna saṃsaya vasena dve dve atthā ati aṭṭhacattālīsa atthā
translated: And to each question there are two answers, one in the case of a decision and one in the case of a doubt, making forty-eight answers.

original: Tattha ye keci kusalāti kusalesu “kusalā nu kho, na kusalā nu kho”ti sandehābhāvato
analyzed: tattha ye keci kusalā ati kusalesu kusalāḥ nu kho na kusalāḥ nu kho ti sandeha abhāvato
translated: Herein, “Any wholesome states” : since there is no doubt as to whether wholesome states are wholesome or not,

original: imasmiṃ pade sanniṭṭhānattho veditabbo. Sabbe te kusalamūlāti “sabbe te kusalā dhammā
analyzed: imasmin pade sanniṭṭhāna tthaḥ veditabbaḥ sabbe te kusala mūlā ati sabbe te kusalāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: The meaning of “decision” should be understood here.

original: kusalamūlā nu kho, na nu kho”ti evaṃ vimativasena pucchitattā imasmiṃ pade saṃsayattho🔽veditabbo. So ca kho veneyyānaṃ saṃsayaṭṭhāne saṃsayaṃ dīpetvā taṃvinodanatthaṃ bhagavatā
analyzed: kusala mūlāḥ nu kho na nu kho ti evam vimati vasena pucchita ttā imasmin pade saṃsaya attho  veditabbaḥ saḥ ca kho veneyyānam saṃsaya ṭṭhāne saṃsayam dīpetvā tad vinodana attham bhagavatā
translated: All those things are roots of the profitable: because of the question asked thus, “Are all those things profitable, or are they not?” the meaning of “doubt” should be understood here.🔽And that is stated by the Blessed One for the purpose of removing the doubt of those who are in doubt about the place of doubt. But the Tathāgata has no place of doubt.

original: vutto, tathāgatassa pana saṃsayaṭṭhānaṃ nāma natthi. Ito paresupi pucchāpadesu eseva
analyzed: vuttaḥ tathāgatassa pana saṃsaya ṭṭhānam nāma natthi itas paresu pi pucchā padesu esā iva
translated: The same method applies in the case of the other terms of the question.

original: nayo. Yathā ca kusalapadaṃ nissāya ime catunayādayo honti, akusalapadaṃ nissāyapi
analyzed: nayaḥ yathā ca kusala padam nissāya ime catu naya ādayaḥ honti akusala padam
translated: And just as there are these four sets of sixteen terms, etc., based upon the term “profitable,”🔽so there are also based upon the term “unprofitable” and based upon the term “indeterminate.”

original: tatheva, abyākatapadaṃ nissāyapi tatheva, kusalādīni tīṇipi padāni ekato katvā niddiṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: tathā iva abyākata padam tathā iva kusala ādīni tīṇi pi padāni ekatas katvā niddiṭṭham
translated: And the term “idea” is demonstrated by combining the three terms “profitable,” etc., together.

original: nāmapadaṃ nissāya tathevāti kusalattikamātikāya catūsu padesu sabbepi soḷasa nayā,
analyzed: nāmapadam nissāya tathā iva ati kusalattika mātikāya catūsu padesu sabbe pi soḷasa nayāḥ
translated: So there are sixteen terms in each of the four terms of the question in the case of the dyad of the profitable triad,

original: aṭṭhacattālīsa yamakāni, channavuti pucchā, dvānavutisataṃ atthā ca uddesavasena
analyzed: aṭṭhacattālīsa yamakāni channavuti pucchā dvānavuti satam atthā ca uddesa vasena
translated: making forty-eight dyads, eighty-one triads, and one hundred and sixty-two questions,

original: vuttāti veditabbā. Ettāvatā mūlavāro hetuvāro nidānavāro sambhavavāro pabhavavāro
analyzed: vuttā iti veditabbā ettāvatā mūlavāraḥ hetuvāraḥ nidānavāraḥ sambhavavāraḥ pabhavavāro
translated: should be understood.🔽So far, the ten sections have been reached: the root section, the cause section, the source section, the origin section, the birth section,

original: samuṭṭhānavāro āhāravāro ārammaṇavāro paccayavāro samudayavāroti sabbepi dasa vārā
analyzed: samuṭṭhāna vāraḥ āhāra vāraḥ ārammaṇa vāraḥ paccaya vāraḥ samudaya vāraḥ ti sabbe pi dasa vārāḥ
translated: the arising section, the production section, the condition section, the origination section.

original: honti. Tattha mūlavāre āgataparicchedeneva avasesesupi nayādayo veditabbā. Pāḷi panettha🔽atisaṃkhittā. Iti sabbesupi dasasu vāresu saṭṭhisataṃ nayā, asītiadhikāni cattāri
analyzed: honti tattha mūla vāre āgata paricchedena iva avasesesu pi naya ādayaḥ veditabbā pana ittha  atisaṃkhittāḥ iti sabbesu pi dasasu vāresu saṭṭhi satam nayāḥ asīti adhikāni cattāri
translated: Herein, the method, etc., should be understood by the method of exposition given in the root section in the rest of the sections as well. But the text🔽is very condensed here.

original: yamakasatāni, saṭṭhiadhikāni nava pucchāsatāni, vīsādhikāni ekūnavīsati atthasatāni🔽ca uddiṭṭhānīti veditabbāni.🔽Evamettha nayayamakapucchā atthavārappabhedavasena pāḷivavatthānaṃ viditvā idāni
analyzed: yamaka satāni saṭṭhi adhikāni nava pucchā satāni vīsa adhikāni ekūnavīsati attha satāni  ca uddiṭṭhāni iti veditabbāni  evam ettha naya yamaka pucchāḥ attha vāra ppabheda vasena pāḷi vavatthānam viditvā idāni
translated: So in all the ten sections the methods are six hundred, the dyads are four hundred and eighty, the triads are nine hundred and sixty, and the tetrads are one thousand nine hundred and twenty.🔽This is how the exposition of the text should be understood here by means of the method of exposition classed according to method, dyad, triad, and tetrad.

original: tassā anuttānapadatthānusāreneva vibhaṅganayasahito saṅkhepatthavaṇṇanānayo evaṃ
translated: Now, the method of exposition of the meaning in brief, together with the method of analysis, should be understood as follows, by following the meaning of the words that are not clear.

original: veditabbo – tattha ye kecīti anavasesavacanaṃ. Kusalā dhammāti anavajjasukhavipākā
analyzed: veditabbaḥ tattha ye keci iti anavasesa vacanam kusalā dhammā ati anavajja sukha vipākā
translated: Herein, “whatever” is a word for non-excess. “Profitable states” are blameless and have a happy outcome.

original: nissattasabhāvā. Sabbe te kusalamūlāti kiṃ te sabbeyeva kusalamūlā hontīti pucchā.

translated: But there is no answer to this in the Schedule. For in the Schedule the question is stated in all cases

analyzed: niddesa nayena iva vissajjana mukham dassayissāma ye keci kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sabbe

original: te kusalamūlā”ti pucchāya vibhaṅganayena idaṃ vissajjanamukhaṃ. “Tīṇeva kusalamūlāni,🔽avasesā kusalā dhammā na kusalamūlā”ti tassā cāyamattho – na te sabbe kusalā dhammā🔽kusalamūlāni honti, alobhādīni pana tīṇeva kusalamūlānīti. Ye vā pana kusalamūlā
analyzed: te kusala mūlā ati pucchāya vibhaṅga nayena idam vissajjana mukham tīṇi iva kusala mūlāni  avasesā kusalā dhammā na kusala mūlā ti tassā ca ayam attho na te sabbe kusalāḥ dhammā  kusala mūlāni honti alobha ādīni pana tīṇi iva kusala mūlāni iti ye vā pana kusala mūlā
translated: “There are three wholesome roots,🔽the rest of the wholesome states are not wholesome roots.” The meaning of this is that not all wholesome states are wholesome roots, but only the three, non-greed, etc., are wholesome roots.

original: tayo alobhādayo kusalānaṃ mūlāti vuttā, sabbe te kusalā dhammāti kiṃ te sabbe tayopi
analyzed: tayo alobha ādayaḥ kusalānam mūlā ati vuttā sabbe te kusalāḥ dhammā ati kim te sabbe tayo api
translated: Or alternatively, those that are wholesome roots, the three beginning with non-greed, are called “roots of the wholesome,” are all those wholesome states? —this is the question.

original: dhammā kusalāti pucchā. Tassā niddese “āmantā”ti vissajjanaṃ. Tassa tesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ
analyzed: dhammā kusalā ati pucchā tassā niddese āmantā ati vissajjanam tassa tesam tiṇṇam

translated: “Are ideas profitable?” is the question. “Yes, friends,” is the answer. The meaning is that he agrees that the three roots are profitable. This, firstly, is the method of the single root in the case of the method of the roots.

original: kusalamūlena ekamūlā, sabbe te dhammā kusalāti pucchā. Tassā pana kusalacittasamuṭṭhānaṃ🔽rūpaṃ kusalamūlena ekamūlameva, na kusalaṃ, phassādidhammajātaṃ pana kusalamūlena
analyzed: kusala mūlena eka mūlā sabbe te dhammā kusalā ati pucchā tassā pana kusala citta samuṭṭhānam 🔽rūpam kusala mūlena eka mūlam eva na kusalam phassa ādi dhamma jātam pana kusala mūlena
translated: But in the case of the single-rooted dyad all those ideas are single-rooted with the profitable root in the sense of sameness, not in the sense of counting. The meaning here is this: “They are single-rooted since they are the same as one root, namely, the profitable root, in each case” . The question is “Is the root of contact the same as the root of feeling, etc.? ” The answer in the Vibhanga is “Yes, friends,” in the sense of agreeing that they are so. Or else the question is “Are all those ideas that are single-rooted with the profitable root profitable?” The answer is “Yes, friends,” in the sense of agreeing that the materiality originated by profitable consciousness is single-rooted with the profitable root, though it is not profitable, but that the class of ideas beginning with contact is profitable and single-rooted with the profitable root.

analyzed: ahetukam abyākatam ṭhapetvā sesāḥ abyākata mūlena eka mūlakā ati vissajjanam tattha

analyzed: ahetukam abyākatanti aṭṭhārasa ahetuka cittuppādāḥ rūpam nibbānam ca ettha ca kiñcā api

analyzed: katvā niddese ekatas labbhamānaka vasena apetam vissajjanam katan ti veditabbam

analyzed: nāma pada mūlesu ca ye keci nāmā dhammā sabbe te nāma mūlā ati pucchāya nava iva nāma mūlāni

analyzed: dhammā sabbe te nāma mūlena eka mūlā ati pucchā ahetukam nāmam ṭhapetvā sesam nāma mūlena

analyzed: eka mūlam ti vissajjanam tattha ahetuka cittuppāda vicikicchu ddhacca sampayutta moha nibbāna vasena

analyzed: nipphādana ttham hinoti pavattati iti hetu handa nam gaṇhatha ati dassentam viya attanaḥ  phalam nideti iti nidānam etasmai phalam sambhavati iti sambhavaḥ pabhavati iti pabhavaḥ  tam ettha etena ati vā samuṭṭhānam tam āharati iti āhāraḥ a paṭikkhipitabba ṭṭhena  tena ālambīyati iti ālambaṇam etam paṭicca tam eti iti paccayaḥ etasmā tam samudeti iti

translated: “The consciousness aggregate is not consciousness” is the answer to the question.

original: veditabbo, visesamattameva pana vakkhāma.
analyzed: veditabbaḥ visesa mattam eva pana vakkhāma
translated: The method of answering the rest of the questions should be understood in the same way. Only the difference will be pointed out.

original: Padasodhanamūlacakkavāre pana ayaṃ viseso – khandhā vedanākkhandhoti ye keci khandhā,
analyzed: pada sodhana mūla cakka vāre pana ayam viseso khandhāḥ vedanā khandho ti ye keci khandhāḥ
translated: But there is this difference in the word-derivation and root-cause series: any aggregates are the feeling aggregate …

original: sabbe te vedanākkhandhoti pucchā. Tassā “vedanākkhandho khandho ceva vedanākkhandho
analyzed: sabbe te vedanā khandho ti pucchā tassā vedanā kkhandho khandho ca iva vedanā kkhandho
translated: But there is this difference in the “pedigree” and “root” wheels of the analysis of terms: in the case of the aggregates, the question is “Are any of the aggregates feeling?” and the answer is “The aggregate of feeling is an aggregate and also feeling,

original: ca, avasesā pana khandhā, na vedanākkhandho”ti vissajjanaṃ. Sesesupi eseva nayo.🔽Paṭilome pana na khandhā na vedanākkhandhoti pucchāya “āmantā”ti vissajjanaṃ. Ettha
analyzed: ca avasesā pana khandhāḥ na vedanā khandho ti vissajjanam sesesu pi esā iva nayo  paṭilome pana na khandhāḥ na vedanā khandho ti pucchāya āmantā ati vissajjanam ettha
translated: but the rest of the aggregates are aggregates but not feeling.” The rest are to be construed in the same way.🔽But in the reverse order, the question “Are any of the aggregates not the aggregate of feeling?” is answered “Yes.”

original: ca ye paññattinibbānasaṅkhātā dhammā khandhāpi na honti, te yasmā vedanākkhandhopi
analyzed: ca ye paññatti nibbāna saṅkhātāḥ dhammāḥ khandhāḥ api na honti te yasmā vedanā khandhaḥ api
translated: And here, since the states called “the Nibbāna element that is a non-remnant of clinging” are not even aggregates,

original: na hoti, tasmā “āmantā”ti vissajjanaṃ, sesaṃ suviññeyyameva. Padasodhanamūlacakkavāro.
analyzed: na hoti tasmai āmantā ati vissajjanam sesam su viññeyyam eva pada sodhana mūla cakkavāro
translated: they are not the aggregate of feeling either, and so the answer is “Yes.” The rest is easily intelligible. The “pedigree” and “root” wheels of the analysis of terms are ended.

original: Suddhakhandhavāre pana “rūpaṃ khandho”ti pucchāya “āmantā”ti vissajjanaṃ piyarūpādīnañca
analyzed: suddha khandha vāre pana rūpam khandho ti pucchāyaḥ āmantā ati vissajjanam piya rūpa ādīnam ca
translated: But in the case of the “pure aggregates” wheel, the question “Is materiality an aggregate?” is answered “Yes,” because the things called “agreeable,” etc.,

original: pañcasu khandhesu saṅgahitattā. “Khandhā rūpa”ntiādīsu ye keci khandhā, sabbe te
analyzed: pañcasu khandhesu saṅgahita ttā khandhāḥ rūpa nti ādīsu ye keci khandhāḥ sabbe te
translated: are included among the five aggregates. In the case of the questions “Are any of the aggregates materiality?,” etc., the answer is “Yes” in each case,

original: rūpakkhandhotiādinā attho gahetabbo. Teneva hissa niddese “khandhā rūpa”ntiādinā🔽padaṃ anuddharitvā “khandhā rūpakkhandho”tiādinā atthavaseneva padaṃ uddharitvā “rūpakkhandho
analyzed: rūpa khandhaḥ ti ādinā atthaḥ gahetabbo tena iva hi ssa niddese khandhāḥ rūpam ti ādinā  padam an uddharitvā khandhāḥ rūpa kkhandhaḥ ti ādinā attha vasena iva padam uddharitvā rūpa kkhandhaḥ
translated: The meaning should be taken as “the materiality aggregate” and so on. For in the description of the first triad he does not extract the terms “aggregates,” “materiality,” and so on,

original: khandho ceva rūpakkhandho ca, avasesā khandhā, na rūpakkhandho”ti vissajjanaṃ kataṃ.
analyzed: khandho ca iva rūpa kkhandho ca avasesāḥ khandhāḥ na rūpa kkhandho ti vissajjanam katam
translated: but he extracts the terms “the materiality aggregate,” and so on, in the sense of the meaning, and he answers, “The materiality aggregate is both an aggregate and the materiality aggregate; the remaining aggregates are aggregates only, not the materiality aggregate” .

original: Teneva ca kāraṇena suddhakhandhavāroti vutto. Vacanasodhane viya hi ettha na vacanaṃ🔽pamāṇaṃ, yathā pana suddhakhandhā labbhanti, tathā tathā atthova pamāṇaṃ. Parato
analyzed: tena iva ca kāraṇena suddha khandha vāraḥ ti vuttaḥ vacana sodhane viya hi ettha na vacanam  pamāṇam yathā pana suddha khandhāḥ labbhanti tathā tathā pamāṇam paratas
translated: And for this reason it is called the “pure aggregates method.” For here the terms are not the criterion, as in the case of the “purification of virtue” ,

original: āyatanayamakamātikādīsupi eseva nayo. Paṭilome “na rūpaṃ na khandho”ti yaṃ dhammajātaṃ
analyzed: āyatana yamaka mātikā ādīsu pi esa eva nayaḥ paṭilome na rūpam na khandho ti yam dhamma jātam
translated: but rather the meaning is the criterion, in whatever way the pure aggregates are obtained. The same method applies in the case of the other triads, dyads, and so on, such as the bases, the elements, the dependent origination pentad, and so on.

original: rūpaṃ na hoti, taṃ khandhopi na hotīti pucchā, tassā “rūpakkhandhavirahitā khandhā,
analyzed: rūpam na hoti tam khandho api na hoti iti pucchā tassā rūpa khandha virahitāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: In the reverse order, the question “Materiality is not an aggregate” is asked in order to find out whether any given state that is not materiality is an aggregate. The answer is: “The aggregates devoid of the materiality aggregate,

original: na rūpaṃ, tathā nibbānaṃ na pana rūpañceva na khandho cā”ti vissajjanaṃ. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva. Suddhakhandhavāro.🔽Suddhakhandhamūlacakkavārepi “khandhā vedanākkhandho”tiādinā heṭṭhā vuttanayena attho veditabboti ayaṃ paṇṇattivāre nayo.
analyzed: na rūpam tathā nibbānam na pana rūpam ca iva na khandho ca ati vissajjanam sesam su viññeyyam eva suddha khandha vāro  suddha khandha mūla cakka vāre pi khandhāḥ vedanā khandho ti ādinā heṭṭhā vutta nayena atthaḥ veditabbaḥ ti ayam paṇṇatti vāre nayo
translated: The section on the pliability of the aggregates.

original: Yasmā pana niddese imissā pana mātikāya paṇṇattivārasaṅkhātaṃ niddesaṃ vatvā tato🔽imaṃ mātikākkamaṃ muñcitvā aparena pariyāyena aññepi uddesavāravirahitā “pavattivāro
analyzed: yasmā pana niddese imissā pana mātikāya paṇṇatti vāra saṅkhātam niddesam vatvā tatas  imam mātikā kkamam muñcitvā aparena pariyāyena aññe pi uddesa vāra virahitā pavatti vāro
translated: In the case of the basic dyad on the pliability of the aggregates, the meaning should be understood in the way already stated under the exposition of the dyads beginning with “The aggregates are the feeling aggregate” . This is the method in the case of the exposition of the dyads.

original: pariññāvāro”ti dve mahāvārā pucchāvissajjanavasena vuttā, tasmā tesaṃ dvinnampi vārānaṃ
analyzed: pariññāvāro ti dve mahāvārā pucchā vissajjana vasena vuttā tasmā tesam dvinnam pi
translated: But in the description of the method in the case of the two great divisions, namely, the occurrence division and the full-understanding division, which are stated by way of question and answer after the description of the dyads called the exposition has been given in the Schedule,

original: nayo dassetabbo. Tato pavattivāre tāva pāḷivavatthānapubbikā mukhamattappakāsanā
analyzed: nayaḥ dassetabbo tatas pavatti vāre tāva pāḷi vavatthāna pubbikā mukha matta ppakāsanā
translated: the method should be shown in the following way.

original: – imasmiṃ hi uppādavāro nirodhavāro uppādanirodhavāroti tayo antaravārā honti. Tattha
analyzed: imasmin hi uppāda vāraḥ nirodha vāraḥ uppāda nirodha vāraḥ ti tayaḥ antara vārāḥ honti tattha
translated: For in the occurrence division there are three intermediate divisions, namely, the origination division, the cessation division, and the origination and cessation division. Herein,

original: uppādavāre tāva tiṇṇaṃ addhānaṃ vasena cha kālabhedā honti paccuppanno, atīto, anāgato,
analyzed: uppāda vāre tāva tiṇṇam addhānam vasena cha kāla bhedāḥ honti paccuppannaḥ atītaḥ anāgataḥ
translated: In the case of the arising section, there are six divisions of time according to the three periods: present, past, and future.

original: paccuppannenātīto, paccuppannenānāgato, atītenānāgatoti. Evametesu chasu kālabhedesu
analyzed: paccuppannena atītaḥ paccuppannena anāgataḥ atītena anāgataḥ ti evam etesu chasu kāla bhedesu
translated: Present and past, present and future, past and future. So in these six divisions of time

original: yvāyaṃ paṭhamo paccuppanno, tattha puggalato okāsato puggalokāsatoti tayo vārā honti.
analyzed: yvā ayam paṭhamo paccuppanno tattha puggalataḥ okāsataḥ puggala ukāsataḥ tayaḥ vārāḥ honti
translated: there are three sections according to person, place, and person and place.

original: Tattha “yassa rūpakkhandho uppajjati, tassa vedanākkhandho uppajjatīti? Asaññasattaṃ
analyzed: tattha yassa rūpa kkhandho uppajjati tassa vedanā kkhandho uppajjati iti asaññasattam
translated: Herein, “When the materiality aggregate arises, does the feeling aggregate arise? “

original: upapajjantānaṃ tesaṃ rūpakkhandho uppajjati, no ca tesaṃ vedanākkhandho uppajjati.
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam rūpa kkhandho uppajjati no ca tesam vedanā kkhandho uppajjati
translated: In the case of those reappearing in the Non-percipient Beings, their materiality aggregate arises, but not their feeling aggregate.

original: Pañcavokāraṃ upapajjantānaṃ tesaṃ rūpakkhandho ca uppajjati, vedanākkhandho ca uppajjati.
analyzed: pañcavokāram upapajjantānam tesam rūpa kkhandho ca uppajjati vedanā kkhandho ca uppajjati
translated: In the case of those reappearing in the five-constituent becoming, their materiality aggregate arises and their feeling aggregate arises.🔽“Or when the feeling aggregate arises, does the materiality aggregate arise? “

original: Yassa vā pana vedanākkhandho uppajjati, tassa rūpakkhandho uppajjatīti? Arūpaṃ upapajjantānaṃ
analyzed: yassa vā pana vedanā kkhandhaḥ uppajjati tassa rūpa kkhandhaḥ uppajjati iti arūpam upapajjantānam
translated: In the case of those reappearing in the immaterial becoming,

original: tesaṃ vedanākkhandho uppajjati, no ca tesaṃ rūpakkhandho uppajjati. Pañcavokāraṃ
analyzed: tesam vedanā kkhandho uppajjati no ca tesam rūpa kkhandho uppajjati pañcavokāram
translated: their feeling aggregate arises, but not their materiality aggregate. In the case of those reappearing in the five-constituent becoming,

original: upapajjantānaṃ tesaṃ vedanākkhandho ca uppajjati, rūpakkhandho ca uppajjati. Yassa🔽rūpakkhandho uppajjati…pe… tassa viññāṇakkhandho uppajjati…pe… yassa vā pana viññāṇakkhandho
analyzed: upapajjantānam tesam vedanā kkhandho ca uppajjati rūpa kkhandho ca uppajjati yassa  rūpa kkhandho uppajjati pe tassa viññāṇa kkhandho uppajjati pe yassa vā pana viññāṇa kkhandho
translated: and for those reappearing in the fine-material sphere, the feeling aggregate and the form aggregate do.🔽“When the form aggregate … the consciousness aggregate arises, does the feeling aggregate … the form aggregate arise?”🔽“When the form aggregate … the consciousness aggregate arises, does the form aggregate arise?”

original: uppajjati, tassa rūpakkhandho uppajjatīti…pe… pañcavokāraṃ …pe… uppajjatī”ti evaṃ🔽rūpakkhandhamūlakāni cattāri, “yassa vedanākkhandho uppajjati, tassa saññākkhandho
analyzed: uppajjati tassa rūpa kkhandho uppajjati iti pe pañcavokāram pe uppajjati iti evam  rūpa kkhandha mūlakāni cattāri yassa vedanā kkhandho uppajjati tassa saññā kkhandho
translated: “When the five aggregates arise, do the form aggregate … the consciousness aggregate arise?”🔽“When the feeling aggregate arises, does the perception aggregate … the formations aggregate … the consciousness aggregate arise?”🔽“When the perception aggregate … the formations aggregate … the consciousness aggregate arises, does the form aggregate arise?”🔽“When the five aggregates arise, do the form aggregate … the consciousness aggregate arise?”

original: uppajjatī”tiādinā ca vedanākkhandhamūlakāni tīṇi, saññākkhandhamūlakāni dve, saṅkhārakkhandhamūlakaṃ
analyzed: uppajjati iti ādinā ca vedanā kkhandha mūlakāni tīṇi saññā kkhandha mūlakāni dve saṅkhāra kkhandha mūlakam
translated: “When the five aggregates arise, do the form aggregate … the consciousness aggregate arise?”

original: ekanti evametāni paccuppannakāle puggalavāre anulomanaye dasa yamakāni honti. Tattha
analyzed: ekam ti evam etāni paccuppanna kāle puggala vāre anuloma naye dasa yamakāni honti tattha
translated: In the section on the person in the present, in the forward order, there are ten such dyads.

original: rūpakkhandhamūlakesu catūsu ādito ekameva pāḷiyaṃ vissajjitaṃ, sesāni tena sadisavissajjanānīti🔽tantiyā lahubhāvatthaṃ saṃkhittāni.
analyzed: rūpa kkhandha mūlakesu catūsu āditas ekam eva pāḷiyam vissajjitam sesāni tena sadisa vissajjanāni iti 🔽tantiyāḥ lahu bhāvattham saṃkhittāni
translated: Herein, in the case of the four dyads based on the form aggregate, only the first is given in the text, the rest being abbreviated for brevity’s sake, since they are to be construed in the same way.

original: Vedanākkhandhamūlake pana sabbattha “āmantā”ti ekasadisameva vissajjanaṃ. Vedanādīsu
analyzed: vedanā khandha mūlake pana sabbattha āmantā ati eka sadisam eva vissajjanam vedanā ādīsu
translated: But in the case of the feeling aggregate, etc., the answer is the same in all instances, namely, “Yes,”

original: uppannesu niyamena saññādīnaṃ uppajjanato tattha sabbāni saṃkhittāni. Yathā ca puggalavāre
analyzed: uppannesu niyamena saññā ādīnam uppajjanato tattha sabbāni saṃkhittāni yathā ca puggala vāre
translated: because it is invariably the case that perception, etc., arise when feeling, etc., arise. So all are abbreviated there.🔽And just as there are ten pairs in the case of the persons, so too in the case of the bases there are ten pairs beginning thus: “Where the materiality aggregate …🔽… the feeling aggregate …

original: dasa yamakāni, evaṃ okāsavārepi “yattha rūpakkhandho uppajjati, tattha vedanākkhandho
analyzed: dasa yamakāni evam okāsa vāre pi yattha rūpa kkhandho uppajjati tattha vedanā kkhandho
translated: … the perception aggregate …🔽… the formations aggregate …🔽… the consciousness aggregate arises, does the materiality aggregate arise there too? In the case of non-percipient beings …

original: uppajjatīti? Asaññasatte tattha…pe… pañcavokāre tattha…pe… uppajjatī”tiādinā, puggalokāsavārepi
analyzed: uppajjati iti asaññasatte tatthape pañcavokāre tatthape uppajjati iti ādinā puggala ukāsa vāre pi
translated: … in the case of those in the five-constituent becoming …🔽… the materiality aggregate arises there too” , and in the case of the persons and bases there are ten pairs beginning thus: “In the case of one in whom the materiality aggregate …🔽… the feeling aggregate …🔽… the perception aggregate …🔽… the formations aggregate …

original: “yassa yattha rūpakkhandho uppajjati, tassa tattha vedanākkhandho uppajjatīti? Asaññasattaṃ…pe…
analyzed: yassa yattha rūpa kkhandho uppajjati tassa tattha vedanā kkhandho uppajjati iti
translated: … the consciousness aggregate arises, does the materiality aggregate arise in him too? In the case of non-percipient beings …🔽… in the case of one in the five-constituent becoming …🔽… the materiality aggregate arises in him too” .

original: pañcavokāraṃ…pe… uppajjatī”tiādinā. Paccuppannakāle tīsu vāresu anulomanaye tiṃsa
analyzed: uppajjati iti ādinā paccuppanna kāle tīsu vāresu anuloma naye tiṃsa
translated: So there are thirty pairs in the three sections in the case of the present state in the direct method.

original: yamakā honti. Yathā anulomanaye tiṃsa, evaṃ paṭilomanayepi “yassa rūpakkhandho nuppajjati,
analyzed: yamakāḥ honti yathā anuloma naye tiṃsa evam paṭiloma naye pi yassa rūpa kkhandho na uppajjati
translated: As there are thirty in the direct method, so too there are thirty in the reverse method: “In the case of one in whom the materiality aggregate does not arise, does the feeling aggregate …🔽… the perception aggregate …

original: tassa vedanākkhandho nuppajjatīti? Arūpaṃ upapajjantānaṃ tesaṃ rūpakkhandho nuppajjati,
analyzed: tassa vedanā kkhandho nuppajjati iti arūpam upapajjantānam tesam rūpa kkhandho nuppajjati
translated: does his feeling-aggregate not arise? For those arising in the formless (realms) the form-aggregate does not arise,

original: no ca tesaṃ vedanākkhandho nuppajjati. Sabbesaṃ cavantānaṃ tesaṃ rūpakkhandho ca
analyzed: no ca tesam vedanā kkhandho nuppajjati sabbesam cavantānam tesam rūpa kkhandho ca
translated: but their feeling-aggregate does arise. For all those passing away the form-aggregate

original: nuppajjati vedanākkhandho ca nuppajjati. Yassa vā pana vedanākkhandho nuppajjati,
analyzed: nuppajjati vedanā khandho ca nuppajjati yassa vā pana vedanā khandho nuppajjati
translated: and the feeling-aggregate do not arise. But for those for whom the feeling-aggregate does not arise,

original: tassa rūpakkhandho nuppajjatīti? Asaññasattaṃ upapajjantānaṃ tesaṃ vedanākkhandho
analyzed: tassa rūpa kkhandho nuppajjati iti asaññasattam upapajjantānam tesam vedanā kkhandho
translated: does their form-aggregate not arise? For those arising in the (formless) states of non-perceptive beings the feeling-aggregate

original: nuppajjati, no ca tesaṃ rūpakkhandho nuppajjati. Sabbesaṃ cavantānaṃ tesaṃ vedanākkhandho
analyzed: nuppajjati no ca tesam rūpa kkhandho nuppajjati sabbesam cavantānam tesam vedanā kkhandho
translated: does not arise, but their form-aggregate does arise. For all those passing away the feeling-aggregate

original: ca nuppajjati rūpakkhandho ca nuppajjatī”tiādinā, “yattha rūpakkhandho nuppajjati,
analyzed: ca nuppajjati rūpa kkhandho ca nuppajjati iti ādinā yattha rūpa kkhandho nuppajjati
translated: and the form-aggregate do not arise.” and so on, “Where the form-aggregate does not arise,

original: tattha vedanākkhandho nuppajjatīti? Uppajjati. Yattha vā pana…pe… nuppajjatīti? Uppajjatī”tiādinā
analyzed: tattha vedanā khandho nuppajjati iti uppajjati yattha vā pana pe nuppajjati iti uppajjati itiādinā
translated: does the feeling-aggregate not arise there? It arises. Or, where … and so on,

original: ca, “yassa yattha rūpakkhandho nuppajjati, tassa tattha vedanākkhandho nuppajjatīti…pe…
analyzed: ca yassa yattha rūpa kkhandho nuppajjati tassa tattha vedanā kkhandho nuppajjati iti pe
translated: “For those for whom the form-aggregate does not arise, does their feeling-aggregate not arise? …

original: sabbesaṃ cavantānaṃ tadubhayaṃ nuppajjatī”tiādinā cāti tiṃsa yamakā. Evaṃ paccuppannakāle
analyzed: sabbesam cavantānam tat ubhayam nuppajjati iti ādinā ca ati tiṃsa yamakāḥ evam paccuppanna kāle
translated: Thus there are thirty pairs.

original: saṭṭhi yamakāni, taddiguṇā pucchā, taddiguṇā ca atthā veditabbā.
analyzed: saṭṭhi yamakāni taddiguṇā pucchā taddiguṇā ca atthā veditabbā
translated: So there are sixty pairs in the present, and the questions are twice that number, and the meanings are twice that number too.

original: Tattha yassa rūpakkhandho uppajjatīti yassa puggalassa paṭisandhikkhaṇe rūpakkhandho
analyzed: tattha yassa rūpa kkhandho uppajjati iti yassa puggalassa paṭisandhi kkhaṇe rūpa kkhandho
translated: Herein, as regards the question, “When materiality is arising in one, does only materiality arise in him and not feeling?”

original: uppajjati. Tassa vedanākkhandhoti vedanākkhandhopi tassa tasmiṃyeva khaṇe uppajjatīti
analyzed: uppajjati tassa vedanā khandhaḥ ti vedanā khandhaḥ pi tassa tasmiṃ yeva khaṇe uppajjati iti
translated: the meaning is that feeling also arises in him at that moment.

original: attho imināva nayena. Tattha asaññasattanti asaññattabhavaṃ paṭisandhivasena upapajjantānaṃ
analyzed: attho iminā ava nayena tattha asaññasattam ti asaññatta bhavam paṭisandhi vasena upapajjantānam
translated: The “beings without thought” are those who are reborn in the non-percipient realm by way of rebirth-linking.

original: tesaṃ uppajjanakkhaṇe rūpakkhandho uppajjati, no ca tesaṃ acittakattā vedanākkhandho
analyzed: tesam uppajjana khaṇe rūpa kkhandho uppajjati no ca tesam acittakattā vedanā kkhandho
translated: The meaning is that materiality arises in them at the moment of arising, but feeling does not arise in them because they are without consciousness.

original: uppajjatīti attho. Imināva nayena “yassa vā pana vedanākkhandho”tiādikesu pucchāvissajjanesu,
analyzed: uppajjati iti atthaḥ iminā ava nayena yassa vā pana vedanā khandhaḥ ti ādikesu pucchā vissajjanesu
translated: And the meaning should be understood in this way in the case of the questions and answers beginning, “When feeling is arising in one, does only feeling arise in him and not materiality?”

original: tato paresupi sabbattha attho veditabbo.
analyzed: tatas paresu pi sabbattha atthaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: and in the rest too.

original: Idaṃ panettha uppādanirodhesu niyamalakkhaṇaṃ – sakalepi hi imasmiṃ khandhayamake
analyzed: idam pana ittha uppāda nirodhesu niyama lakkhaṇam sakale api hi imasmim khandha yamake
translated: For in this whole section on the aggregates

original: tattha tattha uppannānaṃ sattānaṃ pavatte yāva maraṇā vā khandhānaṃ apariyantesu🔽uppādanirodhesu vijjamānesupi lahuparivattānaṃ dhammānaṃ vinibbhogaṃ katvā uppādanirodhe
analyzed: tattha tattha uppannānam sattānam pavatte yāva maraṇāḥ vā khandhānam apariyantesu  uppāda nirodhesu vijjamānesu pi lahu parivattānam dhammānam vinibbhogam katvā uppāda nirodhe
translated: arising and cessation are found in the uninterrupted occurrence of the aggregates of those beings who are reborn here and there,

original: dassetuṃ na sukaranti pavattiyaṃ uppādanirodhe anāmasitvā paṭisandhiuppādavaseneva🔽uppādavāro, nirodhamaraṇakāle nirodhavaseneva ca nirodhavāro kathito. Evamettha uppādanirodhesu
analyzed: dassetum na su karanti pavattiyam uppāda nirodhe an āmasitvā paṭisandhi uppāda vasena iva  uppāda vāraḥ nirodha maraṇa kāle nirodha vasena iva ca nirodha vāraḥ kathitaḥ evam ettha uppāda nirodhesu
translated: but it is not easy to point out arising and cessation by discerning the states that are subject to arising and cessation because of their rapid revolution.🔽So the section on arising is stated only by way of rebirth-linking arising and the section on cessation only by way of cessation at death, without singling out arising and cessation in the course of an existence.

original: niyamalakkhaṇaṃ viditvā paṭisandhiuppādameva ca cutinirodhameva ca gahetvā tesu tesu
analyzed: niyama lakkhaṇam viditvā paṭisandhi uppādam eva ca cuti nirodham eva ca gahetvā tesu tesu
translated: This is how the characteristic of the delimitation of arising and of cessation should be understood here.

original: ṭhānesu āgatānaṃ pucchāvissajjanānaṃ atthavinicchayo veditabbo.
analyzed: ṭhānesu āgatānam pucchā vissajjanānam attha vinicchayaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: And the exposition of the meaning of the questions and answers given in the various places should be understood as follows.

original: Paṭilomanaye pana sabbesaṃ cavantānanti maraṇacittassa bhaṅgakkhaṇasamannāgatānaṃ.
analyzed: paṭiloma naye pana sabbesam cavantānam ti maraṇa cittassa bhaṅga khaṇa samannāgatānam
translated: In the reverse order, “all those who die” are those conascent with the death consciousness at the moment of its dissolution.

original: Tesaṃ hi tattha rūpakkhandho nuppajjati, vedanākkhandho ca cuticittassa uppattikkhaṇe
analyzed: tesam hi tattha rūpa kkhandho na uppajjati vedanā kkhandho ca cuti cittassa uppatti kkhaṇe
translated: For their material-form aggregate does not arise there, and their feeling aggregate has already arisen at the moment of the death consciousness.

original: eva uppannattā. “Yattha rūpakkhandho nuppajjati, tattha vedanākkhandho nuppajjatī”ti🔽pucchāya arūpabhavaṃ sandhāya “uppajjatī”ti idaṃ vissajjanaṃ kataṃ, anantarapucchāya
analyzed: eva uppanna ttā yattha rūpa kkhandho nuppajjati tattha vedanā kkhandho nuppajjati iti  pucchāya arūpa bhavam sandhāya uppajjati iti idam vissajjanam katam anantara pucchāya
translated: “Where the material-form aggregate does not arise, does the feeling aggregate not arise there?”🔽This answer “It arises” should be understood as referring to the immaterial-existence plane. The answer “It arises” to the next question

original: asaññibhavaṃ sandhāya “uppajjatī”ti idaṃ vissajjananti veditabbaṃ. Sesaṃ suviññeyyamevāti
analyzed: asaññi bhavam sandhāya uppajjati iti idam vissajjanam ti veditabbam sesam su viññeyyam eva ati
translated: should be understood as referring to the non-percipient existence. The rest is easily intelligible.

original: ayaṃ paccuppannakāle nayo.
analyzed: ayam paccuppanna kāle nayaḥ
translated: This is the method of explanation in the present.

original: Yathā ca paccuppannakāle saṭṭhi yamakādīni, evaṃ sesesupi pañcasu kālabhedesu paccekanti🔽gahetabbaṃ. Pucchāvissajjanesu panettha kiñcāpi “yassa rūpakkhandho uppajjittha,
analyzed: yathā ca paccuppanna kāle saṭṭhi yamaka ādīni evam sesesu pi pañcasu kāla bhedesu  gahetabbam pucchā vissajjanesu pana ittha kiñcā api yassa rūpakkhandho uppajjittha
translated: And just as the sixty pairs, etc., are to be taken in the present, so too in each of the remaining five divisions of time.🔽But in the answers to the questions, although it is said: “If the material-form aggregate has arisen in anyone, has the feeling aggregate arisen in him too? … ”

original: tassa vedanākkhandho uppajjitthāti? Āmantā”tiādinā, “yattha rūpakkhandho uppajjittha,
analyzed: tassa vedanā kkhandho uppajjittha ati āmantā ati ādinā yattha rūpa kkhandho uppajjittha
translated: “Where the material-form aggregate has arisen, has the feeling aggregate arisen there too? … ”

original: tattha vedanākkhandho uppajjitthāti? Pañcavokāre uppajjittha, nāññatthā”tiādinā ca,
analyzed: tattha vedanā khandho uppajjittha ati pañcavokāre uppajjittha na aññattha atiādinā ca
translated: Herein, as regards the question “Has the feeling category arisen? ” the answer is “It has arisen in the five constituent groups, not elsewhere. ”

original: “yassa yattha rūpakkhandho uppajjittha, tassa tattha vedanākkhandho uppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha rūpa kkhandho uppajjittha tassa tattha vedanā kkhandho uppajjittha ati
translated: And as regards the question “Has the form category arisen where the feeling category has arisen? ”

original: Pañcavokārānaṃ tesaṃ tattha uppajjittha, nāññatthā”tiādinā ca atītakāle anulomanaye,
analyzed: pañcavokārānam tesam tattha uppajjittha na aññattha atiādinā ca atīta kāle anuloma naye
translated: the answer is “It has arisen there in the case of those in the five constituent groups, not elsewhere. ”

original: “yassa rūpakkhandho nuppajjittha, tassa vedanākkhandho nuppajjitthāti? Natthī”tiādinā,
analyzed: yassa rūpa kkhandhaḥ nuppajjittha tassa vedanā kkhandhaḥ nuppajjittha ati natthi itiādinā
translated: And as regards the question “Has the form category not arisen where the feeling category has not arisen? ” the answer is “There is none. ”

original: “yattha rūpakkhandho nuppajjittha, tattha vedanākkhandho nuppajjitthāti? Uppajjitthā”tiādinā,
analyzed: yattha rūpa kkhandhaḥ nuppajjittha tattha vedanā kkhandhaḥ nuppajjittha ati uppajjittha atiādinā
translated: And as regards the question “Has the feeling category arisen where the form category has not arisen? ” the answer is “It has arisen. ”

original: “yassa yattha rūpakkhandho nuppajjittha, tassa tattha vedanākkhandho nuppajjitthāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha rūpa kkhandho nuppajjittha tassa tattha vedanā kkhandho nuppajjittha ati
translated: And as regards the question “Has the form category not arisen where the feeling category has not arisen? ”

original: Arūpānaṃ tesaṃ tattha rūpakkhandho nuppajjittha, no ca tesaṃ…pe… suddhāvāsānaṃ tesaṃ
analyzed: arūpānam tesam tattha rūpa kkhandho nuppajjittha no ca tesam pe suddhāvāsānam tesam
translated: the answer is “It has not arisen there in the case of those in the immaterial-form world, but it has arisen there in the case of those in the pure abodes. ”🔽And as regards the question “Has both arisen there? ” the answer is “It has not. ”

original: tattha tadubhayaṃ nuppajjitthā”tiādinā tīsu vāresu paṭilomanaye ca,
analyzed: tattha tat ubhayam nu pajjittha atiādinā tīsu vāresu paṭiloma naye ca
translated: And so in the three sections in the reverse order.

original: “Yassa rūpakkhandho uppajjissati, tassa vedanākkhandho uppajjissatīti? Āmantā”tiādinā,🔽“yattha rūpakkhandho uppajjissati, tattha vedanākkhandho uppajjissatīti…pe… pañcavokāre
analyzed: yassa rūpa kkhandhaḥ uppajjissati tassa vedanā kkhandhaḥ uppajjissati iti āmantā atiādinā  yattha rūpa kkhandhaḥ uppajjissati tattha vedanā kkhandho uppajjissati itipe pañcavokāre
translated: “When the materiality category will arise for anyone, will the feeling category arise for him?” “Yes,” he replies.🔽“Where the materiality category will arise, will the feeling category arise there?” “In the five-constituent becoming it will,” he replies.

original: uppajjissatī”tiādinā, “yassa yattha rūpakkhandho uppajjissati, tassa tattha vedanākkhandho
analyzed: uppajjissati itiādinā yassa yattha rūpa kkhandho uppajjissati tassa tattha vedanā kkhandho
translated: “For anyone anywhere the materiality category will arise, will the feeling category arise there for him?” “For those in the five-constituent becoming it will,” he replies.

original: uppajjissati…pe… pañcavokārānaṃ tesaṃ tattha uppajjissatī”tiādinā ca anāgatakāle
analyzed: pañcavokārānam tesam tattha uppajjissati iti ādinā ca anāgata kāle
translated: This is the forward order in the future.

original: anulomanaye, “yassa rūpakkhandho nuppajjissati, tassa vedanākkhandho nuppajjissatīti?
analyzed: anuloma naye yassa rūpa kkhandho nuppajjissati tassa vedanā kkhandho nuppajjissati iti
translated: “When the materiality category will not arise for anyone, will the feeling category not arise for him?”

original: Ye arūpaṃ upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti, tesaṃ rūpakkhandho nuppajjissati, netaro,
analyzed: ye arūpam upapajjitvā parinibbāyissanti tesam rūpa khandhaḥ nuppajjissati na itaraḥ
translated: “For those who will attain Nibbāna in the immaterial becoming without rearising, the materiality category will not arise, but not the others.

original: pacchimabhavikānaṃ tadubhayaṃ nuppajjissatī”tiādinā, “yattha rūpakkhandho nuppajjissati,
analyzed: pacchimabhavikānam tat ubhayam nuppajjissati itiādinā yattha rūpa kkhandho nuppajjissati

original: tattha vedanākkhandho nuppajjissatī”tiādinā, “yassa yattha rūpakkhandho nuppajjissati,
analyzed: tattha vedanā kkhandho nuppajjissati itiādinā yassa yattha rūpa kkhandho nuppajjissati
translated: “Where the materiality category will not arise, will the feeling category not arise there?”🔽“For anyone anywhere the materiality category will not arise, will the feeling category not arise there for him?”

analyzed: tassa tattha vedanā kkhandho nuppajjissati iti arūpānam tesam tattha rūpa kkhandho nuppajjissati
translated: … his feeling-aggregate will not arise there? In the case of those in the immaterial world, their materiality-aggregate will not arise there,

original: netaro, pacchimabhavikānaṃ tadubhayaṃ nuppajjissatī”tiādinā paṭilomanaye ca,
analyzed: na itaraḥ pacchimabhavikānam tat ubhayam na uppajjissati itiādinā paṭiloma naye ca
translated: but the other four will. In the case of those who will be reborn in the next existence, all five will arise there.”

original: “Yassa rūpakkhandho uppajjati, tassa vedanākkhandho uppajjitthā”tiādinā, “yattha🔽rūpakkhandho uppajjati, tattha vedanākkhandho uppajjitthāti…pe… pañcavokāre uppajjatī”tiādinā,
analyzed: yassa rūpa kkhandho uppajjati tassa vedanā kkhandho uppajjittha ati ādinā  rūpa kkhandho uppajjati tattha vedanā kkhandho pañcavokāre uppajjati itiādinā
translated: And in the reverse order: “In the case of anyone in whom the materiality-aggregate arises, does his feeling-aggregate arise? ”🔽“In the case of those in whom the materiality-aggregate arises, does their feeling-aggregate arise? ”
