Natthī”tiādinā ca uppādavāre,🔽“Yassa kusalā dhammā nirujjhanti, tassa akusalā dhammā nirujjhantīti? No”tiādinā nirodhavāre ca,🔽“Yassa kusalā dhammā uppajjanti, tassa akusalā dhammā nirujjhantīti? No”tiādinā uppādanirodhavāre ca,
analyzed: tattha abyākatāḥ dhammāḥ na uppajjanti iti uppajjanti yattha vā pana abyākatāḥ dhammā  nuppajjanti tattha akusalāḥ dhammā nuppajjanti iti natthi itiādinā ca uppāda vāre  yassa kusalāḥ dhammāḥ nirujjhanti tassa akusalāḥ dhammāḥ nirujjhanti iti no ti ādinā nirodha vāre ca  yassa kusalāḥ dhammāḥ uppajjanti tassa akusalāḥ dhammāḥ nirujjhanti iti no ti ādinā uppāda nirodha vāre ca
translated: “Where wholesome thoughts do not occur, do unwholesome thoughts occur? “ “Yes. “ “Where unwholesome thoughts do not occur, do indeterminate thoughts occur? “ “Yes. “ “Where indeterminate thoughts do not occur, do unwholesome thoughts occur? “ “No. “ So in the case of the Direction of Arising.🔽“When wholesome thoughts cease, do unwholesome thoughts cease? “ “No. “ So in the case of the Direction of Cessation.🔽“When wholesome thoughts arise, do unwholesome thoughts cease? “ “No. “ So in the case of the Direction of Arising and Cessation.

original: “Yo kusalaṃ dhammaṃ bhāveti, so akusalaṃ dhammaṃ pajahitthāti? No…pe… yo kusalaṃ🔽dhammaṃ na bhāveti, so akusalaṃ dhammaṃ nappajahitthāti? Aggamaggasamaṅgiñca arahantañca
analyzed: yaḥ kusalam dhammam bhāveti saḥ akusalam dhammam pajahittha ati no upe yaḥ kusalam 🔽dhammaṃ na bhāveti saḥ akusalam dhammam na ppajahittha ati agga magga samaṅgin ca arahantam ca
translated: “Does he who develops a wholesome thought abandon an unwholesome thought? “ “No. “ “Does he who does not develop a wholesome thought abandon an unwholesome thought? “ “Yes. “ “Does he who develops a wholesome thought abandon an unwholesome thought? “ “No. “ “Does he who does not develop a wholesome thought abandon an unwholesome thought? “ “No. “ “Does he who develops a wholesome thought abandon an unwholesome thought? “ “Yes. “ “Does he who does not develop a wholesome thought abandon an unwholesome thought? “ “No. “ So in the case of the Direction Dealing with Abandoning.

original: ṭhapetvā avasesā puggalā”tiādinā bhāvanāvāre ca pucchāvissajjananayo heṭṭhā vuttānusārena ñātabbo.
analyzed: ṭhapetvā avasesā puggala ati ādinā bhāvanā vāre ca pucchā vissajjana nayaḥ heṭṭhā vutta anusārena ñātabbaḥ
translated: In the section on the profitable, etc., the method of question and answer should be understood in the way already stated .

original: Atthavinicchaye panettha idaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ. Imassa hi dhammayamakassa pavattimahāvāre🔽uppajjanti nirujjhantīti imesu uppādanirodhesu kusalākusaladhammā tāva ekantena pavattiyaṃyeva
analyzed: attha vinicchaye pana ittha idam lakkhaṇam imassa hi dhamma yamakassa pavatti mahāvāre  uppajjanti nirujjhanti iti imesu uppāda nirodhesu kusala akusala dhammā tāva ekantena pavattiyaṃ yeva
translated: Herein, this is the characteristic of the exposition. In the case of this Thread, in the first place, in the case of the great division on occurrence,🔽in the case of the profitable and unprofitable ideas, only the arising and the ceasing are found in the occurrence,

original: labbhanti, na cutipaṭisandhīsu, abyākatadhammā pana pavatte ca cutipaṭisandhīsu cāti🔽tīsupi kālesu labbhanti, evamettha yaṃ yattha yattha labbhati, tassa vasena tattha
analyzed: labbhanti na cuti paṭisandhīsu abyākata dhammā pana pavatte ca cuti paṭisandhīsu ca ati  tīsu pi kālesu labbhanti evam ettha yam yattha yattha labbhati tassa vasena tattha
translated: not in the death and rebirth-linking, while in the case of the indeterminate ideas they are found in all three instances, that is, in the occurrence, the death, and the rebirth-linking.

original: tattha vinicchayo veditabbo.
analyzed: tattha vinicchayaḥ veditabbo
translated: So here the exposition should be understood in each case according to what is found in each case.

original: Tatridaṃ nayamukhaṃ – kusalākusalānaṃ tāva ekakkhaṇe anuppajjanato “no”ti paṭisedho
analyzed: tatra idam naya mukham kusala akusalānam tāva eka khaṇe an uppajjanataḥ no ti paṭisedhaḥ
translated: Here is the method. In the first place, since the profitable and unprofitable are not found in the same moment, the denial “No” is made.

original: kato. Abyākatā cāti idaṃ cittasamuṭṭhānarūpaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Yattha kusalā dhammā
analyzed: kataḥ abyākatā ca ati idam citta samuṭṭhāna rūpam sandhāya vuttam yattha kusalāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: As to the indeterminate: this is said with reference to the materiality originated by the mind. In the case of the profitable ideas, etc.,

original: nuppajjantīti asaññabhavaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, abyākatānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppattiṭṭhānassābhāvā
analyzed: nuppajjanti iti asañña bhavam sandhāya vuttam abyākatānam dhammānam anuppatti ṭṭhānassa abhāvā
translated: “Do not arise” is said with reference to the non-percipient becoming, because there is no place for the arising of indeterminate states.

original: “natthī”ti paṭikkhepo kato, nirodhavāre kusalākusalānaṃ ekato anirujjhanato “no”ti
analyzed: natthi iti paṭikkhepaḥ kataḥ nirodha vāre kusala akusalānam ekatas anirujjhanataḥ no ti
translated: “No” is said because the profitable and unprofitable do not cease together in the case of the cessation-of-perception base.

original: vuttanti imināva nayamukhena sabbattha vinicchayo veditabbo. Ayaṃ dhammayamakamātikatthasaṃvaṇṇanānayo.🔽Indriyayamakamātikatthavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vuttam ti iminā ava naya mukhena sabbattha vinicchayaḥ veditabbaḥ ayam dhamma yamaka mātika ttha saṃvaṇṇanā nayaḥ
translated: The exposition should be understood in this way in all instances. This is the method of exposition in the case of the dyad of ideas.🔽In the case of the dyad of faculties, the exposition of the meaning of the text should be understood in all instances by the method stated in the case of the dyads of aggregates, etc.,

original: Indriyayamakamātikāyaṃ pana khandhayamakamātikādīsu vuttanayeneva pāḷivavatthānādiko
analyzed: indriya yamaka mātikāyam pana khandha yamaka mātikā ādīsu vutta nayena iva pāḷi vavatthāna ādikaḥ
translated: namely, the definition of the text, etc.,

original: sabbo atthasaṃvaṇṇanānayo veditabbo. Manindriyaṃ panettha yathā cakkhundriyādimūlakehi,
analyzed: sabbaḥ attha saṃvaṇṇanā nayaḥ veditabbaḥ man indriyam pana ittha yathā cakkhu indriya ādi mūlakehi
translated: The mind faculty here is associated with the femininity faculty, etc., just as it is with the eye faculty, etc.,

original: tatheva itthindriyādimūlakehi saddhiṃ sampayogaṃ gacchati, tasmā nikkhittapaṭipāṭiyā
analyzed: tathā iva itthi indriya ādi mūlakehi saddhim sampayogam gacchati tasmā nikkhitta paṭipāṭiyā
translated: so it is associated with the femininity faculty, etc., too. Therefore it is not yoked in the order given,🔽but it is yoked at the end with all the faculties beginning with the eye faculty.

original: ayojetvā sabbehipi cakkhundriyamūlādīhi saddhiṃ pariyosāne yojitaṃ, cakkhundriyena
analyzed: a yojetvā sabbehi pi cakkhundriya mūla ādīhi saddhim pariyosāne yojitam cakkhundriyena
translated: With the eye faculty,

original: ca saddhiṃ sukhindriyadukkhindriyadomanassindriyāni, lokuttarindriyāni ca paṭisandhiyaṃ
analyzed: ca saddhim sukha indriya dukkha indriya domanassa indriyāni lokuttara indriyāni ca paṭisandhiyam
translated: and the pleasure faculty, pain faculty, and grief faculty, and the supramundane faculties, are not included because they do not exist in rebirth-linking.

original: natthīti na gahitāni. Yathā cettha, evaṃ sesindriyamūlakesupi yathānurūpaṃ ñātabbaṃ.
analyzed: natthi iti na gahitāni yathā ca ittha evam sesa indriya mūlakesu pi yathā anurūpam ñātabbam
translated: And as here, so too in the other dyads beginning with the faculties, they should be understood according to the method stated.

original: Indriyānaṃ pana bahukatāya dhātuyamakatopi bahutarāni yamakāni honti ayaṃ viseso,
analyzed: pana bahukatāya dhātu yamakataḥ api bahutarāni yamakāni honti ayam visesaḥ
translated: But because of the multiplicity of faculties, the dyads are more numerous than the elements. This is the difference.

original: sesaṃ heṭṭhā vuttānusārena ñātabbanti. Ayaṃ indriyayamakamātikatthasaṃvaṇṇanānayo.
analyzed: sesam heṭṭhā vutta anusārena ñātabban ti ayam indriya yamaka mātika ttha saṃvaṇṇanā anayaḥ
translated: The rest should be understood by the method stated above. This is the method of explaining the meaning of the dyads of the faculties.

original: Mohavicchedaniyā abhidhammamātikatthavaṇṇanāya
translated: The exposition of the dyads of the Abhidhamma Pitaka, which is a part of the Mohavicchedani

original: Yamakamātikatthavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽7. Paṭṭhānamātikatthavaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the dyads is ended.🔽The exposition of the numerical groups

original: Idāni paṭṭhānamātikāya atthasaṃvaṇṇanānayo hoti. Kenaṭṭhena paṭṭhānanti? Nānappakārapaccayaṭṭhena.
analyzed: idāni paṭṭhāna mātikāya attha saṃvaṇṇanā anayaḥ hoti kenaṭṭhena paṭṭhānan ti nānappakāra paccaya ṭṭhena
translated: Now there is the method of explaining the meaning of the numerical groups of the Paṭṭhāna. In what sense is it called Paṭṭhāna? In the sense of condition in its various modes.

original: Pa-saddo hi nānappakāratthaṃ dīpeti, ṭhāna-saddo paccayatthaṃ. Atha vā vibhajanaṭṭhena
analyzed: pa saddaḥ hi nānā pakāra attham dīpeti ṭhāna saddaḥ paccaya ttham atha vā vibhajana ṭṭhena
translated: For the word paṭṭhāna signifies various modes, and the word ṭhāna signifies condition. Or else, in the sense of distribution,

original: paṭṭhānaṃ. Yathā hi paññāpanā paṭṭhapanā vivaraṇā vibhajanā uttānīkammanti āgataṭṭhāne
analyzed: paṭṭhānam yathā hi paññāpanā paṭṭhapanā vivaraṇā vibhajanā uttānīkammanti āgata ṭṭhāne
translated: As in the passage: “The establishment of the teaching, the establishment of the rules of training, the establishment of the recital in detail, the establishment of the recital in brief, the establishment of the higher penalty” ,

original: vibhajanaṭṭho paṭṭhānasaddasamānattho paṭṭhapanā-saddo dissati, evamidhāpi kusalādīnaṃ
analyzed: vibhajana ṭṭhaḥ paṭṭhāna sadda samāna atthaḥ paṭṭhapanā saddo dissati evam idha api kusala ādīnam
translated: the word “establishment” is seen to have the same meaning as the word “recital in detail,” which has the meaning of “analysis.” So too here, because of the analysis of the wholesome, etc.,

original: dhammānaṃ hetupaccayādīhi vibhajanato vibhajanaṭṭhena paṭṭhānaṃ nāma. Atha vā paṭṭhitaṭṭhena
analyzed: dhammānam hetu paccaya ādīhi vibhajanataḥ vibhajana ṭṭhena paṭṭhānam nāma atha vā paṭṭhita ṭṭhena
translated: dhammas by way of the root-conditions, etc., it is called “establishment” in the sense of “analysis.” Or alternatively, it is called “establishment” in the sense of “going” ,

original: paṭṭhānaṃ, gamanaṭṭhenāti attho. Sabbadhammesu hi asaṅgagamanassa sabbaññutaññāṇassa
analyzed: paṭṭhānam gamana ṭṭhena āti attho sabba dhammesu hi asaṅga gamanassa sabbaññuta ññāṇassa
translated: in the sense of “going forth” . For the knowledge of omniscience, which goes without obstruction in all dhammas,

original: hetupaccayādibhedabhinnesu kusalādīsu vitthāritanayalābhato nissaṅgavasena pavattagamanattā
analyzed: hetu paccaya ādi bheda bhinnesu kusala ādīsu vitthārita naya lābhataḥ nissaṅga vasena pavatta gamana ttā
translated: goes forth without obstruction in the wholesome, etc., which are differentiated by way of root-conditions, etc., by obtaining the method of exposition in detail.

original: gamanaṭṭhena paṭṭhānaṃ nāma, iti nānappakārapaccayaṭṭhena, vibhajanaṭṭhena, gamanaṭṭhena
analyzed: gamana ṭṭhena paṭṭhānam nāma iti nāna ppakāra paccaya ṭṭhena vibhajana ṭṭhena gamana ṭṭhena
translated: Thus, in the sense of “analysis” by way of the various kinds of conditions, in the sense of “analysis,” and in the sense of “going,”

original: ca tikapaṭṭhānādīsu catuvīsatiyā paṭṭhānesu ekekampi paṭṭhānaṃ nāma, tesaṃ pana samūhato
analyzed: ca tika paṭṭhāna ādīsu catuvīsatiyā paṭṭhānesu ekekam pi paṭṭhānam nāma tesam pana samūhato
translated: each of the twenty-four establishments in the three-fold, four-fold, etc., establishments is called “establishment.” But in the sense of “collection,”

original: pakaraṇaṃ paṭṭhānaṃ nāma, tesaṃ paṭṭhānānaṃ mātikā. Sayampi vā paṭṭhānabhūtā mātikā,
analyzed: pakaraṇam paṭṭhānam nāma tesam paṭṭhānānam mātikā sayam pi vā paṭṭhāna bhūtā mātikā
translated: Or the mātikā itself is the paṭṭhāna.

original: sabbampetaṃ paṭṭhānamātikā. Yā sā “hetupaccayo, ārammaṇapaccayo…pe… avigatapaccayo”ti🔽evaṃ tikapaṭṭhānādicatuvīsatippabhedasamantapaṭṭhānadesanāya mūlabhūtapaccayabhedassa
analyzed: sabbam petam paṭṭhāna mātikā yā sā hetu paccayaḥ ārammaṇa paccaya upe avigata paccayaḥ ti  evam mūla bhūta paccaya bhedassa
translated: All this is the paṭṭhāna and the mātikā.

original: vasena bhagavatā pakaraṇassa ādimhi ṭhapitā, ayaṃ idha paṭṭhānamātikā nāma.
analyzed: vasena bhagavatā pakaraṇassa ādimhi ṭhapitā ayam idha paṭṭhānamātikā nāma
translated: The mātikā that the Exalted One set out at the beginning of the text in the form of the twenty-four paṭṭhānas, beginning with the three-factored paṭṭhāna, by way of the various kinds of paccaya that form its basis, is called the paṭṭhāna mātikā here.

original: Tattha anuttānatthādisahito saṅkhepatthavinicchayo tāva evaṃ veditabbo – hetupaccayotiādīsu
analyzed: tattha anuttāna attha ādi sahitaḥ saṅkhepa ttha vinicchayaḥ tāva evam veditabbaḥ hetu paccayaḥ ti ādīsu
translated: The concise explanation of the meaning of the mātikā, together with the unexpounded meaning, should be understood as follows:🔽In the passage beginning “hetupaccaya” ,

original: hi hetu ca so paccayo cāti hetupaccayo, hetu hutvā paccayo hetupaccayo, hetubhāvena🔽paccayoti vuttaṃ hoti. Tattha hetūti vacanāvayavakāraṇamūlānametaṃ adhivacanaṃ. “Paṭiññāhetū”tiādīsu
analyzed: hi hetu ca so paccayaḥ ca ati hetu paccayaḥ hetu hutvā paccayaḥ hetu paccayaḥ hetu bhāvena  paccayaḥ ti vuttam hoti tattha hetū ti adhivacanam paṭiññā hetu utiādīsu
translated: hetu and paccaya are hetupaccaya. Hetupaccaya is hetu and paccaya, hetu as paccaya, hetu as🔽paccayuppatti. Herein, the word hetu is a designation for the cause, the reason, the root.🔽For in the world, a cause is called a hetu in such passages as “paṭiññāhetu” .

original: hi loke vacanāvayavo “hetū”ti vuccati, sāsane pana “ye dhammā hetuppabhavā”tiādīsu
analyzed: hi loke vacana avayavaḥ hetu iti vuccati sāsane pana ye dhammā hetu ppabhavā ti ādīsu
translated: But in the Dispensation, in such passages as “Ye dhammā hetuppabhavā” ,

original: kāraṇaṃ, “tayo kusalā hetū, tayo akusalā hetū”tiādīsu mūlaṃ, idaṃ idha adhippetaṃ,
analyzed: kāraṇam tayo kusalā hetū tayo akusalā hetu uti ādīsu mūlam idam idha adhippetam
translated: Root is what is meant here.🔽It is a condition in the sense of cause,

original: taṃ paṭicca etasmā etīti paccayo, apaccakkhāya naṃ vattatīti attho. Yo hi dhammo
analyzed: tam paṭicca etasmai eti iti paccayaḥ a paccakkhāya nam vattati iti atthaḥ yaḥ hi dhammo
translated: because it is the cause of the occurrence of the state of being of the things that are its effects.

original: yaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca apaccakkhāya tiṭṭhati vā uppajjati vā, so tassa upakārakalakkhaṇena
analyzed: yam dhammam paṭicca a paccakkhāya tiṭṭhati vā uppajjati vā so tassa upakāraka lakkhaṇena
translated: For a state of being does not occur without a cause.

original: paccayo nāma. Iti mūlaṭṭhena hetu, upakārakaṭṭhena paccayoti saṅkhepato mūlaṭṭhena
analyzed: paccayaḥ nāma iti mūla ṭṭhena hetu upakāraka ṭṭhena paccayaḥ ti saṅkhepataḥ mūla ṭṭhena
translated: And a state of being is a condition in the sense of cause for a state of being that is subsequent to it and of the same kind as itself,🔽but not for a state of being that is not subsequent to it and not of the same kind as itself.🔽So a state of being is a cause in the sense of root, and a condition in the sense of assistance.

original: upakārako dhammo hetupaccayo, kusalādīnaṃ kusalādibhāvasādhakoti keci, evaṃ sante
analyzed: upakārakaḥ dhammaḥ hetu paccayaḥ kusala ādīnam kusala ādi bhāva sādhakaḥ ti keci evam sante
translated: Some say that a state of being is a cause in the sense of root and a condition in the sense of assistance.🔽But if that were so,🔽the state of being of the materiality originated thereby would not be a cause condition,

original: pana taṃsamuṭṭhānarūpesu hetupaccayatā na sampajjati, ahetukacittānañca vinā etehi🔽abyākatabhāvo siddho, sahetukānampi ca yonisomanasikārādipaṭibaddho kusalādibhāvo,
analyzed: pana tad samuṭṭhāna rūpesu hetu paccaya tā na sampajjati ahetuka cittānam ca vinā etehi  abyākata bhāvo siddhaḥ ca yoniso manasikāra ādi paṭibaddhaḥ kusala ādi bhāvaḥ
translated: and the state of being of the immaterial states would be established without these states.🔽And the state of being of the states with root-cause would be bound up with right view, etc.,

original: na sampayuttahetupaṭibaddho. Yadi ca siyā, hetūsupi kusalādibhāvasādhakena aññena
analyzed: na sampayutta hetu paṭibaddhaḥ yadi ca siyā hetūsupi kusala ādi bhāva sādhakena aññena
translated: and not bound up with associated cause. And if it were,

original: bhavitabbaṃ, kusalādibhāvasādhanavasena pana hetūnaṃ mūlaṭṭhaṃ aggahetvā suppatiṭṭhitabhāvasādhanavasena
analyzed: bhavitabbam kusala ādi bhāva sādhana vasena pana hetūnam mūla ṭṭham aggahetvā suppatiṭṭhita bhāva sādhana vasena
translated: But although the root-meaning of cause is not taken as the establishment of the profitable, etc., still there is no contradiction in taking it as the establishment of the well-foundedness.

original: gayhamāne na kiñci virujjhati. Laddhahetupaccayā hi dhammā viruḷhamūlā viya pādapā
analyzed: gayhamāne na kiñci virujjhati laddha hetu paccayāḥ hi dhammāḥ viruḷha mūlāḥ viya pādapāḥ
translated: For states that have obtained a cause condition are well founded, like trees with roots,

original: thirā honti suppatiṭṭhitā, itare pana tilabījakādisevālā viya na suppatiṭṭhitā, iti
analyzed: thirāḥ honti su patiṭṭhitāḥ itare pana na su patiṭṭhitāḥ iti
translated: whereas those that have not obtained a cause condition are not well founded, like sesame seeds and so on that have not been put into the ground.

original: mūlaṭṭhena upakārakoti suppatiṭṭhitabhāvasādhanena upakārako dhammo hetupaccayoti veditabbo.🔽Niddese “hetū hetusampayuttakānaṃ dhammānaṃ taṃsamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṃ hetupaccayena
analyzed: mūla ṭṭhena upakārako ti suppatiṭṭhita bhāva sādhanena upakārako dhammo hetu paccayaḥ ti veditabbaḥ  niddese hetū hetu sampayuttakānam dhammānam tad samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam hetu paccayena
translated: So a state that is helpful in the sense of being a root should be understood as a cause condition in the sense of establishing well-foundedness.🔽In the description it is said: “Causes are a condition, as cause condition, for states conascent with the cause and for the kinds of materiality originated thereby” . Herein, the words “for the kinds of materiality originated thereby” are said

original: paccayo”ti vuttaṃ, tattha “cittasamuṭṭhānāna”nti avatvā “taṃsamuṭṭhānāna”nti idaṃ
analyzed: paccayaḥ ti vuttam tattha citta samuṭṭhānānam ti avatvā tad samuṭṭhānānam ti idam
translated: not as “for the kinds of materiality that are conascent with consciousness” but as “for those originated thereby”🔽in order to include the kinds of materiality originated by the immaterial.

original: acittasamuṭṭhānānampi saṅgaṇhanatthaṃ. Pañhāvārasmiṃ hi “paṭisandhikkhaṇe vipākābyākatā
analyzed: acitta samuṭṭhānānam pi saṅgaṇhana attham pañhā vārasmim hi paṭisandhi khaṇe
translated: In the section dealing with questions it is said: “At the moment of rebirth-linking, the resultant indeterminate

original: hetū sampayuttakānaṃ khandhānaṃ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṃ hetupaccayena paccayo”ti āgataṃ,
analyzed: hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ ti āgatam
translated: and of the aggregates associated with it, and of the kinds of materiality derived by way of kamma performed, it is a condition by way of root condition.”

original: kasmā panāyaṃ hetu paṭisandhiyameva kaṭattārūpānaṃ hetupaccayena paccayo hoti, na🔽pavatteti? Paṭisandhiyaṃ kammajarūpānaṃ cittapaṭibaddhavuttitāya, bhavapaṭhamanipātato🔽cittajāti. Itararūpasantatiuppatthambhābhāvena eva dubbalavatthuṃ cittameva nissāya
analyzed: kasmā pana ayam hetu paṭisandhiyam eva kaṭattā rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ hoti na  pavattā iti paṭisandhiyam kamma ja rūpānam citta paṭibaddha vutti tāya bhava paṭhama nipātato  citta jāti itara rūpa santati uppatthambha abhāvena eva dubbala vatthum cittam eva nissāya
translated: But why is this root condition only a condition by way of root condition for the kinds of materiality derived by k way of kamma performed at the moment of rebirth-linking,🔽and not in the course of an existence? Because the materiality derived by kamma at the moment of rebirth-linking has its occurrence bound up with consciousness, and because it arises and persists supported by consciousness alone, which is a weak support, since it is unable to project a new becoming by the force of kamma,

original: uppajjati ceva tiṭṭhati ca. Taṃ cittampi hi paṭisandhikkhaṇe kammavegakkhittatāya🔽ceva apurejātavatthukatāya ca appatiṭṭhitaṃ, papāte patitamattako puriso na kiñci
analyzed: uppajjati ca iva tiṭṭhati ca tam cittam pi hi paṭisandhi kkhaṇe kamma vega kkhitta tāya  ca iva a purejāta vatthuka tāya ca appatiṭṭhitam papāte patita mattakaḥ puriso na kiñci
translated: as it is the first consciousness in the new becoming, and since it has no prior materiality as its support.🔽For just as a man who has fallen over a precipice is unable to do anything until he has touched the ground, so too consciousness derived by kamma is unable to generate materiality derived by kamma until it has touched down by means of the materiality derived by nutriment.

original: sippaṃ kātuṃ viya cittajarūpaṃ janetuṃ na sakkoti, tameva kaṭattārūpaṃ nissāya patiṭṭhāti.
analyzed: sippam kātum viya citta ja rūpam janetum na sakkoti tam eva kaṭattā rūpam nissāya patiṭṭhāti
translated: And that consciousness at the moment of rebirth-linking is unable to touch down because it is impelled by the force of kamma and because it has no prior materiality as its support.

original: Paṭisandhicittāni hi rūpaṃ na janenti, kammajarūpameva pana tesaṃ cittasamuṭṭhānarūpaṭṭhāne
analyzed: paṭisandhi cittāni hi rūpam na janenti kamma ja rūpam eva pana tesam citta samuṭṭhāna rūpa ṭṭhāne
translated: The consciousnesses at the moment of rebirth-linking do not generate materiality. But the materiality derived by kamma is established by taking as its support the materiality derived by nutriment, which is the first to arise among the kinds of materiality that are generated by consciousness.

original: tiṭṭhati, pavattiyaṃ pana paṭiladdhupatthambhatāya taṃ rūpaṃ vināpi kammapaṭibaddhāva🔽pavatti, hetupaccayassa panettha kusalādibhedato, bhūmibhedato ca vibhāgo heṭṭhā
analyzed: tiṭṭhati pavattiyam pana paṭiladdha upatthambha tāya tam rūpam vinā api kamma paṭibaddhā ava  pavatti hetu paccayassa pana ittha kusala ādi bhedataḥ bhūmi bhedato ca vibhāgaḥ heṭṭhā
translated: But in occurrence, it is supported by the kamma that has already been acquired, and it occurs without that materiality.

original: vuttanayeneva veditabboti ayaṃ hetupaccaye nayo.
analyzed: vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ ti ayam hetu paccaye nayo
translated: But the analysis of the condition by way of cause according to the profitable, etc., and according to the plane should be understood in the way already stated under the condition consisting in decisive support .🔽This is the method of explaining the condition consisting in cause.

original: Tato paresu ārammaṇabhāvena upakārako dhammo ārammaṇapaccayo, so niddese “rūpāyatanaṃ
analyzed: tatas paresu ārammaṇa bhāvena upakārakaḥ dhammaḥ ārammaṇa paccayo saḥ niddese rūpa āyatanam
translated: Next, the condition by way of object is a state that assists by being the object. It is stated in the description thus:🔽“The visible-data base is a condition, as object condition, for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith.

original: cakkhuviññāṇadhātuyā…pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṃ kāyaviññāṇadhātuyā taṃsampayuttakānañca🔽dhammānaṃ…pe… rūpāyatanaṃ saddagandharasaphoṭṭhabbāyatanaṃ manodhātuyā…pe… sabbe
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa dhātuyā āpe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇa dhātuyā tad sampayuttakānam ca  rūpa āyatanam sadda gandha rasa phoṭṭhabba āyatanam manaḥ dhātu yāpe sabbe
translated: The tangible-data base is a condition, as object condition, for the body-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith.🔽The visible-data base, the sound base, the odour base, the flavour base, the tangible-data base, are conditions, as object condition, for the mind element and for the states associated therewith.

original: dhammā manoviññāṇadhātuyā…pe… yaṃ yaṃ dhammaṃ ārabbha ye ye dhammā uppajjanti cittacetasikā
analyzed: dhammā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātuyā āpe yam yam dhammaṃ ārabbha ye ye dhammāḥ uppajjanti citta cetasikā
translated: All are conditions, as object condition, for the mind-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith.

original: dhammā, te te dhammā tesaṃ tesaṃ dhammānaṃ ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo”ti evaṃ niddiṭṭhattā
analyzed: dhammā te te dhammā tesam tesam dhammānam ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ti evam niddiṭṭha ttā
translated: Whatever states arise contingent upon any given state, that given state is a condition, as object condition, for those states” .

original: na koci dhammo na hoti. Yathā hi dubbalapuriso daṇḍaṃ vā rajjuṃ vā ālambitvā uṭṭhahati
analyzed: na koci dhammaḥ na hoti yathā hi dubbala purisaḥ daṇḍam vā rajjum vā ālambitvā uṭṭhahati
translated: No phenomenon is without it. Just as a weak man gets up and stands up holding on to a stick or a rope,

original: ceva tiṭṭhati ca, evaṃ cittacetasikā dhammā rūpādīsu chasu yaṃ kiñci ālambitvā uppajjanti🔽ceva tiṭṭhanti ca, tasmā lokiyalokuttarādibhedā sabbepi dhammā yathāyogaṃ cittacetasikānaṃ
analyzed: ca iva tiṭṭhati ca evam citta cetasikāḥ dhammāḥ rūpa ādīsu chasu yam kiñci ālambitvā uppajjanti  ca iva tiṭṭhanti ca tasmā lokiya lokuttara ādi bhedā sabbe pi dhammā yathāyogam citta cetasikānam
translated: so too the mental factors and consciousness arise and occur holding on to one or other of the six objects beginning with visible data.

original: ārammaṇapaccayoti veditabboti ayaṃ ārammaṇapaccaye nayo.🔽Jeṭṭhakaṭṭhena upakārako dhammo adhipatipaccayo, so niddese “chandādhipati chandasampayuttakānaṃ🔽dhammānaṃ taṃsamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṃ…pe… vīriyacittavīmaṃsādhipati…pe… adhipatipaccayena🔽paccayo, yaṃ yaṃ dhammaṃ garuṃ katvā ye ye dhammā uppajjanti cittacetasikā dhammā,
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayaḥ ti veditabbaḥ ti ayam ārammaṇa paccaye nayo  jeṭṭhaka ṭṭhena upakārakaḥ dhammaḥ adhipati paccayaḥ saḥ niddese chanda adhipati chanda sampayuttakānam  dhammānaṃ tad samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ pe vīriya citta vīmaṃsa ādhipati pe adhipati paccayena  paccayaḥ yam yam dhammam garum katvā ye ye dhammāḥ uppajjanti citta cetasikāḥ dhammāḥ

original: te te dhammā tesaṃ tesaṃ dhammānaṃ adhipatipaccayena paccayo”ti evaṃ dvidhā niddiṭṭho.
analyzed: te te dhammā tesam tesam dhammānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ti evam dvidhā niddiṭṭhaḥ
translated: “Any states that arise and occur in dependence on a certain state are a condition, as predominance condition, for that state” .

analyzed: ca lobha sahagatassa iva na aññassa tathā kiriya bhūtaḥ api iti aṭṭhakathāyam āgatam tam  ñāṇa sampayutta kiriyānam sabbaññu taññāṇa abhiññā ādi pubba vasa ppavattānam kāmāvacara kusalehi
translated: It is stated in the Commentary that the functional plane is the object-predominance condition for the consciousnesses associated with greed,

Nibbāna is the object-predominance condition

analyzed: tesam eva lokuttara kusala vipākānam ca ati veditabban ti ayam adhipati paccaye nayo  anantara bhāvena upakārakaḥ dhammaḥ anantara paccayaḥ saḥ uva samanantara paccayaḥ byañjana mattam eva

analyzed: nānam upacaya santati iti ādīsu viya yam pi attha anantara tāya anantara paccayaḥ kāla anantara tāya  samanantara paccayo ti ācariyānam matam tat nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatana kusalam

analyzed: phala samāpattiyāḥ samanantara paccayena paccayaḥ ti ādīhi virujjhati tad niddese cakkhu viññāṇa dhātu

analyzed: dhammānaṃ pe purimā purimāḥ akusalāḥ dhammā pacchimānam pacchimānam akusalānam pe  abyākatānam pe yesam yesam dhammānam anantarā ye ye dhammāḥ uppajjanti citta cetasikā

analyzed: paviṭṭha ttā tesam hi paṭisandhi citta cetasikā sahajāta paccayā tāni pana  vatthu virahitāni rūpāni pavattiyam citta samuṭṭhānānam viya citta cetasikānam paccayattham
translated: materiality. For the mind and mental factors of rebirth-linking are a condition by way of association for those . But those materialities,

analyzed: na pharanti tasmai na vuttam tathā bhūtānam upādā rūpam evam hi a gayhamāne

original: viya. So niddese “cattāro khandhā arūpino aññamaññapaccayena paccayo, cattāro mahābhūtā…pe…
analyzed: viya so niddese cattāro khandhāḥ arūpino aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ cattāro
translated: “The four immaterial aggregates are a condition, by way of mutuality condition, for each other. The four great elementalities are a condition, by way of mutuality condition, for each other.

original: okkantikkhaṇe nāmarūpaṃ aññamaññapaccayena paccayo”ti evaṃ tidhā niddiṭṭhoti ayaṃ
analyzed: okkanti khaṇe nāma rūpam aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ ti evam tidhā niddiṭṭhaḥ ti ayam
translated: At the moment of descent into the womb mentality and materiality are a condition, by way of mutuality condition, for each other” .

original: aññamaññapaccaye nayo.
analyzed: añña mañña paccaye nayaḥ
translated: This is the method of explaining the mutuality condition.

original: Adhiṭṭhānākārena, nissayākārena ca upakārako dhammo nissayapaccayo tarucittakammādīnaṃ
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāna ākārena nissaya ākārena ca upakārakaḥ dhammaḥ nissaya paccayaḥ taru citta kamma ādīnam
translated: A state that assists by way of determination and by way of support is a support condition, like the earth, etc., for trees, etc.

original: pathavīpaṭādayo viya, so niddese sahajātapaccaye viya chadhāva niddiṭṭho. Chaṭṭho🔽panettha koṭṭhāso “cakkhāyatanaṃ cakkhuviññāṇadhātuyā, sotaghānajivhākāyāyatanaṃ
analyzed: pathavī paṭa ādayaḥ viya saḥ niddese sahajāta paccaye viya chadhā ava niddiṭṭhaḥ chaṭṭho  pana ittha koṭṭhāsaḥ cakkha āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇa dhātuyā sota ghāna jivhā kāya āyatanam
translated: The sixth🔽section here is shown by the words “The eye-base is a support condition for the eye-consciousness element, the ear-, nose-, tongue-, and body-bases are a support condition for the body-consciousness element …

original: kāyaviññāṇadhātuyā…pe… yaṃ rūpaṃ nissāya manodhātu ca manoviññāṇadhātu ca vattanti,🔽taṃ rūpaṃ manodhātuyā ca manoviññāṇadhātuyā ca taṃsampayuttakānañca dhammānaṃ nissayapaccayena
analyzed: kāya viññāṇa dhātuyā āpe yam rūpam nissāya manaḥ dhātu ca manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu ca vattanti  tam rūpam manaḥ dhātuyā ca manaḥ viññāṇa dhātuyā ca tad sampayuttakānam ca dhammānam nissaya paccayena
translated: The materiality that is the support for the mind element and the mind-consciousness element

original: paccayo”ti evaṃ purejātanissayadassanavasena vibhatto, sesaṃ tādisameva. Tattha rūpanti hadayavatthu.🔽Upanissayapaccayoti ettha panāyaṃ vacanattho – tadadhīnavuttitāya attano phalena🔽nissito, nappaṭikkhittoti nissayo, yathā pana bhuso āyāso upāyāso, evaṃ bhuso nissayo
analyzed: paccayaḥ ti evam purejāta nissaya dassana vasena vibhattaḥ sesam tādisam eva tattha rūpan ti hadaya vatthu  upanissaya paccayaḥ ti ettha pana ayam vacana atthaḥ tad adhīna vutti tāya attanaḥ phalena  nissitaḥ na paṭikkhittaḥ ti nissayaḥ yathā pana bhusaḥ āyāsaḥ upāyāsaḥ evam bhusaḥ nissayaḥ
translated: is a support condition for the mind element and the mind-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith” . The rest is similar to that. Herein, materiality is the heart- basis.

original: upanissayo, balavakāraṇassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ, tasmā balavakāraṇabhāvena upakārako dhammo
analyzed: upanissayaḥ balava kāraṇassa itam adhivacanam tasmā balava kāraṇa bhāvena upakārakaḥ dhammaḥ
translated: As regards the words “predominance condition” , the meaning of the words is this: It is a support , thus it is a support ; it is not a non-support . For it is a support in the sense of being a cause for the occurrence of its fruit by being prior to it. But just as “upāyāsa” is a compound word derived from “āyāsa” in the sense of “great” , so too “upanissaya” is a compound word derived from “nissaya” in the sense of “great” . This is a term for a powerful cause. So a state that is helpful by way of being a powerful cause is a predominance condition.

original: upanissayapaccayoti veditabbo. So ārammaṇūpanissayo anantarūpanissayo pakatūpanissayoti
analyzed: upanissaya paccayo ti veditabbaḥ saḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ ti
translated: It should be understood as a decisive-support condition. It is threefold as object-decisive- support, proximity-decisive-support, and natural-decisive-support.

original: tividho hoti. Tattha ārammaṇūpanissayo tāva ārammaṇādhipatinā saddhiṃ nānattaṃ akatvā🔽vibhatto. Tattha yaṃ ārammaṇaṃ garuṃ katvā cittacetasikā uppajjanti, taṃ niyamato
analyzed: tividhaḥ hoti tattha ārammaṇa upanissayo tāva ārammaṇa adhipatinā saddhim nānattam a katvā  vibhattaḥ tattha yam ārammaṇam garum katvā citta cetasikāḥ uppajjanti tam niyamato
translated: Herein, the object-decisive-support is distinguished without making any difference from the object-predominance.

original: tesaṃ ārammaṇesu balavārammaṇaṃ hoti, iti garukātabbamattaṭṭhena ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: tesam ārammaṇesu balavā ārammaṇam hoti iti garu kātabba matta ṭṭhena ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: Herein, the object by means of which consciousness and consciousness-concomitants arise making that their object is, as a rule, a powerful object among the objects. So the object-predominance is in the sense of what is to be given importance to,

original: balavakāraṇaṭṭhena ārammaṇūpanissayoti evametesaṃ nānattaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: balava kāraṇa ṭṭhena ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ ti evam etesam nānattam veditabbam
translated: and the object-decisive-support is in the sense of a powerful cause. This is how their difference should be understood.

original: Anantarūpanissayopi anantarapaccayena nānattaṃ akatvāva vibhatto, evaṃ santepi attano🔽attano anantaraṃ anurūpassa cittuppādassa pavattanasamatthatāya anantaratā, purimacittassa
analyzed: anantara ūpa nissayaḥ api anantara paccayena nānattam a katvā ava vibhattaḥ evam sante pi attano  attanaḥ anantaram anurūpassa cittuppādassa pavattana samattha tāya anantara tā purima cittassa
translated: The proximity-decisive-support is distinguished without making any difference from the proximity condition. Nevertheless, it should be understood that the proximity is the fact of being suitable to cause to arise next to itself a consciousness of a kind in conformity with itself,

original: pacchimacittuppādane balavatāya anantarūpanissayatā ca veditabbā. Yathā hi hetupaccayādīsu
analyzed: pacchima citta uppādane balava tāya ananta rūpa nissaya tā ca veditabbā yathā hi hetu paccaya ādīsu
translated: and the proximity-decisive-support is the fact of being powerful in causing the next consciousness to arise. For just as, among the conditions beginning with cause,

original: kañci dhammaṃ vināpi cittaṃ uppajjati, na evaṃ anantaracittaṃ vinā cittassa uppatti
analyzed: kañci dhammam vinā api cittam uppajjati na evam anantara cittam vinā cittassa uppatti
translated: A state of consciousness arises without a preceding consciousness, but not without a condition.

original: nāma atthi, tasmā balavapaccayo hoti, iti balavakāraṇaṭṭhena anantarova anantarūpanissayoti
analyzed: nāma atthi tasmai balava paccayaḥ hoti iti balava kāraṇa ṭṭhena anantaraḥ uva anantara upanissayaḥ ti
translated: So it is a powerful condition. Thus the condition by way of proximity is the proximate condition by reason of being a powerful cause.

original: evametesaṃ nānattaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: evam etesam nānattam veditabbam
translated: This is how the difference should be understood.

original: Pakato upanissayo pakatūpanissayo, pakato nāma attano santāne uppādito vā saddhāsīlādiupasevito
analyzed: pakataḥ upanissayaḥ pakatūpanissayaḥ pakataḥ nāma attano santāne uppāditaḥ vā saddhā sīla ādi upasevito
translated: Natural condition: the natural condition is either what is produced in one’s own continuity or what is resorted to by faith, virtue, etc.,

original: vā utubhojanādipakatiyāyeva vā upanissayo pakatūpanissayo, iti parūpanissayena amissoti
analyzed: vā utu bhojana ādi pakatiyāya iva vā upanissayaḥ pakatu upanissayaḥ iti para upanissayena amissaḥ ti
translated: or what is a condition by way of faculty, etc., naturally. So it is not mixed up with the other-nature condition.

original: attho. So ca pakatūpanissayo “saddhaṃ upanissāya dānaṃ deti, sīlaṃ samādiyati, uposathakammaṃ🔽karoti, jhānaṃ uppādeti; vipassanaṃ, maggaṃ, abhiññaṃ, samāpattiṃ uppādeti; sīlaṃ,
analyzed: attho so ca pakata upanissayaḥ saddham upanissāya dānam deti sīlam samādiyati uposatha kammaṃ  karoti jhānam uppādeti vipassanam maggam abhiññam samāpattim uppādeti sīlam
translated: And this natural condition is stated thus: “He gives a gift, having resorted to faith; he undertakes virtue, undertakes observances, undertakes asceticism, having resorted to faith.

original: sutaṃ, cāgaṃ, paññaṃ upanissāya dānaṃ deti…pe… samāpattiṃ uppādetī”tiādinā imesaṃ
analyzed: sutam ca āgam paññam upanissāya dānam samāpattim uppādeti itiādinā imesam
translated: He generates the jhāna, insight, path, direct-knowledge, and fruition, having resorted to faith. He gives a gift, having resorted to virtue … to learning … to generosity … to understanding. He undertakes virtue … he generates the jhāna … the path … direct-knowledge … the fruition, having resorted to understanding” .

original: saddhādīnaṃ vasena bahudhā vibhatto, evaṃ upanissayapaccayo tividho. Niddese panāyaṃ🔽“purimā purimā kusalā dhammā pacchimānaṃ pacchimānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ …pe… akusalānaṃ
analyzed: saddhā ādīnam vasena bahudhā vibhattaḥ evam upanissaya paccayaḥ tividhaḥ niddese pana ayam  purimā purimā kusalā dhammā pacchimānam pacchimānam kusalānam dhammānam pe akusalānam
translated: It is classed in many ways according to faith, etc., and so it is threefold as decisive-support condition.🔽But in the description it is given thus:

original: kesañci…pe… abyākatānaṃ dhammānaṃ…pe… purimā purimā akusalā dhammā pacchimānaṃ pacchimānaṃ🔽akusalānaṃ…pe… kusalānaṃ kesañci…pe… abyākatānaṃ dhammānaṃ…pe… purimā purimā abyākatā🔽dhammā…pe… abyākatānaṃ, kusalānaṃ, akusalānaṃ upanissayapaccayena paccayo, puggalopi
analyzed: abyākatānam dhammānaṃ pe purimāḥ purimāḥ akusalāḥ dhammā pacchimānam pacchimānam  akusalānam kusalānam abyākatānam dhammānam pe purimā purimā abyākatā  abyākatānam kusalānam akusalānam upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ puggala upi
translated: “Profitable first … first unprofitable … first indeterminate … indeterminate … profitable … unprofitable states are a condition, as decisive-support condition, for some profitable … for some unprofitable … for some indeterminate states” .🔽And a person is a condition, as decisive-support condition, and so too a resting place” .

original: upanissayapaccayena paccayo, senāsanampī”ti evaṃ niddiṭṭho. Tattha purimāti anantarūpanissaye
analyzed: upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ senāsanam pi iti evam niddiṭṭhaḥ tattha purimā ti anantara upanissaye
translated: Herein, first means in the prior-to-arising decisive-support condition.

original: samanantarātītāva labbhanti.
analyzed: labbhanti
translated: Only the immediately past states are included.

original: Ārammaṇūpanissayapakatūpanissayesu pana nānāvidhivasena purimatarāvāti tayopi rāsī
analyzed: ārammaṇa upanissaya pakata upanissayesu pana nānā vidhi vasena rāsī
translated: But in the object-decisive-support condition and the proximate-decisive-support condition, the three kinds of states are included according to the various ways in which they are decisive-support conditions.

original: kusalena kusalapade labbhanti. Kusalena panākusale samanantarātītā na labbhanti,
analyzed: kusalena kusala pade labbhanti kusalena pana akusale samanantara atītāḥ na labbhanti
translated: and with profitable they are found in the profitable. But with profitable they are not found in the unprofitable as conascent and as postnascent,

original: tenāha “kesañcī”ti. Idaṃ hi “kusalo dhammo akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇūpanissayo
analyzed: tena āha kesañci iti idam hi kusalaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ
translated: hence he said “in some” . For this is said in the Question Section thus: “Is a profitable idea a condition, as decisive-support condition, for an unprofitable idea?

original: pakatūpanissayo, ārammaṇūpanissayo pana dānaṃ datvā…pe… taṃ garuṃ katvā rāgo uppajjati…pe…
analyzed: pakata upanissayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ pana dānam datvā āpe tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati āpe
translated: Yes. When, after giving a gift, after observing moral self- restraint, after taking up a meditation subject, he exalts himself and disparages others because of that giving, etc., greed arises in him, …

original: pakatūpanissayo saddhaṃ upanissāya mānaṃ jappetī”tiādinā pañhāvāre āgataṃ imaṃ nayaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pakata upanissayaḥ saddham upanissāya mānam jappeti iti ādinā pañhā vāre āgatam imam nayam sandhāya vuttam
translated: When, relying on faith, he exalts himself and disparages others because of that reliance on faith” .

original: Akusalena kusalapade hi samanantarātītā na labbhanti, tenāha “kesañcī”ti. Idaṃ pana🔽“akusalo dhammo kusalassa dhammassa pakatūpanissayo. Rāgaṃ upanissāya dānaṃ deti…pe…
analyzed: akusalena kusala pade hi samanantara atītāḥ na labbhanti tena āha kesañci iti idam pana  akusalaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa dhammassa pakatūpanissayaḥ rāgam upanissāya dānam detipe
translated: But with unprofitable they are not found in the profitable as conascent and as postnascent, hence he said “in some” . But this is said in the Question Section thus:🔽“Is an unprofitable idea a condition, as decisive-support condition, for a profitable idea?🔽Yes. When, after giving a gift out of greed, after observing moral self-restraint out of greed, after taking up a meditation subject out of greed, he exalts himself and disparages others because of that giving, etc.,

original: pāṇaṃ hantvā tassa paṭighātatthāya dānaṃ detī”tiādinā nayena pañhāvāre āgataṃ pakatūpanissayameva
analyzed: pāṇam hantvā tassa paṭighāta atthāya dānam deti iti ādinā nayena pañhā vāre āgatam pakata upanissayam eva
translated: when he gives a gift for the purpose of killing a breathing thing, for the purpose of burning a forest” , and so on.🔽This is said in the Question Section by way of the decisive-support condition as prenascent only.

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Yathā hi akusalaṃ kusalassa anantarūpanissayo na hoti, tathā ārammaṇūpanissayopi
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam yathā hi akusalam kusalassa anantara upanissayaḥ na hoti tathā ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ api
translated: and it is said accordingly. For just as the unprofitable is not a condition by way of proximity condition for the profitable, so too it is not a condition by way of object condition.

original: na hoti. Na hi taṃ garuṃ katvā kusalaṃ pavattati.
analyzed: na hoti na hi tam garum katvā kusalam pavattati
translated: For the profitable does not occur making the unprofitable its object.

original: Akusalena abyākatapade pana ārammaṇūpanissayova na labbhati. Na hi taṃ abyākatā garuṃ
analyzed: akusalena abyākata pade pana ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ uva na labbhati na hi tam abyākatā garum
translated: But in the case of the unprofitable and the indeterminate there is no object condition at all. For the indeterminate do not make the unprofitable their object,

original: karonti, anantarā panassa honti. Tenevettha “kesañcī”ti na vuttaṃ. Sesapadesu tayopi
analyzed: karonti anantarā pana assa honti tena iva ittha kesañci iti na vuttam sesa padesu
translated: but they are proximate to it. That is why “for some” is not said here. In the remaining cases all three

original: upanissayā labbhanteva. “Puggalopi, senāsanampī”ti idampi dvayaṃ pakatūpanissayavasenevettha🔽vuttaṃ, utubhojanādayo cettha saṅgahetabbā. Imasmiñca paccaye ekaccāya paññattiyā
analyzed: upanissayāḥ labbhanteva puggalaḥ pi senāsanam pi iti idam pi dvayam pakatu upanissaya vasena iva ittha  vuttam utu bhojana ādayaḥ ca ittha saṅgahetabbāḥ imasmin ca paccaye ekaccāya paññattiyā
translated: are found. And the two, “person” and “resting place,” are mentioned here only by way of the natural condition.

original: saddhiṃ sabbepi catubhūmakā dhammā saṅgahitāti veditabbāti ayaṃ upanissayapaccaye nayo.🔽Paṭhamataraṃ uppajjitvā vattamānabhāvena upakārakā rūpadhammā purejātapaccayo, so
analyzed: saddhim sabbe api catu bhūmakā dhammā saṅgahitā ati veditabbā ti ayam upanissaya paccaye nayo 🔽paṭhamataram uppajjitvā vattamāna bhāvena upakārakāḥ rūpa dhammāḥ purejāta paccayo so
translated: The season, food, etc., should be included here too. And it should be understood that in this condition all states in the four planes are included together with some determinations.

original: pasādatabbisayahadayavatthuvasena ekādasavidho. Niddese ca “cakkhāyatanaṃ cakkhuviññāṇadhātuyā🔽taṃsampayuttakānañca dhammānaṃ purejātapaccayena paccayo…pe… kāyāyatanaṃ kāyaviññāṇadhātuyā
analyzed: pasāda tad visaya hadaya vatthu vasena ekādasavidhaḥ niddese ca cakkha āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇa dhātuyā  tad sampayuttakānam ca dhammānam purejāta paccayena paccaya upe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇa dhātuyā
translated: and elevenfold as the physical basis of the sensitive matter that is the object of confidence.

original: …pe… rūpāyatanaṃ cakkhuviññāṇadhātuyā…pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṃ kāyaviññāṇadhātuyā…pe…🔽rūpāyatanaṃ saddagandharasaphoṭṭhabbāyatanaṃ manodhātuyā…pe… yaṃ rūpaṃ nissāya…pe…
analyzed: pe rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇa dhātu yāpe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇa dhātu yāpe  rūpa āyatanam sadda gandha rasa phoṭṭhabba āyatanam manaḥ dhātu yāpe yam rūpam
translated: And in the Description of Conditions: “The eye base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith. … The body base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the body-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith. … The visible-data base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith. … The tangible-data base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the body-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith. …

original: taṃ rūpaṃ manodhātuyā ca manoviññāṇadhātuyā ca kiñcikāle purejātapaccayena paccayo,
analyzed: tam rūpam manaḥ dhātuyā ca manaḥ viññāṇa dhātuyā ca kiñcikāle purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The visible-data base, the sound base, the odour base, the flavour base, and the tangible-data base are a condition, as prenascence condition, for the mind element and for the states associated therewith. … The materiality that has arisen and is present that is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the mind element and for the states associated therewith is a condition, as prenascence condition, sometimes for the mind element and for the states associated therewith,🔽sometimes not.

original: kiñcikāle na purejātapaccayena paccayo”ti evaṃ sabbathāpi pañcadvāre vatthārammaṇavasena,🔽manodvāre vatthuvaseneva cāyaṃ niddiṭṭho. Pañhāvāre pana ārammaṇapurejātaṃ “arahā
analyzed: kiñci kāle na purejāta paccayena paccayo ti evam sabbathā api pañca dvāre vattha ārammaṇa vasena  manaḥ dvāre vatthu vasena iva ca ayam niddiṭṭho pañhāvāre pana ārammaṇa purejātam arahā
translated: ” Thus it is described in all ways in the five doors as the physical basis and the object,🔽and in the mind door as the physical basis only. But in the Description of Terms, the prenascent object is given as follows: “The eye of an Arahant🔽is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith. … The mind of an Arahant is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the mind-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith. …

original: cakkhuṃ aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassatī”ti āgatattā manodvārepi aṭṭhārasannaṃ
analyzed: cakkhum aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati iti āgata ttā manaḥ dvāre pi aṭṭhārasannam
translated: ” Thus it is given in the mind door too for the eighteen

original: rūpānaṃ vasena ārammaṇapurejātampi labbhatevāti ayaṃ purejātapaccaye nayo.
analyzed: rūpānam vasena ārammaṇa purejātam pi labbhate iva ati ayam purejāta paccaye nayo
translated: And it is also possible in the case of the object-predominance condition that the object is prior to the condition. This is the method in the case of the prenascence condition.

original: Purejātānaṃ rūpadhammānaṃ upatthambhakaṭṭhena upakārako arūpadhammo pacchājātapaccayo🔽gijjhapotakasarīrānaṃ āhārāsā cetanā viya. Niddesepi cassa “pacchājātā cittacetasikā
analyzed: purejātānam rūpa dhammānam upatthambhaka ṭṭhena upakārakaḥ arūpa dhammaḥ pacchājāta paccayo  gijjha potaka sarīrānaṃ cetanā viya niddese pi ca ssa pacchājātā citta cetasikā
translated: A state that is helpful to prenascent states as their supporter is a postnascence condition for them,

original: dhammā purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo”ti evaṃ vuttaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: dhammā purejātassa imassa kāyassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayo ti evam vuttam tattha
translated: like the volition of craving for nutriment that is helpful to the states consisting of the body of a young crow. analyzed: upanijjhāyana ṭhena upakārakāni ṭhapetvā dvi pañca viññāṇesu ekagga tat ca
translated: Except for the three kinds of feeling and unification of mind in the two, the five-door and mind-door processes, all the other faculties are helpful by way of predominance.

original: sesāni kusalādibhedāni satta jhānaṅgāni jhānapaccayo. Dvipañcaviññāṇānaṃ hi abhinipātamattattā
analyzed: sesāni kusala ādi bhedāni satta jhāna aṅgāni jhāna paccayaḥ dvi pañca viññāṇānam hi abhinipāta matta ttā
translated: For the first five kinds of consciousness have only impulsion,🔽and the equanimity in the five is not classed among the jhāna factors because it is not of the kind called “looking on” .

original: tesu vedanekaggatā upanijjhāyanākārassa abhāvena jhānaṅgesu na uddhaṭā, niddese panassa
analyzed: tesu vedanā ekagga tā upanijjhāyana ākārassa abhāvena jhāna aṅgesu na uddhaṭā niddese pana assa
translated: But in the Description of the Terms of Expression it is said:

original: “jhānaṅgāni jhānasampayuttakānaṃ dhammānaṃ taṃsamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṃ jhānapaccayena🔽paccayo”ti niddiṭṭho. Idhāpi taṃsamuṭṭhānānanti iminā ca kaṭattārūpampi gahitaṃ.
analyzed: jhāna aṅgāni jhāna sampayuttakānam dhammānam tad samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ jhāna paccayena  paccayaḥ ti niddiṭṭhaḥ idha api iminā ca gahitam
translated: “The jhāna factors are a condition, as jhāna condition, for the states associated with jhāna and for the kinds of materiality originated thereby” .🔽And here the words “originated thereby” include the kinds of materiality originated by the kinds of consciousness associated with the jhāna.

original: Pañhāvārehi “paṭisandhikkhaṇe vipākābyākatāni jhānaṅgāni sampayuttakānaṃ khandhānaṃ
analyzed: pañhā vārehi paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vipāka abyākatāni jhāna aṅgāni sampayuttakānam khandhānam
translated: In the Questions it is said: “At the moment of rebirth-linking the resultant indeterminate jhāna factors are a condition, as jhāna condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness” .

original: kaṭattā ca rūpāna”nti vuttanti ayaṃ jhānapaccaye nayo.
analyzed: kaṭattā ca rūpānanti vuttanti ayam jhāna paccaye nayo
translated: This is the method in the case of jhāna condition.

original: Yato tato vā niyyānaṭṭhena upakārakāni kusalādibhedāni dvādasa maggaṅgāni maggapaccayo.
analyzed: yatas tatas vā niyyāna ṭṭhena upakārakāni kusala ādi bhedāni dvādasa maggaṅgāni magga paccayo
translated: The twelve path factors classed as profitable, etc., are path condition in the sense of leading out from the opposite state,🔽but in the Description of the Terms of Expression it is said:

original: Niddese pana “maggaṅgāni maggasampayuttakānaṃ dhammānaṃ taṃsamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṃ
analyzed: niddese pana maggaṅgāni magga sampayuttakānam dhammānam tad samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṃ
translated: “The path factors are a condition, as path condition, for the states associated with the path and for the kinds of materiality originated thereby” .

original: maggapaccayena paccayo”ti niddiṭṭho. Etthāpi taṃsamuṭṭhānānanti iminā kaṭattārūpaggahaṇaṃ.
analyzed: magga paccayena paccayaḥ ti niddiṭṭhaḥ ettha api iminā kaṭattā rūpa ggahaṇam
translated: “Condition by way of path condition” is stated. Here too, “arisen together with it” includes the materiality originated by it.

original: Pañhāvāre hi “paṭisandhikkhaṇe vipākābyākatāni maggaṅgāni sampayuttakānaṃ khandhānaṃ🔽kaṭattā ca rūpāna”nti vuttaṃ, ahetukacittesu cettha vijjamānāni maggaṅgāni maggapaccayā
analyzed: pañhāvāre hi paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vipāka abyākatāni maggaṅgāni sampayuttakānam khandhānam  kaṭattā ca rūpānanti vuttam ahetuka cittesu ca ittha vijjamānāni maggaṅgāni magga paccayā
translated: For in the Question Section it is said: “At the time of rebirth-linking the resultant indeterminate path factors are a condition, as path condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness” .

original: na honti. Ayaṃ maggapaccaye nayo.🔽Ekavatthukaekārammaṇaekuppādaekanirodhasaṅkhātena sampayuttabhāvena upakārakā arūpino🔽dhammā sampayuttapaccayo. Niddese pana “cattāro khandhā arūpino dhammā aññamaññaṃ🔽sampayuttapaccayena paccayo”ti niddiṭṭhoti ayaṃ sampayuttapaccaye nayo.
analyzed: na honti ayam magga paccaye nayo  eka vatthuka eka ārammaṇa eka uppāda eka nirodha saṅkhātena sampayutta bhāvena upakārakāḥ arūpino  dhammā sampayutta paccayaḥ niddese pana cattāro khandhāḥ arūpino dhammāḥ aññamaññam  sampayutta paccayena paccayaḥ ti niddiṭṭhaḥ ti ayam sampayutta paccaye nayo
translated: And here the path factors that exist in the immaterial-sphere consciousness without root-cause are not a condition by way of path condition. This is the method in the case of path condition.🔽The immaterial states that are helpful by being conascent, having a single resort and object, a single arising and cessation, are a condition by way of association condition. But in the Description of Conditions it is stated thus: “The four immaterial aggregates are a condition, as association condition, for each other” . This is the method in the case of association condition.

original: Ekavatthukādibhāvānupagamena upakārakā rūpino dhammā arūpīnaṃ, arūpino dhammā rūpīnaṃ
analyzed: eka vatthuka ādi bhāva anupagamena upakārakāḥ rūpinaḥ dhammāḥ arūpīnam arūpinaḥ dhammāḥ rūpīnam
translated: The material states that are helpful by being conascent, having a single resort and object, a single arising and cessation, but not necessarily a single physical basis, are a condition, as association condition, for the immaterial states. The immaterial states are a condition, as association condition, for the material states.

original: vippayuttapaccayo, so sahajātapurejātapacchājātavasena tividho hoti. Vuttaṃ hetaṃ
analyzed: vippayutta paccayo so sahajāta purejāta pacchājāta vasena tividhaḥ hoti vuttam ha etam
translated: Dependent origination is threefold as conascence, prior, and postnascence. For this is said:

original: “sahajātā kusalā khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṃ rūpānaṃ…pe… pacchājātā kusalā khandhā
analyzed: sahajātā kusalā khandhā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam pe pacchājātā kusalā khandhā
translated: “The profitable aggregates are a condition, as a condition dependent on what is absent, for the materiality originated by consciousness” .

original: purejātassa imassa kāyassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo”tiādi. Purejātaṃ pana chavatthuvaseneva🔽veditabbaṃ. Niddese panassa “rūpino dhammā arūpīnaṃ…pe… arūpino dhammā rūpīnaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: purejātassa imassa kāyassa vippayutta paccayena paccaya utiādi purejātam pana cha vatthu vasena iva  veditabbam niddese panassa rūpinaḥ dhammāḥ arūpīnam pe arūpinaḥ dhammāḥ rūpīnam dhammānam
translated: Post-nascent profitable aggregates are a condition, as a condition dependent on what is absent, for this prenascent body” .🔽But the prenascent should be understood as the six bases.🔽In the description it is stated generally thus: “Material states are a condition, as a condition dependent on what is absent, for immaterial states” ,

original: vippayuttapaccayena paccayo”ti evaṃ sāmaññato niddiṭṭho. Tattha rūpinoti idaṃ chavatthūnaṃ🔽vasena vuttaṃ, rūpādayo pana ārammaṇadhammā sampayogāsaṅkāyābhāvena vippayuttapaccayā
analyzed: vippayutta paccayena paccayo ti evam sāmaññataḥ niddiṭṭhaḥ tattha rūpino ti idam cha vatthūnam  vasena vuttam rūpa ādayaḥ pana ārammaṇa dhammā sampayoga asaṅkāya abhāvena vippayutta paccayā
translated: and “immaterial states are a condition, as a condition dependent on what is absent, for material states” .🔽Herein, “material” is said of the six bases,🔽but the states consisting of materiality, etc., as objects are not mentioned as conditions dependent on what is absent because there is no occasion for association with them.

original: na vuttā. Cakkhādīnaṃ hi vatthūnaṃ abbhantarato arūpadhammā nikkhamantā viya uppajjanti,
analyzed: na vuttā cakkha ādīnam hi vatthūnam abbhantarataḥ arūpa dhammā nikkhamantā viya uppajjanti
translated: For immaterial states arise as if they had issued from within the eye, etc., as their bases,

original: tattha sampayogāsaṅkā hoti. Pañhāvārepi hi “vatthu kusalānaṃ khandhānaṃ…pe… cakkhāyatanaṃ
analyzed: tattha sampayoga āsaṅkā hoti pañhāvāre pi hi vatthu kusalānam khandhānam pe cakkhāyatanaṃ
translated: Herein, there is no question of conjunction.🔽And in the Question Section too only six bases are mentioned thus: “The basis of profitable aggregates … Eye sense-sphere …🔽… is related to eye-consciousness element” , and so on.

original: cakkhuviññāṇadhātuyā”tiādinā cha vatthūneva uddhaṭāni, arūpino dhammā rūpīnanti etthāpi
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa dhātuyā ti ādinā cha vatthūna eva uddhaṭāni arūpinaḥ dhammā ettha api
translated: And in the case of immaterial states and material states,

original: nibbānaṃ arūpampi samānaṃ rūpassa vippayuttapaccayo na hoti sabbathā sampayogāsaṅkābhāvato,
analyzed: nibbānam arūpam pi samānam rūpassa vippayutta paccayaḥ na hoti sabbathā sampayoga āsaṅka abhāvato
translated: Nibbana, though immaterial, is not a condition by way of dissociation, because there is no question of conjunction in any way.

original: “catūhi sampayogo catūhi vippayogo”ti hi vuttanti ayaṃ vippayuttapaccaye nayo.
analyzed: catūhi sampayogo catūhi vippayogo ti hi vuttan ti ayam vippayutta paccaye nayo
translated: “Conjunction with four, disjunction with four” , it is said. This is the method in the case of dissociation condition.

original: Paccuppannalakkhaṇena atthibhāvena tādisasseva dhammassa upatthambhakaṭṭhena upakārako🔽dhammo atthipaccayo, so niddese “cattāro khandhā arūpino aññamaññaṃ…pe… cattāro mahābhūtā🔽aññamaññaṃ, okkantikkhaṇe nāmarūpaṃ aññamaññaṃ, cittacetasikā dhammā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṃ
analyzed: paccuppanna lakkhaṇena atthi bhāvena tādisassa eva dhammassa upatthambhaka ṭṭhena upakārako  dhammo atthi paccayo so niddese cattāro khandhāḥ arūpino cattāro mahābhūtā  aññamaññam okkanti khaṇe nāma rūpam aññamaññam citta cetasikāḥ dhammāḥ citta samuṭṭhānānam
translated: A state that is helpful by way of the state of existing with the characteristic of existing in the present is a condition by way of presence.

original: rūpānaṃ, mahābhūtā upādārūpānaṃ, cakkhāyatanaṃ cakkhuviññāṇadhātuyā…pe… rūpāyatanaṃ
analyzed: rūpānam mahābhūtāḥ upādā rūpānam cakkha āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇa dhātu yāpe rūpa āyatanam
translated: It is said in the Description of Conditions: “The four immaterial aggregates are mutually related to each other … The four great primaries are mutually related to each other … At the moment of descent into the womb mentality and materiality are mutually related to each other … States of consciousness and its concomitants are related to materiality originated by consciousness … The great primaries are related to secondary formations … The eye-base is related to the eye-consciousness element … The visible-data base is related to the eye-consciousness element …

original: cakkhuviññāṇadhātuyā taṃsampayuttakānañca dhammānaṃ…pe… rūpāyatanaṃ…pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṃ
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa dhātuyā tad sampayuttakānaṃ ca dhammānam pe rūpa āyatanam pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam
translated: and of eye-consciousness element and of the states associated therewith, the visible-data base … and of the tangible-data base …🔽and of the mind element and of the mind-consciousness element and of the states associated therewith,

original: manodhātuyā…pe… manodhātuyā ca manoviññāṇadhātuyā ca taṃsampayuttakānañca dhammānaṃ
analyzed: manaḥ dhātuyā āpe manaḥ dhātuyā ca manaḥ viññāṇa dhātuyā ca tad sampayuttakānaṃ ca dhammānaṃ
translated: the visible-data base … and of the tangible-data base …

original: atthipaccayena paccayo”ti evaṃ sahajātapurejātavasena ca bahudhā niddiṭṭho, pañhāvāre
analyzed: atthi paccayena paccayo ti evam sahajāta purejāta vasena ca bahudhā niddiṭṭho pañhāvāre
translated: is a condition, as presence condition, for the states associated therewith” .

original: pana “sahajātaṃ purejātaṃ pacchājātaṃ āhāraṃ indriya”nti imesaṃ pañcannampi vasena
analyzed: sahajātam purejātam pacchājātam āhāram vasena
translated: But in the Question Section it is stated thus: “Conascent, prenascent, postnascent, nutriment, faculty” .

original: āgatattā pacchājātakabaḷīkāraāhārarūpajīvitindriyānaṃ vasenāpi atthipaccayo gahetabbovāti
analyzed: āgata ttā pacchā jātaka baḷīkāra āhāra rūpa jīvita indriyānam vasena api atthi paccayaḥ gahetabbaḥ uvā ti
translated: So presence condition should be taken also as postnascent, as nutriment, and as the materiality of the physical basis of life and of the faculties.

original: ayaṃ atthipaccaye nayo.🔽Attano anantaraṃ uppajjamānānaṃ arūpadhammānaṃ pavattiokāsadānavasena upakārakā samanantaraniruddhā
analyzed: ayam atthi paccaye nayaḥ  attanaḥ anantaram uppajjamānānam arūpa dhammānam pavatti okāsa dāna vasena upakārakā samanantara niruddhā
translated: This is the method in the case of presence condition.🔽The states that are present immediately next to themselves and are a proximate cause for the occurrence of the subsequent immaterial states by giving them an opportunity are called “absence condition” .

original: arūpadhammā natthipaccayo, niddese pana “samanantaraniruddhā cittacetasikā dhammā
analyzed: arūpa dhammā natthi paccayaḥ niddese pana samanantara niruddhāḥ citta cetasikāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: In the description it is said: “States of consciousness and its concomitants that have ceased next before the present states of consciousness and its concomitants are a condition, as absence condition, for the latter” .

original: paṭuppannānaṃ cittacetasikānaṃ dhammānaṃ natthipaccayena paccayo”ti evaṃ sāmaññatova
analyzed: paṭuppannānam citta cetasikānam dhammānam natthi paccayena paccayaḥ ti evam sāmaññataḥ va
translated: and for the cessation of the thoughts and mental factors that have arisen, the condition is by way of absence condition.” So it is shown in general.

original: niddiṭṭho. Sabbathā anantarapaccayasadisatāya tattha niddiṭṭhanayenevettha viseso
analyzed: niddiṭṭhaḥ sabbathā anantara paccaya sadisa tāya tattha niddiṭṭha nayena iva ittha viseso
translated: And in all cases it is similar to the immediately preceding condition. The difference should be understood in the way shown in the case of the immediately preceding condition.

original: ñātabboti ayaṃ natthipaccaye nayo.🔽Natthipaccayadhammāva vigatabhāvena upakārakattā vigatapaccayoti saha niddesena natthipaccayasadisovāti.
analyzed: ñātabbaḥ iti ayam natthi paccaye nayo  vigata bhāvena upakāraka ttā vigata paccayaḥ ti saha niddesena natthi paccaya sadisaḥ uvā ti
translated: This is the method in the case of the absence condition.🔽The condition by way of disappearance is similar to the absence condition in that it is helpful by the state of disappearance of states.

original: Avigatapaccayopi sabbathā atthipaccayasadisova, desanāvilāsena, veneyyavasena vā ayaṃ duko vuttoti ayaṃ avigatapaccaye nayo.
analyzed: avigata paccayaḥ api sabbathā atthi paccaya sadisaḥ iva desanā vilāsena veneyya vasena vā ayam dukaḥ vuttaḥ ti ayam avigata paccaye nayo
translated: And the condition by way of non-disappearance is similar to the presence condition in that it is helpful by the state of non-disappearance of states. But this dyad is stated by way of the elegance of the teaching or by way of the disciples. This is the method in the case of the non-disappearance condition.

original: Pakiṇṇakavinicchayo
analyzed: pakiṇṇaka vinicchayaḥ
translated: The miscellaneous section

original: Imesu pana catuvīsatiyā paccayesu ñāṇacārassa visadabhāvatthaṃ –🔽Dhammato kālato ceva, ekassānekapaccayā;
analyzed: imesu pana catuvīsatiyā paccayesu ñāṇa cārassa visada bhāva attham  dhammataḥ kālataḥ ca iva ekassa aneka paccayā
translated: Now, in order to make clear the scope of the knowledge of conditions in these twenty-four conditions,🔽By way of state, by way of time,🔽And by way of the fact that one🔽Condition is for many states,

original: Anekesañca dhammānaṃ, ekapaccayabhāvato.
analyzed: anekesam ca dhammānam eka paccaya bhāvato
translated: And many conditions are for one state,🔽By way of similarity and dissimilarity,

original: Sabhāgā visabhāgā ca, yugaḷā janakādito;
analyzed: sabhāgā visabhāgā ca yugaḷā janaka ādeḥ
translated: By way of pair, of generator, etc.,

original: Sabbaṭṭhānādibhedā ca, rūpārūpavikappato;
analyzed: sabba ṭṭhāna ādi bhedā ca rūpa arūpa vikappataḥ
translated: By way of all, of place, etc., and by way of matter and by way of name,

original: Bhavato saṅgahā ñeyyo, pakiṇṇakavinicchayo.
analyzed: bhavato saṅgahā ñeyyaḥ pakiṇṇaka vinicchayo
translated: The exposition of the miscellaneous should be known as the collection of these.

original: Tattha dhammatoti imesu hi paccayesu hetupaccayo tāva nāmarūpadhammesu nāmadhammekadeso,
analyzed: tattha dhammato ti imesu hi paccayesu hetu paccayo tāva nāma rūpa dhammesu nāma dhamma ekadeso
translated: Herein, as to state: as regards these conditions, firstly, as to the root-cause condition, it is a part of the states consisting of mentality and of materiality,

original: tathā sahajātādhipatikammajhānamaggapaccayā, tathā āsevanavipākapaccayā, catukkhandhasaṅgahitāpi🔽vipākadhammā anantarasamanantarapacchājātasampayuttanatthivigatapaccayā. Nibbānassa
analyzed: tathā sahajāta adhipati kamma jhāna magga paccayā tathā āsevana vipāka paccayā catu khandha saṅgahitā api  vipāka dhammāḥ anantara samanantara pacchājāta sampayutta natthi vigata paccayāḥ nibbānassa
translated: as are the conascent, postnascent, and prenascent conditions, and the repetition and kamma-result conditions. And the states consisting of mentality and of materiality included in the four aggregates are also🔽the immediately preceding, the prior, the postnascent, the conasigned, the disappearance, and the absence conditions. And it is proper to say that nibbāna is

original: asaṅgahato nāmekadesotipi vattuṃ vaṭṭati. Purejātapaccayo rūpadhammova, sesā yathālābhavasena
analyzed: asaṅgahataḥ nāma eka deso ti pi vattum vaṭṭati purejāta paccayo sesāḥ yathā lābha vasena
translated: a part of the states consisting of mentality, as it is not included in the aggregates. The prenascent condition is a state consisting of materiality. The rest are

original: nāmarūpadhammā. Tattha ca ārammaṇādhipatiārammaṇūpanissayapakatūpanissayesu paññattipi
analyzed: nāma rūpa dhammā tattha ca ārammaṇa adhipati ārammaṇa upanissaya pakata upanissayesu paññatti pi
translated: states consisting of mentality and of materiality, according as it is appropriate in each instance. And here, as to the object, predominance, object-predominance, and support-predominance conditions, the concept is also

original: saṅgahitāti ayaṃ dhammato vinicchayo.
analyzed: saṅgahitā ati ayam dhammataḥ vinicchayo
translated: included. This is the exposition as to state.

original: Kālato pana hetusahajātaaññamaññanissayapurejātapacchājātavipākaāhāraindriyajhānamaggasampayuttavippayuttaatthiavigatapaccayā
analyzed: kālato pana hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya purejāta pacchājāta vipāka āhāra aindriya jhāna magga sampayutta vippayutta atthi avigata paccayā
translated: As to time: the root-cause, conascent, and postnascent conditions, and the support, prenascent, postnascent, kamma-result, nutriment, faculty, jhāna, path, association, dissociation, presence, and absence conditions—

original: pannarasa paccuppannāva hutvā attano phalassa paccayā honti, anantarasamanantaraāsevananatthivigatapaccayā
analyzed: pannarasa paccuppannā ava hutvā attano phalassa paccayāḥ honti anantara samanantara āsevana natthi vigata paccayāḥ
translated: Fifteen are conditions for their own fruits only when they are present. They are the immediately preceding condition, the decisive support condition, the prenascence condition, the postnascence condition, the nutriment condition, and the faculty condition.

original: pañca atītā eva hutvā, kammapaccayo paneko paccuppannopi atītopi hutvā, sesā ārammaṇaadhipatiupanissayapaccayā
analyzed: pañca atītā eva hutvā kamma paccayo paneko paccuppannaḥ api atītaḥ api hutvā sesāḥ ārammaṇa adhipati upanissaya paccayā
translated: Five are only past conditions. But the kamma condition is also present and past. The remaining conditions are

original: tayopi tekālikāpi, nibbānapaññattivasena kālavimuttāpi hutvā attano phalassa paccayā
analyzed: tayo api tekālikā api nibbāna paññatti vasena kāla vimuttā api hutvā attanaḥ phalassa paccayā
translated: all three temporal periods. They are conditions for their own fruits when they are free from temporal determination in the sense of the description of Nibbāna.

original: hontīti ayaṃ kālato vinicchayo.
analyzed: honti iti ayam kālataḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: This is the exposition of the conditions according to temporal determination.

original: Ekassānekapaccayāti ekadhammassa, ekapaccayassa ca anekapaccayabhāvato. Kathaṃ? Hetupaccaye🔽tāva amoho eko dhammo, so purejātakammaāhārajhānavajjānaṃ vīsatiyā paccayānaṃ vasena
analyzed: ekassa aneka paccayā ti eka dhammassa eka paccayassa ca aneka paccaya bhāvataḥ katham hetu paccaye  tāva amoho ekaḥ dhammo so purejāta kamma āhāra jhāna vajjānam vīsatiyā paccayānam vasena
translated: As to one being many conditions: because one state is many conditions and a single condition is many conditions. How?🔽First, as to the root-cause condition: non-delusion is one state. original: channaṃ vasena. Āhārapaccaye ojā ārammaṇaārammaṇādhipatiupanissayāhāraatthiavigatānaṃ

translated: In the nutriment condition, nutriment is a condition for the six, namely, the object, object-predominance, support-predominance, nutriment, absence, and disappearance conditions.

translated: It is a condition in many ways, not relinquishing its own particular state.

original: tesaṃ tesaṃ sabbattha ārammaṇādhipatianantarasamanantarūpanissayādipaccayatā vuttanayena
analyzed: tesam tesam sabbattha ārammaṇa adhipati anantara samananta rūpa nissaya ādi paccaya tā vutta nayena
translated: The condition by way of object, predominance, proximity, contiguity, support, decisive support, absence, disappearance, and repetition, etc., is in each case according to the method stated.

original: veditabbā. Sesaṃ suviññeyyamevāti ayaṃ ekassānekapaccayato vinicchayo.🔽Anekesañca dhammānaṃ, ekapaccayabhāvatoti etesu hi ṭhapetvā kammapaccayaṃ sesesu🔽tevīsatiyā paccayesu aneke anekesaṃ dhammānaṃ ekato ekekaṃ paccayā honti. Kammapaccayo
analyzed: veditabbā sesam su viññeyyam evā ti ayam ekassa aneka paccayataḥ vinicchayo  anekesam ca dhammānam eka paccaya bhāvato ti etesu hi ṭhapetvā kamma paccayam sesesu  tevīsatiyā paccayesu aneke anekesam dhammānam ekatas ekekam paccayāḥ honti kamma paccayo
translated: The condition by way of object, predominance, proximity, contiguity, support, decisive support, etc., should be understood in the way already stated. The rest is easy to understand. This is the exposition of the single condition.

original: pana cetanā ekadhammovāti ayaṃ anekadhammānaṃ ekapaccayabhāvato vinicchayo.🔽Sabhāgā visabhāgā cāti etesu hi anantarasamanantaraanantarūpanissayāsevananatthivigatapaccayā🔽sabhāgā, tathā ārammaṇaārammaṇādhipatiārammaṇūpanissayā. Purejātapaccayo panettha
analyzed: pana cetanā eka dhammā uvāti ayam aneka dhammānam eka paccaya bhāvataḥ vinicchayaḥ  sabhāgā visabhāgā ca ati etesu hi anantara samanantara ananta rūpa nissaya āsevana natthi vigata paccayā  sabhāgā tathā ārammaṇa ārammaṇa adhipati ārammaṇa upanissayā purejāta paccayaḥ pana ittha
translated: As to the many states being one condition: in these twenty-three conditions, excluding the kamma condition, many states are one condition for many states. But the kamma condition is a single state, namely, volition. This is the exposition of the many states being one condition.

original: pacchājātena visabhāgo, tathā sampayutto vippayuttena, atthi natthinā, vigato avigatenāti
analyzed: pacchājātena visabhāgaḥ tathā sampayuttaḥ vippayuttena atthi natthinā vigataḥ avigatena ati
translated: As to similar and dissimilar: here the proximity, contiguity, proximity-decisive-support, and prenascence conditions are similar. So too the object, object-predominance, and object-decisive-support conditions. But the postnascence condition here is dissimilar to the prenascence condition. So too the conascence condition is dissimilar to the association, dissociation, presence, and absence conditions.

original: ayaṃ sabhāgavisabhāgato vinicchayo.
analyzed: ayam sabhāga visabhāgataḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: This is the exposition of the similar and dissimilar.

original: Yugaḷāti ettha atthasarikkhatāya saddasarikkhatāya kālapaṭipakkhatāya hetuphalatāya🔽aññamaññapaṭipakkhatāyāti imehi kāraṇehi yugaḷaṃ veditabbaṃ. Anantarasamanantarā🔽hi atthasarikkhatāya ekaṃ yugaḷaṃ nāma. Nissayūpanissayā saddasarikkhatāya, purejātapacchājātā
analyzed: yugaḷā ti ettha attha sarikkha tāya sadda sarikkha tāya kāla paṭipakkha tāya hetu phala tāya  aññamañña paṭipakkha tāya ati imehi kāraṇehi yugaḷam veditabbam anantara samanantarā  hi attha sarikkha tāya ekam yugaḷam nāma nissaya upanissayā sadda sarikkha tāya purejāta pacchājātā
translated: Pairs: here, by similarity of meaning, by similarity of sound, by opposition of prior and posterior, by cause and fruit,

original: kālapaṭipakkhatāya, kammavipākā hetuphalatāya, sampayuttavippayuttā aññamaññapaṭipakkhatāya
analyzed: kāla paṭipakkha tāya kamma vipākāḥ hetu phala tāya sampayutta vippayuttāḥ aññamañña paṭipakkha tāya
translated: by mutual opposition, these should be understood as pairs. For the conditions of proximity and contiguity are one pair, being similar in meaning.
