Conjoined and disjoined are one pair, being mutually opposed.

original: ekaṃ yugaḷaṃ, tathā atthinatthipaccayā, vigataavigatapaccayāti ayaṃ yugaḷato vinicchayo.🔽Janakāditoti janakopatthambhakato. Etesu hi anantarasamanantarūpanissayapakatūpanissayāsevanapaccayā,
analyzed: ekam yugaḷam tathā atthi natthi paccayāḥ vigata avigata paccayā ati ayam yugaḷataḥ vinicchayo  janaka āditaḥ ti janaka upatthambhakataḥ etesu hi anantara samanantara upanissaya pakata upanissaya āsevana paccayā
translated: Similarly, presence and absence are one pair, and presence-of-a-state and absence-of-a-state are one pair. This is the exposition of the pairs.

original: nānakkhaṇiko kammapaccayo, natthivigatapaccayā cāti ime janakā eva, na upatthambhakā.
analyzed: nānākkhaṇikaḥ kamma paccayaḥ natthi vigata paccayā ca ati ime janakāḥ eva na upatthambhakāḥ
translated: Origination, etc.: here, by origination, etc., should be understood origination, disappearance, and origination-and-disappearance; persistence, change, and persistence-and-change; unbinding, non-disappearance, and unbinding-and-non-disappearance. For the conditions of proximity and contiguity, support and supported, prenascence and postnascence, repetition, and kamma are origination.🔽The non-conascence condition and the absence-of-a-state condition are disappearance. The presence condition and the non-disappearance condition are origination-and-disappearance. The root-cause condition is persistence. The condition being present is change. The support and supported conditions, the prenascence and postnascence conditions, and the conascence condition are persistence-and-change. The non-disappearance condition is unbinding. The absence-of-a-state condition is non-disappearance. The presence condition is unbinding-and-non-disappearance. This is the exposition of origination, etc.

original: Pacchājātapaccayo upatthambhako eva, na janako. Sesā janakā ceva upatthambhakā cāti
analyzed: pacchājāta paccayo upatthambhakaḥ eva na janakaḥ sesā janakā ca iva upatthambhakā ca ati
translated: The postnascence condition is only a supporter, not a producer. The rest are both producers and supporters.

original: ayaṃ janakādito vinicchayo.
analyzed: ayam janaka āditaḥ
translated: This is the exposition of the conditions as producers, etc.

original: Sabbaṭṭhānādibhedāti sabbaṭṭhānikaasabbaṭṭhānikabhedato. Etesu hi sahajātanissayaatthiavigatapaccayā
analyzed: sabba ṭṭhāna ādi bhedā ti sabba ṭṭhānika asabba ṭṭhānika bhedato etesu hi sahajāta nissaya atthi avigata paccayā
translated: As to the distinction of being always effective, etc.: As to the distinction of being always effective and not always effective. Herein, the conascence, support, dissociation, and presence conditions

original: sabbaṭṭhānikā. Sabbesu paccayuppannesu icchitabbā. Etehi vinā uppajjamāno ekadhammopi🔽natthi. Sesā asabbaṭṭhānikā. Tattha ca ārammaṇaārammaṇādhipatianantarasamanantarānantarūpanissayapakatūpanissayapurejātāsevanasampayutta
analyzed: sabbaṭṭhānikā sabbesu paccaya uppannesu icchitabbā etehi vinā uppajjamānaḥ eka dhammaḥ api  natthi sesā asabba ṭṭhānikā tattha ca ārammaṇa ārammaṇa adhipati anantara samanantara ananta rūpa nissaya pakata upanissaya purejāta āsevana sampayutta
translated: are always effective. They must be accepted as conditions for all conditionally arisen states. There is no single state that arises without them. The rest are not always effective.🔽Herein, the object, predominance, proximity, contiguity, absence, disappearance, and support conditions, and the prenascence, repetition, and association conditions,

original: atthinatthivigatapaccayā arūpadhammānaññeva kāraṇato asabbaṭṭhānikā. Tathā pacchājātapaccayo
analyzed: atthi natthi vigata paccayāḥ arūpa dhammā anaññā eva kāraṇataḥ asabba ṭṭhānikā tathā pacchājāta paccayo
translated: are not always effective as causes of immaterial states only. So too the postnascence condition

original: rūpānaññeva kāraṇato, sesā ekaccānaṃ rūpārūpadhammānaṃ kāraṇato asabbaṭṭhānikā. Ayaṃ
analyzed: rūpa anaññā eva kāraṇataḥ sesāḥ ekaccānam rūpa arūpa dhammānam kāraṇataḥ asabba ṭṭhānikā ayam
translated: is not always effective as a cause of materiality only. The rest are not always effective as causes of certain material and immaterial states. This is🔽the exposition of the conditions as to the distinction of being always effective, etc.

original: sabbaṭṭhānādibhedato vinicchayo.
analyzed: sabba ṭṭhāna ādi bhedataḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: As to the distinction of being internal, etc.:

original: Rūpārūpavikappatoti rūpaṃ rūpassa, rūpaṃ arūpassātiādi vikappato. Etesu hi ekopi🔽paccayo rūpameva hutvā rūpasseva paccayo bhavanto nāma natthi, rūpameva pana arūpasseva
analyzed: rūpa arūpa vikappato ti rūpam rūpassa rūpam arūpassa atiādi vikappataḥ etesu hi ekaḥ api  paccayaḥ rūpam eva hutvā rūpassa iva paccayaḥ bhavanto nāma natthi rūpam eva pana arūpassa iva
translated: As to the assumption of materiality and immateriality: as to the assumption of materiality as materiality, of materiality as immateriality, and so on. For in these instances there is no such thing as a condition that is materiality becoming a condition for materiality only, or immateriality becoming a condition for immateriality only.

original: atthi, so purejātapaccayo eko eva. Rūpameva hutvā rūpārūpasseva paccayo nāmātipi🔽natthi, arūpameva hutvā arūpasseva paccayopi atthi, so anantarasamanantaraāsevanasampayuttanatthivigatavasena
analyzed: atthi so purejāta paccayaḥ ekaḥ eva rūpam eva hutvā rūpa arūpassa iva paccayaḥ nāma atipi  natthi arūpam eva hutvā arūpassa iva paccayaḥ api atthi saḥ anantara samanantara āsevana sampayutta natthi vigata vasena
translated: As to the assumption of materiality and immateriality: as to the assumption of materiality as materiality, of materiality as immateriality, and so on. For here there is not one condition that is called materiality becoming a condition only for materiality, nor is there any that is called immateriality becoming a condition only for immateriality. But there is one condition that is called materiality becoming a condition only for immateriality, and that is the prenascent condition.🔽There is not one that is called materiality becoming a condition for materiality and immateriality.🔽But there is one that is called immateriality becoming a condition only for immateriality, and that is of six kinds as the immediately preceding, the support, the prenascent, the postnascent, the kamma, and the nutriment conditions.

original: chabbidho. Arūpameva pana rūpasseva paccayopi atthi, so pacchājātapaccayo eko eva.
analyzed: chabbidhaḥ arūpam eva pana rūpassa iva paccayaḥ api atthi saḥ pacchājāta paccayaḥ ekaḥ eva
translated: There is one that is called immateriality becoming a condition only for materiality, and that is the postnascent condition.

original: Arūpameva hutvā rūpārūpānampi atthi, so hetukammavipākajhānamaggavasena pañcavidho.
analyzed: arūpam eva hutvā rūpa arūpānam pi atthi so hetu kamma vipāka jhāna magga vasena pañcavidhaḥ
translated: There is one that is called immateriality becoming a condition for both materiality and immateriality, and that is of five kinds as root-cause, kamma, resultant, jhāna, and path condition.

original: Rūpārūpapaññatti hutvā arūpasseva paccayopi atthi, so ārammaṇaupanissayavasena duvidho.
analyzed: rūpa arūpa paññatti hutvā arūpassa iva paccayaḥ api atthi saḥ ārammaṇa upanissaya vasena duvidhaḥ
translated: There is one that is called materiality and immateriality becoming a condition only for immateriality, and that is of two kinds as object and decisive-support condition.

original: Rūpārūpaṃ pana rūpārūpassāpi atthi, so adhipatisahajātaaññamaññanissayāhārindriyavippayuttaatthiavigatavasena
analyzed: rūpa arūpam pana rūpa arūpassa api atthi saḥ adhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya āhāra indriya vippayutta atthi avigata vasena
translated: But the material and immaterial are also found in the material and immaterial. They are ninefold as predominance, conascence, mutuality, support, nutriment, faculty, dissociation, presence, and non-disappearance conditions.

original: navavidhoti ayaṃ rūpārūpavikappato vinicchayo.
analyzed: navavidhaḥ ti ayam rūpa arūpa vikappataḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: This is the exposition of the material and immaterial.

original: Bhavatoti imesu hi paccayesu pañcavokārabhave tāva na koci paccayo na labbhati nāma,
analyzed: bhavato ti imesu hi paccayesu pañcavokāra bhave tāva na koci paccayaḥ na labbhati nāma
translated: As to becoming: in the five-constituent becoming there is no kind of condition that is not found.

original: sabbepi labbhanti. Catuvokārabhave pana purejātapacchājātavippayuttapaccaye apanetvā
analyzed: sabbe api labbhanti catuvokāra bhave pana purejāta pacchājāta vippayutta paccaye apanetvā
translated: All are found. But in the four-constituent becoming the prenascent and postnascent conditions and the dissociation condition are excluded,

original: sesā ekavīsatimeva. Ekavokārabhave sahajātaaññamaññanissayakammindriyaatthiavigatavasena
analyzed: sesāḥ ekavīsatim eva eka vokāra bhave sahajāta aññamañña nissaya kamma indriya atthi avigata vasena
translated: so that the remaining twenty-one are found. In the one-constituent becoming the conascence, mutuality, support, faculty, presence, and non-disappearance conditions are found,

original: satteva. Bāhire pana anindriyabaddharūpe tesu kammindriyavajjā pañceva labbhantīti
analyzed: sattā iva bāhire pana anindriya baddha rūpe tesu kammindriya vajjā pañca iva labbhanti iti
translated: so that only six are found. But in external materiality not bound up with faculties the five conditions beginning with kamma and excluding faculty are found.

original: ayaṃ bhavato vinicchayo.
analyzed: ayam bhavataḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: This is the exposition as to becoming.

original: Saṅgahāti sabbepi hi ime catuvīsati paccayā ārammaṇasahajātaupanissayapurejātapacchājātakammāhārindriyesu
analyzed: sabbe api hi ime catuvīsati paccayāḥ ārammaṇa sahajāta aupanissaya purejāta pacchājāta kamma āhāra indriyesu
translated: As to inclusion: all these twenty-four conditions are included in the object, conascence, support, prenascent, postnascent, kamma, nutriment, faculty, dissociation, presence, and non-disappearance conditions.

original: aṭṭhasu ca paccayesu saṅgahaṃ gacchanti. Kathaṃ? Tesu hi hetuaññamaññavipākajhānamaggasampayuttapaccayā🔽cha sahajātapaccaye saṅgahaṃ gacchanti. Anantarasamanantarāsevananatthivigatapaccayā🔽pañca anantarūpanissaye upanissayapaccaye. Nissayapaccayo sahajātapurejātabhedato
analyzed: aṭṭhasu ca paccayesu saṅgaham gacchanti katham tesu hi hetu aññamañña vipāka jhāna magga sampayutta paccayā  cha sahajāta paccaye saṅgaham gacchanti anantara samanantara āsevana natthi vigata paccayā  pañca anantara upanissaye upanissaya paccaye nissaya paccayo sahajāta purejāta bhedato
translated: The six conditions of conascence are included in the condition consisting in conascence. The conditions of proximity, contiguity, repetition, absence, and disappearance are included in the condition consisting in proximity.

original: duvidho. Tattha sahajāto sahajātapaccaye, purejāto purejātapaccaye. Adhipatipaccayopi🔽ārammaṇabhūto ārammaṇūpanissaye, sahajātabhūto sahajātapaccaye. Vippayuttapaccayopi
analyzed: duvidhaḥ tattha sahajātaḥ sahajāta paccaye purejātaḥ purejāta paccaye adhipati paccayaḥ api  ārammaṇa bhūtaḥ ārammaṇa upanissaye sahajāta bhūtaḥ sahajāta paccaye vippayutta paccayaḥ pi
translated: The condition of support is twofold as conascence and prenascence. Herein, the conascence condition is included in the condition consisting in conascence. The prenascence condition is included in the condition consisting in prenascence. The condition of predominance is included in the condition consisting in decisive support.🔽The object condition is included in the condition consisting in decisive support as object. The conascence condition is included in the condition consisting in decisive support as conascence. The dissociation condition is included in the condition consisting in decisive support as dissociation.

original: sahajātapurejātapacchājātabhūtatāya tattha tattha saṅgahaṃ gacchati. Atthiavigatapaccayāpi🔽sahajātapurejātapacchājātāhārindriyabhūtatāya tattha tattha paccayesu saṅgahaṃ gacchanti.
analyzed: sahajāta purejāta pacchājāta bhūta tāya tattha tattha saṅgaham gacchati atthi avigata paccayā api 🔽sahajāta purejāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya bhūta tāya tattha tattha paccayesu saṅgaham gacchanti
translated: The absence and disappearance conditions are included in the condition consisting in decisive support as absence and disappearance. The presence and non-disappearance conditions are included in the condition consisting in decisive support as presence and non-disappearance.🔽The support condition is included in the condition consisting in decisive support as support. The conascence condition is included in the condition consisting in conascence. The prenascence condition is included in the condition consisting in prenascence. The postnascence condition is included in the condition consisting in postnascence. The nutriment condition is included in the condition consisting in nutriment. The faculty condition is included in the condition consisting in faculty. The jhāna condition is included in the condition consisting in jhāna. The path condition is included in the condition consisting in path. The association condition is included in the condition consisting in association. The dissociation condition is included in the condition consisting in dissociation. The condition of presence is included in the condition consisting in presence. The condition of absence is included in the condition consisting in absence. The condition of disappearance is included in the condition consisting in disappearance. The condition of non-disappearance is included in the condition consisting in non-disappearance.

original: Evaṃ imesu paccayesu sabbapaccayānaṃ saṅgaho veditabbo. Teneva tikapaṭṭhānapāḷiyaṃ
analyzed: evam imesu paccayesu sabba paccayānam saṅgahaḥ veditabbaḥ tena iva tika paṭṭhāna pāḷiyam
translated: That is why in the section on the method of conditionality in the Paṭṭhāna,

original: paccanīyanaye imesaṃ aṭṭhannaṃ paccayānaṃ vaseneva katipayapañhā vissajjitā. Imesaṃ
analyzed: paccanīya naye imesam aṭṭhannam paccayānam vasena iva katipaya pañhāḥ vissajjitāḥ imesam
translated: the answers to some of the questions are given in terms of these eight conditions.

original: pana aṭṭhannampi aññamaññasaṅgahopi atthiyeva. Tesu hi ārammaṇapaccayo adhipatibhūto
analyzed: pana aṭṭhannam pi aññamañña saṅgaho pi atthi yeva tesu hi ārammaṇa paccayaḥ adhipati bhūto
translated: But there is also inclusion of these eight in one another. For among them, the object condition is the dominant condition that is a decisive support,

original: upanissaye, anadhipatibhūto na katthacīti ārammaṇapaccayo hutvā visuññeva tiṭṭhati.🔽Kammapaccayopi sahajāto sahajāte. Nānakkhaṇiko pana balavā vipākadhammānaṃ upanissayo🔽hotīti upanissayapaccaye saṅgahaṃ gacchati. Balavāpi pana kammajarūpānaṃ, dubbalo
analyzed: upanissaye anadhipati bhūtaḥ na katthaci iti ārammaṇa paccayaḥ hutvā visuññā eva tiṭṭhati  kamma paccayaḥ pi sahajātaḥ sahajāte nānakkhaṇikaḥ pana balavā vipāka dhammānam upanissayaḥ  hoti iti upanissaya paccaye saṅgaham gacchati balavā api pana kamma ja rūpānam dubbalaḥ
translated: and it is not a decisive support when it is not dominant. So it stands apart as object condition.🔽The kamma condition is conascence in conascent states, but it is a decisive support for strong resultant states when it is not in the same moment.

original: arūpānaṃ nānakkhaṇikakammapaccayo hutvā visuññeva tiṭṭhati. Āhārapaccayopi arūpabhūto
analyzed: arūpānam nānākkhaṇika kamma paccayaḥ hutvā visuññā iva tiṭṭhati āhāra paccayaḥ pi arūpa bhūto
translated: So it is included in the decisive-support condition. But it stands apart as kamma condition when it is not strong, and it is a condition by way of kamma conditionality for the materiality of the kinds of generation other than the egg-born, and it is not a condition for the immaterial states.🔽The nutriment condition is conascence in the immaterial states,

original: sahajāte, rūpabhūto na katthacīti visuññeva tiṭṭhati, indriyapaccayopi arūpabhūto
analyzed: sahajāte rūpa bhūtaḥ na katthaci iti visuññā iva tiṭṭhati indriya paccayaḥ pi arūpa bhūtaḥ
translated: but it stands apart as nutriment when it is not that.

original: sahajāte, pasādindriyā purejāte, rūpajīvitindriyaṃ na katthaci saṅgahaṃ gacchatīti
analyzed: sahajāte pasāt indriyā purejāte rūpa jīvita indriyam na katthacid saṅgaham gacchati iti
translated: The faculties of faith, etc., are included in the associated condition, and the material life faculty is included in the prenascent condition. But the material life faculty is not included anywhere else.

original: indriyapaccayo hutvā visuññeva tiṭṭhatīti evamevaṃ aññamaññasaṅgahopi attheva. Sabbepi
analyzed: indriya paccayaḥ hutvā visuññā iva tiṭṭhati iti evam evam aññamañña saṅgahaḥ api atthā iva sabbe pi
translated: So it stands quite outside the other conditions. So too, the reciprocal condition is included in the other conditions.

original: panete catuvīsati paccayā ārammaṇaupanissayakammaatthipaccayesu catūsupi saṅgahaṃ
analyzed: pana ete catuvīsati paccayāḥ ārammaṇa upanissaya kamma atthi paccayesu catūsu pi saṅgaham
translated: But all these twenty-four conditions are included in the four, namely, object, support, kamma, and presence conditions.

original: gacchantīti ayaṃ saṅgahato vinicchayo. Ayaṃ anuttānapadatthasahito saṅkhepatthavinicchayo.
analyzed: gacchanti iti ayam saṅgahataḥ vinicchayaḥ ayam anuttāna padattha sahitaḥ saṅkhepa attha vinicchayaḥ
translated: This is the exposition of the conditions in brief.

original: Pakiṇṇakavinicchayo niṭṭhito.🔽Vibhaṅganaye panettha pāḷivavatthānaṃ tāva saṅkhepato evaṃ veditabbaṃ. Paṭṭhānapāḷiyaṃ
analyzed: pakiṇṇaka vinicchayaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ  vibhaṅga naye pana ittha pāḷi vavatthānam tāva saṅkhepataḥ evam veditabbam paṭṭhāna pāḷiyam
translated: The exposition of the miscellaneous is ended.

original: hi “hetupaccayo…pe… avigatapaccayo”ti paccayapadāni mātikāvasena nikkhipitvā tesaṃ
analyzed: hi hetu paccaya upe avigata paccayo ti paccaya padāni mātikā vasena nikkhipitvā tesam
translated: In the Vibhaṅga method the exposition of the text should be understood firstly in brief as follows. In the text of the Paṭṭhāna, after the words “root-cause condition … … non-disappearance condition,” the conditions are set out by the method of the mātikā.

original: paccayānaṃ – “hetū hetusampayuttakānaṃ dhammānaṃ taṃsamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṃ hetupaccayena
analyzed: paccayānam hetū hetu sampayuttakānam dhammānam tad samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam hetu paccayena
translated: Then, after the words “What are the states that are root-cause conditions? They are: the states of profitable kamma-resultant root-cause, and the materiality originated by kamma-resultant root-cause,” the conditions are set out by the method of the dhammas.🔽“Root-cause conditions are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the states associated with the root-cause and for the kinds of materiality originated by the root-cause.

original: paccayo”tiādinā nayena paccayabhājanīyasaṅkhāto niddesavāro paṭhamaṃ vutto. Sopi🔽ca anantarasaṅkhepatthavinicchayo tattha tattha dassito eva. Tadanantaraṃ tesaṃ catuvīsatiyā🔽paccayānaṃ kusalattikādayo dvāvīsatitike, hetudukādayo sataṃ duke ca nissāya nānānayato🔽vibhajanavasena catuvīsatisamantapaṭṭhānasamodhānaṃ anantanayasamantapaṭṭhānaṃ vibhattaṃ.
analyzed: paccayaḥ ti ādinā nayena paccaya bhājanīya saṅkhāto niddesa vāro paṭhamam vutto saḥ api  ca anantara saṅkhepa attha vinicchayo tattha tattha dassitaḥ eva tad anantaram tesam catuvīsatiyā  paccayānam kusala ttika ādayaḥ dvāvīsa titike hetu duka ādayaḥ satam duke ca nissāya nānā nayato  vibhajana vasena catuvīsati samanta paṭṭhāna samodhānam ananta naya samanta paṭṭhānam vibhattam
translated: The first part is called the “exposition” because it is the exposition of the conditions by way of the method beginning, “What is condition? ”🔽And the brief exposition of the meaning of each of the twenty-four conditions has been given here and there.🔽Immediately after that, the “exposition of the all-encompassing method” and the “exposition of the endless all-encompassing method” are given by way of the analysis of the twenty-four conditions by means of the twenty-two triads beginning with the profitable triad, the hundred dyads beginning with the cause dyad, and so on, in various ways.🔽🔽

original: Kathaṃ? Catubbidhaṃ hi paṭṭhānaṃ – anulomapaṭṭhānaṃ, paccanīkapaṭṭhānaṃ, anulomapaccanīkapaṭṭhānaṃ,🔽paccanīkānulomapaṭṭhānanti. Tattha “kusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca kusalo dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā”tiādinā, “hetuṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca hetudhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā”tiādinā
analyzed: katham catubbidham hi paṭṭhānam anuloma paṭṭhānam paccanīka paṭṭhānam anuloma paccanīka paṭṭhānam 🔽paccanīka anuloma paṭṭhānan ti tattha kusalam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati 🔽hetu paccayā ati ādinā hetum dhammam paṭicca hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā ati ādinā

original: kusalādīnaṃ, hetuādīnañca dhammānaṃ anulomavasena pavattaṃ anulomapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma.
analyzed: kusala ādīnam hetu ādīnam ca dhammānam anuloma vasena pavattam anulomapaṭṭhānam nāma
translated: The exposition in forward order is that which occurs in forward order, in accordance with the profitable, etc., and the cause, etc., ideas.🔽“With a profitable idea as condition there arises a profitable idea, by way of root-cause condition … with an unprofitable idea … with a neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable idea …

original: “Nakusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā…pe… nahetuṃ dhammaṃ
analyzed: na kusalam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccaya āpe na hetum dhammaṃ
translated: with a root-cause idea … with a non-root-cause idea …

original: paṭicca nahetudhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā”tiādinā kusalādīnaṃ, hetuādīnañca dhammānaṃ🔽paccanīkavasena pavattaṃ paccanīkapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma. “Kusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca nakusalo
analyzed: paṭicca na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā ti ādinā kusala ādīnam hetu ādīnañca dhammānam  paccanīka vasena pavattam paccanīka paṭṭhānam nāma kusalam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ
translated: The exposition in reverse order is that which occurs in reverse order, in accordance with the profitable, etc., and the cause, etc., ideas.🔽“With a profitable idea as condition there arises an unprofitable idea, by way of root-cause condition … with a profitable idea … with a neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable idea …

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā…pe… hetuṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca nahetudhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā”tiādinā🔽pavattaṃ anulomapaccanīkapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma. “Nakusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca kusalo dhammo…pe…
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccaya āpe hetum dhammam paṭicca na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā ti ādinā  pavattam anuloma paccanīka paṭṭhānam nāma na kusalam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ dhamma upe
translated: with a root-cause idea … with a non-root-cause idea …🔽The exposition in forward and reverse order is that which occurs in forward and reverse order, in accordance with the profitable, etc., and the cause, etc., ideas.

original: nahetuṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca hetudhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā”tiādinā pavattaṃ paccanīkānulomapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma.
analyzed: na hetum dhammam paṭicca hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccaya āti ādinā pavattam paccanīka anulomapaṭṭhānam nāma
translated: “With a profitable idea as condition there arises an unprofitable idea, by way of root-cause condition … with a profitable idea … with a neither-profitable-nor-unprofitable idea …🔽with a non-root-cause idea … with a root-cause idea …

original: Evametesu catūsu paṭṭhānesu yaṃ dhammaṃ anulomapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma, taṃ tāva chabbidhaṃ🔽hoti – tikapaṭṭhānaṃ dukapaṭṭhānaṃ dukatikapaṭṭhānaṃ tikadukapaṭṭhānaṃ tikatikapaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: evam etesu catūsu paṭṭhānesu yam dhammam anulomapaṭṭhānam nāma tam tāva chabbidham  hoti tika paṭṭhānam duka paṭṭhānam duka tika paṭṭhānam tika duka paṭṭhānam tika tika paṭṭhānam
translated: So in these four instances the conformity-mode is of six kinds,

original: dukadukapaṭṭhānanti. Yathā cetaṃ, evaṃ paccanīkapaṭṭhānādīnipi tīṇi tīṇi paccekanti
analyzed: duka duka paṭṭhānam ti yathā ca itam evam paccanīka paṭṭhāna ādīni pi tīṇi tīṇi paccekam ti
translated: namely, the triad-mode, the dyad-mode, the dyad-in-triad-mode, the triad-in-dyad-mode, the triad-in-triad-mode, and the dyad-in-dyad-mode. And as this is so, so also the three, namely, the counter-part-mode, etc., are each of three kinds.

original: catuvīsatisamantapaṭṭhānasamodhānaṃ paṭṭhānappakaraṇaṃ veditabbaṃ. Sammāsambuddhena
analyzed: catuvīsati samanta paṭṭhāna samodhānam paṭṭhāna ppakaraṇam veditabbam sammāsambuddhena
translated: So the Mode of Conveying a Fourfold Array should be understood as the combination of twenty-four.

original: hi anulomapaṭṭhāne dvāvīsatitike nissāya tikapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma niddiṭṭhaṃ. Sataṃ duke🔽nissāya dukapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma. Tato tike dukesu pakkhipitvā dukatikapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma.🔽Tato duke tikesu pakkhipitvā tikadukapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma. Tike pana tikesuyeva pakkhipitvā
analyzed: hi anuloma paṭṭhāne dvāvīsati tike nissāya tikapaṭṭhānam nāma niddiṭṭham satam duke  nissāya duka paṭṭhānam nāma tatas tike dukesu pakkhipitvā duka tika paṭṭhānam nāma  tatas duke tikesu pakkhipitvā tikadukapaṭṭhānam nāma tike pana tikesu yeva pakkhipitvā
translated: For the conformity-mode has been demonstrated by the Fully Enlightened One as the triad-mode with twenty-two triads as the basis, as the dyad-mode with a hundred dyads as the basis, as the dyad-in-triad-mode with the dyads placed in the triads as the basis,

original: tikatikapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma. Duke ca dukesu eva pakkhipitvā dukadukapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma niddiṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: tika tika paṭṭhānam nāma duke ca dukesu eva pakkhipitvā duka duka paṭṭhānam nāma niddiṭṭham
translated: as the triad-in-dyad-mode with the triads placed in the dyads as the basis, as the triad-in-triad-mode with the triads placed in the triads as the basis, and as the dyad-in-dyad-mode with the dyads placed in the dyads as the basis.

original: Paṭhamaṃ tāvettha anulomapaṭṭhāne tikapaṭṭhānanayo niddiṭṭho. Evaṃ paccanīkapaṭṭhāne,
analyzed: paṭhamam tāva ettha anuloma paṭṭhāne tika paṭṭhāna nayaḥ niddiṭṭhaḥ evam paccanīka paṭṭhāne
translated: Herein, the method of the triple and quadruple conditionings has been demonstrated first in the direct order. So too in the reverse order,

original: anulomapaccanīkapaṭṭhāne, paccanīkānulomapaṭṭhāneti catuvīsatisamantapaṭṭhānaṃ desitaṃ.
analyzed: anuloma paccanīka paṭṭhāne paccanīka anuloma paṭṭhāne iti catuvīsati samanta paṭṭhānam desitam
translated: in the direct and reverse order, and in the reverse and direct order, the twenty-four modes of direct conditioning have been demonstrated.

original: Ettha ca duvidhaṃ anulomaṃ, paccanīkañca dhammānulomaṃ dhammapaccanīkaṃ, paccayānulomaṃ🔽paccayapaccanīkanti. Tattha “kusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca kusalo dhammo”tiādinā kusalādīnaṃ
analyzed: ettha ca duvidham anulomam paccanīkam ca dhamma anulomam dhamma paccanīkam paccaya anulomam  paccaya paccanīkam ti tattha kusalam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ dhammo ti ādinā kusala ādīnam
translated: And here there are two kinds of direct order and two kinds of reverse order, namely, direct order of states and reverse order of states, and direct order of conditions and reverse order of conditions.🔽Herein, direct order of states should be understood as the teaching of the triple and quadruple states beginning with the profitable in the direct order thus: “With a profitable state as condition, a profitable state” ,

original: tikadhammānaṃ, hetuādīnaṃ dukadhammānañca anulomadesanāvasena dhammānulomaṃ veditabbaṃ.🔽“Nakusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca nakusalo dhammo”tiādinā tikadukadhammānaṃ paccanīkavasena🔽dhammapaccanīkaṃ veditabbaṃ. “Hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā”ti evaṃ catuvīsatiyā paccayānaṃ
analyzed: tika dhammānam hetu ādīnam duka dhammānam ca anuloma desanā vasena dhamma anulomam veditabbam  na kusalam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ ti ādinā tika duka dhammānam paccanīka vasena  dhamma paccanīkam veditabbam hetu paccayā ārammaṇa paccayā ti evam catuvīsatiyā paccayānam
translated: and so on. Reverse order of states should be understood as the teaching of the triple and quadruple states in the reverse order thus: “With an unprofitable state as condition, a profitable state” ,🔽and so on. Direct order of conditions should be understood as the teaching of the twenty-four conditions in the direct order thus: “With root-cause as condition, a state with root-cause” ,

original: anulomadesanāvasena paccayānulomaṃ veditabbaṃ. “Nahetupaccayā nārammaṇapaccayā”ti
analyzed: anuloma desanā vasena paccaya anulomam veditabbam na hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇa paccayā ti
translated: and so on. Reverse order of conditions should be understood as the teaching of the twenty-four conditions in the reverse order thus: “With non-root-cause as condition, a state with root-cause” ,🔽and so on.

original: evaṃ paccayānaṃ paccanīkavasena paccayapaccanīkañca veditabbaṃ. Tatra yadidaṃ dhammānulomaṃ
analyzed: evam paccayānam paccanīka vasena paccaya paccanīkam ca veditabbam tatra yat idam dhamma anulomam
translated: So the opposition of conditions should be understood in this way too. Herein, the twenty-four kinds of direct-knowledge should be understood in the way beginning “In conformity with states”

original: dhammapaccanīkañca, tassa vasena catuvīsatisamantapaṭṭhānaṃ veditabbaṃ. Paccayānulomaṃ
analyzed: dhamma paccanīkam ca tassa vasena catuvīsati samanta paṭṭhānam veditabbam paccaya anulomam
translated: and “In opposition to states.” The twenty-four kinds of direct-knowledge should be understood in the way beginning “In conformity with conditions”

original: paccayapaccanīkañca anulomatikapaṭṭhānādīsu catuvīsatiyā paṭṭhānesu ekekatikadukesu🔽evaṃ labbhati. Tañca upari pāḷinayadassane eva pākaṭaṃ bhavissati. Tatrimāni catuvīsati
analyzed: paccaya paccanīkam ca anuloma tika paṭṭhāna ādīsu catuvīsatiyā paṭṭhānesu ekekatika dukesu  evam labbhati tat ca upari pāḷi naya dassane eva pākaṭam bhavissati catuvīsati
translated: and “In opposition to conditions.” In the twenty-four kinds of direct-knowledge beginning with conformity knowledge,

original: paṭṭhānāni imesaṃ tikadukānaṃ vasena niddiṭṭhattā tikapaṭṭhānaṃ…pe… dukadukapaṭṭhānanti vuccati.
analyzed: paṭṭhānāni imesam tika dukānam vasena niddiṭṭha ttā tika paṭṭhānam pe duka duka paṭṭhānam ti vuccati
translated: this is found in each of the triads and dyads. And that will become clear in the exposition of the text itself later on . Herein, these twenty-four kinds of direct-knowledge are called “triad direct-knowledge” because they are demonstrated by means of these triads and dyads, and so on up to “dyad direct-knowledge.”

original: Tesu tikadukesu ekekaṃ tikadukaṃ imesaṃ hetupaccayādīnaṃ catuvīsatiyā paccayānaṃ
analyzed: tesu tika dukesu ekekam tika dukam imesam hetu paccaya ādīnam catuvīsatiyā paccayānam
translated: In the triads and dyads, each triad and dyad is analyzed in detail by means of the twenty-four conditions,

original: anulomādinayacatukkavasena sattahi sattahi mahāvārehi vitthārato vibhattaṃ. Katamehi
analyzed: anuloma ādi naya catukka vasena sattahi sattahi mahāvārehi vitthārato vibhattam katamehi
translated: that is to say, by means of the four groups of seven, beginning with “in conformity” and so on. By means of which four groups of seven?

original: sattahi? Paṭiccavāro sahajātavāro paccayavāro nissayavāro saṃsaṭṭhavāro sampayuttavāro🔽pañhāvāroti imehi. Tattha “kusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca kusalo dhammo”tiādinā paṭiccābhidhānena🔽vutto paṭiccavāro nāma. “Kusalaṃ dhammaṃ sahajāto, kusalaṃ dhammaṃ paccayā, kusalaṃ
analyzed: sattahi paṭiccavāro sahajāta vāro paccayavāro nissayavāro saṃsaṭṭhavāro sampayuttavāro  pañhāvāraḥ ti imehi tattha kusalam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ dhammo tiādinā paṭicca abhidhānena  vuttaḥ paṭiccavāraḥ nāma kusalam dhammam sahajātaḥ kusalam dhammam paccayā kusalam
translated: By seven? The section on condition, the section on conascence, the section on cause, the section on dependence, the section on contact, the section on association,🔽and the section on questions. Herein, the section on condition is called so because it is stated by the word “condition” in the way beginning, “With a profitable idea as condition there arises a profitable idea” .

original: dhammaṃ nissāya, kusalaṃ dhammaṃ saṃsaṭṭho, kusalaṃ dhammaṃ sampayutto”ti evaṃ sahajātādiabhidhānehi
analyzed: dhammam nissāya kusalam dhammam saṃsaṭṭho kusalam dhammam sampayuttaḥ ti evam sahajāta ādi abhidhānehi
translated: The five sections beginning with the section on conascence are called the sections on conascence, etc., because they are stated by the words “conascent with a profitable idea,” “with a profitable idea as condition,” “dependent on a profitable idea,” “associated with a profitable idea,” and “accompanied by a profitable idea” respectively.

original: vuttā pañca vārā sahajātādivārāni. Parato ca saṃsaṭṭhasampayuttavāresu dvīsu arūpadhammavaseneva
analyzed: vuttā pañca vārā sahajāta ādi vārāni paratas ca saṃsaṭṭha sampayutta vāresu dvīsu arūpa dhamma vasena iva
translated: And in the two sections on contact and on association, the ideas are only immaterial.

original: paccayapaccayuppannā ca, sesesu catūsu vāresu, sattameva pañhāvāre ca rūpārūpavasena,
analyzed: paccaya paccaya uppannā ca sesesu catūsu vāresu sattamā eva pañhāvāre ca rūpa arūpa vasena
translated: In the remaining four sections and in the seventh section on questions, the ideas are both material and immaterial.

original: paccayavāre, nissayavāre ca sahajātapacchājātapurejātavasena, sesesu sahajātavasena
analyzed: paccaya vāre nissaya vāre ca sahajāta pacchājāta purejāta vasena sesesu sahajāta vasena
translated: In the section on cause and in the section on dependence, the ideas are conascent, postnascent, and prior. In the remaining sections they are only conascent.

original: paccayapaccayuppannā ca kathitāti ayaṃ viseso. Sattamavāre pana yasmā “kusalo dhammo🔽kusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo”tiādinā nayena te te pañhe uddharitvā puna
analyzed: paccaya paccaya uppannā ca kathitā ati ayam viseso sattama vāre pana yasmā kusalaḥ dhammo  kusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccaya uti ādinā nayena te te pañhe uddharitvā puna
translated: and the dependent and the originated are stated. This is the difference.

original: “kusalā hetū sampayuttakānaṃ khandhāna”ntiādinā nayena sabbepi te pañhā nijjaṭā,
analyzed: kusalāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam ti ādinā nayena sabbe api te pañhāḥ nijjaṭā
translated: In the seventh section, however, the questions are extracted by the method beginning “A profitable idea is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a profitable idea” , and then they are all analysed by the method beginning “Profitable root-causes are a condition for the associated aggregates” , and so they are disentangled and unknotted.

original: niggumbā ca katvā vibhattā, tasmā so vāro pañhānaṃ sādhukaṃ vibhattattā pañhāvārotveva🔽saṅkhaṃ gato. Iti imehi sattahi mahāvārehi catuvīsatiyā samantapaṭṭhānesu sabbepi
analyzed: niggumbā ca katvā vibhattā tasmai saḥ vāraḥ sādhukam  saṅkham gataḥ iti imehi sattahi mahāvārehi catuvīsatiyā samanta paṭṭhānesu sabbe pi
translated: Therefore that section is called “The Section on Questions” because the questions are well analysed.🔽So in these seven great sections, in the twenty-four instances beginning with “as to root cause” , all the triplets and all the dyads are analysed in detail by the twenty-four conditions in the way beginning with “as to direct-resultant” .

original: tikadukā catuvīsatiyā paccayānaṃ anulomādivasena vitthārato vibhattā. Kathaṃ? Anulomapaṭṭhāne
analyzed: tika dukā catuvīsatiyā paccayānam anuloma ādi vasena vitthārataḥ vibhattā katham anuloma paṭṭhāne
translated: How? In the “as to direct-resultant” instance,

original: hi yadidaṃ dvāvīsatitike nissāya tikapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma sabbapaṭhamaṃ niddiṭṭhaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: hi yat idam dvāvīsati tike nissāya tikapaṭṭhānam nāma sabba paṭhamam niddiṭṭham tattha
translated: the “triplet section” called “triplet section based on the twenty-two triplets” is demonstrated first of all.

original: kusalattikaṃ tāva imehi paṭiccavārādīhi mahāvārehi paccayānulomādinayacatukkato vibhattaṃ.
analyzed: kusala ttikam tāva imehi paṭiccavāra ādīhi mahāvārehi paccaya anuloma ādi naya catukkataḥ vibhattam
translated: Herein, the “profitable triplet” is analysed by the method of the fourfold method beginning with “as to root cause” in the great sections beginning with the “reversal of the section” .

original: Tattha yo tāvesa sabbapaṭhamo paṭiccavāro nāma, so uddesaniddesato duvidho hoti.🔽Tattha uddesavāro kusalādayo paṭicca hetupaccayādivasena kusalādīnaṃ yuttānaṃ, akusalādīnaṃ
analyzed: tattha yaḥ tāva esa sabba paṭhamo paṭiccavāraḥ nāma so uddesa niddesato duvidhaḥ hoti  tattha uddesa vāraḥ kusala ādayo paṭicca hetu paccaya ādi vasena kusala ādīnam yuttānam akusala ādīnam
translated: Herein, the first of these two sections, called “Conditioned by what?” is twofold as the “Enumeration” and the “Explanation.”

original: ayuttakānañca dhammānaṃ uppattipucchanavaseneva pavattattā “pucchāvāro”tipi, pucchānaññeva
analyzed: ayuttakānam ca dhammānam uppatti pucchana vasena iva pavatta ttā pucchāvāraḥ tipi
translated: Herein, the “Enumeration” section is called also the “Questions Section” because it proceeds by asking questions about the arising of profitable, etc., ideas that are related as cause, condition, etc., and unprofitable, etc., ideas that are unrelated as cause, etc.,

original: paññāpanato “paṇṇattivāro”tipi vuccati. Na hi tattha vissajjanaṃ atthi. Niddesavāro🔽pana pucchāvāre paripucchitesu pañhesu “siyā akusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca akusalo dhammo
analyzed: paññāpanato paṇṇattivāraḥ ti pi vuccati na hi tattha vissajjanam atthi niddesavāro  pana pucchāvāre paripucchitesu pañhesu siyā akusalam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ dhammo
translated: and it is called the “Designation Section” because it designates only questions, for there is no answer there.

original: uppajjeyyā”tiādikaṃ ayuttaṃ pañhaṃ anuddharitvā labbhamānānaññeva pañhānaṃ vasena
analyzed: uppajjeyya ati ādikam ayuttam pañham an uddharitvā labbhamāna anaññā iva pañhānam vasena
translated: But the “Explanation” section proceeds by omitting any question that is not applicable, such as “Can an unprofitable idea arise conditioned by an unprofitable idea? ” and so on, and it does so by means of only those questions that are applicable, after omitting those that are not applicable, in the case of the questions asked in the “Questions” section.

original: pavatto. Itaresu pana sahajātādīsu, sesesu ca tikesu, sesapaṭṭhānesu ca sabbattha
analyzed: itaresu pana sahajāta ādīsu sesesu ca tikesu sesa paṭṭhānesu ca sabbattha
translated: But in the case of the rest of the tetrads, etc., and in the case of the rest of the contexts,

original: pucchāvāro natthi, labbhamānavasena sabbavissajjanameva dassitanti idamettha saṅkhepato pāḷivavatthānaṃ.🔽Idāni panettha ādito paṭṭhāya evaṃ vibhaṅganayo veditabbo. Anulomapaṭṭhānasmiñhi
analyzed: pucchāvāraḥ natthi labbhamāna vasena sabba vissajjanam eva dassitan ti idam ettha saṅkhepataḥ pāḷi vavatthānam  idāni pana ittha āditaḥ paṭṭhāya evam vibhaṅga nayaḥ veditabbaḥ anuloma paṭṭhānasmin hi
translated: There is no question section, and the whole is shown as a single reply, according to what is possible. This is the summary of the text here.

original: tikapaṭṭhāne kusalattikassa sattasu mahāvāresu paṭhamassa paṭiccavārassa pucchāvāre🔽tāva – “siyā kusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca kusalo dhammo uppajjeyya hetupaccayā…pe… akusalo🔽dhammo…pe… abyākato…pe… kusalo ca abyākato ca…pe… akusalo ca abyākato ca…pe… kusalo
analyzed: tika paṭṭhāne kusala ttikassa sattasu mahāvāresu paṭhamassa paṭiccavārassa pucchāvāre  tāva siyā kusalam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjeyya hetu paccaya āpe akusalaḥ  dhamma upe abyākata upe kusalo ca abyākato cape akusalo ca abyākataḥ cape kusalo
translated: Now the method of exposition should be understood here in this way, starting from the beginning. In the case of the exposition by threes in the forward order in the case of the profitable triad in the seven great divisions, in the first section, that on condition, in the question section,

original: ca akusalo ca…pe… kusalo ca akusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā uppajjeyyuṃ hetupaccayā”ti
analyzed: ca akusalo kusalo ca akusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā uppajjeyyuṃ hetu paccayā ti
translated: first of all, there are seven questions stated thus: “Can a profitable idea … an unprofitable idea … an indeterminate idea … a profitable and an indeterminate idea … an unprofitable and an indeterminate idea … a profitable and an unprofitable idea … a profitable and an unprofitable and an indeterminate idea arise with a profitable idea as their condition by way of root-cause condition? … ”

original: kusalapadamūlā satta pucchā uddhaṭā.
analyzed: kusala pada mūlā satta pucchā uddhaṭā
translated: So there are seven questions stated with the profitable idea as the basic question.

original: Evaṃ akusalapadamūlā, abyākatapadamūlā ca. “Siyā kusalañca abyākatañca dhammaṃ paṭicca

analyzed: tattha kusalam dhammam paṭicca ati sahajātesu vedanā khandha ādi bhedam ekam kusalam dhammam  paṭicca paṭigantvā sahuppatti saṅkhātena sadisa bhāvena patvā ati atthaḥ sadisatthaḥ  hi ettha paṭisaddo paṭipuggalo ti ādīsu viya kusalaḥ dhammo ti saññā kkhandha ādi bhedaḥ
translated: Herein, taking a profitable idea as object means taking one profitable idea as object among those conjoined with it, that is to say, among the feeling aggregate, etc.,

original: sahuppanno kusalo dhammo. Uppajjatīti pākaṭabhāvato uddhaṃ uppādādiṃ pāpuṇāti, attānaṃ🔽vā paṭilabhati. Hetupaccayāti na kevalaṃ kusaladhammamattameva paṭicca uppajjati,
analyzed: sahuppannaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati iti pākaṭa bhāvataḥ uddham uppāda ādim pāpuṇāti attānam  vā paṭilabhati hetu paccayā ti na kevalam kusala dhamma mattam eva paṭicca uppajjati
translated: and reaching it by means of the similarity consisting in their simultaneous arising. The meaning is that it arrives at it. original: atha kho kusalahetunā hetupaccayataṃ sādhentena ca uppajjatīti evamattho gahetabbo.

analyzed: vā dve vā pana ekassa iva paccayāḥ nāma na honti tasmā te pakārena a nāmasitvā  ekam khandham paṭicca tayo khandhā ti ādinā paccaya bhāvena gahita avasesam sabbam paccaya uppannam
translated: or for two only, or two are for one only, they are not called by name in the way stated.🔽Therefore it should be understood that all the rest, which is included in the condition clause, is shown by taking it as “arisen by a condition” in the way beginning, “With one aggregate as condition, three aggregates” .

original: katvā dassitanti veditabbaṃ. Evaṃ uparipi sabbattha. Cittasamuṭṭhānaṃ rūpanti idaṃ
analyzed: katvā dassitanti veditabbam evam upari pi sabbattha citta samuṭṭhānam rūpanti idam
translated: So too in all the rest. The materiality originated by consciousness is said

original: paṭiccatthassa sahajātatthattā yaṃ kusalena sahajātañceva hetupaccayañca labhati,
analyzed: paṭiccatthassa sahajāta ttha ttā yam kusalena sahajātam ca iva hetu paccayam ca labhati
translated: in order to show that which gets a condition by way of root-cause condition as well as by way of conascence with the profitable.

original: taṃ dassetuṃ vuttaṃ “vipākābyākataṃ kiriyābyākata”nti. Ettha hetupaccayādhikāre ahetukā
analyzed: tam dassetum vuttam vipāka abyākatam kiriyā abyākatam ti ettha hetu paccaya adhikāre ahetukā
translated: “Resultant indeterminate, functional indeterminate” is said. Herein, the root-cause condition is not included in the unprofitable.

original: na gahetabbā. Khandhe paṭicca vatthūtiādi kaṭattārūpaggahaṇena vatthusmiṃ gahitepi
analyzed: na gahetabbā khandhe paṭicca vatthu uti ādi kaṭattā rūpa ggahaṇena vatthusmin gahite pi
translated: “With the bases as condition, the materiality originated by nutriment” is said in order to show the arising of the immaterial aggregates due to the bases, although the materiality included in the bases is already included.

original: vatthuṃ paṭicca arūpakkhandhānaṃ uppattidassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Ekaṃ mahābhūtantiādi
analyzed: vatthum paṭicca arūpa kkhandhānam uppatti dassana tham vuttam ekam mahābhūtam tiādi
translated: “One great primary” and so on is said in order to show the arising of the immaterial aggregates due to the great primaries, although the materiality included in the great primaries is already included.

original: pana rūpābyākataṃ paṭicca rūpābyākatassa uppattidassanatthaṃ. Hetupaccaye upatthambhakānameva
analyzed: pana rūpa abyākatam paṭicca rūpa abyākatassa uppatti dassana ttham hetu paccaye upatthambhakānam eva
translated: and the arising of the material unprofitable through the material unprofitable.

original: cettha cittajānaṃ, paṭisandhiyaṃ kammajānañca aññamaññaṃ paccayapaccayuppannatā gahetabbā,
analyzed: ca ittha citta jānam paṭisandhiyam kamma jānam ca aññam aññam paccaya paccaya uppanna tā gahetabbā
translated: As regards the condition being a cause, the condition being a prenascent, postnascent, or co-nascent state is applicable only to the mind and its concomitant states, and to the rebirth-linking consciousness and the kinds of consciousness that are kamma-born.

original: na ahetukacittajautujādīnaṃ tesaṃ hetupaccayā uppattiyā abhāvato. Mahābhūte paṭicca
analyzed: na ahetuka citta jautuja ādīnam tesam hetu paccayāḥ uppattiyāḥ abhāvataḥ mahābhūte paṭicca
translated: It is not applicable to the kinds of consciousness that are not accompanied by roots, to the kinds of consciousness that are born of kamma accompanied by roots, and to the kinds of consciousness that are born of temperature and nutriment, because these do not arise through the condition being a cause.

original: cittasamuṭṭhānantiādi mahābhūte paṭicca upādādīnaṃ uppattidassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Iminā
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhāna nti ādi mahābhūte paṭicca upādā ādīnam uppatti dassana tham vuttam iminā
translated: As regards the condition being a prenascent, postnascent, or co-nascent state, the words “With the great primaries as condition, the derived materiality” are stated in order to show the arising of the derived materiality such as the eye faculty, etc., through the condition being a prenascent, postnascent, or co-nascent state.

original: upāyena ārammaṇapaccayādīsupi vissajjanānaṃ attho veditabbo.
analyzed: upāyena ārammaṇa paccaya ādīsu pi vissajjanānam atthaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: In the same way, the meaning of the answers should be understood in the case of the condition being an object, etc.

original: Ārammaṇapaccaye “kusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca kusalo dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.🔽Ekaṃ khandhaṃ…pe… dve khandhe paṭicca dve khandhā. Akusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca akusalo
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccaye kusalam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā  ekam khandhaṃpe dve khandhe paṭicca dve khandhā akusalam dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ
translated: As regards the condition being an object, the text states: “With a profitable state as condition, a profitable state arises through the condition being an object.

original: dhammo…pe… abyākataṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca abyākato dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā. Vipākābyākataṃ
analyzed: dhamma upe abyākatam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā vipāka abyākatam
translated: With one aggregate as condition, the three aggregates … With two aggregates as condition, two aggregates. With an unprofitable state as condition … With an indeterminate state as condition, an indeterminate state arises through the condition being an object. With the resultant indeterminate …

original: khandhaṃ…pe… dve khandhā. Vatthuṃ paṭicca khandhā”ti evaṃ tisso vissajjitā. Sesā
analyzed: dve khandhāḥ vatthum paṭicca khandhā ati evam tissaḥ vissajjitā sesā
translated: The two immaterial aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the three aggregates.🔽The three aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the materiality of the physical basis.🔽The two immaterial aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the materiality of the physical basis.🔽The three aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the two immaterial aggregates.

original: rūpamissakattā, rūpassa ca ārammaṇapaccayena anuppattito na gahitā. Teneva “vatthuṃ
analyzed: rūpa missaka ttā rūpassa ca ārammaṇa paccayena anuppattitaḥ na gahitā tena iva vatthum
translated: The two immaterial aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the three aggregates.🔽The three aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the three aggregates.

analyzed: paṭicca khandhā ti vatvā khandhe paṭicca vatthu iti na vuttam ettha ca ārammaṇa paccayā ti  sahajātam kusalam dhammam paṭicca uppajjamānaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ tatas aññena asahajātena
translated: The two immaterial aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the two immaterial aggregates.🔽The three aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the materiality of the physical basis.🔽The two immaterial aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the materiality of the physical basis.🔽The three aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the three aggregates.🔽The two immaterial aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the two immaterial aggregates.🔽The three aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the three aggregates.

analyzed: chabbidhena ārammaṇa bhūtena paccayena ati evam atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ na hi attanā sahajātam  ārammaṇam katvā citta cetasikāḥ uppajjanti
translated: The two immaterial aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the two immaterial aggregates.🔽The three aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the three aggregates.🔽The two immaterial aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the two immaterial aggregates.🔽The three aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the three aggregates.🔽The two immaterial aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the two immaterial aggregates.🔽The three aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the three aggregates.🔽The two immaterial aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the two immaterial aggregates.🔽The three aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the three aggregates.🔽The two immaterial aggregates are conditions, as object condition, for the two immaterial aggregates.

analyzed: adhipati paccaye hetu paccaya sadisam vissajjanam anantara samanantaresu pana rūpa abhāvato

translated: The great primaries originated by nutriment can be discerned as a condition, as foundation, for the other two great primaries. … The great primaries originated by temperature can be discerned as a condition, as foundation, for the other two great primaries. … One great primary in the case of the non-percipient beings can be discerned as a condition, as foundation, for the other two great primaries. … Two great primaries can be discerned as a condition, as foundation, for the other two great primaries. … The derived materiality originated by kamma can be discerned as a condition, as foundation, for the other great primaries” .🔽This is the addition. In the support condition too the explanation is like that for the co-nascence condition.

original: vissajjanaṃ. Paṭiccatthassa pana sahajātatthattā cakkhādīsu purejātanissayā idha

translated: But because the meaning of the “as a condition” clause is the meaning of the “co-nascent” clause, the prenascent support in the eye, etc., is not included here.

original: na gahitāti. Upanissayapaccayepi rūpassa upanissayapaccayuppannattābhāvā ārammaṇapaccayasadisameva vissajjanaṃ.

analyzed: pacchājāta paccayaḥ idha arūpa dhammesu na labbhati rūpa dhammesu ca upatthambhakaḥ uva
translated: The postnascence condition is not found here among the immaterial states. And among the material states it is only a support,

original: paccayuppannabhāvaappaṭikkhepavasena pavattattā dhammapaccanīyānulomapaṭṭhānaṃ nāma🔽jātaṃ. Tattha nakusalaṃ dhammanti kusalassa paccayabhāvanivāraṇaṃ. Akusalo dhammo
analyzed: paccaya uppanna bhāva appaṭikkhepa vasena pavatta ttā dhamma paccanīya anuloma paṭṭhānam nāma  jātam tattha na kusalam dhamman ti kusalassa paccaya bhāva nivāraṇam akusalaḥ dhammo
translated: The method of occurrence is called “the method of conditions in reverse order of the unprofitable” because it occurs by way of the denial of the state of being a condition.🔽It is born. Herein, “An unprofitable state is a condition for a profitable state” is the denial of the condition state for the profitable.

original: uppajjatīti akusalassa uppattividhānaṃ. Kusalaṃ pana paṭicca kusalassa uppattiabhāvato
analyzed: uppajjati iti akusalassa uppatti vidhānam kusalam pana paṭicca kusalassa uppatti abhāvato
translated: “An unprofitable state arises with a profitable state as its condition” is the laying down of the arising of the unprofitable. But because there is no arising of the profitable with the profitable as its condition,

original: “kusalo dhammo uppajjatī”ti avatvā “akusalo dhammo uppajjatī”ti labbhamānapadavasena
analyzed: kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati iti avatvā akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati iti labbhamāna pada vasena
translated: instead of saying “A profitable state arises,” the words “An unprofitable state arises” are used, since the words are available.

original: vuttaṃ. Kusalaṃ, hi akusalaṃ, abyākataṃ vā sahajātapaccayaṃ katvā uppajjamāno kusalo
analyzed: vuttam kusalam hi akusalam abyākatam vā sahajāta paccayam katvā uppajjamānaḥ kusalaḥ
translated: For there is no profitable state that arises with the unprofitable as its conascence condition, or with the condition of conascence, or with the condition of mutuality, or with the condition of support, or with the condition of dissociation, or with the condition of presence, or with the condition of non-disappearance, or with the condition of prior conditionality, or with the condition of post-nascence, or with the condition of repetition, or with the condition of non-deprivation.

original: nāma natthi, tasmā akusalassa ca abyākatassa ca vasena desanā katā. Evamaññattha.
analyzed: nāma natthi tasmai akusalassa ca abyākatassa ca vasena desanā katā evamaññattha
translated: That is why the teaching is given in terms of the unprofitable and the indeterminate. The meaning is this.

original: Evamettha dhammapaccanīyānulomapaṭṭhāne –🔽“Tikañca paṭṭhānavaraṃ dukuttamaṃ,🔽Dukatikañceva tikadukañca;
analyzed: evam ettha dhamma paccanīya anuloma paṭṭhāne  tikam ca paṭṭhāna varam duk uttamam  duka tikam ca iva tika dukam ca
translated: So in the method of conditions in reverse order of the unprofitable here,🔽The triple method, the supreme method, the double method,🔽The method of the triple and the double, the method of the triple,

original: Tikatikañceva dukadukañca,
analyzed: tika tikam ca iva duka dukam ca
translated: The method of the double and the double,

original: Cha paccanīyānulomamhi nayā sugambhīrā”ti. –
analyzed: cha paccanīya anulomamhi nayā sugambhīrā ati
translated: These six in the way of conditions in reverse order of the unprofitable are deep and sublime.

original: Vuttā cha nayā veditabbā. Paccayavasena panetthāpi tikapaṭṭhānādīsu ekekasmiṃ paccayānulomādīnaṃ
analyzed: vuttā cha nayā veditabbā paccaya vasena pana itthā api tika paṭṭhāna ādīsu ekekasmin paccaya anuloma ādīnam
translated: The six methods should be understood as stated. But in the case of the three-factored, etc., method, in each of the three methods, namely, the condition method, the order method, and the dependent origination method, there are four methods, namely, the forward order method, the reverse order method, the method of conditions, and the method of conditionality.

original: catunnaṃ catunnaṃ nayānaṃ vasena ekena pariyāyena catuvīsatinayapaṭimaṇḍitamidaṃ
analyzed: catunnam catunnam vasena ekena pariyāyena catuvīsati naya paṭimaṇḍitam idam
translated: So this method is adorned with twenty-four methods.

original: dhammapaccanīyānulomapaṭṭhānanti veditabbanti ayaṃ paccanīyānulomapaṭṭhānanayo.🔽Evamidaṃ bhagavatā anulomapaṭṭhānādīsu catūsu ekekasmiṃ paṭṭhāne tikadukādīnaññeva
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma paṭṭhānan ti veditabban ti ayam paccanīya anuloma paṭṭhāna nayo  evam idam bhagavatā anuloma paṭṭhāna ādīsu catūsu ekekasmin paṭṭhāne
translated: It should be understood as the “counter-method in forward order by way of states.”

original: channaṃ channaṃ nayānaṃ vasena catuvīsatinayapaṭimaṇḍitaṃ samantapaṭṭhānamahāpakaraṇaṃ🔽desitaṃ. Paccayavasena panetesu catuvīsatiyā paṭṭhānesu ekekasmiṃ paccayānulomādīnaṃ
analyzed: channam channam nayānam vasena catuvīsati naya paṭimaṇḍitam samanta paṭṭhāna mahā apakaraṇam  desitam paccaya vasena pana itesu catuvīsatiyā paṭṭhānesu ekekasmim paccaya anuloma ādīnam
translated: So this Great Book of the Multitude of Conditions, which is adorned with twenty-four methods, is taught by the Blessed One in the four methods, namely, the forward-order method, the reverse-order method, the method of conditions, and the method of conditionality, in each of which there are six methods, namely, the three-factored method, the two-factored method, the single-factored method, the method of conditions, the method of conditionality, and the method of the three appearances.

original: catunnaṃ catunnaṃ nayānaṃ vasenetaṃ channavutinayapaṭimaṇḍitaṃ hoti, dhammavaseneva
analyzed: catunnam catunnam nayānam vasena itam channavuti naya paṭimaṇḍitam hoti dhamma vasena iva
translated: But in the case of these twenty-four methods, in each of the twenty-four methods, namely, the condition method, the forward-order method, the reverse-order method, the method of conditions, the method of conditionality, and the method of the three appearances, there are four methods, namely, the forward-order method, the reverse-order method, the method of conditions, and the method of conditionality.🔽So this book is adorned with twenty-four methods. It is called the “Great Book of the Multitude of Conditions” because it is taught by way of states.

original: cetaṃ pakaraṇaṃ catuvīsatisamantapaṭṭhānaṃ vuttanti ayamettha vibhaṅganayo.
analyzed: ca itam pakaraṇam catuvīsati samanta paṭṭhānam vuttan ti ayam ettha vibhaṅga nayo
translated: This is the method of analysis here.

original: Mohavicchedaniyā abhidhammamātikatthavaṇṇanāya
translated: The commentary on the matrix of the Abhidhamma, called The Dispelling of Delusion,

original: Paṭṭhānamātikatthavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭṭhāna mātika ttha vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: is finished.

original: Nigamanakathā
analyzed: nigamana kathā
translated: The concluding discussion

original: Ettāvatā ca –
analyzed: ettāvatā ca
translated: And so far

original: Mātikāyābhidhammassa, āraddhā atthavaṇṇanā;
analyzed: āraddhā attha vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the meaning of the matrix of the Abhidhamma has been begun,

original: Mohavicchedanī nāma, yā sā niṭṭhamupāgatā.
analyzed: mohavicchedanī nāma yā sā niṭṭham upāgatā
translated: called The Dispelling of Delusion, which has now been completed.

original: Niṭṭhaṃ yathāyaṃ sampattā, lajjīhi abhipatthitā;
analyzed: niṭṭham yathā ayam sampattā lajjīhi abhipatthitā
translated: Since it has been completed, as desired by the modest,

original: Sabbe niṭṭhaṃ tathā santā, samentu sumanorathā.
analyzed: sabbe niṭṭham tathā santā samentu su manorathā
translated: let all be gladdened in their hearts, having reached the same goal.

original: Yo gambhīro sasādīnaṃ, samuddova bhayāvaho;🔽Kālesmiṃ dhīmatañcāpi, api ganthāvalokane.
analyzed: yaḥ gambhīraḥ sasādīnam samuddaḥ uva bhaya āvahaḥ  api gantha avalokane
translated: Just as the ocean, which is deep and fearful to the timid,🔽is also at times a delight to the wise, even when it is looked at,

original: Paṭhamantaradhānassa, abhidhammassa tassa yaṃ;
analyzed: paṭhama antaradhānassa abhidhammassa tassa yaṃ
translated: so too this Abhidhamma, which is deep and hard to fathom,

original: Silālekhā nidhīnaṃva, dhammatthānaṃ pakāsikā.
analyzed: silā lekhā nidhīnam va dhammatthānam pakāsikā
translated: is a guide to the Dhamma like a treasure of written records.

original: Nāvā viya samuddassa, sukhotaraṇapaddhati;🔽Pāḷiaṭṭhakathā cesā, parisuddhā anākulā.
analyzed: nāvā viya samuddassa sukha utaraṇa paddhati  pāḷi aṭṭhakathā ca isā parisuddhā an ākulā
translated: Just as a boat is the means for a comfortable crossing of the ocean,🔽so too this commentary on the text is pure and unconfused,

original: Nayatopi avikkiṇṇā, asaṃkiṇṇā nikāyato;🔽Yato sakkacca sotabbā, saddhammaṭṭhitiyā satā.
analyzed: nayataḥ api a vikkiṇṇāḥ a saṃkiṇṇāḥ nikāyataḥ  yatas sakkacca sotabbā saddhamma ṭṭhitiyā satā
translated: unmixed with other methods, unadulterated by other schools,🔽and therefore should be listened to with respect for the preservation of the true Dhamma.

original: Saddhammaṭṭhitikāmena, anattukkaṃsanādito;
analyzed: saddhamma ṭṭhiti kāmena an attukkaṃsana āditaḥ
translated: One who desires the preservation of the true Dhamma, without praising oneself,

original: Mayāpi vaṇṇayantena, racitā suddhacetasā;
analyzed: mayā api vaṇṇayantena racitā suddha cetasā
translated: By me also, who am extolling it, it has been composed with a pure heart,

original: Tettiṃsabhāṇavārāya, parimāṇena tantiyā.
analyzed: tettiṃsa bhāṇa vārāya parimāṇena tantiyā
translated: In the measure of thirty-eight chapters, of the Bhaṇavāra.

original: Mātikāvaṇṇanā yā sā, yāva niṭṭhaṃ yathābalaṃ;
analyzed: mātikā vaṇṇanā yā sā yāva niṭṭham yathābalam

original: Sabbatthasaṅgahā esā, anākulapadakkamā.
analyzed: sabbattha saṅgahā esā an ākula padakkamā
translated: This is a collection of all the meanings, with the words in the right order.

translated: By that which is wholesome, having attained the highest enlightenment,🔽May all beings, with a mind of good will, reach the end of all suffering.

original: Nānājanādhiramaṇīyatarassa,🔽Coḷaraṭṭhassa bhāramadhivāhakulandharassa;
analyzed: nānā jana adhiramaṇīyatarassa  coḷaraṭṭhassa bhāram adhivāha kulandharassa

original: Rājādhirājavaravaṃsasupīṇitassa.
analyzed: rāja adhirāja vara vaṃsa su pīṇitassa
translated: The well-nourished of the best royal lineage of the great king.

original: Majjhamhi coḷakakalaṅkanibhena maggaṃ,
analyzed: majjhamhi coḷaka kalaṅka nibhena maggam

analyzed: pūram visāla vibhavehi mahā kulehi

analyzed: pākāra cakka parikhāhi ca gopurehi

analyzed: yuttam jana ākula su sajjita rāja maggam  sabba upabhoga paribhoga dhanehi nānā
translated: The royal road well-prepared with good families.🔽With all the wealth of enjoyment and use, with various

original: Vaṇṇehi puṇṇavividhāpaṇikehi sobhaṃ;
analyzed: vaṇṇehi puṇṇa vividha āpaṇikehi sobham
translated: Filled with various shops,

original: Coḷādhināgapuranandananāthabhūtaṃ,
analyzed: coḷa adhināga pura nandana nātha bhūtam
translated: The city of Coḷa, the protector of the Nandana forest,

original: Ye tattha sogatavihāravarābhirāmā.
analyzed: ye sogata vihāra vara abhirāmā
translated: Those who are delighted there with the excellent monastery.

original: Tesaṃ mukhe janamanoharasatthubimba-
analyzed: tesam mukhe jana manohara satthu bimba
translated: In their mouths the delightful image of the Teacher,

original: Sambhāvite mahati sajjanamānanīye;
analyzed: sambhāvite mahati sat jana mānanīye
translated: Honoured, great, worthy of the respect of the good;

original: Vijjālayehi udayācalasannibhehi,🔽Kelāsakūṭasikharopamacetiyehi.🔽Pāsādahammiyavarehi ca maṇḍapehi,
analyzed: vijja ālayehi udayācala sannibhehi  kelāsa kūṭa sikhara upama cetiye hi  pāsāda hammiya varehi ca maṇḍapehi
translated: With the rising of the sun-like (image) in the moon,🔽With the moon-like (image) on the peak of the Kelasa mountain.🔽With the best of palaces and pavilions,

analyzed: jambamba tāla panasa ādi tara āvalīhi
translated: With the garlands of the rose-apple trees and the tāla trees;

analyzed: nanda upananda bhujagassa varassa bhoga  cakka āvalī sama sudhā kata gopurehi

original: Yutte visālasikatāsitamāḷakehi,
analyzed: yutte visāla sikatā sita māḷakehi

original: Yutte susīlayatisaṅghanisevitamhi;

original: Nāgajjunavhayavihāravare vasanto.

original: Nāmena yo dhutadharaggasamānanāmo,
analyzed: nāmena yaḥ
translated: He who by name was honoured as the foremost of the ascetics,

original: Candova pākaṭanabhoditavītapañño;
analyzed: candaḥ u va pākaṭa nabha udita vīta pañño

analyzed: satthantaresu nipuṇaḥ piṭa kattaye ca

original: Mappicchatādiguṇasāravibhūsitatto;

translated: May this [garland], shining with excellent fame,

translated: May the light of the Jina's teaching shine as long as

translated: Thus, composed in the country of Oḍra by the Elder Mahākassapa,🔽The commentary on the Abhidhamma mātikā called

analyzed: abhidhamma mātikattha vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
